verses.first_half: Blessed is the man who has not walked in the counsel of the ungodly,
verses.second_half: nor stood in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the seat of the scornful;
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man that hath not walked in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stood in the way of sinners,
verses.second_half_tle: and hath not sat in the seat of the scornful.

verses.first_half: But his delight is in the law of the LORD,
verses.second_half: and on his law will he meditate day and night.
verses.first_half_tle: But his delight is in the law of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and in his law will he exercise himself day and night.

verses.first_half: And he shall be like a tree planted by the waterside,
verses.second_half: that will bring forth his fruit in due season.
verses.first_half_tle: And he shall be like a tree planted by the water-side,
verses.second_half_tle: that will bring forth his fruit in due season.

verses.first_half: His leaf also shall not wither;
verses.second_half: and look, whatever he does, it shall prosper.
verses.first_half_tle: His leaf also shall not wither;
verses.second_half_tle: and look, whatsoever he doeth, it shall prosper.

verses.first_half: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them;
verses.second_half: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scatters away from the face of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them;
verses.second_half_tle: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scattereth away from the face of the earth.

verses.first_half: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgment,
verses.second_half: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

verses.first_half: For the LORD knows the way of the righteous,
verses.second_half: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
verses.first_half_tle: But the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: and the way of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.first_half: Why do the nations so furiously rage together?
verses.second_half: And why do the peoples devise a vain thing?
verses.first_half_tle: Why do the heathen so furiously rage together?
verses.second_half_tle: and why do the people imagine a vain thing?

verses.first_half: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together,
verses.second_half: against the LORD and against his Anointed:
verses.first_half_tle: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together
verses.second_half_tle: against the LORD, and against his Anointed:

verses.first_half: “Let us break their bonds asunder
verses.second_half: and cast away their cords from us.”
verses.first_half_tle: Let us break their bonds asunder,
verses.second_half_tle: and cast away their cords from us.

verses.first_half: He who dwells in heaven shall laugh them to scorn;
verses.second_half: the Lord shall hold them in derision.
verses.first_half_tle: He that dwelleth in heaven shall laugh them to scorn:
verses.second_half_tle: the Lord shall have them in derision.

verses.first_half: Then shall he speak to them in his wrath
verses.second_half: and terrify them in his great anger:
verses.first_half_tle: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath,
verses.second_half_tle: and vex them in his sore displeasure:

verses.first_half: “I myself have set my King
verses.second_half: upon my holy hill of Zion.”
verses.first_half_tle: Yet have I set my King
verses.second_half_tle: upon my holy hill of Zion.

verses.first_half: I will proclaim the decree of the LORD;
verses.second_half: he said to me, “You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.
verses.first_half_tle: I will rehearse the decree;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

verses.first_half: Ask of me, and I shall give you the nations for your inheritance
verses.second_half: and the ends of the earth for your possession.
verses.first_half_tle: Desire of me, and I shall give thee the nations for thine inheritance,
verses.second_half_tle: and the utmost parts of the earth for thy possession.

verses.first_half: You shall bruise them with a rod of iron
verses.second_half: and break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt bruise them with a rod of iron,
verses.second_half_tle: and break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.

verses.first_half: Be wise now, O you kings;
verses.second_half: be warned, you judges of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings;
verses.second_half_tle: be instructed, ye that are judges of the earth.

verses.first_half: Serve the LORD in fear,
verses.second_half: and rejoice with trembling.
verses.first_half_tle: Serve the LORD in fear,
verses.second_half_tle: and rejoice unto him with reverence.

verses.first_half: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish in the way; for his wrath is quickly kindled.
verses.second_half: Blessed are all those who put their trust in him.
verses.first_half_tle: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and so ye perish from the right way, if his wrath be kindled, yea but a little.
verses.second_half_tle: Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

verses.first_half: LORD, how they are increased who trouble me;
verses.second_half: many are those who rise against me.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me!
verses.second_half_tle: many are they that rise against me.

verses.first_half: Many there are who say of my soul,
verses.second_half: “There is no help for him in his God.”
verses.first_half_tle: Many one there be that say of my soul,
verses.second_half_tle: There is no help for him in his God.

verses.first_half: But you, O LORD, are my defender;
verses.second_half: you are my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou, O LORD, art my defender;
verses.second_half_tle: thou art my worship, and the lifter up of my head.

verses.first_half: I called upon the LORD with my voice,
verses.second_half: and he heard me from his holy hill.
verses.first_half_tle: I did call upon the LORD with my voice,
verses.second_half_tle: and he heard me out of his holy hill.

verses.first_half: I lay down and slept, and rose up again,
verses.second_half: for the LORD sustained me.
verses.first_half_tle: I laid me down and slept, and rose up again;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD sustained me.

verses.first_half: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people
verses.second_half: who have set themselves against me round about.
verses.first_half_tle: I will not be afraid for ten thousands of the people,
verses.second_half_tle: that have set themselves against me round about.

verses.first_half: Rise up, O LORD, and help me, O my God;
verses.second_half: for you smite all my enemies on the cheek-bone; you have broken the teeth of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: Up, LORD, and help me, O my God,
verses.second_half_tle: for thou smitest all mine enemies upon the cheekbone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: Salvation belongs to the LORD;
verses.second_half: may your blessing be upon your people.
verses.first_half_tle: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy blessing is upon thy people.

verses.first_half: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness;
verses.second_half: you set me free when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness:
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast set me at liberty when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hearken unto my prayer.

verses.first_half: O you children of men, how long will you blaspheme my honor,
verses.second_half: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after falsehood?
verses.first_half_tle: O ye sons of men, how long will ye blaspheme mine honor,
verses.second_half_tle: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after falsehood?

verses.first_half: Know this also, that the LORD has chosen for himself the one that is godly;
verses.second_half: when I call upon the LORD, he will hear me.
verses.first_half_tle: Know this also, that the LORD hath chosen to himself the man that is godly;
verses.second_half_tle: when I call upon the LORD he will hear me.

verses.first_half: Stand in awe, and sin not;
verses.second_half: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still.
verses.first_half_tle: Stand in awe, and sin not;
verses.second_half_tle: commune with your own heart, and in your chamber, and be still.

verses.first_half: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness
verses.second_half: and put your trust in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: and put your trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: There are many that say, “Who will show us any good?”
verses.second_half: LORD, lift up the light of your countenance upon us.
verses.first_half_tle: There be many that say,
verses.second_half_tle: Who will show us any good?

verses.first_half: You have put gladness in my heart,
verses.second_half: more than when others’ grain and wine and oil increased.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, lift thou up
verses.second_half_tle: the light of thy countenance upon us.

verses.first_half: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest;
verses.second_half: for you, LORD, only, make me dwell in safety.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast put gladness in my heart;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, more than when their corn and wine and oil increase

verses.first_half_tle: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest;
verses.second_half_tle: for it is thou, LORD, only, that makest me dwell in safety.

verses.first_half: Give ear to my words, O LORD;
verses.second_half: consider my meditation.
verses.first_half_tle: Ponder my words, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: consider my meditation.

verses.first_half: O hearken unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God,
verses.second_half: for unto you will I make my prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: O hearken thou unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God:
verses.second_half_tle: for unto thee will I make my prayer.

verses.first_half: My voice shall you hear in the morning, O LORD;
verses.second_half: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto you, and will look up.
verses.first_half_tle: My voice shalt thou hear betimes, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

verses.first_half: For you are not a god who has pleasure in wickedness,
verses.second_half: neither shall any evil dwell with you.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou art the God that hast no pleasure in wickedness;
verses.second_half_tle: neither shall any evil dwell with thee.

verses.first_half: The boastful shall not stand in your sight,
verses.second_half: for you hate all those who work iniquity.
verses.first_half_tle: Such as be foolish shall not stand in thy sight;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hatest all them that work iniquity.

verses.first_half: You shall destroy those who speak lies;
verses.second_half: the LORD will abhor the bloodthirsty and the deceitful.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt destroy them that speak lies:
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD will abhor both the blood-thirsty and deceitful man.

verses.first_half: But as for me, through the multitude of your mercies I will come into your house,
verses.second_half: and in reverence will I bow myself toward your holy temple.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for me, in the multitude of thy mercy I will come into thine house;
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

verses.first_half: Lead me, O LORD, in your righteousness, because of my enemies;
verses.second_half: make your way straight before my face.
verses.first_half_tle: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness, because of mine enemies;
verses.second_half_tle: make thy way plain before my face.

verses.first_half: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
verses.second_half: their heart is eaten up with wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
verses.second_half_tle: their inward parts are very wickedness.

verses.first_half: Their throat is an open sepulcher;
verses.second_half: they flatter with their tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: Their throat is an open sepulcher;
verses.second_half_tle: they flatter with their tongue.

verses.first_half: Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall because of their own devices;
verses.second_half: because of the multitude of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.
verses.first_half_tle: Destroy thou them, O God; let them perish through their own imaginations;
verses.second_half_tle: cast them out in the multitude of their ungodliness; for they have rebelled against thee.

verses.first_half: But let all those who put their trust in you rejoice;
verses.second_half: let them ever give thanks because you defend them; those who love your Name shall be joyful in you.
verses.first_half_tle: And let all them that put their trust in thee rejoice:
verses.second_half_tle: they shall ever be giving of thanks, because thou defendest them; they that love thy Name shall be joyful in thee.

verses.first_half: For you, LORD, will give your blessing unto the righteous,
verses.second_half: and with your favorable kindness you will defend him as with a shield.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, LORD, wilt give thy blessing unto the righteous,
verses.second_half_tle: and with thy favorable kindness wilt thou defend him as with a shield.

verses.first_half: O LORD, rebuke me not in your indignation,
verses.second_half: neither chasten me in your displeasure.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine indignation,
verses.second_half_tle: neither chasten me in thy displeasure.

verses.first_half: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am weak;
verses.second_half: O LORD, heal me, for my bones are racked.
verses.first_half_tle: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am weak;
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, heal me, for my bones are vexed.

verses.first_half: My soul also is greatly troubled;
verses.second_half: but, LORD, how long will you punish me?
verses.first_half_tle: My soul also is sore troubled:
verses.second_half_tle: but, LORD, how long wilt thou punish me?

verses.first_half: Turn, O LORD, and deliver my soul;
verses.second_half: O save me for your mercy’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn thee, O LORD, and deliver my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: O save me, for thy mercy’s sake.

verses.first_half: For in death no one remembers you,
verses.second_half: and who will give you thanks in the grave?
verses.first_half_tle: For in death no man remembereth thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and who will give thee thanks in the pit?

verses.first_half: I am weary with my groaning;
verses.second_half: every night I flood my bed and drench my couch with my tears.
verses.first_half_tle: I am weary of my groaning;
verses.second_half_tle: every night wash I my bed, and water my couch with my tears.

verses.first_half: My eyes have become dim because of trouble,
verses.second_half: and worn away because of all my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: My beauty is gone for very trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: and worn away because of all mine enemies.

verses.first_half: Away from me, all you who work wickedness,
verses.second_half: for the LORD has heard the voice of my weeping.
verses.first_half_tle: Away from me, all ye that work iniquity;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.first_half: The LORD has heard my petition;
verses.second_half: the LORD will receive my prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hath heard my petition;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD will receive my prayer.

verses.first_half: All my enemies shall be confounded and greatly vexed;
verses.second_half: they shall be turned back and put to shame suddenly.
verses.first_half_tle: All mine enemies shall be confounded, and sore vexed;
verses.second_half_tle: they shall be turned back, and put to shame suddenly.

verses.first_half: O LORD my God, in you have I put my trust;
verses.second_half: save me from all those who persecute me, and deliver me,
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD my God, in thee have I put my trust:
verses.second_half_tle: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me;

verses.first_half: Lest they devour me like a lion and tear me in pieces
verses.second_half: while there is none to help.
verses.first_half_tle: Lest he devour my soul like a lion, and tear it in pieces,
verses.second_half_tle: while there is none to help.

verses.first_half: O LORD my God, if I have done any such thing,
verses.second_half: if there be any wickedness in my hands,
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD my God, if I have done any such thing;
verses.second_half_tle: or if there be any wickedness in my hands;

verses.first_half: If I have repaid evil to him who has dealt with me as a friend,
verses.second_half: or plundered him who without any cause is my enemy,
verses.first_half_tle: If I have rewarded evil unto him that dealt friendly with me;
verses.second_half_tle: (yea, I have delivered him that without any cause is mine enemy;)

verses.first_half: Then let my enemy pursue me and overtake me,
verses.second_half: let him trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust.
verses.first_half_tle: Then let mine enemy persecute my soul, and take me;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, let him tread my life down upon the earth, and lay mine honor in the dust.

verses.first_half: Stand up, O LORD, in your wrath, and lift yourself up against the fury of my enemies;
verses.second_half: rise up for me in the judgment that you have commanded.
verses.first_half_tle: Stand up, O LORD, in thy wrath, and lift up thyself, because of the indignation of mine enemies;
verses.second_half_tle: arise up for me in the judgment that thou hast commanded.

verses.first_half: Then shall the assembly of the peoples be gathered about you;
verses.second_half: lift yourself up again, O LORD, O judge of all the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: And so shall the congregation of the peoples come about thee:
verses.second_half_tle: for their sakes therefore lift up thyself again.

verses.first_half: Give sentence for me, O LORD, according to my righteousness,
verses.second_half: and according to the innocence that is in me.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall judge the peoples: give sentence with me, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: according to my righteousness, and according to the innocency that is in me.

verses.first_half: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end,
verses.second_half: but establish the just.
verses.first_half_tle: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end;
verses.second_half_tle: but guide thou the just.

verses.first_half: For the righteous God
verses.second_half: tries the very hearts and minds.
verses.first_half_tle: For the righteous God
verses.second_half_tle: trieth the very hearts and reins.

verses.first_half: God is my shield and my defense;
verses.second_half: he preserves those who are true of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: My help cometh of God,
verses.second_half_tle: who preserveth them that are true of heart.

verses.first_half: God is a righteous judge, strong and patient;
verses.second_half: and God is provoked every day.
verses.first_half_tle: God is a righteous Judge, strong, and patient;
verses.second_half_tle: and God is provoked every day.

verses.first_half: If a man will not repent, God will whet his sword;
verses.second_half: he will bend his bow, and make it ready.
verses.first_half_tle: If a man will not turn, he will whet his sword;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

verses.first_half: He has prepared for him the instruments of death;
verses.second_half: he makes his arrows shafts of fire.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath prepared for him the instruments of death;
verses.second_half_tle: he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

verses.first_half: Behold, the ungodly is in labor with mischief;
verses.second_half: he has conceived wickedness and brought forth lies.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, the ungodly travaileth with iniquity;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

verses.first_half: He has made a pit and dug it out,
verses.second_half: but will himself fall into the trap that he made for others.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath graven and digged up a pit,
verses.second_half_tle: and is fallen himself into the destruction that he made for other.

verses.first_half: For his malice shall come upon his own head,
verses.second_half: and his wickedness shall fall on his own scalp.
verses.first_half_tle: For his travail shall come upon his own head,
verses.second_half_tle: and his wickedness shall fall on his own pate.

verses.first_half: I will give thanks unto the LORD, according to his righteousness,
verses.second_half: and I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto the LORD, according to his righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.

verses.first_half: O LORD our Governor, how excellent is your Name in all the world;
verses.second_half: you have set your glory above the heavens!
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD our Governor, how excellent is thy Name in all the world;
verses.second_half_tle: thou that hast set thy glory above the heavens!

verses.first_half: Out of the mouth of babes and infants you have ordained strength, because of your enemies,
verses.second_half: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.
verses.first_half_tle: Out of the mouth of very babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength, because of thine enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

verses.first_half: When I consider your heavens, even the works of your fingers,
verses.second_half: the moon and the stars, which you have ordained,
verses.first_half_tle: When I consider thy heavens, even the work of thy fingers;
verses.second_half_tle: the moon and the stars which thou hast ordained;

verses.first_half: What is man, that you are mindful of him,
verses.second_half: the son of man, that you visit him?
verses.first_half_tle: What is man, that thou art mindful of him?
verses.second_half_tle: and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

verses.first_half: You made him little lower than the angels,
verses.second_half: to crown him with glory and honor.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou madest him lower than the angels,
verses.second_half_tle: to crown him with glory and worship.

verses.first_half: You made him to have dominion over the works of your hands,
verses.second_half: and you have put all things in subjection under his feet:
verses.first_half_tle: Thou makest him to have dominion of the works of thy hands;
verses.second_half_tle: and thou hast put all things in subjection under his feet:

verses.first_half: All sheep and oxen,
verses.second_half: even the beasts of the field,
verses.first_half_tle: All sheep and oxen;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and the beasts of the field;

verses.first_half: The birds of the air, and the fish of the sea,
verses.second_half: and whatsoever walks through the paths of the seas.
verses.first_half_tle: The fowls of the air, and the fishes of the sea;
verses.second_half_tle: and whatsoever walketh through the paths of the seas.

verses.first_half: O LORD our Governor,
verses.second_half: how excellent is your Name in all the world!
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD our Governor,
verses.second_half_tle: how excellent is thy Name in all the world!

verses.first_half: I will give thanks unto you, O LORD, with my whole heart;
verses.second_half: I will speak of all your marvelous works.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, with my whole heart;
verses.second_half_tle: I will speak of all thy marvelous works.

verses.first_half: I will be glad and rejoice in you;
verses.second_half: indeed, my songs will I sing of your Name, O Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: I will be glad and rejoice in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, my songs will I make of thy Name, O thou Most Highest.

verses.first_half: When my enemies are driven back,
verses.second_half: they shall fall and perish at your presence;
verses.first_half_tle: While mine enemies are driven back,
verses.second_half_tle: they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

verses.first_half: For you have maintained my right and my cause;
verses.second_half: you sit on your throne judging right.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause;
verses.second_half_tle: thou art set in the throne that judgest right.

verses.first_half: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the ungodly;
verses.second_half: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, and destroyed the ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

verses.first_half: As for the enemy, their destruction has come; they are in perpetual ruin;
verses.second_half: like the cities which you have destroyed, their memory has perished with them.
verses.first_half_tle: O thou enemy, thy destructions are come to a perpetual end;
verses.second_half_tle: even as the cities which thou hast destroyed, whose memorial is perished with them.

verses.first_half: But the LORD sits enthroned for ever;
verses.second_half: he has prepared his seat for judgment.
verses.first_half_tle: But the LORD shall endure for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath also prepared his seat for judgment.

verses.first_half: For he shall judge the world in righteousness,
verses.second_half: and minister true judgment to the peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall judge the world in righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: and minister true judgment unto the people.

verses.first_half: The LORD will be a defense for the oppressed,
verses.second_half: even a refuge in the time of trouble;
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD also will be a defense for the oppressed,
verses.second_half_tle: even a refuge in due time of trouble.

verses.first_half: And those who know your Name will put their trust in you,
verses.second_half: for you, LORD, have never failed those who seek you.
verses.first_half_tle: And they that know thy Name will put their trust in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou, LORD, hast never failed them that seek thee.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD who dwells in Zion;
verses.second_half: tell the peoples what things he has done.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD which dwelleth in Zion;
verses.second_half_tle: show the people of his doings.

verses.first_half: For when he takes vengeance for blood, he remembers them,
verses.second_half: and forgets not the cry of the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: For when he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them,
verses.second_half_tle: and forgetteth not the complaint of the poor.

verses.first_half: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider the trouble I suffer from those who hate me,
verses.second_half: O you who lift me up from the gates of death,
verses.first_half_tle: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider the trouble which I suffer of them that hate me,
verses.second_half_tle: thou that liftest me up from the gates of death;

verses.first_half: That I may tell of all your praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion;
verses.second_half: I will rejoice in your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: That I may show all thy praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion;
verses.second_half_tle: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

verses.first_half: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made;
verses.second_half: in the same net which they hid secretly is their foot caught.
verses.first_half_tle: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made;
verses.second_half_tle: in the same net which they hid privily is their foot taken.

verses.first_half: The LORD is known to execute judgment;
verses.second_half: the ungodly are trapped in the works of their own hands.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is known to execute judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: the ungodly is trapped in the work of his own hands.

verses.first_half: The wicked shall return to the grave,
verses.second_half: even all the peoples that forget God.
verses.first_half_tle: The wicked shall be turned to destruction,
verses.second_half_tle: and all the people that forget God.

verses.first_half: For the poor shall not always be forgotten;
verses.second_half: the patient hope of the meek shall not perish for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: For the poor shall not alway be forgotten;
verses.second_half_tle: the patient abiding of the meek shall not perish for ever.

verses.first_half: Rise up, O LORD, and let them not have the upper hand;
verses.second_half: let the nations be judged in your sight.
verses.first_half_tle: Up, LORD, and let not man have the upper hand;
verses.second_half_tle: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

verses.first_half: Put them in fear, O LORD,
verses.second_half: that the nations may know themselves to be merely human.
verses.first_half_tle: Put them in fear, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: that the heathen may know themselves to be but men.

verses.first_half: Why do you stand so far off, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and hide your face in the time of need and trouble?
verses.first_half_tle: Why standest thou so far off, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and hidest thy face in the needful time of trouble?

verses.first_half: The ungodly in his pride persecutes the poor;
verses.second_half: let him be taken in the crafty schemes that he has imagined.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly, for his own lust, doth persecute the poor:
verses.second_half_tle: let them be taken in the crafty wiliness that they have imagined.

verses.first_half: For the ungodly has boasted of his own heart’s desire;
verses.second_half: the covetous holds the LORD in contempt and blasphemes his Name.
verses.first_half_tle: For the ungodly hath made boast of his own heart’s desire,
verses.second_half_tle: and speaketh good of the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.

verses.first_half: The ungodly is so proud that he cares not for God;
verses.second_half: neither is God in any of his thoughts.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly is so proud that he care not for God;
verses.second_half_tle: neither is God in all his thoughts.

verses.first_half: His ways are always grievous;
verses.second_half: your judgments are far above, out of his sight, and therefore he defies all his enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: His ways are alway grievous;
verses.second_half_tle: thy judgments are far above out of his sight, and therefore defieth he all his enemies.

verses.first_half: For he has said in his heart, “I shall never be cast down;
verses.second_half: no harm shall happen to me.”
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath said in his heart, Tush, I shall never be cast down,
verses.second_half_tle: there shall no harm happen unto me.

verses.first_half: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud;
verses.second_half: under his tongue are ungodliness and vanity.
verses.first_half_tle: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud;
verses.second_half_tle: under his tongue is ungodliness and vanity.

verses.first_half: He sits lurking in the thievish corners of the streets, and in his hiding places he murders the innocent;
verses.second_half: his eyes are set against the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: He sitteth lurking in the thievish corners of the streets,
verses.second_half_tle: and privily in his lurking dens doth he murder the innocent; his eyes are set against the poor.

verses.first_half: For he lies waiting secretly, even as a lion lurks in his den,
verses.second_half: that he may ravish the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: For he lieth waiting secretly; even as a lion lurketh he in his den,
verses.second_half_tle: that he may ravish the poor.

verses.first_half: He ravishes the poor
verses.second_half: when he gets him into his net.
verses.first_half_tle: He doth ravish the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: when he getteth him into his net.

verses.first_half: The innocent is crushed and humbled before him,
verses.second_half: and the weak cannot stand against his might.
verses.first_half_tle: He falleth down, and humbleth himself,
verses.second_half_tle: that the congregation of the poor may fall into the hands of his captains.

verses.first_half: He has said in his heart, “God has forgotten;
verses.second_half: he hides away his face, and he will never see it.”
verses.first_half_tle: He hath said in his heart, Tush, God hath forgotten;
verses.second_half_tle: he hideth away his face, and he will never see it.

verses.first_half: Arise, O LORD God, and lift up your hand;
verses.second_half: forget not the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, O LORD God, and lift up thine hand;
verses.second_half_tle: forget not the poor.

verses.first_half: Why should the wicked blaspheme God,
verses.second_half: while he says in his heart, “You, O God, do not care”?
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore should the wicked blaspheme God,
verses.second_half_tle: while he doth say in his heart, Tush, thou God carest not for it?

verses.first_half: Surely you have seen it, for you behold ungodliness and wrong,
verses.second_half: that you may take the matter into your hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Surely thou hast seen it;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou beholdest ungodliness and wrong, that thou mayest take the matter into thy hand.

verses.first_half: The poor commits himself unto you,
verses.second_half: for you are the helper of the fatherless.
verses.first_half_tle: The poor commiteth himself unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou art the helper of the friendless.

verses.first_half: Break the power of the ungodly and malicious;
verses.second_half: search out his ungodliness until you have brought it all to light.
verses.first_half_tle: Break thou the power of the ungodly and malicious;
verses.second_half_tle: search out his ungodliness until thou find none.

verses.first_half: The LORD is King for ever and ever,
verses.second_half: and the nations have perished out of the land.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is King for ever and ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and the heathen are perished out of the land.

verses.first_half: O LORD, you have heard the desire of the poor;
verses.second_half: you prepare their heart, and your ear hearkens to it,
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the poor;
verses.second_half_tle: thou preparest their heart, and thine ear hearkeneth;

verses.first_half: To help the fatherless and poor with justice,
verses.second_half: that the one who is of the earth may terrify no more.
verses.first_half_tle: To help the fatherless and poor unto their right,
verses.second_half_tle: that the man of the earth be no more exalted against them.

verses.first_half: To help the fatherless and poor with justice,
verses.second_half: that the one who is of the earth may terrify no more.

verses.first_half: In the LORD I put my trust;
verses.second_half: how then can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird unto the hill;
verses.first_half_tle: In the LORD put I my trust;
verses.second_half_tle: how say ye then to my soul, that she should flee as a bird unto the hill?

verses.first_half: For behold, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrow upon the string,
verses.second_half: that they may secretly shoot at those who are true of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrows within the quiver,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may privily shoot at them which are true of heart.

verses.first_half: For the foundations will be cast down,
verses.second_half: and what can the righteous do?”
verses.first_half_tle: If the foundations be destroyed,
verses.second_half_tle: what can the righteous do?

verses.first_half: The LORD is in his holy temple;
verses.second_half: the LORD’s throne is in heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is in his holy temple;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD’s seat is in heaven.

verses.first_half: His eyes consider the poor,
verses.second_half: and his eyelids try the children of men.
verses.first_half_tle: His eyes consider the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: and his eyelids try the children of men.

verses.first_half: The LORD tests the righteous,
verses.second_half: but the ungodly, and those who delight in wickedness, his soul abhors.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD approveth the righteous:
verses.second_half_tle: but the ungodly, and him that delighteth in wickedness, doth his soul abhor.

verses.first_half: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest;
verses.second_half: this shall be their portion to drink.
verses.first_half_tle: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest:
verses.second_half_tle: this shall be their portion to drink.

verses.first_half: For the righteous LORD loves righteousness;
verses.second_half: the upright shall behold his face.
verses.first_half_tle: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: his countenance will behold the thing that is just.

verses.first_half: Help me, O LORD, for there is no godly one left;
verses.second_half: for the faithful have vanished from among the children of men.
verses.first_half_tle: Help me, LORD, for there is not one godly man left;
verses.second_half_tle: for the faithful are minished from among the children of men.

verses.first_half: They speak falsely, every one with his neighbor;
verses.second_half: they flatter with their lips and deceive with a double heart.
verses.first_half_tle: They talk of vanity every one with his neighbor;
verses.second_half_tle: they do but flatter with their lips, and dissemble in their double heart.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall root out all deceitful lips
verses.second_half: and the tongues that speak proud things,
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall root out all deceitful lips,
verses.second_half_tle: and the tongue that speaketh proud things;

verses.first_half: Which have said, “With our tongue will we prevail;
verses.second_half: our lips are our own; who is lord over us?”
verses.first_half_tle: Which have said, With our tongue will we prevail;
verses.second_half_tle: we are they that ought to speak; who is lord over us?

verses.first_half: “Now because of the trouble of the needy
verses.second_half: and because of the deep sighing of the poor,
verses.first_half_tle: Now for the comfortless troubles’ sake of the needy,
verses.second_half_tle: and because of the deep sighing of the poor,

verses.first_half: I will rise up,” says the LORD,
verses.second_half: “and will give help to every one who longs for it.”
verses.first_half_tle: I will up, saith the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and will help every one from him that swelleth against him, and will set him at rest.

verses.first_half: The words of the LORD are pure words, even as silver that is tried in the furnace,
verses.second_half: and as gold that is purified seven times in the fire.
verses.first_half_tle: The words of the LORD are pure words;
verses.second_half_tle: even as the silver which from the earth is tried, and purified seven times in the fire.

verses.first_half: Preserve us, O Lord, and save us
verses.second_half: from this perverse and evil generation.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

verses.first_half: The ungodly walk on every side
verses.second_half: when wickedness is exalted among the children of men.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly walk on every side:
verses.second_half_tle: when they are exalted, the children of men are put to rebuke.

verses.first_half: How long will you utterly forget me, O LORD?
verses.second_half: How long will you hide your face from me?
verses.first_half_tle: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD; for ever?
verses.second_half_tle: how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

verses.first_half: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul and be so vexed in my heart?
verses.second_half: How long shall my enemy triumph over me?
verses.first_half_tle: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul, and be so vexed in my heart?
verses.second_half_tle: how long shall mine enemy triumph over me?

verses.first_half: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half: give light to my eyes, that I sleep not in death,
verses.first_half_tle: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half_tle: lighten mine eyes, that I sleep not in death;

verses.first_half: Lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed against him”;
verses.second_half: for if I am cast down, those who trouble me will rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him:
verses.second_half_tle: for if I be cast down, they that trouble me will rejoice at it.

verses.first_half: But my trust is in your mercy,
verses.second_half: and my heart is joyful in your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: But my trust is in thy mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: and my heart is joyful in thy salvation.

verses.first_half: I will sing of the LORD, because he has dealt so lovingly with me;
verses.second_half: indeed, I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: I will sing of the LORD, because he hath dealt so lovingly with me;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, I will praise the Name of the Lord Most Highest.

verses.first_half: The fool has said in his heart,
verses.second_half: “There is no God.”
verses.first_half_tle: The fool hath said in his heart,
verses.second_half_tle: There is no God.

verses.first_half: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their doings;
verses.second_half: there is none that does good, no, not one.
verses.first_half_tle: They are corrupt, and become abominable in their doings;
verses.second_half_tle: there is none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.first_half: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
verses.second_half: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
verses.second_half_tle: to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

verses.first_half: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
verses.second_half: there is none that does good, no, not one.
verses.first_half_tle: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable;
verses.second_half_tle: there is none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.first_half: Have they no knowledge, all those workers of evil,
verses.second_half: who eat up my people as bread, and call not upon the LORD?
verses.first_half_tle: Have they no knowledge, that they are all such workers of mischief,
verses.second_half_tle: eating up my people as it were bread, and call not upon the LORD?

verses.first_half: There were they brought into great fear, even where no fear was;
verses.second_half: for God is in the generation of the righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: There were they brought in great fear, even where no fear was;
verses.second_half_tle: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

verses.first_half: Though you have made a mockery of the counsel of the poor,
verses.second_half: yet they put their trust in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: As for you, ye have made a mock at the counsel of the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: because he putteth his trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Zion?
verses.second_half: When the LORD restores his captive people, then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
verses.first_half_tle: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Zion?
verses.second_half_tle: When the LORD turneth the captivity of his people, then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

verses.first_half: LORD, who shall dwell in your tabernacle?
verses.second_half: Or who shall rest upon your holy hill?
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, who shall dwell in thy tabernacle?
verses.second_half_tle: or who shall rest upon thy holy hill?

verses.first_half: Whoever leads an uncorrupt life,
verses.second_half: and does that which is right, and speaks the truth from his heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Even he that leadeth an uncorrupt life,
verses.second_half_tle: and doeth the thing which is right, and speaketh the truth from his heart.

verses.first_half: He has not spoken deceitfully with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor,
verses.second_half: and has not slandered his neighbor.
verses.first_half_tle: He that hath used no deceit in his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor,
verses.second_half_tle: and hath not slandered his neighbor.

verses.first_half: In his eyes the wicked is rejected,
verses.second_half: and he makes much of those who fear the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: He that setteth not by himself, but is lowly in his own eyes,
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh much of them that fear the LORD.

verses.first_half: He swears to his neighbor and disappoints him not,
verses.second_half: though it were to his own hindrance.
verses.first_half_tle: He that sweareth unto his neighbor, and disappointeth him not,
verses.second_half_tle: though it were to his own hindrance.

verses.first_half: He has not given his money for usury,
verses.second_half: nor taken a bribe against the innocent.
verses.first_half_tle: He that hath not given his money upon usury,
verses.second_half_tle: nor taken reward against the innocent.

verses.first_half: Whoever does these things
verses.second_half: shall never be overthrown.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso doeth these things
verses.second_half_tle: shall never fall.

verses.first_half: Preserve me, O God,
verses.second_half: for in you have I put my trust.
verses.first_half_tle: Preserve me, O God:
verses.second_half_tle: for in thee have I put my trust.

verses.first_half: O my soul, you have said unto the LORD,
verses.second_half: “You are my Lord; I have no good apart from you.”
verses.first_half_tle: O my soul, thou hast said unto the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: Thou art my God; I have no good like unto thee.

verses.first_half: All my delight is upon the saints who are on the earth,
verses.second_half: and upon those who excel in virtue.
verses.first_half_tle: All my delight is upon the saints that are in the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and upon such as excel in virtue.

verses.first_half: But those who run after another god
verses.second_half: shall have great trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: But they that run after another god
verses.second_half_tle: shall have great trouble.

verses.first_half: Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
verses.second_half: neither make mention of their names with my lips.
verses.first_half_tle: Their drink offerings of blood will I not offer,
verses.second_half_tle: neither make mention of their names within my lips.

verses.first_half: The LORD himself is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup;
verses.second_half: you shall maintain my lot.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD himself is the portion of mine inheritance, and of my cup;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt maintain my lot.

verses.first_half: The boundaries have fallen for me in pleasant places;
verses.second_half: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.
verses.first_half_tle: The lot is fallen unto me in a fair ground;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, I have a goodly heritage.

verses.first_half: I will thank the LORD for giving me counsel;
verses.second_half: my heart also chastens me in the night season.
verses.first_half_tle: I will thank the LORD for giving me warning;
verses.second_half_tle: my reins also chasten me in the night season.

verses.first_half: I have set the LORD always before me;
verses.second_half: he is at my right hand; therefore I shall not fall.
verses.first_half_tle: I have set the LORD alway before me;
verses.second_half_tle: for he is on my right hand, therefore I shall not fall.

verses.first_half: Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices.
verses.second_half: My flesh also shall rest in hope.
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth:
verses.second_half_tle: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

verses.first_half: For you shall not leave my soul in the grave,
verses.second_half: neither shall you allow your Holy One to see corruption.
verses.first_half_tle: For why? Thou shalt not leave my soul in hell;
verses.second_half_tle: neither shalt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.

verses.first_half: You shall show me the path of life; in your presence is the fullness of joy,
verses.second_half: and at your right hand there is pleasure for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt show me the path of life: in thy presence is the fullness of joy,
verses.second_half_tle: and at thy right hand there is pleasure for evermore.

verses.first_half: Hear what is right, O LORD; consider my complaint;
verses.second_half: hearken to my prayer, which does not come from lying lips.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear the right, O LORD, consider my complaint,
verses.second_half_tle: and hearken unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

verses.first_half: Let justice for me come forth from your presence,
verses.second_half: and let your eyes look upon that which is right.
verses.first_half_tle: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence;
verses.second_half_tle: and let thine eyes look upon the thing that is equal.

verses.first_half: You have tested and visited my heart in the night season.
verses.second_half: If you try me you shall find no wickedness in me; my mouth shall not offend.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast proved and visited mine heart in the night season; thou hast tried me, and shalt find no wickedness in me;
verses.second_half_tle: for I am utterly purposed that my mouth shall not offend.

verses.first_half: As for the works of others,
verses.second_half: because of the words of your lips, I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the works of men,
verses.second_half_tle: by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the ways of the destroyer.

verses.first_half: Hold my steps firmly in your paths,
verses.second_half: that my footsteps may not slip.
verses.first_half_tle: O hold thou up my goings in thy paths,
verses.second_half_tle: that my footsteps slip not.

verses.first_half: I have called upon you, O God, for you will hear me;
verses.second_half: incline your ear to me and hearken to my words.
verses.first_half_tle: I have called upon thee, O God, for thou shalt hear me:
verses.second_half_tle: incline thine ear to me, and hearken unto my words.

verses.first_half: Show your marvelous loving-kindness, you that are the Savior of those who put their trust in you
verses.second_half: from the ones who resist your right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Show thy marvelous loving-kindness, thou that art the Savior of them which put their trust in thee,
verses.second_half_tle: from such as resist thy right hand.

verses.first_half: Keep me as the apple of your eye;
verses.second_half: hide me under the shadow of your wings,
verses.first_half_tle: Keep me as the apple of an eye;
verses.second_half_tle: hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verses.first_half: From the ungodly who assault me,
verses.second_half: even from my enemies who encompass me to take away my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: From the ungodly, that trouble me;
verses.second_half_tle: mine enemies compass me round about, to take away my soul.

verses.first_half: They have closed their heart to pity,
verses.second_half: and their mouth speaks proud things.
verses.first_half_tle: They are inclosed in their own fat,
verses.second_half_tle: and their mouth speaketh proud things.

verses.first_half: They lie waiting in my way on every side,
verses.second_half: watching how they may cast me down to the ground,
verses.first_half_tle: They lie waiting in our way on every side,
verses.second_half_tle: watching to cast us down to the ground;

verses.first_half: Like a lion that is greedy for its prey,
verses.second_half: and like a young lion lurking in secret places.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey,
verses.second_half_tle: and as it were a lion’s whelp lurking in secret places.

verses.first_half: Rise up, O LORD, confront them and cast them down;
verses.second_half: deliver my soul from the ungodly by your sword and by your hand,
verses.first_half_tle: Up, LORD, disappoint him, and cast him down;
verses.second_half_tle: deliver my soul from the ungodly, by thine own sword;

verses.first_half: From those, O LORD, from those whose portion in life is of the world,
verses.second_half: whose bellies you fill with your hidden treasure.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, by thy hand, O LORD; from the men of the evil world;
verses.second_half_tle: which have their portion in this life, whose bellies thou fillest with thy hid treasure.

verses.first_half: They have children at their desire,
verses.second_half: and leave the rest of their abundance for their little ones.
verses.first_half_tle: They have children at their desire,
verses.second_half_tle: and leave the rest of their substance for their babes.

verses.first_half: But as for me, I will behold your presence in righteousness;
verses.second_half: and when I awake and see your likeness, I shall be satisfied.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for me, I shall behold thy presence in righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: and when I awake up after thy likeness, I shall be satisfied.

verses.first_half: I will love you, O LORD my strength;
verses.second_half: the LORD is my rock, my stronghold, and my deliverer,
verses.first_half_tle: I will love thee, O LORD my strength.
verses.second_half_tle: The LORD is my stony rock, and my defense;

verses.first_half: My Savior, my God, and my might in whom I will trust,
verses.second_half: my buckler, the horn of my salvation, and my refuge.
verses.first_half_tle: My Savior, my God, and my might, in whom I will trust;
verses.second_half_tle: my buckler, the horn also of my salvation, and my refuge.

verses.first_half: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised;
verses.second_half: so shall I be safe from my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: I will call upon the LORD, which is worthy to be praised;
verses.second_half_tle: so shall I be safe from mine enemies.

verses.first_half: The waves of death encompassed me;
verses.second_half: the floods that would swallow me up made me afraid.
verses.first_half_tle: The sorrows of death compassed me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the overflowings of ungodliness made me afraid.

verses.first_half: The cords of the grave surrounded me;
verses.second_half: the snares of death overtook me.
verses.first_half_tle: The pains of hell came about me;
verses.second_half_tle: the snares of death overtook me.

verses.first_half: In my trouble I called upon the LORD
verses.second_half: and cried unto my God for help.
verses.first_half_tle: In my trouble I called upon the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and complained unto my God:

verses.first_half: From his holy temple he heard my voice.
verses.second_half: My complaint came before him; it entered into his ears.
verses.first_half_tle: So he heard my voice out of his holy temple,
verses.second_half_tle: and my complaint came before him; it entered even into his ears.

verses.first_half: The earth trembled and quaked;
verses.second_half: the very foundations of the hills shook and were removed, because he was angry.
verses.first_half_tle: The earth trembled and quaked,
verses.second_half_tle: the very foundations also of the hills shook, and were removed, because he was wroth.

verses.first_half: There went out smoke from his nostrils and a consuming fire out of his mouth;
verses.second_half: coals of fire issued from his presence.
verses.first_half_tle: There went a smoke out in his presence,
verses.second_half_tle: and a consuming fire out of his mouth, so that coals were kindled at it.

verses.first_half: He parted the heavens also and came down,
verses.second_half: and it was dark under his feet.
verses.first_half_tle: He bowed the heavens also, and came down,
verses.second_half_tle: and it was dark under his feet.

verses.first_half: He rode upon the cherubim and flew;
verses.second_half: he came flying upon the wings of the wind.
verses.first_half_tle: He rode upon the Cherubim, and did fly;
verses.second_half_tle: he came flying upon the wings of the wind.

verses.first_half: He made darkness his secret place;
verses.second_half: dark waters and thick clouds were his covering round about him.
verses.first_half_tle: He made darkness his secret place,
verses.second_half_tle: his pavilion round about him with dark water, and thick clouds to cover him.

verses.first_half: At the brightness of his presence his clouds broke forth:
verses.second_half: hailstones and coals of fire.
verses.first_half_tle: At the brightness of his presence his clouds removed;
verses.second_half_tle: hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.first_half: The LORD also thundered out of heaven, and the Most High gave forth his voice:
verses.second_half: hailstones and coals of fire.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD also thundered out of heaven, and the Highest gave his thunder;
verses.second_half_tle: hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.first_half: He sent out his arrows and scattered them;
verses.second_half: he cast forth lightning and destroyed them.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent out his arrows and scattered them;
verses.second_half_tle: he cast forth lightnings, and destroyed them.

verses.first_half: The springs of water were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered,
verses.second_half: at your rebuke, O LORD, at the blasting of the breath of your displeasure.
verses.first_half_tle: The springs of waters were seen, and the foundations of the round world were discovered,
verses.second_half_tle: at thy chiding, O LORD, at the blasting of the breath of thy displeasure.

verses.first_half: He reached down from on high to grasp me,
verses.second_half: and he took me out of many waters.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent down from on high to fetch me,
verses.second_half_tle: and took me out of many waters.

verses.first_half: He delivered me from my strongest enemy, and from those who hated me,
verses.second_half: for they were too mighty for me.
verses.first_half_tle: He delivered me from my strongest enemy, and from them which hate me;
verses.second_half_tle: for they were too mighty for me.

verses.first_half: They confronted me in the day of my trouble,
verses.second_half: but the LORD upheld me.
verses.first_half_tle: They came upon me in the day of my trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: but the LORD was my upholder.

verses.first_half: He brought me forth into a place of liberty;
verses.second_half: he delivered me, because I had found favor in his eyes.
verses.first_half_tle: He brought me forth also into a place of liberty;
verses.second_half_tle: he brought me forth, even because he had a favor unto me.

verses.first_half: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteous dealing;
verses.second_half: according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me,
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD rewarded me after my righteous dealing,
verses.second_half_tle: according to the cleanness of my hands did he recompense me.

verses.first_half: Because I had kept the ways of the LORD
verses.second_half: and had not forsaken my God, as the wicked do.
verses.first_half_tle: Because I have kept the ways of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and have not forsaken my God, as the wicked doth.

verses.first_half: For I had an eye unto all his laws
verses.second_half: and did not cast out his commandments from me.
verses.first_half_tle: For I have an eye unto all his laws,
verses.second_half_tle: and will not cast out his commandments from me.

verses.first_half: I was also uncorrupt before him
verses.second_half: and kept myself from my own wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: I was also uncorrupt before him,
verses.second_half_tle: and eschewed mine own wickedness.

verses.first_half: Therefore the LORD rewarded me according to my righteous dealing,
verses.second_half: and according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore the LORD rewarded me after my righteous dealing,
verses.second_half_tle: and according unto the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

verses.first_half: With the faithful you show yourself faithful,
verses.second_half: and with the upright you show yourself upright.
verses.first_half_tle: With the holy thou shalt be holy,
verses.second_half_tle: and with a perfect man thou shalt be perfect.

verses.first_half: With the pure you show yourself pure,
verses.second_half: but with the crooked you show yourself shrewd.
verses.first_half_tle: With the clean thou shalt be clean,
verses.second_half_tle: and with the froward thou shalt be froward.

verses.first_half: For you shall save the people who are in adversity,
verses.second_half: but shall bring down the high looks of the proud.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou shalt save the people that are in adversity,
verses.second_half_tle: and shalt bring down the high looks of the proud.

verses.first_half: You also shall light my lamp;
verses.second_half: the LORD my God shall turn my darkness into light.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou also shalt light my candle;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD my God shall make my darkness to be light.

verses.first_half: For with you I shall crush a host of men,
verses.second_half: and with the help of my God I can leap over a wall.
verses.first_half_tle: For in thee I shall discomfit an host of men,
verses.second_half_tle: and with the help of my God I shall leap over the wall.

verses.first_half: The way of God is an undefiled way; the word of the LORD also is tried in the fire;
verses.second_half: he is the defender of all those who put their trust in him.
verses.first_half_tle: The way of God is an undefiled way:
verses.second_half_tle: the word of the LORD also is tried in the fire; he is the defender of all them that put their trust in him.

verses.first_half: For who is God, but the LORD,
verses.second_half: or who is a rock, except our God?
verses.first_half_tle: For who is God, but the LORD?
verses.second_half_tle: or who hath any strength, except our God?

verses.first_half: It is God who girds me with strength for war
verses.second_half: and makes my way perfect.
verses.first_half_tle: It is God that girdeth me with strength of war
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh my way perfect.

verses.first_half: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer
verses.second_half: and sets me up on high.
verses.first_half_tle: He maketh my feet like harts’ feet,
verses.second_half_tle: and setteth me up on high.

verses.first_half: He teaches my hands to fight,
verses.second_half: and my arms shall bend even a bow of bronze.
verses.first_half_tle: He teacheth mine hands to fight,
verses.second_half_tle: and mine arms shall bend even a bow of steel.

verses.first_half: You have given me the shield of your salvation;
verses.second_half: your right hand also shall hold me up, and your loving correction shall make me great.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast given me the defense of thy salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: thy right hand also shall hold me up, and thy loving correction shall make me great.

verses.first_half: You have made a broad path for my feet,
verses.second_half: and my footsteps shall not slip.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt make room enough under me for to go,
verses.second_half_tle: that my footsteps shall not slide.

verses.first_half: I will follow my enemies and overtake them;
verses.second_half: I will not turn again until I have destroyed them.
verses.first_half_tle: I will follow upon mine enemies, and overtake them;
verses.second_half_tle: neither will I turn again till I have destroyed them.

verses.first_half: I will smite them, and they shall not be able to stand.
verses.second_half: They shall fall under my feet.
verses.first_half_tle: I will smite them, that they shall not be able to stand,
verses.second_half_tle: but fall under my feet.

verses.first_half: You have girded me with strength for the battle;
verses.second_half: you shall throw down my enemies under me.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt throw down mine enemies under me.

verses.first_half: You have made my enemies turn their backs upon me,
verses.second_half: and I shall destroy those who hate me.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast made mine enemies also to turn their backs upon me,
verses.second_half_tle: and I shall destroy them that hate me.

verses.first_half: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them;
verses.second_half: even unto the LORD shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, even unto the LORD shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.

verses.first_half: I will beat them as small as dust before the wind;
verses.second_half: I will tread them down as mire in the streets.
verses.first_half_tle: I will beat them as small as the dust before the wind:
verses.second_half_tle: I will cast them out as the clay in the streets.

verses.first_half: You shall deliver me from the strivings of the peoples,
verses.second_half: and you shall make me the head of the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt deliver me from the strivings of the people,
verses.second_half_tle: and thou shalt make me the head of the nations; a people whom I have not known shall serve me.

verses.first_half: A people whom I have not known
verses.second_half: shall be in subjection under me.
verses.first_half_tle: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me;
verses.second_half_tle: the strangers shall feign obedience unto me.

verses.first_half: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me;
verses.second_half: and foreigners shall cringe before me.
verses.first_half_tle: The strangers shall fail,
verses.second_half_tle: and come trembling out of their strongholds.

verses.first_half: Foreigners shall lose heart,
verses.second_half: and, being afraid, shall come out of their strongholds.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD liveth; and blessed be my strong helper,
verses.second_half_tle: and praised be the God of my salvation;

verses.first_half: The LORD lives, and blessed be my rock,
verses.second_half: and praised be the God of my salvation,
verses.first_half_tle: Even the God that seeth that I be avenged,
verses.second_half_tle: and subdueth the people unto me.

verses.first_half: Even the God who sees that I am avenged
verses.second_half: and subdues the peoples under me.
verses.first_half_tle: It is he that delivereth me from my cruel enemies, and setteth me up above mine adversaries:
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt rid me from the wicked man.

verses.first_half: It is he who delivers me from my cruel enemies, and lifts me up above my adversaries;
verses.second_half: you shall rid me of the wicked.
verses.first_half_tle: For this cause will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the Gentiles,
verses.second_half_tle: and sing praises unto thy Name.

verses.first_half: For this cause will I give thanks unto you, O LORD, among the nations,
verses.second_half: and sing praises unto your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Great prosperity giveth he unto his King,
verses.second_half_tle: and showeth loving-kindness unto David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

verses.first_half: Great prosperity he gives unto his King,
verses.second_half: and shows loving-kindness to David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

verses.first_half: The heavens declare the glory of God,
verses.second_half: and the firmament shows his handiwork.
verses.first_half_tle: The heavens declare the glory of God,
verses.second_half_tle: and the firmament showeth his handy-work.

verses.first_half: One day speaks to another,
verses.second_half: and one night gives knowledge to another.
verses.first_half_tle: One day telleth another;
verses.second_half_tle: and one night certifieth another.

verses.first_half: There is neither speech nor language,
verses.second_half: and their voices are not heard;
verses.first_half_tle: There is neither speech nor language;
verses.second_half_tle: but their voices are heard among them.

verses.first_half: But their sound has gone out into all lands,
verses.second_half: and their words to the ends of the world.
verses.first_half_tle: Their sound is gone out into all lands;
verses.second_half_tle: and their words into the ends of the world.

verses.first_half: In them he has set a tent for the sun,
verses.second_half: which comes forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoices like a strong man to run his course.
verses.first_half_tle: In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun;
verses.second_half_tle: which cometh forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a giant to run his course.

verses.first_half: It goes forth from the uttermost part of the heavens, and runs about to the end of it again,
verses.second_half: and there is nothing hidden from its heat.
verses.first_half_tle: It goeth forth from the uttermost part of the heaven, and runneth about unto the end of it again;
verses.second_half_tle: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

verses.first_half: The law of the LORD is perfect, reviving the soul;
verses.second_half: the testimony of the LORD is sure, and gives wisdom to the simple.
verses.first_half_tle: The law of the LORD is an undefiled law, converting the soul;
verses.second_half_tle: the testimony of the LORD is sure, and giveth wisdom unto the simple.

verses.first_half: The statutes of the LORD are right, and rejoice the heart;
verses.second_half: the commandment of the LORD is pure, and gives light to the eyes.
verses.first_half_tle: The statutes of the LORD are right, and rejoice the heart;
verses.second_half_tle: the commandment of the LORD is pure, and giveth light unto the eyes.

verses.first_half: The fear of the LORD is clean, and endures for ever;
verses.second_half: the judgments of the LORD are true, and righteous altogether.
verses.first_half_tle: The fear of the LORD is clean, and endureth for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: the judgments of the LORD are true, and righteous altogether.

verses.first_half: More to be desired are they than gold, even much fine gold;
verses.second_half: sweeter also than honey, than the drippings from the honeycomb.
verses.first_half_tle: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold;
verses.second_half_tle: sweeter also than honey, and the honeycomb.

verses.first_half: Moreover, by them is your servant taught,
verses.second_half: and in keeping them there is great reward.
verses.first_half_tle: Moreover, by them is thy servant taught;
verses.second_half_tle: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

verses.first_half: Who can tell how often he offends?
verses.second_half: O cleanse me from my secret faults.
verses.first_half_tle: Who can tell how oft he offendeth?
verses.second_half_tle: O cleanse thou me from my secret faults.

verses.first_half: Keep your servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me;
verses.second_half: so shall I be undefiled, and innocent of great offense.
verses.first_half_tle: Keep thy servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me;
verses.second_half_tle: so shall I be undefiled, and innocent from the great offense.

verses.first_half: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be always acceptable in your sight,
verses.second_half: O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be alway acceptable in thy sight,
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, my strength and my redeemer.

verses.first_half: May the LORD hear you in the day of trouble,
verses.second_half: the Name of the God of Jacob defend you;
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: the Name of the God of Jacob defend thee:

verses.first_half: Send you help from the sanctuary,
verses.second_half: and strengthen you out of Zion;
verses.first_half_tle: Send thee help from the sanctuary,
verses.second_half_tle: and strengthen thee out of Zion:

verses.first_half: Remember all your offerings,
verses.second_half: and accept your burnt sacrifice;
verses.first_half_tle: Remember all thy offerings,
verses.second_half_tle: and accept thy burnt-sacrifice:

verses.first_half: Grant you your heart’s desire,
verses.second_half: and accomplish all your plans.
verses.first_half_tle: Grant thee thy heart’s desire,
verses.second_half_tle: and fulfill all thy mind.

verses.first_half: We will rejoice in your salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God;
verses.second_half: may the LORD grant all your petitions.
verses.first_half_tle: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and triumph in the Name of the LORD our God:
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD perform all thy petitions.

verses.first_half: Now I know that the LORD helps his Anointed, and will answer him from his holy heaven,
verses.second_half: even with the saving strength of his right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Now know I that the LORD helpeth his Anointed, and will hear him from his holy heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: even with the wholesome strength of his right hand.

verses.first_half: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses,
verses.second_half: but we put our trust in the Name of the LORD our God.
verses.first_half_tle: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses;
verses.second_half_tle: but we will remember the Name of the LORD our God.

verses.first_half: They are brought down and fallen,
verses.second_half: but we will arise and stand upright.
verses.first_half_tle: They are brought down and fallen;
verses.second_half_tle: but we are risen and stand upright.

verses.first_half: O LORD, save the King,
verses.second_half: and hear us when we call upon you.
verses.first_half_tle: Save, LORD; and hear us, O King of heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: when we call upon thee.

verses.first_half: The King shall rejoice in your strength, O LORD;
verses.second_half: exceedingly glad shall he be of your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: The King shall rejoice in thy strength, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: exceeding glad shall he be of thy salvation.

verses.first_half: You have given him his heart’s desire,
verses.second_half: and have not denied him the request of his lips.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire,
verses.second_half_tle: and hast not denied him the request of his lips.

verses.first_half: For you shall meet him with the blessings of goodness,
verses.second_half: and shall set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou shalt meet him with the blessings of goodness,
verses.second_half_tle: and shalt set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

verses.first_half: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him:
verses.second_half: length of days, for ever and ever.
verses.first_half_tle: He asked life of thee; and thou gavest him a long life,
verses.second_half_tle: even for ever and ever.

verses.first_half: His honor is great because of your salvation;
verses.second_half: glory and majesty shall you lay upon him.
verses.first_half_tle: His honor is great in thy salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: glory and great worship shalt thou lay upon him.

verses.first_half: For you shall give him everlasting felicity
verses.second_half: and make him glad with the joy of your countenance.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou shalt give him everlasting felicity,
verses.second_half_tle: and make him glad with the joy of thy countenance.

verses.first_half: For the King puts his trust in the LORD,
verses.second_half: and because of the mercy of the Most High, he shall not be moved.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? Because the King putteth his trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the mercy of the Most Highest he shall not miscarry.

verses.first_half: All your enemies shall feel your hand;
verses.second_half: your right hand shall find those who hate you.
verses.first_half_tle: All thine enemies shall feel thine hand;
verses.second_half_tle: thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.

verses.first_half: You shall make them like a fiery oven in the time of your wrath;
verses.second_half: the LORD shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thy wrath:
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.

verses.first_half: Their offspring you shall root out of the earth,
verses.second_half: and their seed from among the children of men.
verses.first_half_tle: Their fruit shalt thou root out of the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.first_half: For they intended evil against you,
verses.second_half: and imagined wicked schemes, which they are not able to perform.
verses.first_half_tle: For they intended mischief against thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and imagined such a device as they are not able to perform.

verses.first_half: Therefore you shall put them to flight,
verses.second_half: and the strings of your bow you shall aim at their faces.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore shalt thou put them to flight,
verses.second_half_tle: and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against the face of them.

verses.first_half: Be exalted, O LORD, in your own strength;
verses.second_half: so we will sing and praise your power.
verses.first_half_tle: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength;
verses.second_half_tle: so will we sing, and praise thy power.

verses.first_half: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me,
verses.second_half: and are so far from my cry, and from the words of my complaint?
verses.first_half_tle: My God, my God, look upon me; why hast thou forsaken me,
verses.second_half_tle: and art so far from my health, and from the words of my complaint?

verses.first_half: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but you do not hear;
verses.second_half: in the night season also, but I find no rest.
verses.first_half_tle: O my God, I cry in the day-time, but thou hearest not;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the night season also I take no rest.

verses.first_half: But you remain holy,
verses.second_half: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: And thou continuest holy,
verses.second_half_tle: O thou Worship of Israel.

verses.first_half: Our fathers hoped in you;
verses.second_half: they trusted in you, and you delivered them.
verses.first_half_tle: Our fathers hoped in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: they trusted in thee, and thou didst deliver them.

verses.first_half: They called upon you, and were delivered;
verses.second_half: they put their trust in you, and were not confounded.
verses.first_half_tle: They called upon thee, and were holpen;
verses.second_half_tle: they put their trust in thee, and were not confounded.
