verses.first_half: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man,
verses.second_half: scorned by all, and the outcast of the people.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man;
verses.second_half_tle: a very scorn of men, and the outcast of the people.

verses.first_half: All those who see me laugh me to scorn;
verses.second_half: they curl their lips, and shake their heads, saying,
verses.first_half_tle: All they that see me laugh me to scorn;
verses.second_half_tle: they shoot out their lips, and shake their heads, saying,

verses.first_half: “He trusted in God, that he would deliver him;
verses.second_half: let him deliver him, if he will have him.”
verses.first_half_tle: He trusted in the LORD, that he would deliver him;
verses.second_half_tle: let him deliver him, if he will have him.

verses.first_half: But you are he that took me out of my mother’s womb;
verses.second_half: you were my hope, when I was yet upon my mother’s breasts.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou art he that took me out of my mother’s womb;
verses.second_half_tle: thou wast my hope, when I hanged yet upon my mother’s breasts.

verses.first_half: I have been cast upon you ever since I was born;
verses.second_half: you are my God, even from my mother’s womb.
verses.first_half_tle: I have been left unto thee ever since I was born;
verses.second_half_tle: thou art my God even from my mother’s womb.

verses.first_half: O go not far from me, for trouble is near at hand,
verses.second_half: and there is none to help me.
verses.first_half_tle: O go not from me, for trouble is hard at hand,
verses.second_half_tle: and there is none to help me.

verses.first_half: Many oxen have come around me;
verses.second_half: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.
verses.first_half_tle: Many oxen are come about me;
verses.second_half_tle: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.

verses.first_half: They gape at me with their mouths,
verses.second_half: like a ravening and a roaring lion.
verses.first_half_tle: They gape upon me with their mouths,
verses.second_half_tle: as it were a ramping and a roaring lion.

verses.first_half: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint;
verses.second_half: my heart also in the midst of my body is like melting wax.
verses.first_half_tle: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint;
verses.second_half_tle: my heart also in the midst of my body is even like melting wax.

verses.first_half: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaves to my gums,
verses.second_half: and you bring me into the dust of death.
verses.first_half_tle: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaveth to my gums,
verses.second_half_tle: and thou bringest me into the dust of death.

verses.first_half: For many dogs have come about me,
verses.second_half: and the council of the wicked lays siege against me.
verses.first_half_tle: For many dogs are come about me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the council of the wicked layeth siege against me.

verses.first_half: They pierced my hands and my feet; I can count all my bones;
verses.second_half: they stand staring and looking upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: They pierced my hands and my feet: I may tell all my bones:
verses.second_half_tle: they stand staring and looking upon me.

verses.first_half: They part my garments among them,
verses.second_half: and casts lots for my clothing.
verses.first_half_tle: They part my garments among them,
verses.second_half_tle: and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.first_half: But be not far from me, O LORD.
verses.second_half: You are my succor; hasten to help me.
verses.first_half_tle: But be not thou far from me, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: Thou art my succor, haste thee to help me.

verses.first_half: Deliver my soul from the sword,
verses.second_half: my life from the power of the dog.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver my soul from the sword,
verses.second_half_tle: my darling from the power of the dog.

verses.first_half: Save me from the lion’s mouth,
verses.second_half: and my soul in misery from among the horns of wild oxen.
verses.first_half_tle: Save me from the lion’s mouth;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast heard me also from among the horns of the unicorns.

verses.first_half: I will declare your Name to my brethren;
verses.second_half: in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.
verses.first_half_tle: I will declare thy Name unto my brethren;
verses.second_half_tle: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD, you that fear him;
verses.second_half: magnify him, all you seed of Jacob, and fear him, all you seed of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, ye that fear him:
verses.second_half_tle: magnify him, all ye of the seed of Jacob; and fear him, all ye seed of Israel.

verses.first_half: For he has not despised nor abhorred the low estate of the poor;
verses.second_half: he has not hidden his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard him.
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the low estate of the poor;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath not hid his face from him; but when he called unto him he heard him.

verses.first_half: My praise is of you in the great congregation;
verses.second_half: my vows will I perform in the sight of those who fear him.
verses.first_half_tle: My praise is of thee in the great congregation;
verses.second_half_tle: my vows will I perform in the sight of them that fear him.

verses.first_half: The poor shall eat and be satisfied;
verses.second_half: those who seek after the LORD shall praise him; may your hearts live for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The poor shall eat and be satisfied; they that seek after the LORD shall praise him:
verses.second_half_tle: your heart shall live for ever.

verses.first_half: All the ends of the world shall remember, and be turned unto the LORD,
verses.second_half: and all the families of the nations shall worship before him.
verses.first_half_tle: All the ends of the world shall remember themselves, and be turned unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before him.

verses.first_half: For the kingdom is the LORD’s,
verses.second_half: and he is the Governor among the peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: For the kingdom is the LORD’s,
verses.second_half_tle: and he is the Governor among the nations.

verses.first_half: All those who sleep in the earth, how shall they worship him?
verses.second_half: All those who go down into the dust, how shall they kneel before him?
verses.first_half_tle: All such as be fat upon earth
verses.second_half_tle: have eaten, and worshiped.

verses.first_half: But my life shall be preserved in his sight, and my children shall worship him;
verses.second_half: they shall tell of the Lord to the generations to come;
verses.first_half_tle: All they that go down into the dust shall kneel before him;
verses.second_half_tle: and no man hath quickened his own soul.

verses.first_half: And to a people yet unborn shall they declare his righteousness,
verses.second_half: that he has brought it to pass.
verses.first_half_tle: My seed shall serve him:
verses.second_half_tle: they shall be counted unto the Lord for a generation.

verses.first_half_tle: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness
verses.second_half_tle: unto a people that shall be born, whom the Lord hath made.

verses.first_half: The LORD is my shepherd;
verses.second_half: therefore I can lack nothing.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is my shepherd;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore can I lack nothing.

verses.first_half: He shall feed me in green pastures
verses.second_half: and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall feed me in a green pasture
verses.second_half_tle: and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.

verses.first_half: He shall refresh my soul
verses.second_half: and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness for his Name’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall convert my soul,
verses.second_half_tle: and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness for his Name’s sake.

verses.first_half: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil,
verses.second_half: for you are with me; your rod and your staff comfort me.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff comfort me.

verses.first_half: You shall prepare a table before me, in the presence of those who trouble me;
verses.second_half: you have anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt prepare a table before me in the presence of them that trouble me;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.

verses.first_half: Surely your goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life,
verses.second_half: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Surely thy loving-kindness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever

verses.first_half: The earth is the LORD’s and all that is in it,
verses.second_half: the compass of the world and those who dwell therein.
verses.first_half_tle: The earth is the LORD’s and all that therein is;
verses.second_half_tle: the compass of the world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.first_half: For he has founded it upon the seas
verses.second_half: and established it upon the rivers of the deep.
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath founded it upon the seas,
verses.second_half_tle: and stablished it upon the floods.

verses.first_half: Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD?
verses.second_half: Or who shall stand in his holy place?
verses.first_half_tle: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD?
verses.second_half_tle: or who shall rise up in his holy place?

verses.first_half: He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
verses.second_half: and who has not set his mind upon vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbor.
verses.first_half_tle: Even he that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;
verses.second_half_tle: and that hath not lift up his mind unto vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbor.

verses.first_half: He shall receive blessing from the LORD
verses.second_half: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

verses.first_half: This is the generation of those who seek him,
verses.second_half: even of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: This is the generation of them that seek him;
verses.second_half_tle: even of them that seek thy face, O God of Jacob.

verses.first_half: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
verses.second_half: and the King of glory shall come in.
verses.first_half_tle: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors;
verses.second_half_tle: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.first_half: “Who is the King of glory?”
verses.second_half: “It is the LORD, strong and mighty, even the LORD, mighty in battle.”
verses.first_half_tle: Who is this King of glory?
verses.second_half_tle: It is the LORD strong and mighty, even the LORD mighty in battle.

verses.first_half: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
verses.second_half: and the King of glory shall come in.
verses.first_half_tle: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors;
verses.second_half_tle: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.first_half: “Who is the King of glory?”
verses.second_half: “The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory.”
verses.first_half_tle: Who is this King of glory?
verses.second_half_tle: Even the LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory.

verses.first_half: Unto you, O LORD, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in you;
verses.second_half: O let me not be ashamed, neither let my enemies triumph over me.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee, O LORD, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in thee:
verses.second_half_tle: O let me not be confounded, neither let mine enemies triumph over me.

verses.first_half: For all those who hope in you shall not be ashamed,
verses.second_half: but those who deal untruly shall be put to confusion.
verses.first_half_tle: For all they that hope in thee shall not be ashamed;
verses.second_half_tle: but such as transgress without a cause shall be put to confusion.

verses.first_half: Show me your ways, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and teach me your paths.
verses.first_half_tle: Show me thy ways, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and teach me thy paths.

verses.first_half: Lead me forth in your truth and teach me,
verses.second_half: for you are the God of my salvation; in you has been my hope all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: Lead me forth in thy truth, and learn me:
verses.second_half_tle: for thou art the God of my salvation; in thee hath been my hope all the day long.

verses.first_half: Call to remembrance, O LORD, your tender mercies,
verses.second_half: and your loving-kindnesses, which have been from of old.
verses.first_half_tle: Call to remembrance, O LORD, thy tender mercies,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy loving-kindnesses, which have been ever of old.

verses.first_half: O remember not the sins and offenses of my youth,
verses.second_half: but according to your mercy think on me, O LORD, in your goodness.
verses.first_half_tle: O remember not the sins and offenses of my youth;
verses.second_half_tle: but according to thy mercy think thou upon me, O LORD, for thy goodness.

verses.first_half: Gracious and righteous is the LORD;
verses.second_half: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
verses.first_half_tle: Gracious and righteous is the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

verses.first_half: Those who are meek shall he guide in judgment,
verses.second_half: and those who are gentle shall he teach his way.
verses.first_half_tle: Them that are meek shall he guide in judgment;
verses.second_half_tle: and such as are gentle, them shall he learn his way.

verses.first_half: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth
verses.second_half: to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth,
verses.second_half_tle: unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

verses.first_half: For your Name’s sake, O LORD,
verses.second_half: forgive my sin, for it is great.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy Name’s sake, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: be merciful unto my sin; for it is great.

verses.first_half: Who is the one who fears the LORD?
verses.second_half: He shall teach him in the way that he shall choose.
verses.first_half_tle: What man is he that feareth the LORD?
verses.second_half_tle: Him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

verses.first_half: He shall dwell at ease,
verses.second_half: and his seed shall inherit the land.
verses.first_half_tle: His soul shall dwell at ease,
verses.second_half_tle: and his seed shall inherit the land.

verses.first_half: The LORD reveals his secret counsel to those who fear him,
verses.second_half: and he will show them his covenant.
verses.first_half_tle: The secret of the LORD is among them that fear him;
verses.second_half_tle: and he will show them his covenant.

verses.first_half: My eyes are ever looking to the LORD,
verses.second_half: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes are ever looking unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verses.first_half: Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
verses.second_half: for I am desolate and in misery.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me;
verses.second_half_tle: for I am desolate, and in misery.

verses.first_half: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged;
verses.second_half: O bring me out of my troubles.
verses.first_half_tle: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged:
verses.second_half_tle: O bring thou me out of my troubles.

verses.first_half: Look upon my adversity and misery
verses.second_half: and forgive me all my sin.
verses.first_half_tle: Look upon my adversity and misery,
verses.second_half_tle: and forgive me all my sin.

verses.first_half: Consider my enemies, how many they are,
verses.second_half: and how they bear a tyrannous hate against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Consider mine enemies, how many they are;
verses.second_half_tle: and they bear a tyrannous hate against me.

verses.first_half: O keep my soul and deliver me;
verses.second_half: let me not be ashamed, for I have put my trust in you.
verses.first_half_tle: O keep my soul and deliver me:
verses.second_half_tle: let me not be confounded, for I have put my trust in thee.

verses.first_half: Let integrity and righteous dealing preserve me,
verses.second_half: for my hope has been in you.
verses.first_half_tle: Let perfectness and righteous dealing wait upon me;
verses.second_half_tle: for my hope hath been in thee.

verses.first_half: Deliver Israel, O God,
verses.second_half: out of all his troubles.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver Israel, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: out of all his troubles.

verses.first_half: Be my judge, O LORD, for I have walked innocently;
verses.second_half: my trust has been in the LORD; therefore I shall not fall.
verses.first_half_tle: Be thou my Judge, O LORD, for I have walked innocently:
verses.second_half_tle: my trust hath been also in the LORD, therefore shall I not fall.

verses.first_half: Test me, O LORD, and prove me;
verses.second_half: examine my heart and my mind.
verses.first_half_tle: Examine me, O LORD, and prove me;
verses.second_half_tle: try out my reins and my heart.

verses.first_half: For your loving-kindness is ever before my eyes,
verses.second_half: and I will walk in your truth.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy loving-kindness is ever before mine eyes;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will walk in thy truth.

verses.first_half: I have not dwelt with evildoers,
verses.second_half: neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.
verses.first_half_tle: I have not dwelt with vain persons;
verses.second_half_tle: neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.

verses.first_half: I have hated the company of the wicked,
verses.second_half: and will not sit among the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: I have hated the congregation of the wicked;
verses.second_half_tle: and will not sit among the ungodly.

verses.first_half: I will wash my hands in innocence, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and so will I go to your altar,
verses.first_half_tle: I will wash my hands in innocency, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and so will I go to thine altar;

verses.first_half: That I may lift up the voice of thanksgiving
verses.second_half: and tell of all your wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: That I may show the voice of thanksgiving,
verses.second_half_tle: and tell of all thy wondrous works.

verses.first_half: LORD, I have loved the habitation of your house
verses.second_half: and the place where your honor dwells.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, I have loved the habitation of thy house,
verses.second_half_tle: and the place where thine honor dwelleth.

verses.first_half: O take not away my soul with the sinners,
verses.second_half: nor my life with the bloodthirsty,
verses.first_half_tle: O shut not up my soul with the sinners,
verses.second_half_tle: nor my life with the blood-thirsty,

verses.first_half: Whose hands are full of wickedness,
verses.second_half: and their right hand full of bribes.
verses.first_half_tle: In whose hands is wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and their right hand is full of gifts.

verses.first_half: But as for me, I will walk innocently;
verses.second_half: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for me, I will walk innocently:
verses.second_half_tle: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.

verses.first_half: My foot stands firm;
verses.second_half: I will praise the LORD in the congregations.
verses.first_half_tle: My foot standeth right:
verses.second_half_tle: I will praise the LORD in the congregations.

verses.first_half: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom then shall I fear?
verses.second_half: The LORD is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom then shall I fear?
verses.second_half_tle: The LORD is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?

verses.first_half: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh,
verses.second_half: they stumbled and fell.
verses.first_half_tle: When the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh,
verses.second_half_tle: they stumbled and fell.

verses.first_half: Though a host were encamped against me, yet my heart would not be afraid,
verses.second_half: and though war rose up against me, yet would I put my trust in him.
verses.first_half_tle: Though an host of men were laid against me, yet shall not my heart be afraid;
verses.second_half_tle: and though there rose up war against me, yet will I put my trust in him.

verses.first_half: One thing have I desired of the LORD; one thing I seek:
verses.second_half: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life,
verses.first_half_tle: One thing have I desired of the LORD, which I will require;
verses.second_half_tle: even that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to behold the fair beauty of the LORD, and to visit his temple.

verses.first_half: To behold the fair beauty of the LORD,
verses.second_half: and to seek him in his temple.
verses.first_half_tle: For in the time of trouble shall he hide me in his tabernacle;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, in the secret place of his dwelling he shall hide me, and set me up upon a rock of stone.

verses.first_half: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle;
verses.second_half: indeed, in the secret place of his dwelling he shall hide me, and set me high upon a rock of stone.
verses.first_half_tle: And now shall he lift up mine head
verses.second_half_tle: above mine enemies round about me.

verses.first_half: And now he shall lift up my head
verses.second_half: above my enemies round about me.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore will I offer in his dwelling an oblation, with great gladness:
verses.second_half_tle: I will sing and speak praises unto the LORD.

verses.first_half: Therefore I will offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness;
verses.second_half: I will sing and speak praises unto the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Hearken unto my voice, O LORD, when I cry unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: have mercy upon me, and hear me.

verses.first_half: Hearken to my voice, O LORD, when I cry unto you;
verses.second_half: have mercy upon me and hear me.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart hath talked of thee, Seek ye my face:
verses.second_half_tle: Thy face, LORD, will I seek.

verses.first_half: You speak to my heart and say, “Seek my face.”
verses.second_half: Your face, O LORD, will I seek.
verses.first_half_tle: O hide not thou thy face from me,
verses.second_half_tle: nor cast thy servant away in displeasure.

verses.first_half: O hide not your face from me,
verses.second_half: nor cast your servant away in displeasure.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast been my succor;
verses.second_half_tle: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.first_half: You have been my helper;
verses.second_half: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: When my father and my mother forsake me,
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD taketh me up.

verses.first_half: When my father and my mother forsake me,
verses.second_half: the LORD takes me in.
verses.first_half_tle: Teach me thy way, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and lead me in the right way, because of mine enemies.

verses.first_half: Teach me your way, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and lead me in the right way, because of my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver me not over into the will of mine adversaries:
verses.second_half_tle: for there are false witnesses risen up against me, and such as speak wrong.

verses.first_half: Deliver me not over to the will of my adversaries,
verses.second_half: for there are false witnesses who have risen up against me, and those who speak wrong.
verses.first_half_tle: I should utterly have fainted,
verses.second_half_tle: but that I believe verily to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

verses.first_half: I would utterly have fainted,
verses.second_half: had I not believed that I would see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
verses.first_half_tle: O tarry thou the LORD’s leisure; be strong, and he shall comfort thine heart;
verses.second_half_tle: and put thou thy trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: O wait for the LORD; be strong, and he shall comfort your heart.
verses.second_half: O put your trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: Unto you will I cry, O LORD my rock; do not be deaf to my prayer;
verses.second_half: lest, if you do not answer, I become like those who go down into the pit.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee will I cry, O LORD my strength:
verses.second_half_tle: think no scorn of me; lest, if thou make as though thou hearest not, I become like them that go down into the pit.

verses.first_half: Hear the voice of my humble petitions when I cry unto you,
verses.second_half: when I hold up my hands toward the sanctuary of your holy temple.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear the voice of my humble petitions, when I cry unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: when I hold up my hands towards the mercy-seat of thy holy temple.

verses.first_half: O cast me not away, neither destroy me with the ungodly and evildoers,
verses.second_half: who speak as friends to their neighbors, but imagine evil in their hearts.
verses.first_half_tle: O pluck me not away, neither destroy me with the ungodly and wicked doers,
verses.second_half_tle: which speak friendly to their neighbors, but imagine mischief in their hearts.

verses.first_half: Reward them according to their deeds
verses.second_half: and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.
verses.first_half_tle: Reward them according to their deeds,
verses.second_half_tle: and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.

verses.first_half: Recompense them according to the work of their hands;
verses.second_half: pay them what they have deserved.
verses.first_half_tle: Recompense them after the work of their hands;
verses.second_half_tle: pay them that they have deserved.

verses.first_half: For they regard not in their mind the works of the LORD, nor the operation of his hands;
verses.second_half: therefore he shall break them down and not build them up.
verses.first_half_tle: For they regard not in their mind the works of the LORD, nor the operation of his hands;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore shall he break them down, and not build them up.

verses.first_half: Praised be the LORD,
verses.second_half: for he has heard the voice of my humble petitions.
verses.first_half_tle: Praised be the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for he hath heard the voice of my humble petitions.

verses.first_half: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart has trusted in him, and I am helped;
verses.second_half: therefore my heart dances for joy, and in my song will I praise him.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is my strength, and my shield; my heart hath trusted in him, and I am helped;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore my heart danceth for joy, and in my song will I praise him.

verses.first_half: The LORD is my strength,
verses.second_half: and he is the sure defense of his Anointed.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is my strength,
verses.second_half_tle: and he is the wholesome defense of his anointed.

verses.first_half: O save your people, and give your blessing to your inheritance;
verses.second_half: feed them, and lift them up for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O save thy people, and give thy blessing unto thine inheritance:
verses.second_half_tle: feed them, and set them up for ever.

verses.first_half: Ascribe unto the LORD, O you mighty,
verses.second_half: ascribe unto the LORD worship and strength.
verses.first_half_tle: Ascribe unto the LORD, O ye mighty,
verses.second_half_tle: ascribe unto the LORD worship and strength.

verses.first_half: Give the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.second_half: worship the LORD with holy worship.
verses.first_half_tle: Ascribe unto the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.second_half_tle: worship the LORD with holy worship.

verses.first_half: It is the LORD that commands the waters;
verses.second_half: it is the glorious God that makes the thunder.
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of the LORD is upon the waters;
verses.second_half_tle: it is the glorious God that maketh the thunder.

verses.first_half: It is the LORD that rules the sea; the voice of the LORD is mighty in its working;
verses.second_half: the voice of the LORD is a glorious voice.
verses.first_half_tle: It is the LORD that ruleth the sea; the voice of the LORD is mighty in operation;
verses.second_half_tle: the voice of the LORD is a glorious voice.

verses.first_half: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedar trees;
verses.second_half: indeed, the LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of the LORD breaketh the cedar-trees;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the LORD breaketh the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.first_half: He makes them also to skip like a calf,
verses.second_half: Lebanon also, and Sirion, like a young ox.
verses.first_half_tle: He maketh them also to skip like a calf;
verses.second_half_tle: Lebanon also, and Sirion, like a young unicorn.

verses.first_half: The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire; the voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness;
verses.second_half: indeed, the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of the LORD divideth the flames of fire; the voice of the LORD shaketh the wilderness;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the LORD shaketh the wilderness of Kadesh.

verses.first_half: The voice of the LORD makes the deer to bring forth young, and strips the forests bare;
verses.second_half: in his temple all cry, “Glory.”
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of the LORD maketh the hinds to bring forth young, and strippeth bare the forests:
verses.second_half_tle: in his temple doth everything speak of his honor.

verses.first_half: The LORD sits above the floodwaters,
verses.second_half: and the LORD remains King for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD sitteth above the water-flood,
verses.second_half_tle: and the LORD remaineth a King for ever.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall give strength to his people;
verses.second_half: the LORD shall give his people the blessing of peace.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall give strength unto his people;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD shall give his people the blessing of peace.

verses.first_half: I will magnify you, O LORD, for you have lifted me up,
verses.second_half: and have not let my foes triumph over me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will magnify thee, O LORD; for thou hast set me up,
verses.second_half_tle: and not made my foes to triumph over me.

verses.first_half: O LORD my God, I cried unto you,
verses.second_half: and you have made me whole.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD my God, I cried unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and thou hast healed me.

verses.first_half: You, LORD, have brought my soul out of the Grave;
verses.second_half: you have saved my life from among those who go down to the Pit.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, LORD, hast brought my soul out of hell:
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast kept my life, that I should not go down into the pit.

verses.first_half: Sing praises unto the LORD, O you saints of his,
verses.second_half: and give thanks unto him for the remembrance of his holiness.
verses.first_half_tle: Sing praises unto the LORD, O ye saints of his,
verses.second_half_tle: and give thanks unto him, for a remembrance of his holiness.

verses.first_half: For his wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye, his pleasure for a lifetime;
verses.second_half: heaviness may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.
verses.first_half_tle: For his wrath endureth but the twinkling of an eye, and in his pleasure is life;
verses.second_half_tle: heaviness may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

verses.first_half: In my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved;
verses.second_half: you, LORD, of your goodness, have made my hill so strong.”
verses.first_half_tle: And in my prosperity I said, I shall never be removed:
verses.second_half_tle: thou, LORD, of thy goodness, hast made my hill so strong.

verses.first_half: You turned your face from me,
verses.second_half: and I was distressed.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou didst turn thy face from me,
verses.second_half_tle: and I was troubled.

verses.first_half: Then I cried unto you, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and came to my Lord most humbly.
verses.first_half_tle: Then cried I unto thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and gat me to my LORD right humbly.

verses.first_half: What profit is there in my bloodshed,
verses.second_half: if I go down into the Pit?
verses.first_half_tle: What profit is there in my blood,
verses.second_half_tle: when I go down into the pit?

verses.first_half: Shall the dust give thanks unto you?
verses.second_half: Or shall it declare your faithfulness?
verses.first_half_tle: Shall the dust give thanks unto thee?
verses.second_half_tle: Or shall it declare thy truth?

verses.first_half: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me.
verses.second_half: O LORD, be my helper.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me;
verses.second_half_tle: LORD, be thou my helper.

verses.first_half: You have turned my lamentation into dancing;
verses.second_half: you have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast turned my heaviness into joy;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast put off my sackcloth, and girded me with gladness:

verses.first_half: Therefore shall my heart sing of your praise without ceasing.
verses.second_half: O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto you for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore shall every good man sing of thy praise without ceasing.
verses.second_half_tle: O my God, I will give thanks unto thee for ever.

verses.first_half: In you, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.second_half: let me never be put to confusion; deliver me in your righteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: In thee, O LORD, have I put my trust; let me never be put to confusion;
verses.second_half_tle: deliver me in thy righteousness.

verses.first_half: Bow down your ear to me,
verses.second_half: make haste to deliver me,
verses.first_half_tle: Bow down thine ear to me;
verses.second_half_tle: make haste to deliver me.

verses.first_half: And be my strong rock and house of defense,
verses.second_half: that you may save me.
verses.first_half_tle: And be thou my strong rock, and house of defense,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou mayest save me.

verses.first_half: For you are my strong rock and my castle;
verses.second_half: be also my guide, and lead me for your Name’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou art my strong rock and my castle:
verses.second_half_tle: be thou also my guide, and lead me for thy Name’s sake.

verses.first_half: Draw me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me,
verses.second_half: for you are my strength.
verses.first_half_tle: Draw me out of the net that they have laid privily for me;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou art my strength.

verses.first_half: Into your hands I commend my spirit,
verses.second_half: for you have redeemed me, O LORD, O God of truth.
verses.first_half_tle: Into thy hands I commend my spirit;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast redeemed me, O LORD, thou God of truth.

verses.first_half: I have hated those who hold to worthless vanities,
verses.second_half: and my trust has been in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I have hated them that hold of lying vanities,
verses.second_half_tle: and my trust hath been in the LORD.

verses.first_half: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy,
verses.second_half: for you have considered my trouble, and have known my soul in adversities.
verses.first_half_tle: I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast considered my trouble, and hast known my soul in adversities.

verses.first_half: You have not shut me up in the hand of the enemy,
verses.second_half: but have set my feet where they may walk at liberty.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy;
verses.second_half_tle: but hast set my feet in a large room.

verses.first_half: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble;
verses.second_half: my eye is consumed with heaviness, and also my soul and my body.
verses.first_half_tle: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: and mine eye is consumed for very heaviness; yea, my soul and my body.

verses.first_half: For my life has grown old with heaviness,
verses.second_half: and my years with mourning.
verses.first_half_tle: For my life is waxen old with heaviness,
verses.second_half_tle: and my years with mourning.

verses.first_half: My strength fails me because of my iniquity,
verses.second_half: and my bones are consumed.
verses.first_half_tle: My strength faileth me, because of mine iniquity,
verses.second_half_tle: and my bones are consumed.

verses.first_half: I have become a reproof among all my enemies, but especially among my neighbors;
verses.second_half: my acquaintances are afraid of me, and those who see me in the street shrink from me.
verses.first_half_tle: I became a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbors;
verses.second_half_tle: and they of mine acquaintance were afraid of me; and they that did see me without, conveyed themselves from me.

verses.first_half: I am utterly forgotten, as a dead man, out of mind;
verses.second_half: I have become like a broken vessel.
verses.first_half_tle: I am clean forgotten as a dead man out of mind;
verses.second_half_tle: I am become like a broken vessel.

verses.first_half: For I have heard the whispering of the multitude, and fear is on every side,
verses.second_half: while they conspire together against me and take their counsel to take away my life.
verses.first_half_tle: For I have heard the blasphemy of the multitude, and fear is on every side;
verses.second_half_tle: while they conspire together against me, and take their counsel to take away my life.

verses.first_half: But my hope has been in you, O LORD;
verses.second_half: I have said, “You are my God.”
verses.first_half_tle: But my hope hath been in thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: I have said, Thou art my God.

verses.first_half: My time is in your hand;
verses.second_half: deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.
verses.first_half_tle: My times are in thy hand; deliver me from the hand of mine enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and from them that persecute me.

verses.first_half: Show your servant the light of your countenance,
verses.second_half: and save me for your mercy’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: Show thy servant the light of thy countenance,
verses.second_half_tle: and save me for thy mercy’s sake.

verses.first_half: Let me not be confounded, O LORD, for I have called upon you;
verses.second_half: let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.
verses.first_half_tle: Let me not be confounded, O LORD, for I have called upon thee;
verses.second_half_tle: let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.

verses.first_half: Let the lying lips be put to silence,
verses.second_half: which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully speak against the righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the lying lips be put to silence,
verses.second_half_tle: which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully speak against the righteous.

verses.first_half: Oh, how plentiful is your goodness, which you have laid up for those who fear you,
verses.second_half: and which you have prepared for those who put their trust in you, even before the children of men!
verses.first_half_tle: O how plentiful is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and that thou hast prepared for them that put their trust in thee, even before the sons of men!

verses.first_half: You hide them in the secret place of your presence from those who conspire against them;
verses.second_half: you keep them in your refuge from the strife of tongues.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt hide them in the covert of thine own presence from the plottings of men:
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt keep them secretly in thy tabernacle from the strife of tongues.

verses.first_half: Thanks be to the LORD,
verses.second_half: for he has shown me marvellously great kindness in a strong city.
verses.first_half_tle: Thanks be to the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for he hath showed me marvellous great kindness in a strong city.

verses.first_half: But when I was afraid, I said in my haste,
verses.second_half: “I am cast out of the sight of your eyes.”
verses.first_half_tle: But in my haste I said,
verses.second_half_tle: I am cast out of the sight of thine eyes.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer
verses.second_half: when I cried unto you.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, thou heardest the voice of my prayer
verses.second_half_tle: when I cried unto thee.

verses.first_half: O love the LORD, all you his saints,
verses.second_half: for the LORD preserves those who are faithful, and plenteously repays the proud.
verses.first_half_tle: O love the LORD, all ye his saints;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD preserveth them that are faithful, and plenteously rewardeth the proud doer.

verses.first_half: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart,
verses.second_half: all you that put your trust in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart,
verses.second_half_tle: all ye that put your trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the one whose unrighteousness is forgiven,
verses.second_half: and whose sin is covered.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is he whose unrighteousness is forgiven,
verses.second_half_tle: and whose sin is covered.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the one to whom the LORD imputes no sin,
verses.second_half: and in whose spirit there is no guile.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man unto whom the LORD imputeth no sin,
verses.second_half_tle: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.first_half: For while I held my tongue, my bones wasted away;
verses.second_half: I ceased not from groaning all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: For whilst I held my tongue,
verses.second_half_tle: my bones consumed away through my daily complaining.

verses.first_half: For your hand was heavy upon me day and night,
verses.second_half: and I was dried up and withered, as in the drought of summer.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy hand was heavy upon me day and night,
verses.second_half_tle: and my moisture was like the drought in summer.

verses.first_half: Then I acknowledged my sin unto you,
verses.second_half: and I did not hide my iniquity.
verses.first_half_tle: I acknowledged my sin unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and mine unrighteousness have I not hid.

verses.first_half: I said, “I will confess my sins unto the LORD”;
verses.second_half: and so you forgave the wickedness of my sin.
verses.first_half_tle: I said, I will confess my sins unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and so thou forgavest the wickedness of my sin.

verses.first_half: For this reason shall all the godly make their prayers unto you at a time when you may be found;
verses.second_half: when the great floodwaters rise, they shall not reach them.
verses.first_half_tle: For this shall every one that is godly make his prayer unto thee, in a time when thou mayest be found;
verses.second_half_tle: surely the great water-floods shall not come nigh him.

verses.first_half: You are my hiding-place; you shall preserve me from trouble;
verses.second_half: you shall encompass me with songs of deliverance.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art a place to hide me in; thou shalt preserve me from trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt compass me about with songs of deliverance.

verses.first_half: “I will instruct you and teach you in the way that you should go,
verses.second_half: and I will guide you with my eye.
verses.first_half_tle: I will inform thee, and teach thee in the way wherein thou shalt go;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will guide thee with mine eye.

verses.first_half: Do not be like the horse and mule, which have no understanding,
verses.second_half: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, or else they will not come near you.”
verses.first_half_tle: Be ye not like to horse and mule, which have no understanding;
verses.second_half_tle: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, else they will not obey thee.

verses.first_half: Great troubles remain for the ungodly;
verses.second_half: but mercy embraces those who trust in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Great plagues remain for the ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD, mercy embraceth him on every side.

verses.first_half: Be glad, O you righteous, and rejoice in the LORD;
verses.second_half: and be joyful, all who are true of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Be glad, O ye righteous, and rejoice in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and be joyful, all ye that are true of heart.

verses.first_half: Rejoice in the LORD, O you righteous;
verses.second_half: it is fitting for the just to be thankful.
verses.first_half_tle: Rejoice in the LORD, O ye righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: for it becometh well the just to be thankful.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD with the harp;
verses.second_half: sing praises unto him with the ten-stringed lute.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD with harp;
verses.second_half_tle: sing praises unto him with the lute, and instrument of ten strings.

verses.first_half: Sing unto him a new song;
verses.second_half: make skillful melody and cry aloud with joy.
verses.first_half_tle: Sing unto the LORD a new song;
verses.second_half_tle: sing praises lustily unto him with a good courage.

verses.first_half: For the word of the LORD is true,
verses.second_half: and all his works are faithful.
verses.first_half_tle: For the word of the LORD is true;
verses.second_half_tle: and all his works are faithful.

verses.first_half: He loves righteousness and true judgment;
verses.second_half: the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: He loveth righteousness and judgment;
verses.second_half_tle: the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.

verses.first_half: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made,
verses.second_half: and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the host of them by the breath of his mouth.

verses.first_half: He gathers the waters of the sea together, as in a heap,
verses.second_half: and lays up the deep, as in a treasure house.
verses.first_half_tle: He gathereth the waters of the sea together, as it were upon an heap;
verses.second_half_tle: and layeth up the deep, as in a treasure-house.

verses.first_half: Let all the earth fear the LORD;
verses.second_half: stand in awe of him, all you that dwell in the world.
verses.first_half_tle: Let all the earth fear the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: stand in awe of him, all ye that dwell in the world.

verses.first_half: For he spoke, and it was done;
verses.second_half: he commanded and it stood fast.
verses.first_half_tle: For he spake, and it was done;
verses.second_half_tle: he commanded, and it stood fast.

verses.first_half: The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to naught;
verses.second_half: he makes the devices of the peoples to be of no effect, and casts out the counsels of princes.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD bringeth the counsel of the heathen to naught,
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh the devices of the people to be of none effect, and casteth out the counsels of princes.

verses.first_half: The counsel of the LORD shall endure for ever,
verses.second_half: and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.
verses.first_half_tle: The counsel of the LORD shall endure for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD,
verses.second_half: and blessed are the people he has chosen for himself to be his inheritance.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are the people whose God is the Lord Jehovah;
verses.second_half_tle: and blessed are the folk that he hath chosen to him, to be his inheritance.

verses.first_half: The LORD looks down from heaven and beholds all the children of men;
verses.second_half: from the habitation of his dwelling he considers all those who dwell on the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD looketh down from heaven and beholdeth all the children of men;
verses.second_half_tle: from the habitation of his dwelling, he considereth all them that dwell on the earth.

verses.first_half: He fashions all the hearts of them
verses.second_half: and understands all their works.
verses.first_half_tle: He fashioneth all the hearts of them,
verses.second_half_tle: and understandeth all their works.

verses.first_half: There is no king who can be saved by a mighty host;
verses.second_half: neither is any mighty man delivered by great strength.
verses.first_half_tle: There is no king that can be saved by the multitude of an host;
verses.second_half_tle: neither is any mighty man delivered by much strength.

verses.first_half: A horse is considered a vain hope to save a man;
verses.second_half: neither shall it deliver anyone by its great strength.
verses.first_half_tle: A horse is counted but a vain thing to save a man;
verses.second_half_tle: neither shall he deliver any man by his great strength.

verses.first_half: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon those who fear him,
verses.second_half: and upon those who put their trust in his mercy,
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon them that fear him,
verses.second_half_tle: and upon them that put their trust in his mercy;

verses.first_half: To deliver their soul from death,
verses.second_half: and to feed them in the time of famine.
verses.first_half_tle: To deliver their soul from death,
verses.second_half_tle: and to feed them in the time of dearth.

verses.first_half: Our soul has patiently waited for the LORD,
verses.second_half: for he is our help and our shield.
verses.first_half_tle: Our soul hath patiently tarried for the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for he is our help and our shield.

verses.first_half: Our heart shall rejoice in him,
verses.second_half: because we have hoped in his holy Name.
verses.first_half_tle: For our heart shall rejoice in him;
verses.second_half_tle: because we have hoped in his holy Name.

verses.first_half: Let your merciful kindness, O LORD, be upon us,
verses.second_half: as we have put our trust in you.
verses.first_half_tle: Let thy merciful kindness, O LORD, be upon us,
verses.second_half_tle: like as we do put our trust in thee.

verses.first_half: I will always give thanks unto the LORD;
verses.second_half: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: I will alway give thanks unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

verses.first_half: My soul shall make its boast in the LORD;
verses.second_half: the humble shall hear this and be glad.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul shall make her boast in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: the humble shall hear thereof, and be glad.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD with me,
verses.second_half: and let us magnify his Name together.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD with me,
verses.second_half_tle: and let us magnify his Name together.

verses.first_half: I sought the LORD, and he heard me;
verses.second_half: he delivered me out of all my fears.
verses.first_half_tle: I sought the LORD, and he heard me;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, he delivered me out of all my fear.

verses.first_half: They looked unto him, and were made glad,
verses.second_half: and their faces were not ashamed.
verses.first_half_tle: They had an eye unto him, and were lightened;
verses.second_half_tle: and their faces were not ashamed.

verses.first_half: Look, the poor man cries, and the LORD hears him,
verses.second_half: and saves him out of all his troubles.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, the poor crieth, and the LORD heareth him;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and saveth him out of all his troubles.

verses.first_half: The angel of the LORD camps round about those who fear him,
verses.second_half: and delivers them in time of need.
verses.first_half_tle: The angel of the LORD tarrieth round about them that fear him,
verses.second_half_tle: and delivereth them.

verses.first_half: O taste and see how gracious the LORD is;
verses.second_half: blessed is the one who trusts in him.
verses.first_half_tle: O taste, and see, how gracious the LORD is:
verses.second_half_tle: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.

verses.first_half: O fear the LORD, you that are his saints;
verses.second_half: for those who fear him lack nothing.
verses.first_half_tle: O fear the LORD, ye that are his saints;
verses.second_half_tle: for they that fear him lack nothing.

verses.first_half: The lions lack and suffer hunger,
verses.second_half: but those who seek the LORD shall lack nothing that is good.
verses.first_half_tle: The lions do lack and suffer hunger,
verses.second_half_tle: but they who seek the LORD shall want no manner of thing that is good.

verses.first_half: Come, children, and listen to me;
verses.second_half: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Come, ye children, and hearken unto me;
verses.second_half_tle: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Who among you desires to live,
verses.second_half: and longs to see good days?
verses.first_half_tle: What man is he that lusteth to live,
verses.second_half_tle: and would fain see good days?

verses.first_half: Keep your tongue from evil,
verses.second_half: and your lips from speaking lies.
verses.first_half_tle: Keep thy tongue from evil,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy lips, that they speak no guile.

verses.first_half: Turn from evil and do good;
verses.second_half: seek peace and pursue it.
verses.first_half_tle: Eschew evil and do good;
verses.second_half_tle: seek peace, and ensue it.

verses.first_half: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous,
verses.second_half: and his ears are open to their prayers.
verses.first_half_tle: The eyes of the LORD are over the righteous,
verses.second_half_tle: and his ears are open unto their prayers.

verses.first_half: The countenance of the LORD is against those who do evil,
verses.second_half: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: The countenance of the LORD is against them that do evil,
verses.second_half_tle: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.first_half: The righteous cry, and the LORD hears them
verses.second_half: and delivers them out of all their troubles.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous cry, and the LORD heareth them,
verses.second_half_tle: and delivereth them out of all their troubles.

verses.first_half: The LORD is near to those who are brokenhearted
verses.second_half: and will save those who are crushed in spirit.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart,
verses.second_half_tle: and will save such as be of an humble spirit.

verses.first_half: Great are the troubles of the righteous,
verses.second_half: but the LORD delivers him out of them all.
verses.first_half_tle: Great are the troubles of the righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: but the LORD delivereth him out of all.

verses.first_half: He keeps all his bones,
verses.second_half: so that not one of them is broken.
verses.first_half_tle: He keepeth all his bones,
verses.second_half_tle: so that not one of them is broken.

verses.first_half: But evil shall slay the ungodly,
verses.second_half: and those who hate the righteous shall be desolate.
verses.first_half_tle: But misfortune shall slay the ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that hate the righteous shall be desolate.

verses.first_half: The LORD delivers the souls of his servants,
verses.second_half: and all those who put their trust in him shall not be destitute.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD delivereth the souls of his servants;
verses.second_half_tle: and all they that put their trust in him shall not be destitute.

verses.first_half: Contend, O LORD, with those who contend with me,
verses.second_half: and fight against those who fight against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Plead thou my cause, O LORD, with them that strive with me,
verses.second_half_tle: and fight thou against them that fight against me.

verses.first_half: Take up the shield and buckler,
verses.second_half: and stand up to help me.
verses.first_half_tle: Lay hand upon the shield and buckler,
verses.second_half_tle: and stand up to help me.

verses.first_half: Bring forth the spear and bar the way against those who pursue me;
verses.second_half: say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
verses.first_half_tle: Bring forth the spear, and stop the way against them that pursue me;
verses.second_half_tle: say unto my soul, I am thy salvation.

verses.first_half: Let them be confounded and put to shame who seek after my life;
verses.second_half: let them be turned back and brought to confusion who imagine evil against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be confounded, and put to shame, that seek after my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be turned back, and brought to confusion, that imagine mischief for me.

verses.first_half: Let them be as the chaff before the wind,
verses.second_half: and let the angel of the LORD scatter them.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be as dust before the wind,
verses.second_half_tle: and the angel of the LORD scattering them.

verses.first_half: Let their way be dark and slippery,
verses.second_half: and let the angel of the LORD pursue them.
verses.first_half_tle: Let their way be dark and slippery,
verses.second_half_tle: and let the angel of the LORD pursue them.

verses.first_half: For they have secretly laid their net to destroy me without a cause;
verses.second_half: indeed, without a cause have they made a pit to take away my life.
verses.first_half_tle: For they have privily laid their net to destroy me without a cause;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, even without a cause have they made a pit for my soul.

verses.first_half: Let sudden destruction come upon them unawares, and the net, which they have laid secretly, catch themselves,
verses.second_half: that they may fall into their own trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: Let a sudden destruction come upon him unawares, and his net that he hath laid privily catch himself;
verses.second_half_tle: that he may fall into his own mischief.

verses.first_half: Then shall my soul be joyful in the LORD;
verses.second_half: I shall rejoice in his salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.first_half: All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like you? You deliver the poor from those who are too strong for them;
verses.second_half: indeed, the poor and those who are in misery from those who rob them.”
verses.first_half_tle: All my bones shall say, LORD, who is like unto thee, who deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the poor, and him that is in misery, from him that spoileth him?

verses.first_half: Malicious witnesses rise up;
verses.second_half: they charge me with matters I know nothing about.
verses.first_half_tle: False witnesses did rise up:
verses.second_half_tle: they laid to my charge things that I knew not.

verses.first_half: They repay me evil for good,
verses.second_half: to the great sorrow of my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: They rewarded me evil for good,
verses.second_half_tle: to the great discomfort of my soul.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth and humbled myself with fasting;
verses.second_half: I prayed with my whole heart, as if it had been my friend or my brother.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth, and humbled my soul with fasting;
verses.second_half_tle: and my prayer shall turn into mine own bosom.

verses.first_half: I behaved myself as one who mourns for his mother;
verses.second_half: I was bowed down with heaviness of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: I behaved myself as though it had been my friend or my brother;
verses.second_half_tle: I went heavily, as one that mourneth for his mother.

verses.first_half: But in my adversity, they rejoiced and gathered themselves together;
verses.second_half: indeed, those who struck me came together against me, and I had no rest; they tore at me, and would not cease.
verses.first_half_tle: But in mine adversity they rejoiced, and gathered themselves together;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the very abjects came together against me unawares, making mouths at me, and ceased not.

verses.first_half: When I stumbled they mocked me exceedingly,
verses.second_half: and gnashed at me with their teeth.
verses.first_half_tle: With the flatterers were busy mockers,
verses.second_half_tle: who gnashed upon me with their teeth.

verses.first_half: Lord, how long will you look on this?
verses.second_half: O deliver me from the calamities they bring upon me, and my life from the lions.
verses.first_half_tle: Lord, how long wilt thou look upon this?
verses.second_half_tle: O deliver my soul from the calamities which they bring on me, and my darling from the lions.

verses.first_half: So will I give you thanks in the great congregation;
verses.second_half: I will praise you among many people.
verses.first_half_tle: So will I give thee thanks in the great congregation;
verses.second_half_tle: I will praise thee among much people.

verses.first_half: O let not those who are my enemies triumph over me deceitfully;
verses.second_half: neither let them wink with their eyes, those who hate me without a cause.
verses.first_half_tle: O let not them that are mine enemies triumph over me ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: neither let them wink with their eyes, that hate me without a cause.

verses.first_half: For their talking is not for peace,
verses.second_half: but they imagine deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? Their communing is not for peace
verses.second_half_tle: but they imagine deceitful words against them that are quiet in the land.

verses.first_half: They open their mouths at me, and say,
verses.second_half: “Aha! Aha! We saw it with our own eyes!”
verses.first_half_tle: They gaped upon me with their mouths, and said,
verses.second_half_tle: Fie on thee! Fie on thee! We saw it with our eyes.

verses.first_half: This you have seen, O LORD.
verses.second_half: Hold not your tongue then; be not far from me, O Lord.
verses.first_half_tle: This thou hast seen, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: hold not thy tongue then; go not far from me, O Lord.

verses.first_half: Awake, and stand up to judge my case;
verses.second_half: avenge my cause, my God and my Lord.
verses.first_half_tle: Awake, and stand up to judge my quarrel;
verses.second_half_tle: avenge thou my cause, my God and my Lord.

verses.first_half: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to your righteousness,
verses.second_half: and let them not triumph over me.
verses.first_half_tle: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to thy righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: and let them not triumph over me.

verses.first_half: Let them not say in their hearts, “Aha! We have what we want!”
verses.second_half: Neither let them say, “We have devoured him.”
verses.first_half_tle: Let them not say in their hearts, There! There! So would we have it;
verses.second_half_tle: neither let them say, We have devoured him.

verses.first_half: Let them be put to confusion and shame who rejoice at my trouble;
verses.second_half: let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who boast against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be put to confusion and shame together, that rejoice at my trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be clothed with rebuke and dishonor, that boast themselves against me.

verses.first_half: Let them be glad and rejoice who favor my righteous cause;
verses.second_half: indeed, let them say always, “Great is the LORD, who takes pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.”
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be glad and rejoice, that favor my righteous dealing;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, let them say alway, Blessed be the LORD, who hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.

verses.first_half: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of your righteousness
verses.second_half: and of your praise all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of thy righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: and of thy praise, all the day long.

verses.first_half: My heart shows me the wickedness of the ungodly;
verses.second_half: there is no fear of God before his eyes.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart showeth me the wickedness of the ungodly,
verses.second_half_tle: that there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.first_half: For he flatters himself in his own sight,
verses.second_half: until his abominable sin is found out.
verses.first_half_tle: For he flattereth himself in his own sight,
verses.second_half_tle: until his abominable sin be found out.

verses.first_half: The words of his mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit;
verses.second_half: he has left off behaving wisely and doing good.
verses.first_half_tle: The words of his mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit:
verses.second_half_tle: he hath left off to behave himself wisely, and to do good.

verses.first_half: He imagines mischief upon his bed, and has set himself in no good way;
verses.second_half: neither does he abhor anything that is evil.
verses.first_half_tle: He imagineth mischief upon his bed, and hath set himself in no good way;
verses.second_half_tle: neither doth he abhor any thing that is evil.

verses.first_half: Your mercy, O LORD, reaches to the heavens,
verses.second_half: and your faithfulness to the clouds.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy mercy, O LORD, reacheth unto the heavens,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy faithfulness unto the clouds.

verses.first_half: Your righteousness stands like the strong mountains; your judgments are like the great deep;
verses.second_half: you, LORD, shall save both man and beast.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy righteousness standeth like the strong mountains:
verses.second_half_tle: thy judgments are like the great deep.

verses.first_half: How excellent is your mercy, O God!
verses.second_half: The children of men shall take refuge under the shadow of your wings.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, LORD, shalt save both man and beast: How excellent is thy mercy, O God!
verses.second_half_tle: and the children of men shall put their trust under the shadow of thy wings.

verses.first_half: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of your house,
verses.second_half: and you shall give them drink from your pleasures as out of a river.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of thy house;
verses.second_half_tle: and thou shalt give them drink of thy pleasures, as out of the river.

verses.first_half: For with you is the well of life,
verses.second_half: and in your light shall we see light.
verses.first_half_tle: For with thee is the well of life;
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy light shall we see light.

verses.first_half: O continue your loving-kindness to those who know you,
verses.second_half: and your righteousness to those who are true of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: O continue forth thy loving-kindness unto them that know thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy righteousness unto them that are true of heart.

verses.first_half: O let not the foot of the proud come against me,
verses.second_half: and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.
verses.first_half_tle: O let not the foot of pride come against me;
verses.second_half_tle: and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.

verses.first_half: There have they fallen, all those who work wickedness;
verses.second_half: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.
verses.first_half_tle: There are they fallen, all that work wickedness;
verses.second_half_tle: they are cast down, and shall not be able to stand.

verses.first_half: Fret not yourself because of the ungodly,
verses.second_half: neither be envious of those who are evildoers.
verses.first_half_tle: Fret not thyself because of the ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: neither be thou envious against the evil doers.

verses.first_half: For they shall soon be dried up like the grass,
verses.second_half: and be withered even as the green herb.
verses.first_half_tle: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,
verses.second_half_tle: and be withered even as the green herb.

verses.first_half: Put your trust in the LORD, and do good;
verses.second_half: dwell in the land, and surely you shall be fed.
verses.first_half_tle: Put thou thy trust in the LORD, and be doing good;
verses.second_half_tle: dwell in the land, and verily thou shalt be fed.

verses.first_half: Delight yourself in the LORD,
verses.second_half: and he shall give you your heart’s desire.
verses.first_half_tle: Delight thou in the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and he shall give thee thy heart’s desire.

verses.first_half: Commit your way unto the LORD and put your trust in him,
verses.second_half: and he shall bring it to pass.
verses.first_half_tle: Commit thy way unto the LORD and put thy trust in him,
verses.second_half_tle: and he shall bring it to pass.

verses.first_half: He shall make your righteousness as clear as the light
verses.second_half: and your just dealing as the noonday.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall make thy righteousness as clear as the light,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy just dealing as the noon-day.

verses.first_half: Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him;
verses.second_half: do not grieve yourself over the one whose way prospers, over the one who carries out evil counsels.
verses.first_half_tle: Hold thee still in the LORD, and abide patiently upon him:
verses.second_half_tle: but, not and thyself at him whose way doth prosper, against the man that doeth after evil counsels.

verses.first_half: Refrain from wrath, and let go of anger;
verses.second_half: fret not yourself, lest you be moved to do evil.
verses.first_half_tle: Leave off from wrath, and let go displeasure:
verses.second_half_tle: fret not thyself, else shalt thou be moved to do evil.

verses.first_half: For evildoers shall be rooted out,
verses.second_half: but those who wait patiently for the LORD, they shall inherit the land.
verses.first_half_tle: Wicked doers shall be rooted out;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that patiently abide the LORD, those shall inherit the land.

verses.first_half: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone;
verses.second_half: you shall look for their place, and they shall not be there.
verses.first_half_tle: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone:
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt look after his place, and he shall be away.

verses.first_half: But the meek-spirited shall possess the land
verses.second_half: and shall be refreshed with an abundance of peace.
verses.first_half_tle: But the meek-spirited shall possess the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall be refreshed in the multitude of peace.

verses.first_half: The ungodly plot against the just
verses.second_half: and gnash at them with their teeth.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly seeketh counsel against the just,
verses.second_half_tle: and gnasheth upon him with his teeth.

verses.first_half: The Lord shall laugh at them in scorn,
verses.second_half: for he sees that their day is coming.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord shall laugh him to scorn;
verses.second_half_tle: for he hath seen that his day is coming.

verses.first_half: The ungodly have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow
verses.second_half: to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay those who walk aright.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,
verses.second_half_tle: to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be upright in their ways.

verses.first_half: Their sword shall go through their own heart,
verses.second_half: and their bow shall be broken.
verses.first_half_tle: Their sword shall go through their own heart,
verses.second_half_tle: and their bow shall be broken.

verses.first_half: The little that the righteous has
verses.second_half: is better than great riches of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: A small thing that the righteous hath,
verses.second_half_tle: is better than great riches of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken,
verses.second_half: but the LORD upholds the righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken,
verses.second_half_tle: and the LORD upholdeth the righteous.

verses.first_half: The LORD knows the days of the godly,
verses.second_half: and their inheritance shall endure for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD knoweth the days of the godly;
verses.second_half_tle: and their inheritance shall endure for ever.

verses.first_half: They shall not be confounded in perilous times,
verses.second_half: and in the days of famine they shall have enough.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall not be confounded in the perilous time;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the days of dearth they shall have enough.

verses.first_half: As for the ungodly, they shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed as in a fiery furnace;
verses.second_half: even as smoke shall they vanish away.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the ungodly, they shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall consume as the fat of lambs:
verses.second_half_tle: yea, even as the smoke shall they consume away.

verses.first_half: The ungodly borrow and do not repay,
verses.second_half: but the righteous are merciful and generous.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly borroweth, and payeth not again;
verses.second_half_tle: but the righteous is merciful and liberal.

verses.first_half: Those who are blessed by God shall possess the land,
verses.second_half: but those who are cursed by him shall be rooted out.
verses.first_half_tle: Such as are blessed of God, shall possess the land;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that are cursed of him, shall be rooted out.

verses.first_half: The LORD orders a man’s steps;
verses.second_half: he makes his footsteps sure and preserves him on his path.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD ordereth a good man’s going,
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh his way acceptable to himself.

verses.first_half: Though he fall, he shall not be cast down,
verses.second_half: for the LORD upholds him with his hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Though he fall, he shall not be cast away;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD upholdeth him with his hand.

verses.first_half: I have been young, and now I am old,
verses.second_half: yet I never saw the righteous forsaken, nor his children begging bread.
verses.first_half_tle: I have been young, and now am old;
verses.second_half_tle: and yet saw I never the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging their bread.

verses.first_half: The righteous is ever merciful in lending,
verses.second_half: and his seed shall be blessed.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous is ever merciful, and lendeth;
verses.second_half_tle: and his seed is blessed.

verses.first_half: Flee from evil, and do that which is good,
verses.second_half: and dwell in the land for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Flee from evil, and do the thing that is good;
verses.second_half_tle: and dwell for evermore.

verses.first_half: For the LORD loves that which is right;
verses.second_half: he forsakes not those who are godly, and they are preserved for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD loveth the thing that is right;
verses.second_half_tle: he forsaketh not his that be godly, but they are preserved for ever.

verses.first_half: The unrighteous shall be punished;
verses.second_half: as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.
verses.first_half_tle: The unrighteous shall be punished;
verses.second_half_tle: as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.

verses.first_half: The righteous shall inherit the land
verses.second_half: and dwell therein for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous shall inherit the land,
verses.second_half_tle: and dwell therein for ever.

verses.first_half: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
verses.second_half: and his tongue talks of judgment.
verses.first_half_tle: The mouth of the righteous is exercised in wisdom,
verses.second_half_tle: and his tongue will be talking of judgment.

verses.first_half: The law of his God is in his heart,
verses.second_half: and his footsteps shall not falter.
verses.first_half_tle: The law of his God is in his heart,
verses.second_half_tle: and his goings shall not slide.

verses.first_half: The ungodly lie in wait for the righteous
verses.second_half: and seek occasion to slay him.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly watcheth the righteous,
verses.second_half_tle: and seeketh occasion to slay him.

verses.first_half: The LORD will not leave him in their hand,
verses.second_half: nor allow him to be condemned when he is judged.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD will not leave him in his hand,
verses.second_half_tle: nor condemn him when he is judged.

verses.first_half: Hope in the LORD, and keep his way, and he shall exalt you so that you shall possess the land;
verses.second_half: when the ungodly perish, you shall see it.
verses.first_half_tle: Hope thou in the LORD, and keep his way, and he shall promote thee, that thou shalt possess the land:
verses.second_half_tle: when the ungodly shall perish, thou shalt see it.

verses.first_half: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power,
verses.second_half: and flourishing like a tree in full leaf.
verses.first_half_tle: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power,
verses.second_half_tle: and flourishing like a green bay-tree.

verses.first_half: I went by, and behold, they were gone;
verses.second_half: I sought them, but their place could nowhere be found.
verses.first_half_tle: I went by, and lo, he was gone:
