verses.second_half_tle: I sought him, but his place could no where be found.

verses.first_half: Mark the blameless, and take heed of the upright,
verses.second_half: for there is a future for the peaceable.
verses.first_half_tle: Keep innocency, and take heed unto the thing that is right;
verses.second_half_tle: for that shall bring a man peace at the last.

verses.first_half: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together,
verses.second_half: and the end of the ungodly is that they shall be rooted out at the last.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together;
verses.second_half_tle: and the end of the ungodly is, they shall be rooted out at the last.

verses.first_half: But the salvation of the righteous comes from the LORD,
verses.second_half: who is also their strength in the time of trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: But the salvation of the righteous cometh of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: who is also their strength in the time of trouble.

verses.first_half: And the LORD shall stand by them and save them;
verses.second_half: he shall deliver them from the ungodly and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.
verses.first_half_tle: And the LORD shall stand by them, and save them:
verses.second_half_tle: he shall deliver them from the ungodly, and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.

verses.first_half: Rebuke me not, O LORD, in your anger,
verses.second_half: neither chasten me in your weighty displeasure.
verses.first_half_tle: Put me not to rebuke, O LORD, in thine anger;
verses.second_half_tle: neither chasten me in thy heavy displeasure:

verses.first_half: For your arrows stick fast in me,
verses.second_half: and your hand presses me hard.
verses.first_half_tle: For thine arrows stick fast in me,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy hand presseth me sore.

verses.first_half: There is no health in my flesh, because of your displeasure;
verses.second_half: neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.
verses.first_half_tle: There is no health in my flesh, because of thy displeasure;
verses.second_half_tle: neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.

verses.first_half: For my iniquities have gone over my head
verses.second_half: and are like a heavy burden, too much for me to bear.
verses.first_half_tle: For my wickednesses are gone over my head,
verses.second_half_tle: and are like a sore burden, too heavy for me to bear.

verses.first_half: My wounds stink and fester,
verses.second_half: by reason of my foolishness.
verses.first_half_tle: My wounds stink, and are corrupt,
verses.second_half_tle: through my foolishness.

verses.first_half: I am brought into such great trouble and misery
verses.second_half: that I go about mourning all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: I am brought into so great trouble and misery,
verses.second_half_tle: that I go mourning all the day long.

verses.first_half: For my loins are filled with burning,
verses.second_half: and there is no wholeness in my body.
verses.first_half_tle: For my loins are filled with a sore disease,
verses.second_half_tle: and there is no whole part in my body.

verses.first_half: I am feeble and sorely smitten;
verses.second_half: I have roared because of the tumult of my heart.
verses.first_half_tle: I am feeble and sore smitten;
verses.second_half_tle: I have roared for the very disquietness of my heart.

verses.first_half: Lord, you know all my desire,
verses.second_half: and my groaning is not hidden from you.
verses.first_half_tle: Lord, thou knowest all my desire;
verses.second_half_tle: and my groaning is not hid from thee.

verses.first_half: My heart is panting, my strength has failed me,
verses.second_half: and the sight of my eyes is gone from me.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart panteth, my strength hath failed me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the light of mine eyes is gone from me.

verses.first_half: My friends and my neighbors turn away from my trouble,
verses.second_half: and my kinsmen stand afar off.
verses.first_half_tle: My lovers and my neighbors did stand looking upon my trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: and my kinsmen stood afar off.

verses.first_half: Those also who seek after my life lay snares for me,
verses.second_half: and those who go about to do me evil talk of wickedness and imagine deceit all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: They also that sought after my life laid snares for me;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that went about to do me evil talked of wickedness, and imagined deceit all the day long.

verses.first_half: As for me, I am like the deaf who do not hear,
verses.second_half: and as one who is mute, who does not open his mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I was like a deaf man, and heard not;
verses.second_half_tle: and as one that is dumb, who doth not open his mouth.

verses.first_half: I have become like a man who hears not,
verses.second_half: and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
verses.first_half_tle: I became even as a man that heareth not,
verses.second_half_tle: and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

verses.first_half: For in you, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.second_half: you shall answer for me, O Lord my God.
verses.first_half_tle: For in thee, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt answer for me, O Lord my God.

verses.first_half: I have said, “Let not my enemies triumph over me,”
verses.second_half: for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly over me.
verses.first_half_tle: I have required that they, even mine enemies, should not triumph over me;
verses.second_half_tle: for when my foot slipt, they rejoiced greatly against me.

verses.first_half: Truly, I am about to fall,
verses.second_half: and my pain is ever with me.
verses.first_half_tle: And I truly am set in the plague,
verses.second_half_tle: and my heaviness is ever in my sight.

verses.first_half: For I will confess my wickedness,
verses.second_half: and be sorry for my sin.
verses.first_half_tle: For I will confess my wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and be sorry for my sin.

verses.first_half: But my enemies live, and are mighty,
verses.second_half: and those who hate me wrongfully are many in number.
verses.first_half_tle: But mine enemies live, and are mighty;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that hate me wrongfully are many in number.

verses.first_half: Those also who repay evil for good are against me,
verses.second_half: because I follow that which is good.
verses.first_half_tle: They also that reward evil for good are against me;
verses.second_half_tle: because I follow the thing that good is.

verses.first_half: Forsake me not, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half: O be not far from me.
verses.first_half_tle: Forsake me not, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half_tle: be not thou far from me.

verses.first_half: Make haste to help me,
verses.second_half: O Lord God of my salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: Haste thee to help me,
verses.second_half_tle: O Lord God of my salvation.

verses.first_half: I said, “I will take heed to my ways,
verses.second_half: that I may not offend with my tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: I said, I will take heed to my ways,
verses.second_half_tle: that I offend not in my tongue.

verses.first_half: I will keep my mouth as with a bridle
verses.second_half: while the ungodly are in my sight.”
verses.first_half_tle: I will keep my mouth as it were with a bridle,
verses.second_half_tle: while the ungodly is in my sight.

verses.first_half: I held my tongue and spoke nothing;
verses.second_half: I kept silence, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.
verses.first_half_tle: I held my tongue, and spake nothing:
verses.second_half_tle: I kept silence, yea, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.

verses.first_half: My heart was hot within me, and while I was thus pondering the fire kindled,
verses.second_half: and at the last I spoke with my tongue:
verses.first_half_tle: My heart was hot within me: and while I was thus musing the fire kindled,
verses.second_half_tle: and at the last I spake with my tongue:

verses.first_half: “LORD, let me know my end and the number of my days,
verses.second_half: that I may learn how short my life is.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, let me know mine end, and the number of my days;
verses.second_half_tle: that I may be certified how long I have to live.

verses.first_half: Behold, you have made my days as a span in length,
verses.second_half: and my age is even as nothing before you; and truly, everyone living is but a breath.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, thou hast made my days as it were a span long, and mine age is even as nothing in respect of thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and verily every man living is altogether vanity.

verses.first_half: For everyone walks about as a shadow, and disquiets himself in vain;
verses.second_half: he heaps up riches and cannot tell who shall gather them.
verses.first_half_tle: For man walketh in a vain shadow, and disquieteth himself in vain;
verses.second_half_tle: he heapeth up riches, and cannot tell who shall gather them.

verses.first_half: And now, Lord, what is my hope?
verses.second_half: Truly, my hope is in you.
verses.first_half_tle: And now, Lord, what is my hope?
verses.second_half_tle: truly my hope is even in thee.

verses.first_half: Deliver me from all my offenses,
verses.second_half: and make me not a taunt of the foolish.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver me from all mine offenses,
verses.second_half_tle: and make me not a rebuke unto the foolish.

verses.first_half: I became mute and opened not my mouth,
verses.second_half: for it was you that brought it to pass.
verses.first_half_tle: I became dumb and opened not my mouth;
verses.second_half_tle: for it was thy doing.

verses.first_half: Take your affliction from me;
verses.second_half: I am consumed by the blows of your heavy hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Take thy plague away from me:
verses.second_half_tle: I am even consumed by the means of thy heavy hand.

verses.first_half: When you, with rebukes, chasten someone for sin, you consume what is dear to him, like a moth eating a garment;
verses.second_half: everyone therefore is but vanity.
verses.first_half_tle: When thou with rebukes dost chasten man for sin, thou makest his beauty to consume away, like as it were a moth fretting a garment:
verses.second_half_tle: every man therefore is but vanity.

verses.first_half: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and with your ears consider my cry;
verses.second_half: hold not your peace at my tears.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and with thine ears consider my calling;
verses.second_half_tle: hold not thy peace at my tears;

verses.first_half: For I am a stranger with you,
verses.second_half: and a sojourner, as all my fathers were.
verses.first_half_tle: For I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner,
verses.second_half_tle: as all my fathers were.

verses.first_half: O turn your gaze from me, that I may again be glad,
verses.second_half: before I go away to be seen no more.”
verses.first_half_tle: O spare me a little, that I may recover my strength,
verses.second_half_tle: before I go hence, and be no more seen.

verses.first_half: I waited patiently for the LORD,
verses.second_half: and he inclined to me, and heard my call.
verses.first_half_tle: I waited patiently for the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and he inclined unto me, and heard my calling.

verses.first_half: He brought me out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay;
verses.second_half: he set my feet upon the rock, and secured my footing.
verses.first_half_tle: He brought me also out of the horrible pit, out of the mire and clay,
verses.second_half_tle: and set my feet upon the rock, and ordered my goings.

verses.first_half: He has put a new song in my mouth,
verses.second_half: a song of thanksgiving unto our God.
verses.first_half_tle: And he hath put a new song in my mouth,
verses.second_half_tle: even a thanksgiving unto our God.

verses.first_half: Many shall see and fear,
verses.second_half: and shall put their trust in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Many shall see it, and fear,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall put their trust in the LORD.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the man who has set his hope in the LORD,
verses.second_half: and has not turned to the proud, or to those who go about lying.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man that hath set his hope in the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and turned not unto the proud, and to such as go about with lies.

verses.first_half: O LORD my God, great are the wondrous works which you have done, and also your thoughts toward us;
verses.second_half: there is none who can be compared with you.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD my God, great are the wondrous works which thou hast done, like as be also thy thoughts, which are to us-ward;
verses.second_half_tle: and yet there is no man that ordereth them unto thee.

verses.first_half: If I should declare them and speak of them,
verses.second_half: they would be more than I am able to express.
verses.first_half_tle: If I should declare them, and speak of them,
verses.second_half_tle: they should be more than I am able to express.

verses.first_half: Sacrifice and offering you do not desire,
verses.second_half: but my ears you have opened.
verses.first_half_tle: Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not,
verses.second_half_tle: but mine ears hast thou opened.

verses.first_half: Burnt offerings and sin offerings you have not required,
verses.second_half: and so I said, “Behold, I come;
verses.first_half_tle: Burnt-offering and sacrifice for sin hast thou not required:
verses.second_half_tle: then said I, Lo, I come;

verses.first_half: In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I delight to do your will, O my God;
verses.second_half: indeed, your law is within my heart.”
verses.first_half_tle: In the volume of the book it is written of me, that I should fulfill thy will, O my God:
verses.second_half_tle: I am content to do it; yea, thy law is within my heart.

verses.first_half: I have declared your righteousness in the great congregation;
verses.second_half: behold, I will not restrain my lips, O LORD, and that you know.
verses.first_half_tle: I have declared thy righteousness in the great congregation:
verses.second_half_tle: lo, I will not refrain my lips, O LORD, and that thou knowest.

verses.first_half: I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart;
verses.second_half: my talk has been of your truth and of your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart;
verses.second_half_tle: my talk hath been of thy truth, and of thy salvation.

verses.first_half: I have not concealed your loving mercy and truth
verses.second_half: from the great congregation.
verses.first_half_tle: I have not kept back thy loving mercy and truth
verses.second_half_tle: from the great congregation.

verses.first_half: Withdraw not your mercy from me, O LORD;
verses.second_half: let your loving-kindness and your truth always preserve me.
verses.first_half_tle: Withdraw not thou thy mercy from me, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: let thy loving-kindness and thy truth alway preserve me.

verses.first_half: For innumerable troubles have encompassed me; my sins have taken such hold of me that I am not able to look up;
verses.second_half: indeed, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart has utterly failed me.
verses.first_half_tle: For innumerable troubles are come about me; my sins have taken such hold upon me, that I am not able to look up;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, they are more in number than the hairs of my head, and my heart hath failed me.

verses.first_half: O LORD, let it be your pleasure to deliver me;
verses.second_half: make haste, O LORD, to help me.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, let it be thy pleasure to deliver me;
verses.second_half_tle: make haste, O LORD, to help me.

verses.first_half: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my soul to destroy it;
verses.second_half: let them be driven backward and rebuked who wish me evil.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be ashamed, and confounded together, that seek after my soul to destroy it;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be driven backward, and put to rebuke, that wish me evil.

verses.first_half: Let them be desolate and rewarded with shame
verses.second_half: who say to me, “Aha, Aha.”
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be desolate and rewarded with shame
verses.second_half_tle: that say unto me, Fie upon thee! fie upon thee!

verses.first_half: Let all those who seek you be joyful and glad in you;
verses.second_half: and let those who love your salvation say always, “The LORD be praised.”
verses.first_half_tle: Let all those that seek thee, be joyful and glad in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and let such as love thy salvation, say alway, The LORD be praised.

verses.first_half: As for me, I am poor and needy,
verses.second_half: but the Lord cares for me.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I am poor and needy;
verses.second_half_tle: but the Lord careth for me.

verses.first_half: You are my helper and deliverer;
verses.second_half: do not tarry, O my God.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my helper and redeemer;
verses.second_half_tle: make no long tarrying, O my God.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the one who considers the poor and needy;
verses.second_half: the LORD shall deliver him in the time of trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is he that considereth the poor and needy;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD shall deliver him in the time of trouble.

verses.first_half: The LORD preserves him and keeps him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth,
verses.second_half: and delivers him not over to the will of his enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD preserve him, and keep him alive, that he may be blessed upon earth;
verses.second_half_tle: and deliver not thou him into the will of his enemies.

verses.first_half: The LORD comforts him when he lies sick upon his bed,
verses.second_half: and restores him from his bed of sickness.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD comfort him when he lieth sick upon his bed;
verses.second_half_tle: make thou all his bed in his sickness.

verses.first_half: I said, “LORD, be merciful to me;
verses.second_half: heal my soul, for I have sinned against you.”
verses.first_half_tle: I said, LORD, be merciful unto me;
verses.second_half_tle: heal my soul, for I have sinned against thee.

verses.first_half: My enemies speak evil of me:
verses.second_half: “When shall he die, and his name perish?”
verses.first_half_tle: Mine enemies speak evil of me,
verses.second_half_tle: When shall he die, and his name perish?

verses.first_half: And if anyone comes to see me, he speaks empty words;
verses.second_half: his heart conceives falsehood within him, and when he goes forth, he tells it.
verses.first_half_tle: And if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity,
verses.second_half_tle: and his heart conceiveth falsehood within himself; and when he cometh forth, he telleth it.

verses.first_half: All my enemies whisper together against me;
verses.second_half: even against me are they devising evil:
verses.first_half_tle: All mine enemies whisper together against me;
verses.second_half_tle: even against me do they imagine this evil.

verses.first_half: “A deadly thing has taken hold of him,
verses.second_half: and now that he lies down, he will rise up no more.”
verses.first_half_tle: An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him;
verses.second_half_tle: and now that he lieth, he shall rise up no more.

verses.first_half: Indeed, even my own familiar friend, whom I trusted, who also ate of my bread,
verses.second_half: has lifted up his heel against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, even mine own familiar friend whom I trusted,
verses.second_half_tle: who did also eat of my bread, hath laid great wait for me.

verses.first_half: But be merciful to me, O LORD;
verses.second_half: raise me up again, and I shall repay them.
verses.first_half_tle: But be thou merciful unto me, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: raise thou me up again, and I shall reward them.

verses.first_half: By this I know you favor me,
verses.second_half: that my enemy does not triumph over me.
verses.first_half_tle: By this I know thou favorest me,
verses.second_half_tle: that mine enemy doth not triumph against me.

verses.first_half: And when I am in health, you uphold me,
verses.second_half: and shall set me before your face for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: And in my innocency thou upholdest me,
verses.second_half_tle: and shalt set me before thy face for ever.

verses.first_half: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel,
verses.second_half: world without end. Amen.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel,
verses.second_half_tle: world without end. Amen.

verses.first_half: As the deer desires the water brooks,
verses.second_half: so longs my soul for you, O God.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the hart desireth the water-brooks,
verses.second_half_tle: so longeth my soul after thee, O God.

verses.first_half: My soul is athirst for God, even for the living God;
verses.second_half: when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?
verses.first_half_tle: My soul is athirst for God, yea, even for the living God:
verses.second_half_tle: when shall I come to appear before the presence of God?

verses.first_half: My tears have been my food day and night,
verses.second_half: while all day long they say to me, “Where now is your God?”
verses.first_half_tle: My tears have been my meat day and night,
verses.second_half_tle: while they daily say unto me, Where is now thy God?

verses.first_half: When I think upon these things, I pour out my heart,
verses.second_half: when I remember how I went with the multitude, and brought them into the house of God,
verses.first_half_tle: Now when I think thereupon, I pour out my heart by myself;
verses.second_half_tle: for I went with the multitude, and brought them forth into the house of God.

verses.first_half: With the voice of praise and thanksgiving
verses.second_half: among those who keep holy day.
verses.first_half_tle: In the voice of praise and thanksgiving,
verses.second_half_tle: among such as keep holy-day.

verses.first_half: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,
verses.second_half: and why are you so disquieted within me?
verses.first_half_tle: Why art thou so full of heaviness, O my soul?
verses.second_half_tle: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.first_half: O put your trust in God,
verses.second_half: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
verses.first_half_tle: O put thy trust in God;
verses.second_half_tle: for I will yet thank him, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.first_half: My soul is heavy within me;
verses.second_half: therefore I will remember you from the land of Jordan, and from Mizar among the hills of Hermon.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul is vexed within me;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, from Hermon and the little hill.

verses.first_half: One deep calls to another in the noise of your waterfalls;
verses.second_half: all your waves and storms have gone over me.
verses.first_half_tle: One deep calleth another, because of the noise of thy water-floods;
verses.second_half_tle: all thy waves and storms are gone over me.

verses.first_half: The LORD will grant his loving-kindness in the daytime;
verses.second_half: and in the night season will I sing of him, and make my prayer to the God of my life.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD will grant his loving-kindness in the daytime;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the night season will I sing of him, and make my prayer unto the God of my life.

verses.first_half: I will say to God my rock, “Why have you forgotten me?
verses.second_half: Why am I full of heaviness, while the enemy oppresses me?”
verses.first_half_tle: I will say unto the God of my strength, Why hast thou forgotten me?
verses.second_half_tle: why go I thus heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

verses.first_half: My bones are broken asunder,
verses.second_half: while my enemies mock me to my face,
verses.first_half_tle: My bones are smitten asunder as with a sword,
verses.second_half_tle: while mine enemies that trouble me cast me in the teeth;

verses.first_half: While all day long they say to me,
verses.second_half: “Where now is your God?”
verses.first_half_tle: Namely, while they say daily unto me,
verses.second_half_tle: Where is now thy God?

verses.first_half: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul,
verses.second_half: and why are you so disquieted within me?
verses.first_half_tle: Why art thou so vexed, O my soul?
verses.second_half_tle: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.first_half: O put your trust in God,
verses.second_half: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
verses.first_half_tle: O put thy trust in God;
verses.second_half_tle: for I will yet thank him, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.first_half: Give judgment for me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people;
verses.second_half: O deliver me from the deceitful and the wicked.
verses.first_half_tle: Give sentence with me, O God, and defend my cause against the ungodly people;
verses.second_half_tle: O deliver me from the deceitful and wicked man.

verses.first_half: For you are the God of my strength; why have you put me far from you?
verses.second_half: And why do I go about with heaviness, while the enemy oppresses me?
verses.first_half_tle: For thou art the God of my strength; why hast thou put me from thee?
verses.second_half_tle: and why go I so heavily, while the enemy oppresseth me?

verses.first_half: O send out your light and your truth, that they may lead me,
verses.second_half: and bring me to your holy hill, and to your dwelling;
verses.first_half_tle: O send out thy light and thy truth, that they may lead me,
verses.second_half_tle: and bring me unto thy holy hill, and to thy dwelling;

verses.first_half: That I may go to the altar of God, even to the God of my joy and gladness;
verses.second_half: and on the harp will I give thanks to you, O God, my God.
verses.first_half_tle: And that I may go unto the altar of God, even unto the God of my joy and gladness;
verses.second_half_tle: and upon the harp will I give thanks unto thee, O God, my God.

verses.first_half: Why are you so full of heaviness, O my soul?
verses.second_half: and why are you so disquieted within me?
verses.first_half_tle: Why art thou so heavy, O my soul?
verses.second_half_tle: and why art thou so disquieted within me?

verses.first_half: O put your trust in God,
verses.second_half: for I will yet give him thanks, who is the help of my countenance, and my God.
verses.first_half_tle: O put thy trust in God;
verses.second_half_tle: for I will yet give him thanks, which is the help of my countenance, and my God.

verses.first_half: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us
verses.second_half: what you did in the days of old:
verses.first_half_tle: We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us
verses.second_half_tle: what thou hast done in their time of old:

verses.first_half: How you drove out the nations with your hand, and planted our fathers in the land;
verses.second_half: how you destroyed the nations and cast them out.
verses.first_half_tle: How thou hast driven out the heathen with thy hand, and planted our fathers in;
verses.second_half_tle: how thou hast destroyed the nations, and made thy people to flourish.

verses.first_half: For they did not possess the land by their own sword,
verses.second_half: neither was it their own arm that helped them,
verses.first_half_tle: For they gat not the land in possession through their own sword,
verses.second_half_tle: neither was it their own arm that helped them;

verses.first_half: But by your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your countenance,
verses.second_half: because you favored them.
verses.first_half_tle: But thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance;
verses.second_half_tle: because thou hadst a favor unto them.

verses.first_half: You are my King, O God;
verses.second_half: you send help to Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my king, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: send help unto Jacob.

verses.first_half: Through you we will overthrow our enemies,
verses.second_half: and in your Name will we tread down those who rise up against us.
verses.first_half_tle: Through thee will we overthrow our enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy Name will we tread them under that rise up against us.

verses.first_half: For I will not trust in my bow;
verses.second_half: it is not my sword that shall help me;
verses.first_half_tle: For I will not trust in my bow,
verses.second_half_tle: it is not my sword that shall help me;

verses.first_half: But you save us from our enemies
verses.second_half: and put to shame those who hate us.
verses.first_half_tle: But it is thou that savest us from our enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and puttest them to confusion that hate us.

verses.first_half: We make our boast in God all day long
verses.second_half: and will praise your Name for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: We make our boast of God all day long,
verses.second_half_tle: and will praise thy Name for ever.

verses.first_half: But now you have cast us off and put us to shame,
verses.second_half: and you do not go forth with our armies.
verses.first_half_tle: But now thou art far off, and puttest us to confusion,
verses.second_half_tle: and goest not forth with our armies.

verses.first_half: You make us turn our backs upon our enemies,
verses.second_half: so that those who hate us plunder our goods.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou makest us to turn our backs upon our enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: so that they which hate us spoil our goods.

verses.first_half: You let us be eaten up like sheep
verses.second_half: and have scattered us among the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou lettest us be eaten up like sheep,
verses.second_half_tle: and hast scattered us among the heathen.

verses.first_half: You sell your people for nothing
verses.second_half: and take no money for them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou sellest thy people for nought,
verses.second_half_tle: and takest no money for them.

verses.first_half: You make us the reproach of our neighbors,
verses.second_half: to be laughed to scorn, and held in derision by those who are round about us.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou makest us to be rebuked of our neighbors,
verses.second_half_tle: to be laughed to scorn, and had in derision of them that are round about us.

verses.first_half: You make us a byword among the nations,
verses.second_half: so that the peoples shake their heads at us.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou makest us to be a byword among the nations,
verses.second_half_tle: and that the peoples shake their heads at us.

verses.first_half: My disgrace is daily before me,
verses.second_half: and the shame of my face has covered me,
verses.first_half_tle: My confusion is daily before me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the shame of my face hath covered me;

verses.first_half: Because of the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer,
verses.second_half: because of the enemy and avenger.
verses.first_half_tle: For the voice of the slanderer and blasphemer,
verses.second_half_tle: for the enemy and avenger.

verses.first_half: And though all this has come upon us, yet we do not forget you,
verses.second_half: nor have we been unfaithful to your covenant.
verses.first_half_tle: And though all this be come upon us, yet do we not forget thee,
verses.second_half_tle: nor behave ourselves frowardly in thy covenant.

verses.first_half: Our heart has not turned back,
verses.second_half: nor have our steps departed from your way,
verses.first_half_tle: Our heart is not turned back,
verses.second_half_tle: neither our steps gone out of thy way;

verses.first_half: Though you have crushed us in the haunt of jackals,
verses.second_half: and covered us with the shadow of death.
verses.first_half_tle: No, not when thou hast smitten us into the place of dragons,
verses.second_half_tle: and covered us with the shadow of death.

verses.first_half: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and held up our hands to any strange god,
verses.second_half: shall not God search it out? For he knows the very secrets of the heart.
verses.first_half_tle: If we have forgotten the Name of our God, and holden up our hands to any strange god,
verses.second_half_tle: shall not God search it out? for he knoweth the very secrets of the heart.

verses.first_half: For your sake we are killed all the day long,
verses.second_half: and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy sake also are we killed all the day long,
verses.second_half_tle: and are counted as sheep appointed to be slain.

verses.first_half: Rise up, O Lord! Why are you sleeping?
verses.second_half: Awake, and cast us not away for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Up, Lord, why sleepest thou?
verses.second_half_tle: awake, and be not absent from us for ever.

verses.first_half: Why do you hide your face
verses.second_half: and forget our misery and trouble?
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore hidest thou thy face,
verses.second_half_tle: and forgettest our misery and trouble?

verses.first_half: For our soul is brought low, even to the dust;
verses.second_half: our belly cleaves to the ground.
verses.first_half_tle: For our soul is brought low, even unto the dust;
verses.second_half_tle: our belly cleaveth unto the ground.

verses.first_half: Arise, O Lord, and help us,
verses.second_half: and deliver us for your mercy’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, and help us,
verses.second_half_tle: and deliver us, for thy mercy’s sake.

verses.first_half: My heart overflows with a noble song;
verses.second_half: I will sing my words to the King; my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart overfloweth with a good matter; I speak the things which I have made concerning the King.
verses.second_half_tle: My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

verses.first_half: You are fairer than the children of men;
verses.second_half: full of grace are your lips, because God has blessed you for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art fairer than the children of men;
verses.second_half_tle: full of grace are thy lips, because God hath blessed thee for ever.

verses.first_half: Gird your sword upon your thigh, most mighty one,
verses.second_half: according to your honor and majesty.
verses.first_half_tle: Gird thee with thy sword upon thy thigh, O thou Most Mighty,
verses.second_half_tle: according to thy worship and renown.

verses.first_half: In your majesty be victorious; ride out for the sake of truth, to bear witness to righteousness,
verses.second_half: and your right hand shall show you marvelous things.
verses.first_half_tle: Good luck have thou with thine honor:
verses.second_half_tle: ride on, because of the word of truth, of meekness, and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

verses.first_half: Your arrows are very sharp in the heart of the King’s enemies,
verses.second_half: and the peoples shall be subdued under you.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy arrows are very sharp in the heart of the King’s enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and the people shall be subdued unto thee.

verses.first_half: Your throne, O God, endures for ever;
verses.second_half: the scepter of your kingdom is a righteous scepter.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy seat, O God, endureth for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: the scepter of thy kingdom is a right scepter.

verses.first_half: You have loved righteousness and hated iniquity;
verses.second_half: therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity;
verses.second_half_tle: wherefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

verses.first_half: All your garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;
verses.second_half: out of the ivory palaces, stringed instruments have made you glad.
verses.first_half_tle: All thy garments smell of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;
verses.second_half_tle: out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

verses.first_half: Kings’ daughters are among your honorable women;
verses.second_half: at your right hand stands the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought with many colors.
verses.first_half_tle: Kings’ daughters are among thy honorable women;
verses.second_half_tle: upon thy right hand doth stand the queen in a vesture of gold, wrought about with divers colors.

verses.first_half: Hearken, O daughter, and consider; incline your ear;
verses.second_half: forget your own people, and your father’s house.
verses.first_half_tle: Hearken, O daughter, and consider; incline thine ear;
verses.second_half_tle: forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house.

verses.first_half: So shall the King have pleasure in your beauty;
verses.second_half: since he is your Lord, honor him.
verses.first_half_tle: So shall the King have pleasure in thy beauty;
verses.second_half_tle: for he is thy Lord, and worship thou him.

verses.first_half: And the daughter of Tyre shall bring you gifts;
verses.second_half: the rich also among the peoples shall seek your favor.
verses.first_half_tle: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift;
verses.second_half_tle: like as the rich also among the people shall make their supplication before thee.

verses.first_half: The King’s daughter is all glorious within the palace;
verses.second_half: her clothing is of wrought gold.
verses.first_half_tle: The King’s daughter is all glorious within;
verses.second_half_tle: her clothing is of wrought gold.

verses.first_half: She shall be brought to the king in embroidered raiment;
verses.second_half: the virgins who are her companions shall bring her to you.
verses.first_half_tle: She shall be brought unto the King in raiment of needlework:
verses.second_half_tle: the virgins that be her fellows shall bear her company, and shall be brought unto thee.

verses.first_half: With joy and gladness shall they bring her,
verses.second_half: and shall enter into the King’s palace.
verses.first_half_tle: With joy and gladness shall they be brought,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall enter into the King’s palace.

verses.first_half: Instead of your fathers, you shall have sons,
verses.second_half: whom you shall make princes in all the land.
verses.first_half_tle: Instead of thy fathers, thou shalt have children,
verses.second_half_tle: whom thou mayest make princes in all lands.

verses.first_half: I will make your Name to be remembered from one generation to another;
verses.second_half: therefore the peoples shall praise you, world without end.
verses.first_half_tle: I will make thy Name to be remembered from one generation to another;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore shall the people give thanks unto thee, world without end.

verses.first_half: God is our refuge and strength,
verses.second_half: a very present help in trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: God is our hope and strength,
verses.second_half_tle: a very present help in trouble.

verses.first_half: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth be moved,
verses.second_half: and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore will we not fear, though the earth be moved,
verses.second_half_tle: and though the hills be carried into the midst of the sea;

verses.first_half: Though its waters rage and swell,
verses.second_half: and though the mountains shake at its tempest.
verses.first_half_tle: Though the waters thereof rage and swell,
verses.second_half_tle: and though the mountains shake at the tempest of the same.

verses.first_half: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
verses.second_half: the holy dwelling place of the Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: There is a river, the streams whereof make glad the city of God;
verses.second_half_tle: the holy place of the tabernacle of the Most Highest.

verses.first_half: God is in the midst of her; therefore she shall not be moved.
verses.second_half: God shall help her at the break of day.
verses.first_half_tle: God is in the midst of her, therefore shall she not be removed;
verses.second_half_tle: God shall help her, and that right early.

verses.first_half: The nations are in an uproar, and the kingdoms are moved,
verses.second_half: but God has lifted his voice, and the earth shall melt away.
verses.first_half_tle: The nations make much ado, and the kingdoms are moved;
verses.second_half_tle: but God hath showed his voice, and the earth shall melt away.

verses.first_half: The LORD of hosts is with us;
verses.second_half: the God of Jacob is our refuge.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord of hosts is with us;
verses.second_half_tle: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.first_half: O come and behold the works of the LORD,
verses.second_half: what devastations he has brought upon the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: O come hither, and behold the works of the Lord,
verses.second_half_tle: what destruction he hath brought upon the earth.

verses.first_half: He makes wars to cease in all the world;
verses.second_half: he breaks the bow, and shatters the spear, and burns the chariots in the fire.
verses.first_half_tle: He maketh wars to cease in all the world;
verses.second_half_tle: he breaketh the bow, and knappeth the spear in sunder, and burneth the chariots in the fire.

verses.first_half: “Be still then and know that I am God;
verses.second_half: I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.”
verses.first_half_tle: Be still then, and know that I am God:
verses.second_half_tle: I will be exalted among the nations, and I will be exalted in the earth.

verses.first_half: The LORD of hosts is with us;
verses.second_half: the God of Jacob is our refuge.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord of hosts is with us;
verses.second_half_tle: the God of Jacob is our refuge.

verses.first_half: O clap your hands together, all you peoples;
verses.second_half: O cry aloud unto God with shouts of joy.
verses.first_half_tle: O clap your hands together, all ye peoples:
verses.second_half_tle: O sing unto God with the voice of melody.

verses.first_half: For the LORD Most High is to be feared;
verses.second_half: he is the great King over all the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: For the Lord is high, and to be feared;
verses.second_half_tle: he is the great King upon all the earth.

verses.first_half: He shall subdue the peoples under us,
verses.second_half: and the nations under our feet.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall subdue the peoples under us,
verses.second_half_tle: and the nations under our feet.

verses.first_half: He shall choose our inheritance for us,
verses.second_half: the pride of Jacob whom he loved.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall choose out an heritage for us,
verses.second_half_tle: even the excellency of Jacob, whom he loved.

verses.first_half: God has gone up with a shout of triumph,
verses.second_half: the LORD with the sound of the trumpet.
verses.first_half_tle: God is gone up with a merry noise,
verses.second_half_tle: and the Lord with the sound of the trump.

verses.first_half: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God;
verses.second_half: O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.
verses.first_half_tle: O sing praises, sing praises unto our God;
verses.second_half_tle: O sing praises, sing praises unto our King.

verses.first_half: For God is the King of all the earth;
verses.second_half: think upon his mighty acts and praise him with a song.
verses.first_half_tle: For God is the King of all the earth:
verses.second_half_tle: sing ye praises with understanding.

verses.first_half: God reigns over the nations;
verses.second_half: God sits on his holy throne.
verses.first_half_tle: God reigneth over the nations;
verses.second_half_tle: God sitteth upon his holy seat.

verses.first_half: The princes of the peoples are gathered with the people of the God of Abraham;
verses.second_half: for the mighty upon earth have become the servants of the Lord, and he is very highly exalted.
verses.first_half_tle: The princes of the peoples are joined unto the people of the God of Abraham;
verses.second_half_tle: for God, which is very high exalted, doth defend the earth, as it were with a shield.

verses.first_half: Great is the LORD and highly to be praised
verses.second_half: in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.
verses.first_half_tle: Great is the Lord, and highly to be praised
verses.second_half_tle: in the city of our God, even upon his holy hill.

verses.first_half: The hill of Zion is beautiful and lofty;
verses.second_half: it is the joy of the whole earth.
verses.first_half_tle: The hill of Zion is a fair place, and the joy of the whole earth;
verses.second_half_tle: upon the north side lieth the city of the great King: God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.

verses.first_half: Upon the north side lies the city of the great King;
verses.second_half: God is well known in her palaces as a sure refuge.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, the kings of the earth
verses.second_half_tle: were gathered, and gone by together.

verses.first_half: For behold, the kings of the earth
verses.second_half: have gathered and advanced together.
verses.first_half_tle: They marvelled to see such things;
verses.second_half_tle: they were astonished, and suddenly cast down.

verses.first_half: They marvelled to see such things;
verses.second_half: they were astonished and fled in terror.
verses.first_half_tle: Fear came there upon them; and sorrow,
verses.second_half_tle: as upon a woman in her travail.

verses.first_half: Trembling came upon them, and anguish,
verses.second_half: as upon a woman in travail.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou dost break the ships of the sea
verses.second_half_tle: through the east-wind.

verses.first_half: You caused the east wind to blow
verses.second_half: and broke apart the ships of Tarshish.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God;
verses.second_half_tle: God upholdeth the same for ever.

verses.first_half: As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the LORD of hosts, in the city of our God;
verses.second_half: God upholds her for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: We wait for thy loving-kindness, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: in the midst of thy temple.

verses.first_half: We wait for your loving-kindness, O God,
verses.second_half: in the midst of your temple.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, according to thy Name, so is thy praise unto the world’s end;
verses.second_half_tle: thy right hand is full of righteousness.

verses.first_half: O God, according to your Name, so is your praise to the world’s end;
verses.second_half: your right hand is full of righteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the mount Zion rejoice, and the daughters of Judah be glad,
verses.second_half_tle: because of thy judgments.

verses.first_half: Let Mount Zion rejoice, and the cities of Judah be glad,
verses.second_half: because of your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
verses.second_half_tle: and tell the towers thereof.

verses.first_half: Walk about Zion, and go round about her;
verses.second_half: count the number of her towers.
verses.first_half_tle: Mark well her bulwarks, consider her palaces,
verses.second_half_tle: that ye may tell them that come after.

verses.first_half: Mark well her bulwarks, consider her strongholds,
verses.second_half: that you may tell those who come after.
verses.first_half_tle: For this God is our God for ever and ever:
verses.second_half_tle: he shall be our guide unto death.

verses.first_half: This God is our God for ever and ever;
verses.second_half: he shall be our guide, even unto death.

verses.first_half: Hear this, all you peoples;
verses.second_half: ponder it with your ears, all who dwell in the world,
verses.first_half_tle: O hear ye this, all ye people;
verses.second_half_tle: ponder it with your ears, all ye that dwell in the world;

verses.first_half: High and low, rich and poor,
verses.second_half: everyone with his neighbor.
verses.first_half_tle: High and low, rich and poor,
verses.second_half_tle: one with another.

verses.first_half: My mouth shall speak of wisdom,
verses.second_half: and my heart shall muse on understanding.
verses.first_half_tle: My mouth shall speak of wisdom,
verses.second_half_tle: and my heart shall muse of understanding.

verses.first_half: I will incline my ear to a parable,
verses.second_half: and declare my dark sayings with the harp.
verses.first_half_tle: I will incline mine ear to the parable,
verses.second_half_tle: and show my dark speech upon the harp.

verses.first_half: Why should I fear in the days of wickedness,
verses.second_half: and when the wicked at my heels encompass me round about?
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore should I fear in the days of evil,
verses.second_half_tle: when wickedness at my heels compasseth me round about?

verses.first_half: There are some who put their trust in their goods,
verses.second_half: and boast in the multitude of their riches.
verses.first_half_tle: There be some that put their trust in their goods,
verses.second_half_tle: and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches.

verses.first_half: But no one can deliver his brother,
verses.second_half: nor pay unto God a price for him;
verses.first_half_tle: But no man may deliver his brother,
verses.second_half_tle: nor give a ransom unto God for him,

verses.first_half: For it is so costly to redeem their souls,
verses.second_half: that we should never have enough to pay it,
verses.first_half_tle: (For it cost more to redeem their souls,
verses.second_half_tle: so that he must let that alone for ever;)

verses.first_half: So that they should live for ever,
verses.second_half: and should not see the grave.
verses.first_half_tle: That he shall live alway,
verses.second_half_tle: and not see the grave.

verses.first_half: For we see that wise men die, as well as the ignorant and foolish;
verses.second_half: they perish alike and leave their riches for others.
verses.first_half_tle: For he seeth that wise men also die and perish together,
verses.second_half_tle: as well as the ignorant and foolish, and leave their riches for other.

verses.first_half: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever, and that their dwelling places shall endure from one generation to another,
verses.second_half: and they call lands after their own names.
verses.first_half_tle: And yet they think that their houses shall continue for ever, and that their dwelling-places shall endure from one generation to another;
verses.second_half_tle: and call the lands after their own names.

verses.first_half: Man is like an ox that has no understanding;
verses.second_half: he is like the beasts that perish.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, man being in honor abideth not,
verses.second_half_tle: seeing he may be compared unto the beasts that perish;

verses.first_half: This is the way of their foolishness,
verses.second_half: yet their posterity praise their sayings.
verses.first_half_tle: This their way is very foolishness;
verses.second_half_tle: yet their posterity praise their saying.

verses.first_half: Like sheep they are appointed to die, and death shall be their shepherd;
verses.second_half: they shall go down straight into the sepulcher.
verses.first_half_tle: They lie in the grave like sheep; death is their shepherd; and the righteous shall have dominion over them in the morning:
verses.second_half_tle: their beauty shall consume in the sepulchre, and have no abiding.

verses.first_half: Their beauty shall consume away in the grave,
verses.second_half: which shall be their dwelling place for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: But God hath delivered my soul from the power of the grave;
verses.second_half_tle: for he shall receive me.

verses.first_half: But God shall save me from the power of death,
verses.second_half: for he shall deliver my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: Be not thou afraid, though one be made rich,
verses.second_half_tle: or if the glory of his house be increased;

verses.first_half: Be not envious if one is made rich,
verses.second_half: or if the glory of his house is increased,
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dieth,
verses.second_half_tle: neither shall his pomp follow him.

verses.first_half: For he shall carry nothing away with him when he dies,
verses.second_half: neither shall his glory follow him.
verses.first_half_tle: For while he lived, he counted himself an happy man;
verses.second_half_tle: and so long as thou doest well unto thyself, men will speak good of thee.

verses.first_half: For while he lived, he counted himself happy,
verses.second_half: and so long as he did well for himself, people spoke well of him.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall follow the generation of his fathers,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall never see light.

verses.first_half: He shall follow the generation of his fathers
verses.second_half: and shall never see the light.
verses.first_half_tle: Man that is in honor but hath no understanding
verses.second_half_tle: is compared unto the beasts that perish.

verses.first_half: Those who are honored but have no understanding
verses.second_half: are like the beasts that perish.

verses.first_half: The LORD, even the most mighty God, has spoken
verses.second_half: and called the world, from the rising of the sun to the going down thereof.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord, even the Most Mighty God, hath spoken,
verses.second_half_tle: and called the world, from the rising up of the sun unto the going down thereof.

verses.first_half: Out of Zion, perfect in her beauty,
verses.second_half: has God shone forth in glory.
verses.first_half_tle: Out of Zion hath God appeared
verses.second_half_tle: in perfect beauty.

verses.first_half: Our God shall come and shall not keep silence;
verses.second_half: there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.
verses.first_half_tle: Our God shall come, and shall not keep silence;
verses.second_half_tle: there shall go before him a consuming fire, and a mighty tempest shall be stirred up round about him.

verses.first_half: He shall call to the heavens above,
verses.second_half: and to the earth beneath, that he may judge his people:
verses.first_half_tle: He shall call the heaven from above,
verses.second_half_tle: and the earth, that he may judge his people.

verses.first_half: “Gather my faithful together unto me,
verses.second_half: those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”
verses.first_half_tle: Gather my saints together unto me;
verses.second_half_tle: those that have made a covenant with me with sacrifice.

verses.first_half: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness,
verses.second_half: for God himself is Judge.
verses.first_half_tle: And the heavens shall declare his righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: for God is Judge himself.

verses.first_half: “Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
verses.second_half: I myself will testify against you, O Israel, for I am God, even your God.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear, O my people, and I will speak;
verses.second_half_tle: I myself will testify against thee, O Israel; for I am God, even thy God.

verses.first_half: I will not rebuke you because of your sacrifices, or for your burnt offerings,
verses.second_half: because they are always before me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will not reprove thee because of thy sacrifices;
verses.second_half_tle: as for thy burnt-offerings, they are alway before me.

verses.first_half: I will take no bull calf out of your house,
verses.second_half: nor he-goat out of your folds.
verses.first_half_tle: I will take no bullock out of thine house,
verses.second_half_tle: nor he-goats out of thy folds.

verses.first_half: For all the beasts of the forest are mine,
verses.second_half: and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.
verses.first_half_tle: For all the beasts of the forest are mine,
verses.second_half_tle: and so are the cattle upon a thousand hills.

verses.first_half: I know all the birds of the air,
verses.second_half: and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.
verses.first_half_tle: I know all the fowls upon the mountains,
verses.second_half_tle: and the wild beasts of the field are in my sight.

verses.first_half: If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
verses.second_half: for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.
verses.first_half_tle: If I be hungry, I will not tell thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for the whole world is mine, and all that is therein.

verses.first_half: Do you think that I will eat the flesh of bulls
verses.second_half: and drink the blood of goats?
verses.first_half_tle: Thinkest thou that I will eat bulls’ flesh,
verses.second_half_tle: and drink the blood of goats?

verses.first_half: Offer unto God a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
verses.second_half: and pay your vows unto the Most High,
verses.first_half_tle: Offer unto God thanksgiving,
verses.second_half_tle: and pay thy vows unto the Most Highest.

verses.first_half: And call upon me in the time of trouble;
verses.second_half: so will I hear you, and you shall praise me.”
verses.first_half_tle: And call upon me in the time of trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: so will I hear thee, and thou shalt praise me.

verses.first_half: But to the ungodly God says:
verses.second_half: “Why do you recite my laws, and take my covenant in your mouth,
verses.first_half_tle: But unto the ungodly saith God,
verses.second_half_tle: Why dost thou preach my laws, and takest my covenant in thy mouth;

verses.first_half: Though you hate to be disciplined,
verses.second_half: and have cast my words behind you?
verses.first_half_tle: Whereas thou hatest to be reformed,
verses.second_half_tle: and hast cast my words behind thee?

verses.first_half: When you saw a thief, you agreed with him,
verses.second_half: and you have taken part with adulterers.
verses.first_half_tle: When thou sawest a thief, thou consentedst unto him;
verses.second_half_tle: and hast been partaker with the adulterers.

verses.first_half: You have let your mouth speak wickedness,
verses.second_half: and with your tongue you have set forth deceit.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast let thy mouth speak wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and with thy tongue thou hast set forth deceit.

verses.first_half: You sat and spoke against your brother;
verses.second_half: yes, and have slandered your own mother’s son.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou sattest and spakest against thy brother;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and hast slandered thine own mother’s son.

verses.first_half: These things you have done, and I held my tongue,
verses.second_half: and you thought wickedly that I am such a one as yourself.
verses.first_half_tle: These things hast thou done, and I held my tongue, and thou thoughtest wickedly, that I am even such a one as thyself;
verses.second_half_tle: but I will reprove thee, and set before thee the things that thou hast done.

verses.first_half: But I will reprove you,
verses.second_half: and set before you the things that you have done.
verses.first_half_tle: O consider this, ye that forget God,
verses.second_half_tle: lest I pluck you away, and there be none to deliver you.

verses.first_half: O consider this, you who forget God,
verses.second_half: lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver you.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso offereth me thanks and praise, he honoreth me;
verses.second_half_tle: and to him that ordereth his way aright, will I show the salvation of God.

verses.first_half: Whoever offers me a sacrifice of thanksgiving honors me,
verses.second_half: and to him who orders his way aright will I show the salvation of God.”

verses.first_half: Have mercy upon me, O God, in your great goodness;
verses.second_half: according to the multitude of your mercies wipe away my offences.
verses.first_half_tle: Have mercy upon me, O God, after thy great goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: according to the multitude of thy mercies do away mine offenses.

verses.first_half: Wash me thoroughly from my wickedness
verses.second_half: and cleanse me from my sin.
verses.first_half_tle: Wash me throughly from my wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and cleanse me from my sin.

verses.first_half: For I acknowledge my faults,
verses.second_half: and my sin is ever before me.
verses.first_half_tle: For I acknowledge my faults,
verses.second_half_tle: and my sin is ever before me.

verses.first_half: Against you only have I sinned, and done this evil in your sight,
verses.second_half: so that you are justified in your sentence, and blameless in your judgment.
verses.first_half_tle: Against thee only have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight;
verses.second_half_tle: that thou mightest be justified in thy saying, and clear when thou shalt judge.

verses.first_half: Behold, I was brought forth in wickedness,
verses.second_half: and in sin my mother conceived me.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, I was shapen in wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and in sin hath my mother conceived me.

verses.first_half: But behold, you desire truth in the inward parts
verses.second_half: and shall make me understand wisdom secretly.
verses.first_half_tle: But lo, thou requirest truth in the inward parts,
verses.second_half_tle: and shalt make me to understand wisdom secretly.

verses.first_half: You shall purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
verses.second_half: you shall wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

verses.first_half: You shall make me hear of joy and gladness,
verses.second_half: that the bones which you have broken may rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt make me hear of joy and gladness,
verses.second_half_tle: that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

verses.first_half: Turn your face from my sins,
verses.second_half: and blot out all my misdeeds.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn thy face from my sins,
verses.second_half_tle: and put out all my misdeeds.

verses.first_half: Create in me a clean heart, O God,
verses.second_half: and renew a right spirit within me.
verses.first_half_tle: Make me a clean heart, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: and renew a right spirit within me.

verses.first_half: Cast me not away from your presence,
verses.second_half: and take not your holy Spirit from me.
verses.first_half_tle: Cast me not away from thy presence,
verses.second_half_tle: and take not thy holy Spirit from me.

verses.first_half: O give me the comfort of your help again,
verses.second_half: and sustain me with your willing Spirit.
verses.first_half_tle: O give me the comfort of thy help again,
verses.second_half_tle: and stablish me with thy free Spirit.

verses.first_half: Then shall I teach your ways unto the wicked,
verses.second_half: and sinners shall return unto you.
verses.first_half_tle: Then shall I teach thy ways unto the wicked,
verses.second_half_tle: and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

verses.first_half: Deliver me from blood-guilt, O God, the God of my salvation,
verses.second_half: and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou that art the God of my health;
verses.second_half_tle: and my tongue shall sing of thy righteousness.

verses.first_half: O Lord, open my lips,
verses.second_half: and my mouth shall show forth your praise.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt open my lips, O Lord,
verses.second_half_tle: and my mouth shall show thy praise.

verses.first_half: For you desire no sacrifice, or else I would give it to you;
verses.second_half: but you delight not in burnt-offerings.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou desirest no sacrifice, else would I give it thee;
verses.second_half_tle: but thou delightest not in burnt-offerings.

verses.first_half: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit;
verses.second_half: a broken and contrite heart, O God, you shall not despise.
verses.first_half_tle: The sacrifice of God is a troubled spirit:
verses.second_half_tle: a broken and contrite heart, O God, shalt thou not despise.

verses.first_half: O be favorable and gracious unto Zion;
verses.second_half: may you build up the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.first_half_tle: O be favorable and gracious unto Zion;
verses.second_half_tle: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

verses.first_half: Then you shall be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations;
verses.second_half: then shall they offer young bullocks upon your altar.
verses.first_half_tle: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifice of righteousness, with the burnt-offerings and oblations;
verses.second_half_tle: then shall they offer young bullocks upon thine altar.

verses.first_half: Why do you boast, you tyrant,
verses.second_half: that you can do evil;
verses.first_half_tle: Why boastest thou thyself, thou tyrant,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou canst do mischief;

verses.first_half: Whereas the goodness of God
verses.second_half: endures all the day long?
verses.first_half_tle: Whereas the goodness of God
verses.second_half_tle: endureth yet daily?

verses.first_half: Your tongue devises wickedness,
verses.second_half: and with lies you cut like a sharp razor.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy tongue imagineth wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and with lies thou cuttest like a sharp razor.

verses.first_half: You have loved unrighteousness more than goodness
verses.second_half: and to utter lies more than truth.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast loved unrighteousness more than goodness,
verses.second_half_tle: and falsehood more than righteousness.

verses.first_half: You have loved to speak all words that hurt,
verses.second_half: O you deceitful tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast loved to speak all words that may do hurt,
verses.second_half_tle: O thou false tongue.

verses.first_half: Therefore, God shall destroy you for ever;
verses.second_half: he shall catch you, and pluck you out of your dwelling, and root you out of the land of the living.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore shall God destroy thee for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: he shall take thee, and pluck thee out of thy dwelling, and root thee out of the land of the living.

verses.first_half: The righteous also shall see this and fear,
verses.second_half: and shall laugh him to scorn:
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous also shall see this, and fear,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall laugh him to scorn:

verses.first_half: “Behold, this is the one who did not take God for his strength,
verses.second_half: but trusted in the multitude of his riches and relied on his wickedness.”
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, this is the man that took not God for his strength;
verses.second_half_tle: but trusted unto the multitude of his riches, and strengthened himself in his wickedness.

verses.first_half: As for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God;
verses.second_half: my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I am like a green olive-tree in the house of God;
verses.second_half_tle: my trust is in the tender mercy of God for ever and ever.

verses.first_half: I will always give thanks unto you for what you have done,
verses.second_half: and I will declare your Name among the faithful, for it is good.
verses.first_half_tle: I will alway give thanks unto thee for that thou hast done;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will hope in thy Name, for thy saints like it well.

verses.first_half: The fool has said in his heart,
verses.second_half: “There is no God.”
verses.first_half_tle: The foolish body hath said in his heart,
verses.second_half_tle: There is no God.

verses.first_half: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their wickedness;
verses.second_half: there is none that does good.
verses.first_half_tle: Corrupt are they, and become abominable in their wickedness;
verses.second_half_tle: there is none that doeth good.

verses.first_half: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men
verses.second_half: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.
verses.first_half_tle: God looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
verses.second_half_tle: to see if there were any that would understand, and seek after God.

verses.first_half: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
verses.second_half: there is none that does good, no, not one.
verses.first_half_tle: But they are all gone out of the way, they are altogether become abominable;
verses.second_half_tle: there is also none that doeth good, no not one.

verses.first_half: Have they no knowledge, all the workers of evil
verses.second_half: who eat up my people as they would eat bread, and call not upon God?
verses.first_half_tle: Are not they without understanding that work wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: eating up my people as if they would eat bread? They have not called upon God.

verses.first_half: They were afraid where no fear was,
verses.second_half: for God has broken the bones of those who besieged you;
verses.first_half_tle: They were afraid where no fear was;
verses.second_half_tle: for God hath broken the bones of him that besieged thee; thou hast put them to confusion, because God hath despised them.

verses.first_half: You have put them to shame,
verses.second_half: because God has rejected them.
verses.first_half_tle: O that the salvation were given unto Israel out of Zion!
verses.second_half_tle: O that the Lord would deliver his people out of captivity!

verses.first_half: Oh, that salvation were given unto Israel out of Zion!
verses.second_half: Oh, that God would deliver his people out of captivity!
verses.first_half_tle: Then should Jacob rejoice,
verses.second_half_tle: and Israel should be right glad.

verses.first_half: Then shall Jacob rejoice,
verses.second_half: and Israel shall be glad.

verses.first_half: Save me, O God, for your Name’s sake,
verses.second_half: and avenge me in your strength.
verses.first_half_tle: Save me, O God, for thy Name’s sake,
verses.second_half_tle: and avenge me in thy strength.

verses.first_half: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.second_half: and hearken to the words of my mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: and hearken unto the words of my mouth.

verses.first_half: For the arrogant have risen up against me,
verses.second_half: and tyrants, who do not have God before their eyes, seek after my life.
verses.first_half_tle: For strangers are risen up against me;
verses.second_half_tle: and tyrants, which have not God before their eyes, seek after my soul.

verses.first_half: Behold, God is my helper;
verses.second_half: the Lord is he who upholds my life.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, God is my helper;
verses.second_half_tle: the Lord is with them that uphold my soul.

verses.first_half: He shall repay the evil of my enemies.
verses.second_half: O destroy them in your faithfulness.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall reward evil unto mine enemies:
verses.second_half_tle: destroy thou them in thy truth.

verses.first_half: A freewill offering will I give you,
verses.second_half: and praise your Name, O LORD, because it is good.
verses.first_half_tle: An offering of a free heart will I give thee, and praise thy Name, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: because it is so comfortable.

verses.first_half: For he has delivered me out of all my trouble,
verses.second_half: and my eye has seen the ruin of my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath delivered me out of all my trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: and mine eye hath seen his desire upon mine enemies.

verses.first_half: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.second_half: and hide not yourself from my petition.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my prayer, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: and hide not thyself from my petition.

verses.first_half: Give heed to me, and hear me,
verses.second_half: for I am troubled in my prayer and am tormented,
verses.first_half_tle: Take heed unto me, and hear me,
verses.second_half_tle: how I mourn in my prayer, and am vexed;

verses.first_half: Because of the cry of the enemy, and oppression by the ungodly;
verses.second_half: for they are of a mind to do me great harm, so maliciously are they set against me.
verses.first_half_tle: The enemy crieth so, and the ungodly cometh on so fast;
verses.second_half_tle: for they are minded to do me some mischief, so maliciously are they set against me.

verses.first_half: My heart is disquieted within me,
verses.second_half: and the fear of death has fallen upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart is disquieted within me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the fear of death is fallen upon me.

verses.first_half: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me,
verses.second_half: and a horrible dread has overwhelmed me.
verses.first_half_tle: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me,
verses.second_half_tle: and an horrible dread hath overwhelmed me.

verses.first_half: And I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove,
verses.second_half: for then would I fly away and be at rest.
verses.first_half_tle: And I said, O that I had wings like a dove!
verses.second_half_tle: for then would I flee away, and be at rest.

verses.first_half: Indeed, then I would get away to a far off place
verses.second_half: and make my dwelling in the wilderness.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, then would I get me away far off,
verses.second_half_tle: and remain in the wilderness.

verses.first_half: I would make haste to escape,
verses.second_half: because of the stormy wind and tempest.”
verses.first_half_tle: I would make haste to escape,
verses.second_half_tle: because of the stormy wind and tempest.

verses.first_half: Confuse their speech, O Lord, and divide them,
verses.second_half: for I have seen unrighteousness and strife in the city.
verses.first_half_tle: Destroy their tongues, O Lord, and divide them;
verses.second_half_tle: for I have spied unrighteousness and strife in the city.

verses.first_half: Day and night they go about within her walls;
verses.second_half: trouble and sorrow are in the midst of her.
verses.first_half_tle: Day and night they go about within the walls thereof:
verses.second_half_tle: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

verses.first_half: Great wickedness is there;
verses.second_half: deceit and guile do not leave her streets.
verses.first_half_tle: Wickedness is therein;
verses.second_half_tle: deceit and guile go not out of her streets.

verses.first_half: For it is not an enemy who has done me this dishonor,
verses.second_half: for then I could have borne it;
verses.first_half_tle: For it is not an open enemy that hath done me this dishonor;
verses.second_half_tle: for then I could have borne it;

verses.first_half: Neither was it my adversary who exalted himself against me,
verses.second_half: for then I would have hidden myself from him.
verses.first_half_tle: Neither was it mine adversary that did magnify himself against me;
verses.second_half_tle: for then peradventure I would have hid myself from him;

verses.first_half: But it was you, my companion,
verses.second_half: my comrade and my own familiar friend.
verses.first_half_tle: But it was even thou, my companion,
verses.second_half_tle: my guide, and mine own familiar friend.

verses.first_half: We took sweet counsel together
verses.second_half: and walked in the house of God as friends.
verses.first_half_tle: We took sweet counsel together,
verses.second_half_tle: and walked in the house of God as friends.

verses.first_half: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down alive into the grave,
verses.second_half: for there is wickedness in their hearts.
verses.first_half_tle: Let death come hastily upon them, and let them go down alive into the pit;
verses.second_half_tle: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.

verses.first_half: As for me, I will call upon God,
verses.second_half: and the LORD shall save me.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I will call upon God,
verses.second_half_tle: and the LORD shall save me.

verses.first_half: In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray and lament,
verses.second_half: and he shall hear my voice.
verses.first_half_tle: In the evening, and morning, and at noonday will I pray, and that instantly;
verses.second_half_tle: and he shall hear my voice.

verses.first_half: It is he who shall deliver my soul in peace from the battle that is against me,
verses.second_half: for there are many who fight me.
verses.first_half_tle: It is he that hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me;
verses.second_half_tle: for there were many that strove with me.

verses.first_half: God, who endures for ever, shall hear me and bring them down;
verses.second_half: for they never change, nor do they fear God.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, even God, that endureth for ever, shall hear me, and bring them down;
verses.second_half_tle: for they will not turn, nor fear God.

verses.first_half: My familiar friend has laid his hands upon those who were at peace with him,
verses.second_half: and he has broken his covenant.
verses.first_half_tle: He laid his hands upon such as be at peace with him,
verses.second_half_tle: and he brake his covenant.

verses.first_half: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, yet war was in his heart;
verses.second_half: his words were smoother than oil, and yet they were drawn swords.
verses.first_half_tle: The words of his mouth were softer than butter, having war in his heart;
verses.second_half_tle: his words were smoother than oil, and yet they be very swords.

verses.first_half: O cast your burden upon the LORD, and he shall nourish you,
verses.second_half: and shall not allow the righteous to fall for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall nourish thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall not suffer the righteous to fall for ever.

verses.first_half: But as for the bloodthirsty and deceitful,
verses.second_half: you, O God, shall bring them into the pit of destruction.
verses.first_half_tle: And as for them,
verses.second_half_tle: thou, O God, shalt bring them into the pit of destruction.

verses.first_half: They shall not live out half their days;
verses.second_half: but my trust shall be in you, O LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: The bloodthirsty and deceitful men shall not live out half their days:
verses.second_half_tle: nevertheless, my trust shall be in thee, O LORD.

verses.first_half: Be merciful to me, O God, for my adversaries are treading me down;
verses.second_half: they are daily fighting and troubling me.
verses.first_half_tle: Be merciful unto me, O God, for man goeth about to devour me;
verses.second_half_tle: he is daily fighting, and troubling me.

verses.first_half: My enemies go about hounding me daily,
verses.second_half: for there are many who fight against me, O Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine enemies are daily at hand to swallow me up;
