verses.second_half_tle: for they be many that fight against me, O thou Most Highest.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, though I am sometimes afraid,
verses.second_half: yet I put my trust in you.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, though I am sometime afraid,
verses.second_half_tle: yet put I my trust in thee.

verses.first_half: In God whose word I praise, in God I trust and fear not,
verses.second_half: for what can flesh do to me?
verses.first_half_tle: I will praise God, because of his word:
verses.second_half_tle: I have put my trust in God, and will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

verses.first_half: They daily distort my words;
verses.second_half: all that they imagine is to do me evil.
verses.first_half_tle: They daily mistake my words;
verses.second_half_tle: all that they imagine is to do me evil.

verses.first_half: They all gather together and lie in wait,
verses.second_half: and mark my steps, while they seek after my life.
verses.first_half_tle: They hold all together, and keep themselves close,
verses.second_half_tle: and mark my steps, when they lay wait for my soul.

verses.first_half: Shall they escape despite their wickedness?
verses.second_half: O God, in your displeasure cast them down.
verses.first_half_tle: Shall they escape for their wickedness?
verses.second_half_tle: thou, O God, in thy displeasure shalt cast them down.

verses.first_half: You record my lamentation; put my tears into your bottle.
verses.second_half: Are not these things noted in your book?
verses.first_half_tle: Thou tellest my wanderings; put my tears into thy bottle:
verses.second_half_tle: are not these things noted in thy book?

verses.first_half: Whenever I call upon you, then shall my enemies be put to flight;
verses.second_half: this I know, for God is on my side.
verses.first_half_tle: Whensoever I call upon thee, then shall mine enemies be put to flight:
verses.second_half_tle: this I know; for God is on my side.

verses.first_half: In God, whose word I praise,
verses.second_half: in the LORD, whose word I praise,
verses.first_half_tle: In God’s word will I rejoice;
verses.second_half_tle: in the LORD’s word will I comfort me.

verses.first_half: In God have I put my trust;
verses.second_half: I will not be afraid, for what can mortals do to me?
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, in God have I put my trust;
verses.second_half_tle: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

verses.first_half: Unto you, O God, will I pay my vows;
verses.second_half: unto you will I give thanks.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee, O God, will I pay my vows;
verses.second_half_tle: unto thee will I give thanks.

verses.first_half: For you have delivered my soul from death and my feet from stumbling,
verses.second_half: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou hast delivered my soul from death, and my feet from falling,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may walk before God in the light of the living.

verses.first_half: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for my soul trusts in you,
verses.second_half: and under the shadow of your wings shall be my refuge, until this tribulation has passed.
verses.first_half_tle: Be merciful unto me, O God, be merciful unto me; for my soul trusteth in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and under the shadow of thy wings shall be my refuge, until this tyranny be overpast.

verses.first_half: I will call unto the Most High God,
verses.second_half: even unto the God who shall fulfill his purpose for me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will call unto the Most High God,
verses.second_half_tle: even unto the God that shall perform the cause which I have in hand.

verses.first_half: He shall send from heaven and save me; he shall confound those who trample on me.
verses.second_half: God shall send forth his mercy and truth.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall send from heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: and save me from the reproof of him that would eat me up.

verses.first_half: My soul is among lions that devour the people;
verses.second_half: their teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
verses.first_half_tle: God shall send forth his mercy and truth:
verses.second_half_tle: my soul is among lions;

verses.first_half: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.second_half: let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: And I lie even among the children of men, that are set on fire,
verses.second_half_tle: whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.

verses.first_half: They have laid a net for my feet, and brought down my soul;
verses.second_half: they dug a pit before me, but have fallen into the midst of it themselves.
verses.first_half_tle: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy glory above all the earth.

verses.first_half: My heart is firmly fixed, O God, my heart is fixed;
verses.second_half: I will sing and give praise.
verses.first_half_tle: They have laid a net for my feet, and pressed down my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: they have digged a pit before me, and are fallen into the midst of it themselves.

verses.first_half: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
verses.second_half: I myself will awaken the dawn.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed;
verses.second_half_tle: I will sing and give praise.

verses.first_half: I will give thanks unto you, O Lord, among the peoples,
verses.second_half: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: Awake up, my glory; awake, lute and harp:
verses.second_half_tle: I myself will awake right early.

verses.first_half: For the greatness of your mercy reaches unto the heavens,
verses.second_half: and your truth unto the clouds.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the peoples;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will sing unto thee among the nations.

verses.first_half: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.second_half: let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: For the greatness of thy mercy reacheth unto the heavens,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy truth unto the clouds.

verses.first_half_tle: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy glory above all the earth.

verses.first_half: Do you indeed decree righteousness, O you rulers,
verses.second_half: and do you judge uprightly, O children of men?
verses.first_half_tle: Are your minds set upon righteousness, O ye congregation?
verses.second_half_tle: and do ye judge the thing that is right, O ye sons of men?

verses.first_half: No, you devise evil in your heart,
verses.second_half: and on the earth your hands deal out violence.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, ye imagine mischief in your heart upon the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and your hands deal with wickedness.

verses.first_half: The ungodly err even from their mother’s womb;
verses.second_half: as soon as they are born, they go astray and speak lies.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly are froward, even from their mother’s womb;
verses.second_half_tle: as soon as they are born, they go astray, and speak lies.

verses.first_half: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent,
verses.second_half: even like the deaf adder that stops its ears,
verses.first_half_tle: They are as venomous as the poison of a serpent,
verses.second_half_tle: even like the deaf adder, that stoppeth her ears;

verses.first_half: Which refuses to hear the voice of the charmer,
verses.second_half: no matter how skillful his charming.
verses.first_half_tle: Which refuseth to hear the voice of the charmer,
verses.second_half_tle: charm he never so wisely.

verses.first_half: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths;
verses.second_half: smite the jawbones of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: Break their teeth, O God, in their mouths;
verses.second_half_tle: smite the jawbones of the lions, O LORD.

verses.first_half: Let them fall away like water that runs off;
verses.second_half: let them wither like the grass that is trodden underfoot.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them fall away like water that runneth apace;
verses.second_half_tle: when they shoot their arrows, let them be rooted out.

verses.first_half: Let them melt away like a snail,
verses.second_half: and be like a stillborn child that does not see the sun.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them consume away like a snail, and be like the untimely fruit of a woman;
verses.second_half_tle: and let them not see the sun.

verses.first_half: Before they bear fruit, let them be cut off like a briar;
verses.second_half: let them be like thorns and weeds that are swept away.
verses.first_half_tle: Or ever your pots be made hot with thorns,
verses.second_half_tle: he shall take them away with a whirlwind, the green and the burning alike.

verses.first_half: The righteous shall rejoice when they see the vengeance;
verses.second_half: they shall wash their feet in the blood of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance;
verses.second_half_tle: he shall wash his footsteps in the blood of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: So that people shall say, “Truly, there is a reward for the righteous;
verses.second_half: surely, there is a God who judges the earth.”
verses.first_half_tle: So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: doubtless there is a God that judgeth the earth.

verses.first_half: Deliver me from my enemies, O God;
verses.second_half: defend me from those who rise up against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver me from mine enemies, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: defend me from them that rise up against me.

verses.first_half: O deliver me from the evildoers,
verses.second_half: and save me from the bloodthirsty.
verses.first_half_tle: O deliver me from the wicked doers,
verses.second_half_tle: and save me from the blood-thirsty men.

verses.first_half: For behold, they lie in wait for my soul;
verses.second_half: the mighty are gathered against me, without any offense or fault of mine, O LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, they lie waiting for my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: the mighty men are gathered against me, without any offense or fault of me, O LORD.

verses.first_half: They run and prepare themselves without cause.
verses.second_half: Arise therefore to help me, and behold.
verses.first_half_tle: They run and prepare themselves without my fault;
verses.second_half_tle: arise thou therefore to help me, and behold.

verses.first_half: Rise up, O LORD God of hosts, O God of Israel, to visit all the nations,
verses.second_half: and be not merciful to those who offend with malicious wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: Stand up, O LORD God of hosts, thou God of Israel, to visit all the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: and be not merciful unto them that offend of malicious wickedness.

verses.first_half: They go to and fro in the evening;
verses.second_half: they howl like dogs, and run about through the city.
verses.first_half_tle: They go to and fro in the evening,
verses.second_half_tle: they grin like a dog, and run about through the city.

verses.first_half: Behold, they boast with their mouths, and taunts are on their lips,
verses.second_half: for they say, “Who will hear us?”
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, they speak with their mouth, and swords are in their lips;
verses.second_half_tle: for who doth hear?

verses.first_half: But you, O LORD, shall hold them in derision,
verses.second_half: and you shall laugh all the nations to scorn.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou, O LORD, shalt have them in derision,
verses.second_half_tle: and thou shalt laugh all the heathen to scorn.

verses.first_half: My strength I will ascribe unto you,
verses.second_half: for you are the God of my refuge.
verses.first_half_tle: My strength will I ascribe unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou art the God of my refuge.

verses.first_half: God shows me his plenteous goodness,
verses.second_half: and God shall let me look in triumph upon my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: God showeth me his goodness plenteously;
verses.second_half_tle: and God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

verses.first_half: Slay them not, lest my people forget it,
verses.second_half: but scatter them abroad by your might, and put them down, O Lord our shield.
verses.first_half_tle: Slay them not, lest my people forget it;
verses.second_half_tle: but scatter them abroad among the people, and put them down, O Lord our defense.

verses.first_half: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride,
verses.second_half: because their talk is cursing and lies.
verses.first_half_tle: For the sin of their mouth, and for the words of their lips, they shall be taken in their pride:
verses.second_half_tle: and why? their talk is of cursing and lies.

verses.first_half: Consume them in your wrath; consume them, that they may perish,
verses.second_half: and know that it is God who rules in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.
verses.first_half_tle: Consume them in thy wrath, consume them, that they may perish;
verses.second_half_tle: and know that it is God that ruleth in Jacob, and unto the ends of the world.

verses.first_half: In the evening they will return,
verses.second_half: howl like dogs, and run about through the city.
verses.first_half_tle: And in the evening they will return,
verses.second_half_tle: grin like a dog, and will go about the city.

verses.first_half: They will run here and there for meat
verses.second_half: and growl if they are not satisfied.
verses.first_half_tle: They will run here and there for meat,
verses.second_half_tle: and grudge if they be not satisfied.

verses.first_half: As for me, I will sing of your power, and will praise your mercy early in the morning,
verses.second_half: for you have been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I will sing of thy power, and will praise thy mercy betimes in the morning;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.first_half: Unto you, O my strength, will I sing,
verses.second_half: for you, O God, are my refuge, and my merciful God.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou, O God, art my refuge, and my merciful God.

verses.first_half: O God, you have cast us out and scattered us abroad;
verses.second_half: you have been so displeased; O turn unto us again.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, thou hast cast us out, and scattered us abroad;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast also been displeased: O turn thee unto us again.

verses.first_half: You have made the land to quake and divided it;
verses.second_half: heal the breaches in it, for it shakes.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast moved the land, and divided it:
verses.second_half_tle: heal the sores thereof, for it shaketh.

verses.first_half: You have made your people to drink a cup of bitterness;
verses.second_half: you have filled us with wine that makes us stagger.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast showed thy people heavy things;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast given us a drink of deadly wine.

verses.first_half: You have set up a banner for those who fear you,
verses.second_half: that they may triumph because of the truth.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast given a token for such as fear thee,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may triumph because of the truth.

verses.first_half: That your beloved may be delivered,
verses.second_half: help me with your right hand and hear me.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore were thy beloved delivered:
verses.second_half_tle: help me with thy right hand, and hear me.

verses.first_half: God has spoken in his holiness:
verses.second_half: “I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.
verses.first_half_tle: God hath spoken in his holiness, I will rejoice and divide Shechem,
verses.second_half_tle: and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.first_half: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.second_half: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.
verses.first_half_tle: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.second_half_tle: Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;

verses.first_half: Moab is my wash pot; on Edom I will cast my shoe;
verses.second_half: over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”
verses.first_half_tle: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe;
verses.second_half_tle: Philistia, be thou glad of me.

verses.first_half: Who will lead me into the strong city?
verses.second_half: Who will bring me into Edom?
verses.first_half_tle: Who will lead me into the strong city?
verses.second_half_tle: who will bring me into Edom?

verses.first_half: Have you not cast us out, O God?
verses.second_half: Will you not, O God, go out with our armies?
verses.first_half_tle: Hast not thou cast us out, O God?
verses.second_half_tle: wilt not thou, O God, go out with our hosts?

verses.first_half: O be our help in trouble,
verses.second_half: for vain is the help of man.
verses.first_half_tle: O be thou our help in trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: for vain is the help of man.

verses.first_half: Through God we will do great acts,
verses.second_half: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: Through God will we do great acts;
verses.second_half_tle: for it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.first_half: Hear my cry, O God;
verses.second_half: give ear unto my prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my crying, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: give ear unto my prayer.

verses.first_half: From the ends of the earth I will call upon you
verses.second_half: when my heart is in heaviness.
verses.first_half_tle: From the ends of the earth will I call upon thee,
verses.second_half_tle: when my heart is in heaviness.

verses.first_half: O set me upon the rock that is higher than I,
verses.second_half: for you have been my refuge and a strong tower for me against the enemy.
verses.first_half_tle: O set me up upon the rock that is higher than I;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast been my hope, and a strong tower for me against the enemy.

verses.first_half: Let me dwell in your tabernacle for ever,
verses.second_half: and my refuge shall be under the covering of your wings.
verses.first_half_tle: I will dwell in thy tabernacle for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and my trust shall be under the covering of thy wings.

verses.first_half: For you, O God, have heard my vows,
verses.second_half: and have given a heritage to those who fear your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, O Lord, hast heard my desires,
verses.second_half_tle: and hast given an heritage unto those that fear thy Name.

verses.first_half: You shall grant the king a long life,
verses.second_half: that his years may endure throughout all generations.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt grant the King a long life,
verses.second_half_tle: that his years may endure throughout all generations.

verses.first_half: His throne shall abide before God for ever;
verses.second_half: O prepare your loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall dwell before God for ever:
verses.second_half_tle: O prepare thy loving mercy and faithfulness, that they may preserve him.

verses.first_half: So will I always sing praise unto your Name,
verses.second_half: that I may daily perform my vows.
verses.first_half_tle: So will I alway sing praise unto thy Name,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may daily perform my vows.

verses.first_half: For God alone my soul in silence waits;
verses.second_half: from him comes my salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul truly waiteth still upon God;
verses.second_half_tle: for of him cometh my salvation.

verses.first_half: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
verses.second_half: he is my defense, so that I shall not be greatly shaken.
verses.first_half_tle: He verily is my strength and my salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: he is my defense, so that I shall not greatly fall.

verses.first_half: How long will you assail a man to crush him, all of you together,
verses.second_half: as if you were a tottering wall or a broken fence?
verses.first_half_tle: How long will ye imagine mischief against every man?
verses.second_half_tle: Ye shall be slain all the sort of you; yea, as a tottering wall shall ye be, and like a broken hedge.

verses.first_half: Their plan is only to bring down the one whom God has exalted;
verses.second_half: their delight is in lies; they bless with their mouth, but curse with their heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Their device is only how to put him out whom God will exalt;
verses.second_half_tle: their delight is in lies; they give good words with their mouth, but curse with their heart.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, for God alone my soul in silence waits,
verses.second_half: for my hope is in him.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, my soul, wait thou still upon God:
verses.second_half_tle: for my hope is in him.

verses.first_half: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
verses.second_half: he is my defense, so that I shall not fall.
verses.first_half_tle: He truly is my strength and my salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: he is my defense, so that I shall not fall.

verses.first_half: In God is my help and my glory;
verses.second_half: he is the rock of my might, and in him is my trust.
verses.first_half_tle: In God is my health and my glory;
verses.second_half_tle: the rock of my might; and in God is my trust.

verses.first_half: O put your trust in him always, you people;
verses.second_half: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.
verses.first_half_tle: O put your trust in him alway, ye people;
verses.second_half_tle: pour out your hearts before him, for God is our hope.

verses.first_half: As for the children of men, they are but a breath;
verses.second_half: the children of men are deceitful; upon the scales, they are altogether lighter than a breath.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the children of men, they are but vanity; the children of men are deceitful;
verses.second_half_tle: upon the weights they are altogether lighter than vanity itself.

verses.first_half: O trust not in oppression; put not vain hopes in robbery;
verses.second_half: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
verses.first_half_tle: O trust not in wrong and robbery; give not yourselves unto vanity:
verses.second_half_tle: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.

verses.first_half: One thing has God spoken; indeed, two things have I heard him say:
verses.second_half: that power belongs to our God;
verses.first_half_tle: God spake once, and twice I have also heard the same,
verses.second_half_tle: that power belongeth unto God;

verses.first_half: And that you, O Lord, are merciful,
verses.second_half: for you reward everyone according to his work.
verses.first_half_tle: And that thou, Lord, art merciful;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou rewardest every man according to his work.

verses.first_half: O God, you are my God;
verses.second_half: early will I seek you.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, thou art my God;
verses.second_half_tle: early will I seek thee.

verses.first_half: My soul thirsts for you, my flesh also longs after you,
verses.second_half: in a barren and dry land where there is no water.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh also longeth after thee,
verses.second_half_tle: in a barren and dry land where no water is.

verses.first_half: Thus I have looked upon you in your holy place,
verses.second_half: that I might behold your power and glory.
verses.first_half_tle: Thus have I looked for thee in the sanctuary,
verses.second_half_tle: that I might behold thy power and glory.

verses.first_half: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself;
verses.second_half: my lips shall praise you.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy loving-kindness is better than the life itself:
verses.second_half_tle: my lips shall praise thee.

verses.first_half: As long as I live I will magnify you,
verses.second_half: and lift up my hands in your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: As long as I live will I magnify thee in this manner,
verses.second_half_tle: and lift up my hands in thy Name.

verses.first_half: My soul shall be satisfied, as with marrow and fatness,
verses.second_half: when my mouth praises you with joyful lips.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul shall be satisfied, even as it were with marrow and fatness,
verses.second_half_tle: when my mouth praiseth thee with joyful lips.

verses.first_half: When I remember you on my bed,
verses.second_half: I meditate on you in the watches of the night.
verses.first_half_tle: Have I not remembered thee in my bed,
verses.second_half_tle: and thought upon thee when I was waking?

verses.first_half: Because you have been my helper,
verses.second_half: therefore under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Because thou hast been my helper;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore under the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.

verses.first_half: My soul clings to you;
verses.second_half: your right hand has upheld me.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul hangeth upon thee;
verses.second_half_tle: thy right hand hath upholden me.

verses.first_half: Those who seek to destroy my life
verses.second_half: shall go down into the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: These also that seek the hurt of my soul,
verses.second_half_tle: they shall go under the earth.

verses.first_half: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword,
verses.second_half: that they may be a portion for jackals.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them fall upon the edge of the sword,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may be a portion for foxes.

verses.first_half: But the King shall rejoice in God; all those who swear by him shall be commended,
verses.second_half: for the mouth of those who speak lies shall be stopped.
verses.first_half_tle: But the King shall rejoice in God; all they also that swear by him shall be commended;
verses.second_half_tle: for the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.

verses.first_half: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer;
verses.second_half: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer;
verses.second_half_tle: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

verses.first_half: Hide me from the gathering together of the wicked,
verses.second_half: and from the tumult of evildoers,
verses.first_half_tle: Hide me from the gathering together of the froward,
verses.second_half_tle: and from the insurrection of wicked doers;

verses.first_half: Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
verses.second_half: and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words,
verses.first_half_tle: Who have whet their tongue like a sword,
verses.second_half_tle: and shoot out their arrows, even bitter words;

verses.first_half: That they may secretly shoot at the one who is blameless;
verses.second_half: suddenly do they shoot him, and fear not.
verses.first_half_tle: That they may privily shoot at him that is perfect:
verses.second_half_tle: suddenly do they hit him, and fear not.

verses.first_half: They hold fast to their evil purpose,
verses.second_half: and discuss among themselves how they may lay snares, and say that no one shall see them.
verses.first_half_tle: They encourage themselves in mischief,
verses.second_half_tle: and commune among themselves, how they may lay snares; and say, that no man shall see them.

verses.first_half: They imagine wickedness, and practice a cunning plot;
verses.second_half: for the human heart and mind are very deep.
verses.first_half_tle: They imagine wickedness, and practice it;
verses.second_half_tle: that they keep secret among themselves, every man in the deep of his heart.

verses.first_half: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow,
verses.second_half: and they shall be wounded.
verses.first_half_tle: But God shall suddenly shoot at them with a swift arrow,
verses.second_half_tle: that they shall be wounded.

verses.first_half: Indeed, their own tongues shall make them fall,
verses.second_half: so that all who see them shall laugh them to scorn.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, their own tongues shall make them fall;
verses.second_half_tle: insomuch that whoso seeth them shall laugh them to scorn.

verses.first_half: And all shall fear and tell what God has done,
verses.second_half: for they shall perceive that it is his work.
verses.first_half_tle: And all men that see it shall say, This hath God done;
verses.second_half_tle: for they shall perceive that it is his work.

verses.first_half: The righteous shall rejoice in the LORD and put their trust in him,
verses.second_half: and all who are true of heart shall be glad.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous shall rejoice in the LORD, and put his trust in him,
verses.second_half_tle: and all they that are true of heart shall be glad.

verses.first_half: You, O God, are to be praised in Zion,
verses.second_half: and unto you shall vows be performed in Jerusalem.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, O God, art praised in Zion;
verses.second_half_tle: and unto thee shall the vow be performed in Jerusalem.

verses.first_half: You who hear our prayer,
verses.second_half: unto you shall all flesh come.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou that hearest the prayer,
verses.second_half_tle: unto thee shall all flesh come.

verses.first_half: My misdeeds prevail against me;
verses.second_half: O be merciful and blot out our sins.
verses.first_half_tle: My misdeeds prevail against me:
verses.second_half_tle: O be thou merciful unto our sins.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the man whom you choose and receive unto yourself;
verses.second_half: he shall dwell in your courts, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of your house, even of your holy temple.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and receivest unto thee:
verses.second_half_tle: he shall dwell in thy court, and shall be satisfied with the pleasures of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

verses.first_half: You shall show us wonderful things in your righteousness, O God of our salvation,
verses.second_half: for you are the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the isles that are far away.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt show us wonderful things in thy righteousness, O God of our salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: thou that art the hope of all the ends of the earth, and of them that remain in the broad sea.

verses.first_half: You in your strength set firm the mountains,
verses.second_half: and are girded about with power.
verses.first_half_tle: Who in his strength setteth fast the mountains,
verses.second_half_tle: and is girded about with power.

verses.first_half: You still the raging of the seas,
verses.second_half: the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: Who stilleth the raging of the sea,
verses.second_half_tle: and the noise of his waves, and the madness of the peoples.

verses.first_half: Those who dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be in fear of your wonders;
verses.second_half: you make the morning and evening to shout with joy.
verses.first_half_tle: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts of the earth shall be afraid at thy tokens,
verses.second_half_tle: thou that makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to praise thee.

verses.first_half: You visit the earth and bless it;
verses.second_half: you make it very plenteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou visitest the earth, and blessest it;
verses.second_half_tle: thou makest it very plenteous.

verses.first_half: The river of God is full of water;
verses.second_half: you prepare the grain, for so you provide for the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: The river of God is full of water:
verses.second_half_tle: thou preparest their corn, for so thou providest for the earth.

verses.first_half: You water its furrows; you send rain into the little valleys;
verses.second_half: you make it soft with the drops of rain and bless the increase of it.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou waterest her furrows; thou sendest rain into the little valleys thereof;
verses.second_half_tle: thou makest it soft with the drops of rain, and blessest the increase of it.

verses.first_half: You crown the year with your goodness,
verses.second_half: and your paths overflow with plenty.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy clouds drop fatness.

verses.first_half: The fields of the wilderness are rich in pasture,
verses.second_half: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall drop upon the dwellings of the wilderness;
verses.second_half_tle: and the little hills shall rejoice on every side.

verses.first_half: The folds shall be full of sheep;
verses.second_half: the valleys also shall stand so thick with grain that they shall laugh and sing.
verses.first_half_tle: The folds shall be full of sheep;
verses.second_half_tle: the valleys also shall stand so thick with corn, that they shall laugh and sing.

verses.first_half: Be joyful in God, all you lands;
verses.second_half: sing praises to the honor of his Name; make his praise to be glorious.
verses.first_half_tle: O be joyful in God, all ye lands;
verses.second_half_tle: sing praises unto the honor of his Name; make his praise to be glorious.

verses.first_half: Say to God, “How wonderful are your works;
verses.second_half: through the greatness of your power shall your enemies cower before you.
verses.first_half_tle: Say unto God, O how wonderful art thou in thy works!
verses.second_half_tle: through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies bow down unto thee.

verses.first_half: For all the world shall worship you,
verses.second_half: sing to you, and praise your Name.”
verses.first_half_tle: For all the world shall worship thee,
verses.second_half_tle: sing of thee, and praise thy Name.

verses.first_half: O come and see the works of God,
verses.second_half: how wonderful he is in his doing toward all people.
verses.first_half_tle: O come hither, and behold the works of God;
verses.second_half_tle: how wonderful he is in his doing toward the children of men.

verses.first_half: He turned the sea into dry land, so that they went through the water on foot;
verses.second_half: therefore in him let us rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: He turned the sea into dry land,
verses.second_half_tle: so that they went through the water on foot; there did we rejoice thereof.

verses.first_half: He rules with his power for ever; his eyes keep watch over the nations;
verses.second_half: let not the rebellious exalt themselves.
verses.first_half_tle: He ruleth with his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations:
verses.second_half_tle: and such as will not believe shall not be able to exalt themselves.

verses.first_half: Bless our God, you peoples,
verses.second_half: and make the voice of his praise to be heard,
verses.first_half_tle: O praise our God, ye peoples,
verses.second_half_tle: and make the voice of his praise to be heard;

verses.first_half: Who holds our soul in life,
verses.second_half: and does not allow our feet to slip.
verses.first_half_tle: Who holdeth our soul in life;
verses.second_half_tle: and suffereth not our feet to slip.

verses.first_half: For you, O God, have proved us;
verses.second_half: you have tried us, as silver is tried.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, O God, hast proved us;
verses.second_half_tle: thou also hast tried us, like as silver is tried.

verses.first_half: You brought us into the snare
verses.second_half: and laid trouble upon our backs.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou broughtest us into the snare;
verses.second_half_tle: and laidest trouble upon our loins.

verses.first_half: You allowed men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and water;
verses.second_half: but you brought us out into a place of plenty.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou sufferedst men to ride over our heads;
verses.second_half_tle: we went through fire and water, and thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

verses.first_half: I will go into your house with burnt offerings
verses.second_half: and will pay you my vows,
verses.first_half_tle: I will go into thine house with burnt-offerings, and will pay thee my vows,
verses.second_half_tle: which I promised with my lips, and spake with my mouth, when I was in trouble.

verses.first_half: Even those which I promised with my lips
verses.second_half: and spoke with my mouth when I was in trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: I will offer unto thee fat burnt-sacrifices, with the incense of rams;
verses.second_half_tle: I will offer bullocks and goats.

verses.first_half: I will offer you burnt sacrifices of fattened beasts, with the incense of rams;
verses.second_half: I will offer bullocks and goats.
verses.first_half_tle: O come hither, and hearken, all ye that fear God;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will tell you what he hath done for my soul.

verses.first_half: Come here and listen, all you who fear God,
verses.second_half: and I will tell you what he has done for me.
verses.first_half_tle: I called unto him with my mouth,
verses.second_half_tle: and gave him praises with my tongue.

verses.first_half: I called to him with my mouth,
verses.second_half: and gave him praises with my tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: If I incline unto wickedness with mine heart,
verses.second_half_tle: the Lord will not hear me.

verses.first_half: If I had inclined toward wickedness with my heart,
verses.second_half: the Lord would not have heard me.
verses.first_half_tle: But God hath heard me;
verses.second_half_tle: and considered the voice of my prayer.

verses.first_half: But God has heard me
verses.second_half: and considered the voice of my prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: Praised be God, who hath not cast out my prayer,
verses.second_half_tle: nor turned his mercy from me.

verses.first_half: Blessed be God who has not refused my prayer,
verses.second_half: nor turned his mercy from me.

verses.first_half: May God be merciful unto us, and bless us,
verses.second_half: and show us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us.
verses.first_half_tle: God be merciful unto us, and bless us,
verses.second_half_tle: and show us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us;

verses.first_half: Let your way be known upon earth,
verses.second_half: your saving health among all nations.
verses.first_half_tle: That thy way may be known upon earth,
verses.second_half_tle: thy saving health among all nations.

verses.first_half: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
verses.second_half: indeed, let all the peoples praise you.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, let all the peoples praise thee.

verses.first_half: O let the nations rejoice and be glad,
verses.second_half: for you shall judge the peoples righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.
verses.first_half_tle: O let the nations rejoice and be glad;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou shalt judge the folk righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

verses.first_half: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
verses.second_half: let all the peoples praise you.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the peoples praise thee, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, let all the peoples praise thee.

verses.first_half: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase,
verses.second_half: and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.
verses.first_half_tle: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase;
verses.second_half_tle: and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

verses.first_half: God shall bless us,
verses.second_half: and all the ends of the world shall fear him.
verses.first_half_tle: God shall bless us;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

verses.first_half: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered;
verses.second_half: let those who hate him also flee before him.
verses.first_half_tle: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered;
verses.second_half_tle: let them also that hate him flee before him.

verses.first_half: As the smoke vanishes, so shall you drive them away;
verses.second_half: and as wax melts before the fire, so let the ungodly perish before the presence of God.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the smoke vanisheth, so shalt thou drive them away;
verses.second_half_tle: and like as wax melteth at the fire, so let the ungodly perish at the presence of God.

verses.first_half: But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God;
verses.second_half: let them also be merry and joyful.
verses.first_half_tle: But let the righteous be glad, and rejoice before God;
verses.second_half_tle: let them also be merry and joyful.

verses.first_half: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name; magnify him who rides upon the heavens.
verses.second_half: The LORD is his Name; rejoice before him.
verses.first_half_tle: O sing unto God, and sing praises unto his Name; magnify him that rideth upon the heavens;
verses.second_half_tle: praise him in his Name Jah, and rejoice before him.

verses.first_half: He is a father of the fatherless and defends the cause of the widows,
verses.second_half: God in his holy habitation.
verses.first_half_tle: He is a Father of the fatherless, and defendeth the cause of the widows;
verses.second_half_tle: even God in his holy habitation.

verses.first_half: He is the God who gives the solitary a home, and brings the prisoners out of captivity,
verses.second_half: but lets the rebellious dwell in a desert land.
verses.first_half_tle: He is the God that maketh men to be of one mind in an house, and bringeth the prisoners out of captivity;
verses.second_half_tle: but letteth the runagates continue in scarceness.

verses.first_half: O God, when you went forth before the people,
verses.second_half: when you went through the wilderness,
verses.first_half_tle: O God, when thou wentest forth before the people;
verses.second_half_tle: when thou wentest through the wilderness,

verses.first_half: The earth shook, and the heavens poured forth rain at the presence of God,
verses.second_half: even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: The earth shook, and the heavens dropped at the presence of God;
verses.second_half_tle: even as Sinai also was moved at the presence of God, who is the God of Israel.

verses.first_half: You, O God, sent a gracious rain upon your inheritance
verses.second_half: and refreshed the land when it was weary.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, O God, sentest a gracious rain upon thine inheritance,
verses.second_half_tle: and refreshedst it when it was weary.

verses.first_half: Your congregation found a dwelling there,
verses.second_half: for you, O God, of your goodness have provided for the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy congregation shall dwell therein;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou, O God, hast of thy goodness prepared for the poor.

verses.first_half: The Lord gave the word;
verses.second_half: great was the company of those who proclaimed the tidings.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord gave the word;
verses.second_half_tle: great was the company of women that bare the tidings.

verses.first_half: Kings with their armies fled, they fled,
verses.second_half: and the women at home divided the spoil.
verses.first_half_tle: Kings with their armies did flee, and were discomfited,
verses.second_half_tle: and they of the household divided the spoil.

verses.first_half: Though you have lain among the sheepfolds,
verses.second_half: yet shall you be like the wings of a dove that are covered with silver, and whose feathers shine like gold.
verses.first_half_tle: Though ye have lain among the sheep-folds, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove
verses.second_half_tle: that is covered with silver wings, and her feathers like gold.

verses.first_half: When the Almighty scattered kings,
verses.second_half: it was as if it snowed in Zalmon.
verses.first_half_tle: When the Almighty scattered kings for their sake,
verses.second_half_tle: then were they as white as snow in Zalmon.

verses.first_half: As the hill of Bashan, so is God’s hill,
verses.second_half: even a high hill, as the hill of Bashan.
verses.first_half_tle: As the hill of Bashan, so is God’s hill;
verses.second_half_tle: even an high hill, as the hill of Bashan.

verses.first_half: Why look with envy, you high hills? This is God’s hill, on which it pleases him to dwell;
verses.second_half: surely, the LORD will abide on it for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Why mock ye so, ye high hills? this is God’s hill, in the which it pleaseth him to dwell;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the LORD will abide in it for ever.

verses.first_half: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels,
verses.second_half: and the Lord has come from Sinai into the holy place.
verses.first_half_tle: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels,
verses.second_half_tle: and the Lord is among them as in the holy place of Sinai.

verses.first_half: You have gone up on high; you have led captivity captive, and received gifts from men,
verses.second_half: even from your enemies, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art gone up on high, thou hast led captivity captive, and received gifts from men;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, even from thine enemies, that the LORD God might dwell among them.

verses.first_half: Praised be the Lord daily,
verses.second_half: even the God who helps us and pours his benefits upon us.
verses.first_half_tle: Praised be the Lord daily,
verses.second_half_tle: even the God who helpeth us, and poureth his benefits upon us.

verses.first_half: He is our God, the God from whom salvation comes;
verses.second_half: God is the LORD, by whom we escape death.
verses.first_half_tle: He is our God, even the God of whom cometh salvation:
verses.second_half_tle: God is the Lord, by whom we escape death.

verses.first_half: God shall wound the head of his enemies,
verses.second_half: and the hairy scalp of those who persist in their wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: God shall wound the head of his enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and the hairy scalp of such a one as goeth on still in his wickedness.

verses.first_half: The Lord has said, “I will bring back my people again, as I did from Bashan;
verses.second_half: my own will I bring back again, as I did before from the depths of the sea,
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord hath said, I will bring my people again, as I did from Bashan;
verses.second_half_tle: mine own will I bring again, as I did sometime from the deep of the sea.

verses.first_half: That your foot may be dipped in the blood of your enemies,
verses.second_half: and that the tongues of your dogs may be red with blood.”
verses.first_half_tle: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and that the tongue of thy dogs may be red through the same.

verses.first_half: Your solemn procession is seen, O God,
verses.second_half: how you go into the sanctuary, my God and King.
verses.first_half_tle: It is well seen, O God, how thou goest;
verses.second_half_tle: how thou, my God and King, goest in the sanctuary.

verses.first_half: The singers go before, the musicians follow after;
verses.second_half: in the midst are the maidens playing the timbrels.
verses.first_half_tle: The singers go before, the minstrels follow after,
verses.second_half_tle: in the midst of the damsels playing with the timbrels.

verses.first_half: Give thanks unto God in the congregations,
verses.second_half: unto the LORD, the fountain of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: Give thanks unto God the Lord in the congregation,
verses.second_half_tle: ye that are of the fountain of Israel.

verses.first_half: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their counsel,
verses.second_half: the princes of Zebulon, and the princes of Naphtali.
verses.first_half_tle: There is little Benjamin their ruler, and the princes of Judah their council;
verses.second_half_tle: the princes of Zebulon, and the princes of Naphthali.

verses.first_half: O God, send forth your strength;
verses.second_half: establish, O God, what you have wrought in us.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy God hath sent forth strength for thee;
verses.second_half_tle: stablish the thing, O God, that thou hast wrought in us,

verses.first_half: For your temple’s sake at Jerusalem,
verses.second_half: kings shall bring presents unto you.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy temple’s sake at Jerusalem;
verses.second_half_tle: so shall kings bring presents unto thee.

verses.first_half: Rebuke the beasts that dwell among the reeds,
verses.second_half: a herd of bulls with their calves;
verses.first_half_tle: Rebuke thou the dragon and the bull, with the leaders of the heathen, so that they humbly bring pieces of silver;
verses.second_half_tle: scatter thou the peoples that delight in war;

verses.first_half: Rebuke the peoples who trample on those whom you have tried as silver,
verses.second_half: and scatter the peoples who delight in war.
verses.first_half_tle: Then shall the princes come out of Egypt;
verses.second_half_tle: the Morians’ land shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.

verses.first_half: Then shall they bring tribute out of Egypt;
verses.second_half: Ethiopia shall stretch out her hands unto God.
verses.first_half_tle: Sing unto God, O ye kingdoms of the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: O sing praises unto the Lord;

verses.first_half: Sing unto God, O you kingdoms of the earth;
verses.second_half: O sing praises unto the Lord,
verses.first_half_tle: Who sitteth in the heavens over all, from the beginning:
verses.second_half_tle: lo, he doth send out his voice; yea, and that a mighty voice.

verses.first_half: Unto God who sits in the heavens over all from the beginning;
verses.second_half: he sends out his voice, his mighty voice.
verses.first_half_tle: Ascribe ye the power to God over Israel;
verses.second_half_tle: his worship and strength is in the clouds.

verses.first_half: Ascribe power to God over Israel;
verses.second_half: his worship and strength are in the clouds.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, wonderful art thou in thy holy places:
verses.second_half_tle: even the God of Israel, he will give strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.

verses.first_half: O God, you are wonderful in your holy places;
verses.second_half: the God of Israel will give strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.

verses.first_half: Save me, O God,
verses.second_half: for the waters have come up even to my neck.
verses.first_half_tle: Save me, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: for the waters are come in, even unto my soul.

verses.first_half: I sink down in the deep mire, where there is no ground;
verses.second_half: I have come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.
verses.first_half_tle: I stick fast in the deep mire, where no ground is;
verses.second_half_tle: I am come into deep waters, so that the floods run over me.

verses.first_half: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry;
verses.second_half: my sight fails me from waiting so long for my God.
verses.first_half_tle: I am weary of crying; my throat is dry;
verses.second_half_tle: my sight faileth me for waiting so long upon my God.

verses.first_half: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
verses.second_half: those who are my enemies, and would destroy me wrongfully, are mighty.
verses.first_half_tle: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head;
verses.second_half_tle: they that are mine enemies, and would destroy me guiltless, are mighty.

verses.first_half: They bid me restore things I never took.
verses.second_half: O God, you know my foolishness, and my faults are not hidden from you.
verses.first_half_tle: I paid them the things that I never took:
verses.second_half_tle: God, thou knowest my simpleness, and my faults are not hid from thee.

verses.first_half: Let not those who trust in you, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed because of me;
verses.second_half: let not those who seek you be confounded through me, O God of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: Let not them that trust in thee, O Lord God of hosts, be ashamed for my cause;
verses.second_half_tle: let not those that seek thee be confounded through me, O Lord God of Israel.

verses.first_half: Surely for your sake have I suffered reproach;
verses.second_half: shame has covered my face.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? for thy sake have I suffered reproof;
verses.second_half_tle: shame hath covered my face.

verses.first_half: I have become a stranger to my brethren,
verses.second_half: unknown to my mother’s children,
verses.first_half_tle: I am become a stranger unto my brethren,
verses.second_half_tle: even an alien unto my mother’s children.

verses.first_half: Because zeal for your house has consumed me,
verses.second_half: and the reproaches of those who reproached you have fallen upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: For the zeal of thine house hath even eaten me;
verses.second_half_tle: and the rebukes of them that rebuked thee are fallen upon me.

verses.first_half: I wept, and humbled myself with fasting,
verses.second_half: but that was turned to my reproach.
verses.first_half_tle: I wept, and chastened myself with fasting,
verses.second_half_tle: and that was turned to my reproof.

verses.first_half: I put on sackcloth also,
verses.second_half: and I became a byword among them.
verses.first_half_tle: I put on sackcloth also,
verses.second_half_tle: and they jested upon me.

verses.first_half: Those who sit in the gate speak against me,
verses.second_half: and the drunkards make songs about me.
verses.first_half_tle: They that sit in the gate speak against me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the drunkards make songs upon me.

verses.first_half: But, LORD, I make my prayer to you
verses.second_half: in an acceptable time.
verses.first_half_tle: But, LORD, I make my prayer unto thee
verses.second_half_tle: in an acceptable time.

verses.first_half: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of your mercy,
verses.second_half: even in the truth of your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear me, O God, in the multitude of thy mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: even in the truth of thy salvation.

verses.first_half: Take me out of the mire, lest I sink;
verses.second_half: O let me be delivered from those who hate me, and out of the deep waters.
verses.first_half_tle: Take me out of the mire, that I sink not;
verses.second_half_tle: O let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.first_half: Let not the floodwaters drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up,
verses.second_half: and let not the pit shut its mouth upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: Let not the water-flood drown me, neither let the deep swallow me up;
verses.second_half_tle: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verses.first_half: Hear me, O LORD, for your loving-kindness is good;
verses.second_half: turn to me according to the multitude of your mercies;
verses.first_half_tle: Hear me, O LORD, for thy loving-kindness is comfortable;
verses.second_half_tle: turn thee unto me according to the multitude of thy mercies.

verses.first_half: And hide not your face from your servant, for I am in trouble;
verses.second_half: O hasten and hear me.
verses.first_half_tle: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble:
verses.second_half_tle: O haste thee, and hear me.

verses.first_half: Draw near to me and save me;
verses.second_half: O deliver me because of my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: Draw nigh unto my soul, and save it;
verses.second_half_tle: O deliver me, because of mine enemies.

verses.first_half: You have known my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor;
verses.second_half: my adversaries are all in your sight.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast known my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor:
verses.second_half_tle: mine adversaries are all in thy sight.

verses.first_half: Reproach has broken my heart; I am full of heaviness;
verses.second_half: I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no one, neither have I found any to comfort me.
verses.first_half_tle: Reproach hath broken my heart; I am full of heaviness:
verses.second_half_tle: I looked for some to have pity on me, but there was no man, neither found I any to comfort me.

verses.first_half: They gave me gall to eat,
verses.second_half: and when I was thirsty they gave me vinegar to drink.
verses.first_half_tle: They gave me gall to eat;
verses.second_half_tle: and when I was thirsty, they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.first_half: Let their table become a snare for them,
verses.second_half: and let their prosperity become a trap for them.
verses.first_half_tle: Let their table be made a snare to take themselves withal;
verses.second_half_tle: and let the things that should have been for their wealth be unto them an occasion of falling.

verses.first_half: Let their eyes be blinded, that they may not see,
verses.second_half: and make their loins tremble continually.
verses.first_half_tle: Let their eyes be blinded, that they see not;
verses.second_half_tle: and ever bow thou down their backs.

verses.first_half: Pour out your indignation upon them,
verses.second_half: and let your wrathful displeasure overtake them.
verses.first_half_tle: Pour out thine indignation upon them,
verses.second_half_tle: and let thy wrathful displeasure take hold of them.

verses.first_half: Let their habitation be desolate,
verses.second_half: and let no one dwell in their tents.
verses.first_half_tle: Let their habitation be void,
verses.second_half_tle: and no man to dwell in their tents.

verses.first_half: For they persecute him whom you have stricken,
verses.second_half: and they talk of the pain of those you have wounded.
verses.first_half_tle: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten;
verses.second_half_tle: and they talk how they may vex them whom thou hast wounded.

verses.first_half: Lay to their charge guilt upon guilt,
verses.second_half: and let them not receive your vindication.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them fall from one wickedness to another,
verses.second_half_tle: and not come into thy righteousness.

verses.first_half: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living,
verses.second_half: and not be written among the righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be wiped out of the book of the living,
verses.second_half_tle: and not be written among the righteous.

verses.first_half: As for me, when I am poor and in pain,
verses.second_half: your help, O God, shall lift me up.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, when I am poor and in heaviness,
verses.second_half_tle: thy help, O God, shall lift me up.

verses.first_half: I will praise the Name of God with a song,
verses.second_half: and magnify it with thanksgiving.
verses.first_half_tle: I will praise the Name of God with a song,
verses.second_half_tle: and magnify it with thanksgiving.

verses.first_half: This also shall please the LORD
verses.second_half: more than an ox or a bullock that has horns and hooves.
verses.first_half_tle: This also shall please the LORD
verses.second_half_tle: better than a bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.first_half: The humble shall consider this and be glad;
verses.second_half: seek after God and your hearts shall live.
verses.first_half_tle: The humble shall consider this, and be glad:
verses.second_half_tle: seek ye after God, and your soul shall live.

verses.first_half: For the LORD hears the poor
verses.second_half: and does not despise his prisoners.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD heareth the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: and despiseth not his prisoners.

verses.first_half: Let heaven and earth praise him,
verses.second_half: the sea, and all that moves therein.
verses.first_half_tle: Let heaven and earth praise him:
verses.second_half_tle: the sea, and all that moveth therein.

verses.first_half: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah,
verses.second_half: that they may dwell there and have it in possession.
verses.first_half_tle: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah,
verses.second_half_tle: that men may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verses.first_half: The posterity of his servants shall inherit it,
verses.second_half: and those who love his Name shall dwell therein.
verses.first_half_tle: The posterity also of his servants shall inherit it;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that love his Name shall dwell therein.

verses.first_half: Hasten, O God, to deliver me;
verses.second_half: make haste to help me, O LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Haste thee, O God, to deliver me;
verses.second_half_tle: make haste to help me, O LORD.

verses.first_half: Let them be ashamed and confounded who seek after my life;
verses.second_half: let them be turned back and put to confusion who wish me evil.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be turned backward and put to confusion that wish me evil.

verses.first_half: Let them be soon brought to shame
verses.second_half: who cry over me, “Aha! Aha!”
verses.first_half_tle: Let them for their reward be soon brought to shame,
verses.second_half_tle: that cry over me, There! there!

verses.first_half: But let all those who seek you be joyful and glad in you;
verses.second_half: and let all who delight in your salvation say always, “The Lord be praised.”
verses.first_half_tle: But let all those that seek thee be joyful and glad in thee:
verses.second_half_tle: and let all such as delight in thy salvation say alway, The Lord be praised.

verses.first_half: As for me, I am poor and in misery;
verses.second_half: hasten to me, O God.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I am poor and in misery:
verses.second_half_tle: haste thee unto me, O God.

verses.first_half: You are my helper and my deliverer;
verses.second_half: O LORD, do not tarry.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my helper, and my redeemer:
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, make no long tarrying.

verses.first_half: In you, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.second_half: let me never be put to shame.
verses.first_half_tle: In thee, O LORD, have I put my trust; let me never be put to confusion,
verses.second_half_tle: but rid me and deliver me in thy righteousness; incline thine ear unto me, and save me.

verses.first_half: Rescue me and deliver me in your righteousness;
verses.second_half: incline your ear to me and save me.
verses.first_half_tle: Be thou my stronghold, whereunto I may alway resort:
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast promised to help me, for thou art my house of defense, and my castle.

verses.first_half: Be my rock and my refuge, where I may always return;
verses.second_half: you have promised to help me, for you are my stronghold and my fortress.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly,
verses.second_half_tle: out of the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.

verses.first_half: Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the ungodly,
verses.second_half: out of the hand of the unrighteous and the cruel.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, O Lord God, art the thing that I long for:
verses.second_half_tle: thou art my hope, even from my youth.

verses.first_half: For you, O LORD God, are the one I long for;
verses.second_half: you are my hope, even from my youth.
verses.first_half_tle: Through thee have I been holden up ever since I was born:
verses.second_half_tle: thou art he that took me out of my mother’s womb: my praise shall be alway of thee.

verses.first_half: Through you have I been upheld ever since I was born;
verses.second_half: you took me out of my mother’s womb; my praise shall be always of you.
verses.first_half_tle: I am become as it were a monster unto many,
verses.second_half_tle: but my sure trust is in thee.

verses.first_half: I have become a portent to many;
verses.second_half: but you are my refuge and my strength.
verses.first_half_tle: O let my mouth be filled with thy praise,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may sing of thy glory and honor all the day long.

verses.first_half: O let my mouth be filled with your praise,
verses.second_half: that I may sing of your glory all the day long.
verses.first_half_tle: Cast me not away in the time of age;
verses.second_half_tle: forsake me not when my strength faileth me.

verses.first_half: Cast me not away in the time of old age;
verses.second_half: forsake me not when my strength fails me.
verses.first_half_tle: For mine enemies speak against me;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that lay wait for my soul take their counsel together, saying,

verses.first_half: For my enemies speak against me, and those who lie in wait for my life take counsel together.
verses.second_half: They say, “God has forsaken him; pursue him and take him, for there is none to deliver him.”
verses.first_half_tle: God hath forsaken him;
verses.second_half_tle: persecute him, and take him, for there is none to deliver him.

verses.first_half: Go not far from me, O God;
verses.second_half: my God, make haste to help me.
verses.first_half_tle: Go not far from me, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: my God, haste thee to help me.

verses.first_half: Let those who are my adversaries be confounded and perish;
verses.second_half: let those who seek to do me evil be covered with shame and dishonor.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be confounded and perish that are against my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be covered with shame and dishonor that seek to do me evil.

verses.first_half: As for me, I will always patiently abide,
verses.second_half: and will praise you more and more.
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I will patiently abide alway,
verses.second_half_tle: and will praise thee more and more.

verses.first_half: My mouth shall speak daily of your righteousness and salvation,
verses.second_half: for I know not the end of them.
verses.first_half_tle: My mouth shall daily speak of thy righteousness and salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: for I know no end thereof.

verses.first_half: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God,
verses.second_half: and will make mention of your righteousness, yours alone.
verses.first_half_tle: I will go forth in the strength of the Lord God,
verses.second_half_tle: and will make mention of thy righteousness only.

verses.first_half: You, O God, have taught me from my youth;
verses.second_half: even to this day I am telling of your wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, O God, hast taught me from my youth up until now;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore will I tell of thy wondrous works.

verses.first_half: Forsake me not, O God, in my old age, when I am gray-headed,
verses.second_half: until I have proclaimed your strength to this generation, and your power to all those who are yet to come.
verses.first_half_tle: Forsake me not, O God, in mine old age, when I am gray-headed,
verses.second_half_tle: until I have showed thy strength unto this generation, and thy power to all them that are yet for to come.

verses.first_half: Your righteousness, O God, reaches to the heavens;
verses.second_half: you have done great things. Who is like you, O God?
verses.first_half_tle: Thy righteousness, O God, is very high,
verses.second_half_tle: and great things are they that thou hast done: O God, who is like unto thee!

verses.first_half: Oh, what great troubles and adversities you have shown me! And yet you have turned and refreshed me;
verses.second_half: indeed, you have brought me again from the depths of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: O what great troubles and adversities hast thou showed me! and yet didst thou turn and refresh me;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and broughtest me from the deep of the earth again.

verses.first_half: You have brought me to great honor
verses.second_half: and comforted me on every side;
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast brought me to great honor,
verses.second_half_tle: and comforted me on every side:

verses.first_half: Therefore will I praise you and your faithfulness, O God, playing on a stringed instrument;
verses.second_half: to you will I sing with the harp, O Holy One of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore will I praise thee, and thy faithfulness, O God, playing upon an instrument of music:
verses.second_half_tle: unto thee will I sing upon the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.

verses.first_half: My lips will rejoice when I sing to you,
verses.second_half: and so will my soul, which you have delivered.
verses.first_half_tle: My lips will be glad when I sing unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and so will my soul whom thou hast delivered.

verses.first_half: My tongue also shall speak of your righteousness all the day long,
verses.second_half: for they are confounded and brought to shame who seek to do me evil.
verses.first_half_tle: My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long;
verses.second_half_tle: for they are confounded and brought unto shame that seek to do me evil.

verses.first_half: Give the King your judgments, O God,
verses.second_half: and your righteousness to the King’s son.
verses.first_half_tle: Give the King thy judgments, O God,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy righteousness unto the King’s son.

verses.first_half: Then shall he judge your people with righteousness
verses.second_half: and defend the poor with justice.
verses.first_half_tle: Then shall he judge thy people according unto right,
verses.second_half_tle: and defend the poor.

verses.first_half: The mountains also shall bring peace,
verses.second_half: and the little hills righteousness to the people.
verses.first_half_tle: The mountains also shall bring peace,
verses.second_half_tle: and the little hills righteousness unto the people.

verses.first_half: He shall vindicate the poor among the people,
verses.second_half: defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrongdoer.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall keep the simple folk by their right,
verses.second_half_tle: defend the children of the poor, and punish the wrong doer.

verses.first_half: They shall fear you as long as the sun and moon endure,
verses.second_half: from one generation to another.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall fear thee, as long as the sun and moon endureth,
verses.second_half_tle: from one generation to another.

verses.first_half: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass,
verses.second_half: even as showers that water the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall come down like the rain upon the mown grass,
verses.second_half_tle: even as the drops that water the earth.

verses.first_half: In his time shall the righteous flourish,
verses.second_half: even an abundance of peace, so long as the moon endures.
verses.first_half_tle: In his time shall the righteous flourish;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and abundance of peace, so long as the moon endureth.

verses.first_half: His dominion shall be also from one sea to the other,
verses.second_half: and from the river unto the world’s end.
verses.first_half_tle: His dominion shall be also from the one sea to the other,
verses.second_half_tle: and from the River unto the world’s end.

verses.first_half: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him;
verses.second_half: his enemies shall lick the dust.
verses.first_half_tle: They that dwell in the wilderness shall kneel before him;
verses.second_half_tle: his enemies shall lick the dust.

verses.first_half: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall give presents;
verses.second_half: the kings of Arabia and Seba shall bring gifts.
verses.first_half_tle: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall give presents;
verses.second_half_tle: the kings of Arabia and Saba shall bring gifts.

verses.first_half: All kings shall fall down before him;
verses.second_half: all nations shall do him service.
verses.first_half_tle: All kings shall fall down before him;
verses.second_half_tle: all nations shall do him service.

verses.first_half: For he shall deliver the poor when he cries,
verses.second_half: the needy also, and the one that has no helper.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall deliver the poor when he crieth;
verses.second_half_tle: the needy also, and him that hath no helper.

verses.first_half: He shall be favorable to the lowly and needy,
verses.second_half: and shall preserve the lives of the poor.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall be favorable to the simple and needy,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall preserve the souls of the poor.

verses.first_half: He shall deliver them from falsehood and wrong,
verses.second_half: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall deliver their souls from falsehood and wrong;
verses.second_half_tle: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

verses.first_half: Long may he live! And unto him shall be given the gold of Arabia;
verses.second_half: prayer shall ever be made unto him, and daily shall he be blessed.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall live, and unto him shall be given of the gold of Arabia;
verses.second_half_tle: prayer shall be made ever unto him, and daily shall he be praised.

verses.first_half: There shall be an abundance of grain on the earth, thick upon the hilltops;
verses.second_half: its fruit shall flourish like Lebanon, its grain like the grass upon the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall be an heap of corn in the earth, high upon the hills; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon:
verses.second_half_tle: and they of the city shall flourish like grass upon the earth.

verses.first_half: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain as long as the sun.
verses.second_half: All the nations shall be blessed through him and shall call him blessed.
verses.first_half_tle: His Name shall endure for ever; his Name shall remain under the sun among the posterities, which shall be blessed in him;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the nations shall praise him.

verses.first_half: Blessed be the LORD God, even the God of Israel,
verses.second_half: who alone does wondrous things;
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed be the Lord God, even the God of Israel,
verses.second_half_tle: which only doeth wondrous things;

verses.first_half: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever;
verses.second_half: and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.
verses.first_half_tle: And blessed be the Name of his majesty for ever:
verses.second_half_tle: and all the earth shall be filled with his majesty. Amen, Amen.

verses.first_half: Truly, God is loving to Israel,
verses.second_half: even to those who have a clean heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Truly, God is loving unto Israel:
verses.second_half_tle: even unto such as are of a clean heart.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, my feet had almost stumbled;
verses.second_half: my steps had nearly slipped.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, my feet were almost gone,
verses.second_half_tle: my treadings had well-nigh slipped.

verses.first_half: For I was envious of the proud
verses.second_half: when I saw the ungodly in such prosperity.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? I was grieved at the wicked:
verses.second_half_tle: I do also see the ungodly in such prosperity.

verses.first_half: For they are in no fear of death,
verses.second_half: but their bodies are healthy and strong.
verses.first_half_tle: For they are in no peril of death;
verses.second_half_tle: but are lusty and strong.

verses.first_half: They come to no misfortune like other folk,
verses.second_half: neither are they afflicted like others.
verses.first_half_tle: They come in no misfortune like other folk;
verses.second_half_tle: neither are they plagued like other men.

verses.first_half: Therefore they wear pride as a necklace,
verses.second_half: and they wrap themselves with violence as with a garment.
verses.first_half_tle: And this is the cause that they are so holden with pride,
verses.second_half_tle: and cruelty covereth them as a garment.

verses.first_half: Their eyes swell with greed,
verses.second_half: and their hearts overflow with wicked thoughts.
verses.first_half_tle: Their eyes swell with fatness,
verses.second_half_tle: and they do even what they lust.

verses.first_half: Their talk is malice and mockery;
verses.second_half: they have proud looks, and tyrannous words are on their lips.
verses.first_half_tle: They corrupt other, and speak of wicked blasphemy;
verses.second_half_tle: their talking is against the Most High.

verses.first_half: For they set their mouth against the heavens,
verses.second_half: and their evil speech spreads through the world.
verses.first_half_tle: For they stretch forth their mouth unto the heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: and their tongue goeth through the world.

verses.first_half: Therefore the people turn to them,
verses.second_half: and find no fault in them.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore fall the people unto them,
verses.second_half_tle: and thereout suck they no small advantage.

verses.first_half: They say, “How should God perceive it?
verses.second_half: Is there knowledge in the Most High?”
verses.first_half_tle: Tush, say they, how should God perceive it?
verses.second_half_tle: is there knowledge in the Most High?

verses.first_half: Behold, these are the ungodly;
verses.second_half: they prosper in their ways, and they have riches in possession.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, these are the ungodly,
verses.second_half_tle: these prosper in the world, and these have riches in possession:

verses.first_half: I said, “Surely in vain have I cleansed my heart
verses.second_half: and washed my hands in innocence.”
verses.first_half_tle: And I said, Then have I cleansed my heart in vain,
verses.second_half_tle: and washed my hands in innocency.

verses.first_half: All the day long have I been afflicted,
verses.second_half: and chastened every morning.
verses.first_half_tle: All the day long have I been punished,
verses.second_half_tle: and chastened every morning.

verses.first_half: Indeed, had I spoken as they do,
verses.second_half: then would I have betrayed the generation of your children.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, and I had almost said even as they;
verses.second_half_tle: but lo, then I should have condemned the generation of thy children.

verses.first_half: When I sought to understand this,
verses.second_half: it was too hard for me,
verses.first_half_tle: Then thought I to understand this;
verses.second_half_tle: but it was too hard for me,

verses.first_half: Until I went into the sanctuary of God;
verses.second_half: then I understood their end.
verses.first_half_tle: Until I went into the sanctuary of God:
verses.second_half_tle: then understood I the end of these men;

verses.first_half: Surely, you set them in slippery places,
verses.second_half: and cast them down, and destroy them.
verses.first_half_tle: Namely, how thou dost set them in slippery places,
verses.second_half_tle: and castest them down, and destroyest them.

verses.first_half: Oh, how suddenly are they consumed;
verses.second_half: they perish and come to a fearful end.
verses.first_half_tle: O how suddenly do they consume,
verses.second_half_tle: perish, and come to a fearful end!

verses.first_half: Indeed, like a dream when one awakens,
verses.second_half: so shall you make their image vanish out of the city.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, even like as a dream when one awaketh;
