verses.second_half_tle: so shalt thou make their image to vanish out of the city.

verses.first_half: Thus my heart was grieved,
verses.second_half: and I was wounded within;
verses.first_half_tle: Thus my heart was grieved,
verses.second_half_tle: and it went even through my reins.

verses.first_half: So foolish was I, and ignorant,
verses.second_half: as if I were a beast before you.
verses.first_half_tle: So foolish was I, and ignorant,
verses.second_half_tle: even as it were a beast before thee.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, I am always with you,
verses.second_half: for you hold me by my right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, I am alway by thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast holden me by my right hand.

verses.first_half: You shall guide me with your counsel,
verses.second_half: and after that receive me with glory.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel,
verses.second_half_tle: and after that receive me with glory.

verses.first_half: Whom have I in heaven but you?
verses.second_half: And there is no one on earth whom I desire in comparison with you.
verses.first_half_tle: Whom have I in heaven but thee?
verses.second_half_tle: and there is none upon earth that I desire in comparison of thee.

verses.first_half: Though my flesh and my heart fail me,
verses.second_half: God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: My flesh and my heart faileth;
verses.second_half_tle: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.

verses.first_half: For behold, those who forsake you shall perish;
verses.second_half: you destroy all those who are unfaithful to you.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, they that forsake thee shall perish;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast destroyed all them that are unfaithful unto thee.

verses.first_half: But it is good for me to hold fast to God, to put my trust in the Lord God,
verses.second_half: and to speak of all your works in the gates of the city of Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: But it is good for me to hold me fast by God, to put my trust in the Lord God,
verses.second_half_tle: and to speak of all thy works in the gates of the daughter of Zion.

verses.first_half: O God, why have you utterly cast us off?
verses.second_half: Why is your wrath so hot against the sheep of your pasture?
verses.first_half_tle: O God, wherefore art thou absent from us so long?
verses.second_half_tle: why is thy wrath so hot against the sheep of thy pasture?

verses.first_half: O think upon your congregation
verses.second_half: whom you have purchased and redeemed of old.
verses.first_half_tle: O think upon thy congregation,
verses.second_half_tle: whom thou hast purchased, and redeemed of old.

verses.first_half: Think upon the tribe of your inheritance,
verses.second_half: and Mount Zion, where you have dwelt.
verses.first_half_tle: Think upon the tribe of thine inheritance,
verses.second_half_tle: and Mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

verses.first_half: Draw near and behold how all is made desolate
verses.second_half: and how the enemy has destroyed all that is in your sanctuary.
verses.first_half_tle: Lift up thy feet, that thou mayest utterly destroy every enemy,
verses.second_half_tle: which hath done evil in thy sanctuary.

verses.first_half: Your adversaries roar in the midst of your holy place
verses.second_half: and set up their banners as tokens of victory.
verses.first_half_tle: Thine adversaries roar in the midst of thy congregations,
verses.second_half_tle: and set up their banners for tokens.

verses.first_half: Like hewers of timber in a thicket of trees,
verses.second_half: so have they broken down all the carved work with axes and hammers.
verses.first_half_tle: He that hewed timber afore out of the thick trees,
verses.second_half_tle: was known to bring it to an excellent work.

verses.first_half: They have set fire to your holy place
verses.second_half: and have defiled the dwelling place of your Name, even to the ground.
verses.first_half_tle: But now they break down all the carved work thereof
verses.second_half_tle: with axes and hammers.

verses.first_half: They said in their hearts, “Let us make havoc of them altogether.”
verses.second_half: Thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.
verses.first_half_tle: They have set fire upon thy holy places,
verses.second_half_tle: and have defiled the dwelling place of thy Name, even unto the ground.

verses.first_half: We do not see any signs; there is not one prophet anymore;
verses.second_half: there is no one who knows how long these things shall continue.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, they said in their hearts, Let us make havoc of them altogether:
verses.second_half_tle: thus have they burnt up all the houses of God in the land.

verses.first_half: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonor?
verses.second_half: How long shall the enemy blaspheme your Name, for ever?
verses.first_half_tle: We see not our tokens; there is not one prophet more;
verses.second_half_tle: no, not one is there among us, that understandeth any more.

verses.first_half: Why do you withdraw your hand?
verses.second_half: Why do you not take your right hand out of your bosom to consume the enemy?
verses.first_half_tle: O God, how long shall the adversary do this dishonor?
verses.second_half_tle: shall the enemy blaspheme thy Name for ever?

verses.first_half: For God is my King of old;
verses.second_half: he is the one bringing help upon the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Why withdrawest thou thy hand?
verses.second_half_tle: why pluckest thou not thy right hand out of thy bosom to consume the enemy?

verses.first_half: You divided the sea through your power;
verses.second_half: you broke the heads of the dragons in the waters.
verses.first_half_tle: For God is my King of old;
verses.second_half_tle: the help that is done upon earth, he doeth it himself.

verses.first_half: You smote the heads of Leviathan in pieces
verses.second_half: and gave him to be food for the people in the wilderness.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou didst divide the sea through thy power;
verses.second_half_tle: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

verses.first_half: You brought fountains and waters out of the hard rocks,
verses.second_half: and you dried up mighty waters.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou smotest the heads of leviathan in pieces,
verses.second_half_tle: and gavest him to be meat for the people of the wilderness.

verses.first_half: The day is yours, and the night is yours;
verses.second_half: you have prepared the light and the sun.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou broughtest out fountains and waters out of the hard rocks;
verses.second_half_tle: thou driedst up mighty waters.

verses.first_half: You have set all the borders of the earth;
verses.second_half: you have made summer and winter.
verses.first_half_tle: The day is thine, and the night is thine;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

verses.first_half: Remember this, O LORD, how the enemy scoffed,
verses.second_half: and how the foolish people have blasphemed your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast made summer and winter.

verses.first_half: Deliver not the soul of your turtledove to the wild beasts,
verses.second_half: and forget not for ever the lives of your poor.
verses.first_half_tle: Remember this, O LORD, how the enemy hath rebuked;
verses.second_half_tle: and how the foolish people hath blasphemed thy Name.

verses.first_half: Look upon your covenant,
verses.second_half: for the dark places of the earth are full of violence.
verses.first_half_tle: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the enemies;
verses.second_half_tle: and forget not the congregation of the poor for ever.

verses.first_half: Let not the oppressed go away ashamed,
verses.second_half: but let the poor and needy give praise to your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Look upon the covenant;
verses.second_half_tle: for all the earth is full of darkness and cruel habitations.

verses.first_half: Arise, O God, maintain your own cause;
verses.second_half: remember how the foolish one blasphemes you daily.
verses.first_half_tle: O let not the simple go away ashamed;
verses.second_half_tle: but let the poor and needy give praise unto thy Name.

verses.first_half: Forget not the voice of your enemies,
verses.second_half: nor the tumult of those who hate you, which increases ever more and more.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, O God, maintain thine own cause;
verses.second_half_tle: remember how the foolish man blasphemeth thee daily.

verses.first_half_tle: Forget not the voice of thine enemies:
verses.second_half_tle: the presumption of them that hate thee increaseth ever more and more.

verses.first_half: Unto you, O God, do we give thanks;
verses.second_half: indeed, unto you do we give thanks.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, unto thee do we give thanks.

verses.first_half: Those who call upon your Name
verses.second_half: declare your wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy Name also is so nigh;
verses.second_half_tle: and that do thy wondrous works declare.

verses.first_half: “Surely at the time which I appoint,
verses.second_half: I, the Lord, will judge according to what is right.
verses.first_half_tle: In the appointed time, saith God,
verses.second_half_tle: I shall judge according unto right.

verses.first_half: The earth shakes with fear, and all that dwell therein;
verses.second_half: but I, even I, have made firm its pillars.
verses.first_half_tle: The earth is weak, and all the inhabiters thereof:
verses.second_half_tle: I bear up the pillars of it.

verses.first_half: I say to the proud, ‘You should not boast!’
verses.second_half: And to the ungodly, ‘Do not lift up your horn!
verses.first_half_tle: I said unto the fools, Deal not so madly;
verses.second_half_tle: and to the ungodly, Set not up your horn.

verses.first_half: Do not lift up your horn on high,
verses.second_half: nor speak with a stiff neck.’”
verses.first_half_tle: Set not up your horn on high,
verses.second_half_tle: and speak not with a stiff neck.

verses.first_half: For help comes neither from the east nor from the west,
verses.second_half: nor yet from the wilderness or the mountains.
verses.first_half_tle: For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west,
verses.second_half_tle: nor yet from the south.

verses.first_half: For it is God who is the Judge;
verses.second_half: he puts down one and lifts up another.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? God is the Judge;
verses.second_half_tle: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.

verses.first_half: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is foaming;
verses.second_half: it is fully mixed, and he pours it out.
verses.first_half_tle: For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is red;
verses.second_half_tle: it is full mixed, and he poureth out of the same.

verses.first_half: As for the dregs of it,
verses.second_half: all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them and drain them out.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the dregs thereof,
verses.second_half_tle: all the ungodly of the earth shall drink them, and suck them out.

verses.first_half: But I will magnify the God of Jacob
verses.second_half: and praise him for ever and ever.
verses.first_half_tle: But I will talk of the God of Jacob,
verses.second_half_tle: and praise him for ever.

verses.first_half: All the horns of the ungodly will I break,
verses.second_half: but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
verses.first_half_tle: All the horns of the ungodly also will I break,
verses.second_half_tle: and the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

verses.first_half: In Judah God is known;
verses.second_half: his Name is great in Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: In Judah is God known;
verses.second_half_tle: his Name is great in Israel.

verses.first_half: At Salem is his tabernacle,
verses.second_half: and his dwelling is in Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: At Salem is his tabernacle,
verses.second_half_tle: and his dwelling in Zion.

verses.first_half: There he broke the arrows of the bow,
verses.second_half: the shield, the sword, and the weapons of battle.
verses.first_half_tle: There brake he the arrows of the bow,
verses.second_half_tle: the shield, the sword, and the battle.

verses.first_half: You are of more honor and might
verses.second_half: than the everlasting hills.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art glorious in might,
verses.second_half_tle: when thou comest from the hills of the robbers.

verses.first_half: The strong of heart have been despoiled; they have slept their sleep;
verses.second_half: and all those whose hands were mighty have lost their strength.
verses.first_half_tle: The proud are robbed, they have slept their sleep;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the men whose hands were mighty have found nothing.

verses.first_half: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
verses.second_half: both the chariot and horse lie stunned upon the ground.
verses.first_half_tle: At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob,
verses.second_half_tle: both the chariot and horse are fallen.

verses.first_half: You, even you, are to be feared,
verses.second_half: and who may stand in your sight when you are angry?
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, even thou art to be feared;
verses.second_half_tle: and who may stand in thy sight when thou art angry?

verses.first_half: You caused your judgment to be heard from heaven;
verses.second_half: the earth trembled and was silent,
verses.first_half_tle: Thou didst cause thy judgment to be heard from heaven;
verses.second_half_tle: the earth trembled, and was still,

verses.first_half: When God arose to judgment
verses.second_half: and to help all the meek upon earth.
verses.first_half_tle: When God arose to judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: and to help all the meek upon earth.

verses.first_half: The wrath of man shall be turned to your praise,
verses.second_half: and the remnant of fierceness you shall restrain.
verses.first_half_tle: The fierceness of man shall turn to thy praise;
verses.second_half_tle: and the fierceness of them shalt thou refrain.

verses.first_half: Make a vow unto the LORD your God and keep it, all you who are round about him;
verses.second_half: bring gifts unto him who is worthy to be feared.
verses.first_half_tle: Promise unto the LORD your God, and keep it, all ye that are round about him;
verses.second_half_tle: bring presents unto him that ought to be feared.

verses.first_half: He restrains the spirit of princes,
verses.second_half: and is feared among the kings of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall refrain the spirit of princes,
verses.second_half_tle: and is wonderful among the kings of the earth.

verses.first_half: I will cry unto God with my voice;
verses.second_half: even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will cry unto God with my voice;
verses.second_half_tle: even unto God will I cry with my voice, and he shall hearken unto me.

verses.first_half: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord;
verses.second_half: my hands were stretched out in the night without rest; my soul refused comfort.
verses.first_half_tle: In the time of my trouble I sought the Lord:
verses.second_half_tle: I stretched forth my hands unto him, and ceased not in the night season; my soul refused comfort.

verses.first_half: When I think upon God, I groan;
verses.second_half: when I ponder, my spirit grows faint.
verses.first_half_tle: When I am in heaviness, I will think upon God;
verses.second_half_tle: when my heart is vexed, I will complain.

verses.first_half: You hold my eyelids open;
verses.second_half: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou holdest mine eyes waking:
verses.second_half_tle: I am so feeble that I cannot speak.

verses.first_half: I consider the days of old;
verses.second_half: I call to remembrance the years that are past.
verses.first_half_tle: I have considered the days of old,
verses.second_half_tle: and the years that are past.

verses.first_half: In the night I commune with my own heart;
verses.second_half: I meditate and search my spirit.
verses.first_half_tle: I call to remembrance my song,
verses.second_half_tle: and in the night I commune with mine own heart, and search out my spirit.

verses.first_half: Will the Lord cast me off for ever,
verses.second_half: and will he no more show his favor?
verses.first_half_tle: Will the Lord absent himself for ever?
verses.second_half_tle: and will he be no more intreated?

verses.first_half: Is his mercy gone for ever,
verses.second_half: and has his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?
verses.first_half_tle: Is his mercy clean gone for ever?
verses.second_half_tle: and is his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

verses.first_half: Has God forgotten to be gracious,
verses.second_half: and will he withhold his loving-kindness in displeasure?
verses.first_half_tle: Hath God forgotten to be gracious?
verses.second_half_tle: and will he shut up his loving-kindness in displeasure?

verses.first_half: And I said, “Has his right hand become weak?
verses.second_half: Has the hand of the Most High lost its strength?”
verses.first_half_tle: And I said, It is mine own infirmity;
verses.second_half_tle: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most Highest.

verses.first_half: I will remember the works of the LORD,
verses.second_half: and call to mind your wonders of old time.
verses.first_half_tle: I will remember the works of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and call to mind thy wonders of old time.

verses.first_half: I will think also of all your works,
verses.second_half: and my talk shall be of your deeds.
verses.first_half_tle: I will think also of all thy works,
verses.second_half_tle: and my talking shall be of thy doings.

verses.first_half: Your way, O God, is holy;
verses.second_half: who is so great a God as our God?
verses.first_half_tle: Thy way, O God, is holy:
verses.second_half_tle: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.first_half: You are the God who does wonders,
verses.second_half: and have declared your power among the peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art the God that doest wonders,
verses.second_half_tle: and hast declared thy power among the peoples.

verses.first_half: You have mightily delivered your people,
verses.second_half: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast mightily delivered thy people,
verses.second_half_tle: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

verses.first_half: The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and were afraid;
verses.second_half: the depths also were troubled.
verses.first_half_tle: The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee, and were afraid;
verses.second_half_tle: the depths also were troubled.

verses.first_half: The clouds poured out water, the skies thundered,
verses.second_half: and your arrows flashed on every side.
verses.first_half_tle: The clouds poured out water, the air thundered,
verses.second_half_tle: and thine arrows went abroad.

verses.first_half: The voice of your thunder was heard in the whirlwind; the lightning lit up the world;
verses.second_half: the earth was moved and shook.
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of thy thunder was heard round about:
verses.second_half_tle: the lightnings shone upon the ground; the earth was moved, and shook withal.

verses.first_half: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters,
verses.second_half: yet your footsteps were not seen.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy way is in the sea, and thy paths in the great waters,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy footsteps are not known.

verses.first_half: You led your people like sheep
verses.second_half: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou leddest thy people like sheep,
verses.second_half_tle: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.first_half: Hear my teaching, O my people;
verses.second_half: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my law, O my people;
verses.second_half_tle: incline your ears unto the words of my mouth.

verses.first_half: I will open my mouth in a parable;
verses.second_half: I will utter dark sayings of old,
verses.first_half_tle: I will open my mouth in a parable;
verses.second_half_tle: I will declare hard sentences of old;

verses.first_half: Which we have heard and known,
verses.second_half: and such as our forefathers have told us,
verses.first_half_tle: Which we have heard and known,
verses.second_half_tle: and such as our fathers have told us;

verses.first_half: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come,
verses.second_half: but show the honor of the LORD, his mighty and wonderful works that he has done.
verses.first_half_tle: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come;
verses.second_half_tle: but to show the honor of the LORD, his mighty and wonderful works that he hath done.

verses.first_half: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law,
verses.second_half: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,
verses.first_half_tle: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law,
verses.second_half_tle: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children;

verses.first_half: That their posterity might know it,
verses.second_half: and the children which were yet unborn;
verses.first_half_tle: That their posterity might know it,
verses.second_half_tle: and the children which were yet unborn;

verses.first_half: With the intent that when they came up
verses.second_half: they might show it to their children,
verses.first_half_tle: To the intent that when they came up,
verses.second_half_tle: they might show their children the same;

verses.first_half: That they might put their trust in God,
verses.second_half: and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments;
verses.first_half_tle: That they might put their trust in God;
verses.second_half_tle: and not to forget the works of God, but to keep his commandments;

verses.first_half: And not be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation,
verses.second_half: a generation that did not set their heart aright, and whose spirit did not cleave steadfastly to God,
verses.first_half_tle: And not to be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation;
verses.second_half_tle: a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit clave not stedfastly unto God;

verses.first_half: Like the children of Ephraim, archers carrying bows,
verses.second_half: who turned back in the day of battle.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the children of Ephraim;
verses.second_half_tle: who being harnessed, and carrying bows, turned themselves back in the day of battle.

verses.first_half: They did not keep the covenant of God,
verses.second_half: and would not walk in his law,
verses.first_half_tle: They kept not the covenant of God,
verses.second_half_tle: and would not walk in his law;

verses.first_half: But forgot what he had done,
verses.second_half: and the wonderful works that he had shown them.
verses.first_half_tle: But forgat what he had done,
verses.second_half_tle: and the wonderful works that he had showed for them.

verses.first_half: Marvelous things he did in the sight of our forefathers,
verses.second_half: in the land of Egypt, even in the field of Zoan.
verses.first_half_tle: Marvelous things did he in the sight of our forefathers, in the land of Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: even in the field of Zoan.

verses.first_half: He divided the sea and let them go through;
verses.second_half: he made the waters to stand in a heap.
verses.first_half_tle: He divided the sea, and let them go through;
verses.second_half_tle: he made the waters to stand on an heap.

verses.first_half: In the daytime he led them with a cloud,
verses.second_half: and all the night through with a light of fire.
verses.first_half_tle: In the daytime also he led them with a cloud,
verses.second_half_tle: and all the night through with a light of fire.

verses.first_half: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness
verses.second_half: and gave them drink in abundance, as out of the great deep.
verses.first_half_tle: He clave the hard rocks in the wilderness,
verses.second_half_tle: and gave them drink thereof, as it had been out of the great depth.

verses.first_half: He brought waters out of the stony rock,
verses.second_half: so that it gushed out like the rivers.
verses.first_half_tle: He brought waters out of the stony rock,
verses.second_half_tle: so that it gushed out like the rivers.

verses.first_half: Yet for all this they sinned more against him,
verses.second_half: and provoked the Most High in the wilderness.
verses.first_half_tle: Yet for all this they sinned more against him,
verses.second_half_tle: and provoked the Most Highest in the wilderness.

verses.first_half: They tested God in their hearts
verses.second_half: and demanded food for their craving.
verses.first_half_tle: They tempted God in their hearts,
verses.second_half_tle: and required meat for their lust.

verses.first_half: They spoke against God, saying,
verses.second_half: “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
verses.first_half_tle: They spake against God also, saying,
verses.second_half_tle: Shall God prepare a table in the wilderness?

verses.first_half: Indeed, he smote the stony rock, so that water gushed out, and the streams overflowed;
verses.second_half: but can he give bread also, or provide meat for his people?”
verses.first_half_tle: He smote the stony rock indeed, that the water gushed out, and the streams flowed withal;
verses.second_half_tle: but can he give bread also, or provide flesh for his people?

verses.first_half: When the LORD heard this, he was full of wrath;
verses.second_half: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and there flared up fierce anger against Israel,
verses.first_half_tle: When the LORD heard this, he was wroth;
verses.second_half_tle: so the fire was kindled in Jacob, and there came up heavy displeasure against Israel;

verses.first_half: Because they did not believe in God,
verses.second_half: and did not put their trust in his help.
verses.first_half_tle: Because they believed not in God,
verses.second_half_tle: and put not their trust in his help.

verses.first_half: So he commanded the clouds above
verses.second_half: and opened the doors of heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: So he commanded the clouds above,
verses.second_half_tle: and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.first_half: He rained down manna upon them to eat
verses.second_half: and gave them food from heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: He rained down manna also upon them for to eat,
verses.second_half_tle: and gave them food from heaven.

verses.first_half: So mortals ate the bread of angels;
verses.second_half: for he sent them food enough.
verses.first_half_tle: So man did eat angels’ food;
verses.second_half_tle: for he sent them meat enough.

verses.first_half: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,
verses.second_half: and through his power he brought in the south wind.
verses.first_half_tle: He caused the east wind to blow under heaven;
verses.second_half_tle: and through his power he brought in the southwest wind.

verses.first_half: He rained meat upon them as thick as dust
verses.second_half: and feathered fowl like the sand of the sea.
verses.first_half_tle: He rained flesh upon them as thick as dust,
verses.second_half_tle: and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea.

verses.first_half: He let it fall among their tents,
verses.second_half: even round about their habitations.
verses.first_half_tle: He let it fall among their tents,
verses.second_half_tle: even round about their habitation.

verses.first_half: So they ate and were well filled, for he gave them what they desired;
verses.second_half: they did not deny themselves their cravings,
verses.first_half_tle: So they did eat, and were well filled; for he gave them their own desire:
verses.second_half_tle: they were not disappointed of their lust.

verses.first_half: But while the food was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the mightiest of them,
verses.second_half: and struck down the young men of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: But while the meat was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the wealthiest of them;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, and smote down the chosen men that were in Israel.

verses.first_half: But for all this they sinned yet more,
verses.second_half: and did not believe his wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: But for all this they sinned yet more,
verses.second_half_tle: and believed not his wondrous works.

verses.first_half: Therefore he brought their days to an end in vanity
verses.second_half: and their years in trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity,
verses.second_half_tle: and their years in trouble.

verses.first_half: When he slew them, they sought him,
verses.second_half: and returned, and inquired after God.
verses.first_half_tle: When he slew them, they sought him,
verses.second_half_tle: and turned them early, and inquired after God.

verses.first_half: And they remembered that God was their rock,
verses.second_half: and the Most High God was their redeemer.
verses.first_half_tle: And they remembered that God was their strength,
verses.second_half_tle: and that the High God was their redeemer.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, they flattered him with their mouth
verses.second_half: and spoke deceitfully to him with their tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, they did but flatter him with their mouth,
verses.second_half_tle: and dissembled with him in their tongue.

verses.first_half: For their heart was not fixed on him,
verses.second_half: neither did they continue steadfast in his covenant.
verses.first_half_tle: For their heart was not whole with him,
verses.second_half_tle: neither continued they stedfast in his covenant.

verses.first_half: But he was so merciful that he forgave their iniquities
verses.second_half: and did not destroy them.
verses.first_half_tle: But he was so merciful, that he forgave their misdeeds,
verses.second_half_tle: and destroyed them not.

verses.first_half: Indeed, many times he turned his wrath away
verses.second_half: and would not permit his displeasure to arise.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, many a time turned he his wrath away,
verses.second_half_tle: and would not suffer his whole displeasure to arise.

verses.first_half: For he considered that they were but flesh,
verses.second_half: that they were even as the wind that passes away and comes not again.
verses.first_half_tle: For he considered that they were but flesh,
verses.second_half_tle: and that they were even a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.

verses.first_half: Many times they provoked him in the wilderness
verses.second_half: and grieved him in the desert.
verses.first_half_tle: Many a time did they provoke him in the wilderness,
verses.second_half_tle: and grieved him in the desert.

verses.first_half: They turned back, and tested God,
verses.second_half: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: They turned back, and tempted God,
verses.second_half_tle: and provoked the Holy One in Israel.

verses.first_half: They remembered not his power,
verses.second_half: nor the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy,
verses.first_half_tle: They thought not of his hand,
verses.second_half_tle: and of the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy;

verses.first_half: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt
verses.second_half: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.
verses.first_half_tle: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

verses.first_half: He turned their waters into blood,
verses.second_half: so that they might not drink of the rivers.
verses.first_half_tle: He turned their waters into blood,
verses.second_half_tle: so that they might not drink of the rivers.

verses.first_half: He sent flies among them, which devoured them up,
verses.second_half: and frogs to destroy them.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent flies among them, and devoured them up;
verses.second_half_tle: and frogs to destroy them.

verses.first_half: He gave their fruit to the grasshopper
verses.second_half: and their labor to the locust.
verses.first_half_tle: He gave their fruit unto the caterpillar,
verses.second_half_tle: and their labour unto the grasshopper.

verses.first_half: He destroyed their vines with hailstones
verses.second_half: and their sycamore trees with the frost.
verses.first_half_tle: He destroyed their vines with hailstones,
verses.second_half_tle: and their mulberry trees with the frost.

verses.first_half: He smote their cattle also with hailstones
verses.second_half: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.
verses.first_half_tle: He smote their cattle also with hailstones,
verses.second_half_tle: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

verses.first_half: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble,
verses.second_half: sending these destroying angels among them.
verses.first_half_tle: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble:
verses.second_half_tle: and sent evil angels among them.

verses.first_half: He made a way for his indignation, and did not spare their soul from death,
verses.second_half: but gave their life over to the pestilence,
verses.first_half_tle: He made a way to his indignation, and spared not their soul from death;
verses.second_half_tle: but gave their life over to the pestilence;

verses.first_half: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt,
verses.second_half: the firstfruits of their strength in the dwellings of Ham.
verses.first_half_tle: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: the most principal and mightiest in the dwellings of Ham.

verses.first_half: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep
verses.second_half: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep,
verses.second_half_tle: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.first_half: He brought them out safely, and they were not afraid;
verses.second_half: he overwhelmed their enemies with the sea,
verses.first_half_tle: He brought them out safely, that they should not fear,
verses.second_half_tle: and overwhelmed their enemies with the sea.

verses.first_half: And brought them within the borders of his holy land,
verses.second_half: to his mountain which he obtained with his right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: And brought them within the borders of his sanctuary,
verses.second_half_tle: even to this mountain, which he purchased with his right hand.

verses.first_half: He cast out the nations before them,
verses.second_half: and caused their land to be divided among them for an inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
verses.first_half_tle: He cast out the heathen also before them,
verses.second_half_tle: caused their land to be divided among them for an heritage, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.first_half: But they tested and displeased the Most High God,
verses.second_half: and did not keep his testimonies,
verses.first_half_tle: Yet they tempted and displeased the Most High God,
verses.second_half_tle: and kept not his testimonies.

verses.first_half: But turned their backs and fell away like their forefathers,
verses.second_half: twisting aside like a broken bow.
verses.first_half_tle: They turned their backs, and fell away like their forefathers;
verses.second_half_tle: starting aside like a broken bow.

verses.first_half: For they grieved him with their hill altars
verses.second_half: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.
verses.first_half_tle: For they grieved him with their hill-altars,
verses.second_half_tle: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

verses.first_half: When God heard this, he was full of wrath
verses.second_half: and utterly rejected Israel,
verses.first_half_tle: When God heard this, he was wroth,
verses.second_half_tle: and took sore displeasure at Israel;

verses.first_half: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh,
verses.second_half: even the tent that he had pitched among them.
verses.first_half_tle: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh,
verses.second_half_tle: even the tent that he had pitched among men.

verses.first_half: He delivered the ark into captivity,
verses.second_half: and his glory into the enemy’s hand.
verses.first_half_tle: He delivered their power into captivity,
verses.second_half_tle: and their beauty into the enemy’s hand.

verses.first_half: He gave his people over to the sword
verses.second_half: and was angry with his inheritance.
verses.first_half_tle: He gave his people over also unto the sword,
verses.second_half_tle: and was wroth with his inheritance.

verses.first_half: Fire consumed their young men,
verses.second_half: and their maidens had no marriage songs.
verses.first_half_tle: The fire consumed their young men,
verses.second_half_tle: and their maidens were not given in marriage.

verses.first_half: Their priests were slain with the sword,
verses.second_half: and their widows made no lamentation.
verses.first_half_tle: Their priests were slain with the sword,
verses.second_half_tle: and there were no widows to make lamentation.

verses.first_half: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,
verses.second_half: and like a warrior recovered from wine.
verses.first_half_tle: So the Lord awaked as one out of sleep,
verses.second_half_tle: and like a giant refreshed with wine.

verses.first_half: He drove his enemies backward
verses.second_half: and put them to a perpetual shame.
verses.first_half_tle: He drave his enemies backward,
verses.second_half_tle: and put them to a perpetual shame.

verses.first_half: He rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
verses.second_half: and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
verses.first_half_tle: He refused the tabernacle of Joseph,
verses.second_half_tle: and chose not the tribe of Ephraim;

verses.first_half: But chose the tribe of Judah,
verses.second_half: even the hill of Zion which he loved.
verses.first_half_tle: But chose the tribe of Judah,
verses.second_half_tle: even the hill of Zion which he loved.

verses.first_half: And there he built his sanctuary, like the heights of heaven,
verses.second_half: like the earth which he had established for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: And there he built his temple on high,
verses.second_half_tle: and laid the foundation of it like the ground which he hath made continually.

verses.first_half: He chose David his servant,
verses.second_half: and took him away from the sheepfolds;
verses.first_half_tle: He chose David also his servant,
verses.second_half_tle: and took him away from the sheepfolds:

verses.first_half: As he was following the ewes that were great with young, God took him,
verses.second_half: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
verses.first_half_tle: As he was following the ewes with their young he took him,
verses.second_half_tle: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.first_half: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart,
verses.second_half: and guided them with skillful hands.
verses.first_half_tle: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart,
verses.second_half_tle: and ruled them prudently with all his power.

verses.first_half: O God, the nations have come into your inheritance;
verses.second_half: they have defiled your holy temple, and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance;
verses.second_half_tle: thy holy temple have they defiled, and made Jerusalem an heap of stones.

verses.first_half: The dead bodies of your servants have they given to be meat for the birds of the air,
verses.second_half: and the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the land.
verses.first_half_tle: The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be meat unto the fowls of the air,
verses.second_half_tle: and the flesh of thy saints unto the beasts of the land.

verses.first_half: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem,
verses.second_half: and there was no one to bury them.
verses.first_half_tle: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem,
verses.second_half_tle: and there was no man to bury them.

verses.first_half: We have become a reproach to our enemies,
verses.second_half: an object of scorn and derision to those who are round about us.
verses.first_half_tle: We are become an open shame to our enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: a very scorn and derision unto them that are round about us.

verses.first_half: O LORD, how long will you be angry?
verses.second_half: Shall your jealousy burn like fire for ever?
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, how long wilt thou be angry?
verses.second_half_tle: shall thy jealousy burn like fire for ever?

verses.first_half: Pour out your indignation upon the nations that have not known you,
verses.second_half: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Pour out thine indignation upon the heathen that have not known thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy Name.

verses.first_half: For they have devoured Jacob
verses.second_half: and laid waste his dwelling place.
verses.first_half_tle: For they have devoured Jacob,
verses.second_half_tle: and laid waste his dwelling-place.

verses.first_half: O remember not our past sins, but have mercy on us speedily,
verses.second_half: for we have come to great misery.
verses.first_half_tle: O remember not our old sins, but have mercy upon us, and that soon;
verses.second_half_tle: for we are come to great misery.

verses.first_half: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your Name;
verses.second_half: O deliver us and forgive our sins for your Name’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy Name:
verses.second_half_tle: O deliver us, and be merciful unto our sins, for thy Name’s sake.

verses.first_half: Why do the nations say,
verses.second_half: “Where now is their God?”
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore do the heathen say,
verses.second_half_tle: Where is now their God?

verses.first_half: O let the vengeance of your servants’  blood that is shed
verses.second_half: be known in our sight among the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: O let the vengeance of thy servants’ blood that is shed,
verses.second_half_tle: be openly showed upon the heathen, in our sight.

verses.first_half: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you;
verses.second_half: according to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are condemned to die.
verses.first_half_tle: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before thee;
verses.second_half_tle: according to the greatness of thy power, preserve thou those that are appointed to die.

verses.first_half: As for the blasphemy by which our neighbors have blasphemed you,
verses.second_half: repay them, O Lord, seven-fold into their bosoms.
verses.first_half_tle: And for the blasphemy wherewith our neighbours have blasphemed thee,
verses.second_half_tle: reward thou them, O Lord, sevenfold into their bosom.

verses.first_half: So we, who are your people and the sheep of your pasture, shall give you thanks for ever,
verses.second_half: and will always be showing forth your praise from generation to generation.
verses.first_half_tle: So we, that are thy people, and sheep of thy pasture, shall give thee thanks for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and will alway be showing forth thy praise from generation to generation.

verses.first_half: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a sheep;
verses.second_half: show yourself also, you that sit upon the cherubim.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear, O thou Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock;
verses.second_half_tle: show thyself also, thou that sittest upon the Cherubim.

verses.first_half: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
verses.second_half: stir up your strength and come to help us.
verses.first_half_tle: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
verses.second_half_tle: stir up thy strength, and come and help us.

verses.first_half: Restore us again, O God;
verses.second_half: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn us again, O God;
verses.second_half_tle: show the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.first_half: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.second_half: how long will you be angry with your people that pray?
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.second_half_tle: how long wilt thou be angry with thy people that prayeth?

verses.first_half: You feed them with the bread of tears
verses.second_half: and give them plenteous tears to drink.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears,
verses.second_half_tle: and givest them plenteousness of tears to drink.

verses.first_half: You have made us the derision of our neighbors,
verses.second_half: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast made us a very strife unto our neighbours,
verses.second_half_tle: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

verses.first_half: Restore us again, O God of hosts;
verses.second_half: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn us again, thou God of hosts;
verses.second_half_tle: show the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.first_half: You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
verses.second_half: you have cast out the nations and planted it.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.

verses.first_half: You made room for it,
verses.second_half: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou madest room for it;
verses.second_half_tle: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.

verses.first_half: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
verses.second_half: and the boughs thereof were like the mighty cedar trees.
verses.first_half_tle: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
verses.second_half_tle: and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedar-trees.

verses.first_half: It stretched out its branches to the sea
verses.second_half: and its boughs to the river.
verses.first_half_tle: She stretched out her branches unto the sea,
verses.second_half_tle: and her boughs unto the River.

verses.first_half: Why have you broken down its hedge,
verses.second_half: so that all those who go by pluck off its grapes?
verses.first_half_tle: Why hast thou then broken down her hedge,
verses.second_half_tle: that all they that go by pluck off her grapes?

verses.first_half: The wild boar out of the wood roots it up,
verses.second_half: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.
verses.first_half_tle: The wild boar out of the wood doth root it up,
verses.second_half_tle: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

verses.first_half: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
verses.second_half: behold, and visit this vine,
verses.first_half_tle: Turn thee again, thou God of hosts, look down from heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: behold, and visit this vine;

verses.first_half: And the place of the vineyard that your right hand has planted,
verses.second_half: and the branch that you made so strong for yourself.
verses.first_half_tle: And the place of the vineyard that thy right hand hath planted,
verses.second_half_tle: and the branch that thou madest so strong for thyself.

verses.first_half: As for those who burn it with fire and cut it down,
verses.second_half: let them perish at the rebuke of your countenance.
verses.first_half_tle: It is burnt with fire, and cut down;
verses.second_half_tle: and they shall perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.

verses.first_half: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand
verses.second_half: and upon the son of man, whom you made so strong for yourself.
verses.first_half_tle: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand,
verses.second_half_tle: and upon the son of man, whom thou madest so strong for thine own self.

verses.first_half: And so we will not turn back from you;
verses.second_half: O let us live, and we shall call upon your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: And so will not we go back from thee:
verses.second_half_tle: O let us live, and we shall call upon thy Name.

verses.first_half: Restore us again, O LORD God of hosts;
verses.second_half: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts;
verses.second_half_tle: show the light of thy countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.first_half: O sing merrily unto God our strength;
verses.second_half: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: Sing we merrily unto God our strength;
verses.second_half_tle: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.first_half: Take the psalm, bring hither the timbrel,
verses.second_half: the merry harp with the lute.
verses.first_half_tle: Take the psalm, bring hither the tabret,
verses.second_half_tle: the merry harp with the lute.

verses.first_half: Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
verses.second_half: even in the time appointed, and on our solemn feast day.
verses.first_half_tle: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon,
verses.second_half_tle: even in the time appointed, and upon our solemn feast-day.

verses.first_half: For this was made a statute for Israel
verses.second_half: and a law of the God of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: For this was made a statute for Israel,
verses.second_half_tle: and a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.first_half: This he laid upon Joseph for a testimony,
verses.second_half: when he came out of the land of Egypt.
verses.first_half_tle: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony,
verses.second_half_tle: when he came out of the land of Egypt, and had heard a strange language.

verses.first_half: “I eased his shoulder from the burden,
verses.second_half: and his hands were delivered from bearing the load.
verses.first_half_tle: I eased his shoulder from the burden,
verses.second_half_tle: and his hands were delivered from making the pots.

verses.first_half: You called upon me in troubles, and I delivered you,
verses.second_half: and I answered you in the thundercloud and tested you at the waters of strife.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou calledst upon me in troubles, and I delivered thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and heard thee what time as the storm fell upon thee.

verses.first_half: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
verses.second_half: O Israel, if you will hearken unto me,
verses.first_half_tle: I proved thee also
verses.second_half_tle: at the waters of strife.

verses.first_half: There shall be no strange god among you,
verses.second_half: neither shall you worship any other god.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear, O my people; and I will assure thee, O Israel,
verses.second_half_tle: if thou wilt hearken unto me,

verses.first_half: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
verses.second_half: open your mouth wide, and I shall fill it.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall no strange god be in thee,
verses.second_half_tle: neither shalt thou worship any other god.

verses.first_half: But my people would not hear my voice,
verses.second_half: and Israel would not obey me.
verses.first_half_tle: I am the LORD thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt:
verses.second_half_tle: open thy mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

verses.first_half: So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their hearts,
verses.second_half: and let them follow their own imaginations.
verses.first_half_tle: But my people would not hear my voice;
verses.second_half_tle: and Israel would not obey me;

verses.first_half: Oh, that my people would have hearkened unto me,
verses.second_half: that Israel had walked in my ways.
verses.first_half_tle: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lusts,
verses.second_half_tle: and let them follow their own imaginations.

verses.first_half: I would soon have put down their enemies
verses.second_half: and turned my hand against their adversaries.
verses.first_half_tle: O that my people would have hearkened unto me!
verses.second_half_tle: for if Israel had walked in my ways,

verses.first_half: The haters of the LORD would humble themselves before him,
verses.second_half: and their time of punishment would endure for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: I should soon have put down their enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.first_half: But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat-flour,
verses.second_half: and with honey out of the stony rock would I satisfy him.”
verses.first_half_tle: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him;
verses.second_half_tle: but their time should have endured for ever.

verses.first_half_tle: I would have fed them also with the finest wheat-flour;
verses.second_half_tle: and with honey out of the stony rock would I have satisfied thee.

verses.first_half: God stands in the council of princes;
verses.second_half: he is a Judge among gods.
verses.first_half_tle: God standeth in the congregation of princes;
verses.second_half_tle: he is a Judge among gods.

verses.first_half: “How long will you give wrong judgment
verses.second_half: and accept the ungodly?
verses.first_half_tle: How long will ye give wrong judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: and accept the persons of the ungodly?

verses.first_half: Defend the poor and fatherless;
verses.second_half: see that those who are in need and necessity have what is right.
verses.first_half_tle: Defend the poor and fatherless;
verses.second_half_tle: see that such as are in need and necessity have right.

verses.first_half: Deliver the outcast and poor;
verses.second_half: save them from the hand of the ungodly.”
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver the outcast and poor;
verses.second_half_tle: save them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: They will not learn nor understand, but walk about in darkness;
verses.second_half: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
verses.first_half_tle: They know not, neither do they understand, but walk on still in darkness:
verses.second_half_tle: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.

verses.first_half: I have said, “You are gods,
verses.second_half: and you are all the children of the Most High;
verses.first_half_tle: I have said, Ye are gods,
verses.second_half_tle: and ye are all the children of the Most Highest.

verses.first_half: But you shall die like mortals,
verses.second_half: and fall like one of the princes.”
verses.first_half_tle: But ye shall die like men,
verses.second_half_tle: and fall like one of the princes.

verses.first_half: Arise, O God, and judge the earth,
verses.second_half: for you shall take all nations for your inheritance.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, O God, and judge thou the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou shalt take all nations to thine inheritance.

verses.first_half: Hold not your tongue, O God; keep not silent,
verses.second_half: but rouse yourself, O God.
verses.first_half_tle: Hold not thy tongue, O God, keep not still silence:
verses.second_half_tle: refrain not thyself, O God.

verses.first_half: For behold, your enemies murmur,
verses.second_half: and those who hate you have lifted up their head.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, thine enemies make a murmuring;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that hate thee have lift up their head.

verses.first_half: They have conspired secretly against your people
verses.second_half: and taken counsel against your cherished ones.
verses.first_half_tle: They have imagined craftily against thy people,
verses.second_half_tle: and taken counsel against thy secret ones.

verses.first_half: They have said, “Come, and let us wipe them out, that they may be no more a people,
verses.second_half: and that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
verses.first_half_tle: They have said, Come, and let us root them out, that they be no more a people,
verses.second_half_tle: and that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.

verses.first_half: For they have brought their heads together with one consent
verses.second_half: and are aligned against you:
verses.first_half_tle: For they have cast their heads together with one consent,
verses.second_half_tle: and are confederate against thee:

verses.first_half: The tents of the Edomites and the Ishmaelites,
verses.second_half: the Moabites and Hagarenes,
verses.first_half_tle: The tabernacles of the Edomites, and the Ishmaelites;
verses.second_half_tle: the Moabites, and Hagarenes;

verses.first_half: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek,
verses.second_half: the Philistines with those who dwell at Tyre.
verses.first_half_tle: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek;
verses.second_half_tle: the Philistines, with them that dwell at Tyre.

verses.first_half: Assyria also has joined with them,
verses.second_half: and has helped the children of Lot.
verses.first_half_tle: Assyria also is joined with them;
verses.second_half_tle: they have holpen the children of Lot.

verses.first_half: But do to them as you did to the Midianites,
verses.second_half: to Sisera and to Jabin at the brook of Kishon,
verses.first_half_tle: But do thou to them as unto the Midianites;
verses.second_half_tle: unto Sisera, and unto Jabin at the brook of Kishon;

verses.first_half: Who perished at Endor
verses.second_half: and became as dung on the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Who perished at Endor,
verses.second_half_tle: and became as the dung of the earth.

verses.first_half: Make their princes like Oreb and Zeëb;
verses.second_half: indeed, make all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
verses.first_half_tle: Make them and their princes like Oreb and Zeëb;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, make all their princes like as Zebah and Zalmunna;

verses.first_half: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves
verses.second_half: the pastures of God as our possession.”
verses.first_half_tle: Who say, Let us take to ourselves
verses.second_half_tle: the houses of God in possession.

verses.first_half: O my God, make them like whirling dust
verses.second_half: and like stubble before the wind,
verses.first_half_tle: O my God, make them like unto the whirling dust,
verses.second_half_tle: and as the stubble before the wind;

verses.first_half: Like the fire that burns up the woods
verses.second_half: and like the flame that consumes the mountains.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the fire that burneth up the forest,
verses.second_half_tle: and as the flame that consumeth the mountains;

verses.first_half: Pursue them even with your tempest,
verses.second_half: and make them afraid with your storm.
verses.first_half_tle: Pursue them even so with thy tempest,
verses.second_half_tle: and make them afraid with thy storm.

verses.first_half: Cover their faces with shame, O LORD,
verses.second_half: that they may seek your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Make their faces ashamed, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may seek thy Name.

verses.first_half: Let them be disgraced and dismayed ever more and more;
verses.second_half: let them be put to shame and perish.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be confounded and vexed ever more and more;
verses.second_half_tle: let them be put to shame, and perish.

verses.first_half: And they shall know that you, whose Name is the LORD,
verses.second_half: are alone the Most High over all the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: And they shall know that thou, whose Name is Jehovah,
verses.second_half_tle: art only the Most Highest over all the earth.

verses.first_half: How lovely are your dwellings,
verses.second_half: O LORD God of hosts!
verses.first_half_tle: O how amiable are thy dwellings,
verses.second_half_tle: thou LORD of hosts!

verses.first_half: My soul has a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the LORD;
verses.second_half: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul hath a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

verses.first_half: Indeed, the sparrow has found her a house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young,
verses.second_half: even your altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, the sparrow hath found her an house, and the swallow a nest, where she may lay her young;
verses.second_half_tle: even thy altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God.

verses.first_half: Blessed are they who dwell in your house;
verses.second_half: they will be always praising you.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are they that dwell in thy house;
verses.second_half_tle: they will be alway praising thee.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the one whose strength is in you,
verses.second_half: in whose heart are your ways,
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: in whose heart are thy ways.

verses.first_half: Who going through the valley of misery uses it for a well;
verses.second_half: indeed, the early rains fill the pools with water.
verses.first_half_tle: Who going through the vale of misery use it for a well;
verses.second_half_tle: and the pools are filled with water.

verses.first_half: They will go from strength to strength,
verses.second_half: and the God of gods shall be seen by them in Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: They will go from strength to strength,
verses.second_half_tle: and unto the God of gods appeareth every one of them in Zion.

verses.first_half: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer;
verses.second_half: hearken, O God of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer;
verses.second_half_tle: hearken, O God of Jacob.

verses.first_half: Behold, O God, our defender,
verses.second_half: and look upon the face of your Anointed.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, O God our defender,
verses.second_half_tle: and look upon the face of thine anointed.

verses.first_half: For one day in your courts
verses.second_half: is better than a thousand;
verses.first_half_tle: For one day in thy courts
verses.second_half_tle: is better than a thousand.

verses.first_half: I would rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God
verses.second_half: than dwell in the tents of ungodliness.
verses.first_half_tle: I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God,
verses.second_half_tle: than to dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

verses.first_half: For the LORD God is a light and defense;
verses.second_half: the LORD will give grace and honor, and no good thing shall he withhold from those who live a godly life.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD God is a light and defense;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD will give grace and worship; and no good thing shall he withhold from them that live a godly life.

verses.first_half: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.second_half: blessed is the one who puts his trust in you.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.second_half_tle: blessed is the man that putteth his trust in thee.

verses.first_half: LORD, you have been gracious to your land;
verses.second_half: you have turned away the captivity of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, thou art become gracious unto thy land;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast turned away the captivity of Jacob.

verses.first_half: You have forgiven the offence of your people
verses.second_half: and covered all their sins.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast forgiven the offence of thy people,
verses.second_half_tle: and covered all their sins.

verses.first_half: You have taken away all your displeasure
verses.second_half: and turned yourself from your wrathful indignation.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast taken away all thy displeasure,
verses.second_half_tle: and turned thyself from thy wrathful indignation.

verses.first_half: Restore us then, O God our Savior,
verses.second_half: and let your anger cease from us.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn us then, O God our Savior,
verses.second_half_tle: and let thine anger cease from us.

verses.first_half: Will you be displeased at us for ever,
verses.second_half: and will you stretch out your wrath from one generation to another?
verses.first_half_tle: Wilt thou be displeased at us for ever?
verses.second_half_tle: and wilt thou stretch out thy wrath from one generation to another?

verses.first_half: Will you not turn again and quicken us,
verses.second_half: that your people may rejoice in you?
verses.first_half_tle: Wilt thou not turn again, and quicken us,
verses.second_half_tle: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

verses.first_half: Show us your mercy, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and grant us your salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: Show us thy mercy, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and grant us thy salvation.

verses.first_half: I will hearken to what the LORD God will say,
verses.second_half: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.
verses.first_half_tle: I will hearken what the LORD God will say;
verses.second_half_tle: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again unto foolishness.

verses.first_half: For his salvation is near to those who fear him,
verses.second_half: that glory may dwell in our land.
verses.first_half_tle: For his salvation is nigh them that fear him;
verses.second_half_tle: that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.first_half: Mercy and truth have met together;
verses.second_half: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
verses.first_half_tle: Mercy and truth are met together:
verses.second_half_tle: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.first_half: Truth shall flourish out of the earth,
verses.second_half: and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: Truth shall flourish out of the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and righteousness hath looked down from heaven.

verses.first_half: Indeed, the LORD shall show goodness,
verses.second_half: and our land shall give its increase.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, the LORD shall show loving-kindness;
verses.second_half_tle: and our land shall give her increase.

verses.first_half: Righteousness shall go before him,
verses.second_half: and he shall direct his going in the way.
verses.first_half_tle: Righteousness shall go before him,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall direct his going in the way.

verses.first_half: Bow down your ear, O LORD, and hear me,
verses.second_half: for I am poor and in misery.
verses.first_half_tle: Bow down thine ear, O LORD, and hear me;
verses.second_half_tle: for I am poor, and in misery.

verses.first_half: Preserve my life, for I am faithful;
verses.second_half: my God, save your servant who puts his trust in you.
verses.first_half_tle: Preserve thou my soul, for I am holy:
verses.second_half_tle: my God, save thy servant that putteth his trust in thee.

verses.first_half: Be merciful unto me, O Lord,
verses.second_half: for I will call daily upon you.
verses.first_half_tle: Be merciful unto me, O Lord;
verses.second_half_tle: for I will call daily upon thee.

verses.first_half: Comfort the soul of your servant,
verses.second_half: for to you, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: Comfort the soul of thy servant;
verses.second_half_tle: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.first_half: For you, Lord, are good and gracious,
verses.second_half: and of great mercy to all those who call upon you.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, Lord, art good and gracious,
verses.second_half_tle: and of great mercy unto all them that call upon thee.

verses.first_half: Give ear, LORD, unto my prayer,
verses.second_half: and attend to the voice of my humble supplications.
verses.first_half_tle: Give ear, LORD, unto my prayer,
verses.second_half_tle: and ponder the voice of my humble desires.

verses.first_half: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you,
verses.second_half: for you answer me when I call.
verses.first_half_tle: In the time of my trouble I will call upon thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hearest me.

verses.first_half: Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord,
verses.second_half: nor are there any deeds like yours.
verses.first_half_tle: Among the gods there is none like unto thee, O Lord;
verses.second_half_tle: there is not one that can do as thou doest.

verses.first_half: All nations that you have made shall come and worship you, O Lord,
verses.second_half: and shall glorify your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship thee, O Lord;
verses.second_half_tle: and shall glorify thy Name.

verses.first_half: For you are great and do wondrous things;
verses.second_half: indeed, you are God alone.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things:
verses.second_half_tle: thou art God alone.

verses.first_half: Teach me your way, O LORD, and I will walk in your truth;
verses.second_half: O knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Teach me thy way, O LORD, and I will walk in thy truth:
verses.second_half_tle: O knit my heart unto thee, that I may fear thy Name.

verses.first_half: I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
verses.second_half: and will praise your Name for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: I will thank thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart;
verses.second_half_tle: and will praise thy Name for evermore.

verses.first_half: For great is your mercy toward me;
verses.second_half: you have delivered my life from the nethermost Pit.
verses.first_half_tle: For great is thy mercy toward me;
verses.second_half_tle: and thou hast delivered my soul from the nethermost hell.

verses.first_half: O God, the proud have risen up against me,
verses.second_half: and the company of violent men have sought after my life, and have not set you before their eyes.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, the proud are risen against me;
verses.second_half_tle: and the congregations of violent men have sought after my soul, and have not set thee before their eyes.

verses.first_half: But you, O Lord God, are full of compassion and mercy,
verses.second_half: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou, O Lord God, art full of compassion and mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

verses.first_half: O turn then unto me, and have mercy upon me;
verses.second_half: give your strength unto your servant, and help the son of your handmaid.
verses.first_half_tle: O turn thee then unto me, and have mercy upon me;
verses.second_half_tle: give thy strength unto thy servant, and help the son of thine handmaid.

verses.first_half: Show me some token of your favor, that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed,
verses.second_half: because you, LORD, have been my helper and comforter.
verses.first_half_tle: Show some token upon me for good; that they who hate me may see it, and be ashamed,
verses.second_half_tle: because thou, LORD, hast holpen me, and comforted me.

verses.first_half: The LORD loves the foundation which he has laid upon the holy hills;
verses.second_half: the gates of Zion are dearer to him than all the dwellings of Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: Her foundations are upon the holy hills:
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD loveth the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.first_half: Very excellent things are spoken of you,
verses.second_half: O city of God.
verses.first_half_tle: Very excellent things are spoken of thee,
verses.second_half_tle: thou city of God.

verses.first_half: I will consider Egypt and Babylon
verses.second_half: among those who know me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will make mention of Egypt and Babylon,
verses.second_half_tle: among them that know me.

verses.first_half: Behold Philistia also, and Tyre, with Ethiopia;
verses.second_half: each one was born in her.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, Philistia also; and Tyre, with Ethiopia;
verses.second_half_tle: lo, in Zion were they born.

verses.first_half: And of Zion it shall be reported that each one was born in her,
verses.second_half: and the Most High shall establish her.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, of Zion it shall be reported, this one and that one were born in her;
verses.second_half_tle: and the Most High shall stablish her.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall record it when he registers the people,
verses.second_half: that each one was born there.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall record it, when he writeth up the peoples;
verses.second_half_tle: lo, in Zion were they born.

verses.first_half: The singers and the dancers also shall say,
verses.second_half: “All my fresh springs are in you.”
verses.first_half_tle: The singers also and trumpeters shall make answer:
verses.second_half_tle: All my fresh springs are in thee.

verses.first_half: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you;
verses.second_half: O let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to my call.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:
verses.second_half_tle: O let my prayer enter into thy presence, incline thine ear unto my calling;

verses.first_half: For my soul is full of trouble,
verses.second_half: and my life draws nigh to the Grave.
verses.first_half_tle: For my soul is full of trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: and my life draweth nigh unto the grave.

verses.first_half: I am counted as one of those who go down into the pit,
verses.second_half: and I have become as one who has no strength.
verses.first_half_tle: I am counted as one of them that go down into the pit,
verses.second_half_tle: and I am even as a man that hath no strength;

verses.first_half: I have become like the dead, and like the slain who lie in the grave,
verses.second_half: whom you remember no more, and who are cut off from your hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Cast off among the dead, like unto them that are slain, and lie in the grave,
verses.second_half_tle: who are out of remembrance, and are cut away from thy hand.

verses.first_half: You have laid me in the lowest pit,
verses.second_half: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit,
verses.second_half_tle: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

verses.first_half: Your indignation lies heavy upon me,
verses.second_half: and you have overwhelmed me with all your storms.
verses.first_half_tle: Thine indignation lieth hard upon me,
verses.second_half_tle: and thou hast vexed me with all thy storms.

verses.first_half: You have put my friends far from me,
verses.second_half: and made me to be abhorred by them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me,
verses.second_half_tle: and made me to be abhorred of them.

verses.first_half: I am in prison;
verses.second_half: I cannot go forth.
verses.first_half_tle: I am so fast in prison
verses.second_half_tle: that I cannot get forth.

verses.first_half: My sight fails because of trouble;
verses.second_half: LORD, I have called daily upon you; I have stretched forth my hands unto you.
verses.first_half_tle: My sight faileth for very trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: LORD, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched forth my hands unto thee.

verses.first_half: Do you show wonders among the dead,
verses.second_half: or shall the dead rise up again and praise you?
verses.first_half_tle: Dost thou show wonders among the dead?
verses.second_half_tle: or shall the dead rise up again, and praise thee?

verses.first_half: Shall your loving-kindness be shown in the grave,
verses.second_half: or your faithfulness in destruction?
verses.first_half_tle: Shall thy loving-kindness be showed in the grave?
verses.second_half_tle: or thy faithfulness in destruction?

verses.first_half: Shall your wondrous works be known in the dark,
verses.second_half: and your righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?
verses.first_half_tle: Shall thy wondrous works be known in the dark?
verses.second_half_tle: and thy righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

verses.first_half: Unto you have I cried, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and early shall my prayer come before you.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee have I cried, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and early shall my prayer come before thee.

verses.first_half: LORD, why do you cast off my soul
verses.second_half: and hide your face from me?
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, why abhorrest thou my soul,
verses.second_half_tle: and hidest thou thy face from me?

verses.first_half: I am in misery, like one who is at the point of death;
verses.second_half: even from my youth, your terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.
verses.first_half_tle: I am in misery, and like unto him that is at the point to die;
verses.second_half_tle: even from my youth up, thy terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

verses.first_half: Your wrathful displeasure goes over me,
verses.second_half: and the fear of you has undone me.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy wrathful displeasure goeth over me,
verses.second_half_tle: and the fear of thee hath undone me.

verses.first_half: Daily they come round about me like water,
verses.second_half: and encompass me on every side.
verses.first_half_tle: They came round about me daily like water,
verses.second_half_tle: and compassed me together on every side.

verses.first_half: My companions and neighbors you have put away from me,
verses.second_half: and hidden my friends out of my sight.
verses.first_half_tle: My lovers and friends hast thou put away from me,
verses.second_half_tle: and hid mine acquaintance out of my sight.

verses.first_half: My song shall be always of the loving-kindness of the LORD;
verses.second_half: with my mouth will I ever be proclaiming your faithfulness, from one generation to another.
verses.first_half_tle: My song shall be alway of the loving-kindness of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: with my mouth will I ever be showing thy truth from one generation to another.

verses.first_half: For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up for ever;
verses.second_half: your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.”
verses.first_half_tle: For I have said, Mercy shall be set up for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: thy truth shalt thou stablish in the heavens.

verses.first_half: I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
verses.second_half: I have sworn to David my servant:
verses.first_half_tle: I have made a covenant with my chosen;
verses.second_half_tle: I have sworn unto David my servant:

verses.first_half: “Your seed will I establish for ever,
verses.second_half: and set up your throne from one generation to another.”
verses.first_half_tle: Thy seed will I stablish for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and set up thy throne from one generation to another.

verses.first_half: O LORD, the heavens will praise your wondrous works
verses.second_half: and your faithfulness in the assembly of the saints.
