verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, the very heavens shall praise thy wondrous works;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy truth in the congregation of the saints.

verses.first_half: For who in the clouds can be compared unto the LORD?
verses.second_half: And who among the gods is like unto the LORD?
verses.first_half_tle: For who is he among the clouds,
verses.second_half_tle: that shall be compared unto the LORD?

verses.first_half: God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints,
verses.second_half: and to be held in reverence by all those who are round about him.
verses.first_half_tle: And what is he among the gods,
verses.second_half_tle: that shall be like unto the LORD?

verses.first_half: O LORD God of hosts, who is like you?
verses.second_half: Your faithfulness, most mighty LORD, is round about you.
verses.first_half_tle: God is very greatly to be feared in the council of the saints,
verses.second_half_tle: and to be had in reverence of all them that are round about him.

verses.first_half: You rule the raging of the sea;
verses.second_half: you still the waves when they arise.
verses.first_half_tle: O Lord God of hosts, who is like unto thee?
verses.second_half_tle: thy truth, most mighty LORD, is on every side.

verses.first_half: You have subdued Rahab of the deep, and destroyed her;
verses.second_half: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou rulest the raging of the sea;
verses.second_half_tle: thou stillest the waves thereof when they arise.

verses.first_half: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours;
verses.second_half: you laid the foundation of the world, and all that is in it.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast subdued Egypt, and destroyed it;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast scattered thine enemies abroad with thy mighty arm.

verses.first_half: You have made the north and the south;
verses.second_half: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast laid the foundation of the round world, and all that therein is.

verses.first_half: You have a mighty arm;
verses.second_half: strong is your hand, and high is your right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast made the north and the south;
verses.second_half_tle: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy Name.

verses.first_half: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
verses.second_half: mercy and truth shall go before your face.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast a mighty arm;
verses.second_half_tle: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

verses.first_half: Blessed are the people, O LORD, who rejoice in you;
verses.second_half: they shall walk in the light of your countenance.
verses.first_half_tle: Righteousness and equity are the habitation of thy seat;
verses.second_half_tle: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

verses.first_half: Their delight shall be in your Name all the day long,
verses.second_half: and in your righteousness shall they make their boast.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the people, O LORD, that can rejoice in thee;
verses.second_half_tle: they shall walk in the light of thy countenance.

verses.first_half: For you are the glory of their strength,
verses.second_half: and by your favor you shall lift up our might.
verses.first_half_tle: Their delight shall be daily in thy Name;
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy righteousness shall they make their boast.

verses.first_half: For the LORD is our defense;
verses.second_half: the Holy One of Israel is our King.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou art the glory of their strength,
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy loving-kindness thou shalt lift up our horns.

verses.first_half: You spoke in a vision to your saints, and said,
verses.second_half: “I have set the crown upon one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD is our defense;
verses.second_half_tle: the Holy One of Israel is our King.

verses.first_half: I have found David my servant;
verses.second_half: with my holy oil have I anointed him.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou spakest sometime in visions unto thy saints, and saidst,
verses.second_half_tle: I have laid help upon one that is mighty, I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

verses.first_half: My hand shall hold him fast,
verses.second_half: and my arm shall strengthen him.
verses.first_half_tle: I have found David my servant;
verses.second_half_tle: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

verses.first_half: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence;
verses.second_half: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.
verses.first_half_tle: My hand shall hold him fast,
verses.second_half_tle: and my arm shall strengthen him.

verses.first_half: I will smite his foes before his face
verses.second_half: and strike down those who hate him.
verses.first_half_tle: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence;
verses.second_half_tle: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

verses.first_half: My faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him,
verses.second_half: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.
verses.first_half_tle: I will smite down his foes before his face,
verses.second_half_tle: and plague them that hate him.

verses.first_half: I will give him dominion over the sea,
verses.second_half: and with his right hand shall he rule the rivers.
verses.first_half_tle: My truth also and my mercy shall be with him;
verses.second_half_tle: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.first_half: He shall say to me, “You are my Father,
verses.second_half: my God, and the rock of my salvation.”
verses.first_half_tle: I will set his dominion also in the sea,
verses.second_half_tle: and his right hand in the floods.

verses.first_half: And I will make him my firstborn,
verses.second_half: higher than the kings of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall call me, Thou art my Father,
verses.second_half_tle: my God, and my strong salvation.

verses.first_half: My mercy will I keep for him for ever,
verses.second_half: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
verses.first_half_tle: And I will make him my firstborn,
verses.second_half_tle: higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.first_half: His seed will I make to endure for ever
verses.second_half: and his throne as the days of heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore,
verses.second_half_tle: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.first_half: But if his children forsake my law,
verses.second_half: and do not walk in my judgments,
verses.first_half_tle: His seed also will I make to endure for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.first_half: If they break my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
verses.second_half: I will punish their offenses with the rod, and their sin with scourges.
verses.first_half_tle: But if his children forsake my law,
verses.second_half_tle: and walk not in my judgments;

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness I will not utterly take from him,
verses.second_half: nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
verses.first_half_tle: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: I will visit their offences with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

verses.first_half: My covenant I will not break,
verses.second_half: nor alter the word that has gone out of my lips.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him,
verses.second_half_tle: nor suffer my truth to fail.

verses.first_half: I have sworn once by my holiness
verses.second_half: that I will not fail David.
verses.first_half_tle: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips:
verses.second_half_tle: I have sworn once by my holiness, that I will not fail David.

verses.first_half: His seed shall endure for ever
verses.second_half: and his throne as the sun before me.
verses.first_half_tle: His seed shall endure for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and his throne is like as the sun before me.

verses.first_half: It shall endure for evermore as the moon,
verses.second_half: and as the faithful witness in the heavens.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall stand fast for evermore as the moon,
verses.second_half_tle: and as the faithful witness in heaven.

verses.first_half: But you have rejected and forsaken your Anointed;
verses.second_half: you are full of wrath against him.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou hast abhorred and forsaken thine anointed,
verses.second_half_tle: and art displeased at him.

verses.first_half: You have broken the covenant with your servant;
verses.second_half: you have defiled his crown and cast it to the ground.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast broken the covenant of thy servant,
verses.second_half_tle: and cast his crown to the ground.

verses.first_half: You have overthrown all his walls
verses.second_half: and broken down his strongholds.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast overthrown all his hedges,
verses.second_half_tle: and broken down his strongholds.

verses.first_half: All those who go by plunder him,
verses.second_half: and he has become a reproach to his neighbors.
verses.first_half_tle: All they that go by spoil him,
verses.second_half_tle: and he is become a reproach to his neighbours.

verses.first_half: You have exalted the right hand of his enemies,
verses.second_half: and made all his adversaries rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast set up the right hand of his enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and made all his adversaries to rejoice.

verses.first_half: You have turned back the edge of his sword
verses.second_half: and have not given him victory in the battle.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast taken away the edge of his sword,
verses.second_half_tle: and givest him not victory in the battle.

verses.first_half: You have taken away his glory
verses.second_half: and cast his throne down to the ground.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast put out his glory,
verses.second_half_tle: and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.first_half: The days of his youth you have shortened
verses.second_half: and covered him with dishonor.
verses.first_half_tle: The days of his youth hast thou shortened,
verses.second_half_tle: and covered him with dishonour.

verses.first_half: LORD, how long will you utterly hide yourself?
verses.second_half: How long shall your wrath burn like fire?
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, how long wilt thou hide thyself? for ever?
verses.second_half_tle: and shall thy wrath burn like fire?

verses.first_half: O remember how short my time is;
verses.second_half: why have you made all people for nought?
verses.first_half_tle: O remember how short my time is;
verses.second_half_tle: wherefore hast thou made all men for nought?

verses.first_half: What man is there who lives and shall not see death,
verses.second_half: and shall deliver his soul from the power of the Grave?
verses.first_half_tle: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death?
verses.second_half_tle: and shall he deliver his soul from the power of the grave?

verses.first_half: Lord, where are your loving-kindnesses of old,
verses.second_half: which you swore to David in your faithfulness?
verses.first_half_tle: Lord, where are thy old loving-kindnesses,
verses.second_half_tle: which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

verses.first_half: Remember, Lord, how your servants are reproached,
verses.second_half: and how I bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;
verses.first_half_tle: Remember, Lord, the rebuke that thy servants have,
verses.second_half_tle: and how I do bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;

verses.first_half: Remember how your enemies have reproached you, O LORD,
verses.second_half: how they have called after your Anointed King with cries of scorn.
verses.first_half_tle: Wherewith thine enemies have blasphemed thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and slandered the footsteps of thine anointed.

verses.first_half: Praised be the LORD for evermore.
verses.second_half: Amen and Amen.
verses.first_half_tle: Praised be the LORD for evermore.
verses.second_half_tle: Amen, and Amen.

verses.first_half: Lord, you have been our refuge
verses.second_half: from one generation to another.
verses.first_half_tle: Lord, thou hast been our refuge,
verses.second_half_tle: from one generation to another.

verses.first_half: Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made,
verses.second_half: you are God from everlasting, and world without end.
verses.first_half_tle: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever the earth and the world were made,
verses.second_half_tle: thou art God from everlasting, and world without end.

verses.first_half: You turn man back to the dust;
verses.second_half: you say, “Return, O children of men.”
verses.first_half_tle: Thou turnest man to destruction;
verses.second_half_tle: again thou sayest, Come again, ye children of men.

verses.first_half: For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday,
verses.second_half: even as a day that is past.
verses.first_half_tle: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past,
verses.second_half_tle: and as a watch in the night.

verses.first_half: You scatter them as a night-watch that comes quickly to an end;
verses.second_half: they are even as a dream and fade away.
verses.first_half_tle: As soon as thou scatterest them they are even as a sleep;
verses.second_half_tle: and fade away suddenly like the grass.

verses.first_half: They are like the grass, which in the morning is green,
verses.second_half: but in the evening is dried up and withered.
verses.first_half_tle: In the morning it is green, and groweth up;
verses.second_half_tle: but in the evening it is cut down, dried up, and withered.

verses.first_half: For we consume away in your displeasure
verses.second_half: and are afraid at your wrathful indignation.
verses.first_half_tle: For we consume away in thy displeasure,
verses.second_half_tle: and are afraid at thy wrathful indignation.

verses.first_half: You have set our misdeeds before you,
verses.second_half: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast set our misdeeds before thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.

verses.first_half: For when you are angry, all our days are gone;
verses.second_half: we bring our years to an end, as a tale that is told.
verses.first_half_tle: For when thou art angry all our days are gone:
verses.second_half_tle: we bring our years to an end, as it were a tale that is told.

verses.first_half: The days of our life are seventy years, and though some be so strong that they come to eighty years,
verses.second_half: yet is their span but labor and sorrow; so soon it passes away, and we are gone.
verses.first_half_tle: The days of our age are threescore years and ten; and though men be so strong that they come to fourscore years,
verses.second_half_tle: yet is their strength then but labor and sorrow; so soon passeth it away, and we are gone.

verses.first_half: But who regards the power of your wrath,
verses.second_half: and who considers the fierceness of your anger?
verses.first_half_tle: But who regardeth the power of thy wrath?
verses.second_half_tle: or feareth aright thy indignation?

verses.first_half: So teach us to number our days,
verses.second_half: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
verses.first_half_tle: So teach us to number our days,
verses.second_half_tle: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

verses.first_half: Turn again, O LORD, and tarry not;
verses.second_half: be gracious unto your servants.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn thee again, O LORD, at the last,
verses.second_half_tle: and be gracious unto thy servants.

verses.first_half: O satisfy us with your mercy in the morning;
verses.second_half: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.
verses.first_half_tle: O satisfy us with thy mercy, and that soon:
verses.second_half_tle: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

verses.first_half: Comfort us again, according to the measure of the days that you have afflicted us,
verses.second_half: and for the years in which we have suffered adversity.
verses.first_half_tle: Comfort us again now after the time that thou hast plagued us;
verses.second_half_tle: and for the years wherein we have suffered adversity.

verses.first_half: Show your servants your work
verses.second_half: and their children your glory.
verses.first_half_tle: Show thy servants thy work,
verses.second_half_tle: and their children thy glory.

verses.first_half: And may the grace of the Lord our God be upon us;
verses.second_half: prosper the work of our hands; O prosper our handiwork.
verses.first_half_tle: And the glorious majesty of the LORD our God be upon us:
verses.second_half_tle: prosper thou the work of our hands upon us; O prosper thou our handiwork.

verses.first_half: Whoever dwells under the defense of the Most High
verses.second_half: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso dwelleth under the defense of the Most High,
verses.second_half_tle: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.first_half: I will say unto the LORD, “You are my refuge and my stronghold,
verses.second_half: my God in whom I will trust.”
verses.first_half_tle: I will say unto the LORD, Thou art my hope, and my stronghold;
verses.second_half_tle: my God, in him will I trust.

verses.first_half: For he shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter
verses.second_half: and from the deadly pestilence.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall deliver thee from the snare of the hunter,
verses.second_half_tle: and from the noisome pestilence.

verses.first_half: He shall defend you under his wings, and you shall be safe under his feathers;
verses.second_half: his faithfulness and truth shall be your shield and buckler.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall defend thee under his wings, and thou shalt be safe under his feathers;
verses.second_half_tle: his faithfulness and truth shall be thy shield and buckler.

verses.first_half: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night,
verses.second_half: nor of the arrow that flies by day,
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt not be afraid for any terror by night,
verses.second_half_tle: nor for the arrow that flieth by day;

verses.first_half: Of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
verses.second_half: nor of the sickness that destroys at noonday.
verses.first_half_tle: For the pestilence that walketh in darkness,
verses.second_half_tle: nor for the sickness that destroyeth in the noonday.

verses.first_half: A thousand shall fall beside you, and ten thousand at your right hand,
verses.second_half: but it shall not come near you.
verses.first_half_tle: A thousand shall fall beside thee, and ten thousand at thy right hand;
verses.second_half_tle: but it shall not come nigh thee.

verses.first_half: Indeed, with your eyes you shall behold
verses.second_half: and see the reward of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, with thine eyes shalt thou behold,
verses.second_half_tle: and see the reward of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: Because you have said, “The LORD is my refuge,”
verses.second_half: and have made the Most High your stronghold,
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, LORD, art my hope;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast set thine house of defense very high.

verses.first_half: There shall no evil happen to you,
verses.second_half: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall no evil happen unto thee,
verses.second_half_tle: neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.

verses.first_half: For he shall give his angels charge over you,
verses.second_half: to keep you in all your ways.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall give his angels charge over thee,
verses.second_half_tle: to keep thee in all thy ways.

verses.first_half: They shall bear you in their hands,
verses.second_half: that you hurt not your foot against a stone.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall bear thee in their hands,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou hurt not thy foot against a stone.

verses.first_half: You shall tread upon the lion and adder;
verses.second_half: the young lion and the serpent you shall trample under your feet.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt go upon the lion and adder:
verses.second_half_tle: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou tread under thy feet.

verses.first_half: “Because he has set his love upon me, therefore I will deliver him;
verses.second_half: I will lift him up, because he has known my Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him;
verses.second_half_tle: I will set him up, because he hath known my Name.

verses.first_half: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him;
verses.second_half: indeed, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him and bring him honor.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and bring him to honor.

verses.first_half: With long life I will satisfy him,
verses.second_half: and show him my salvation.”
verses.first_half_tle: With long life will I satisfy him,
verses.second_half_tle: and show him my salvation.

verses.first_half: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD,
verses.second_half: and to sing praises unto your Name, O Most High,
verses.first_half_tle: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and to sing praises unto thy Name, O Most Highest;

verses.first_half: To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning,
verses.second_half: and of your faithfulness in the night season,
verses.first_half_tle: To tell of thy loving-kindness early in the morning,
verses.second_half_tle: and of thy truth in the night season;

verses.first_half: Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute,
verses.second_half: with the sound of melody upon the harp.
verses.first_half_tle: Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the lute;
verses.second_half_tle: upon a loud instrument, and upon the harp.

verses.first_half: For you, LORD, have made me glad by your deeds,
verses.second_half: and I will shout for joy because of your handiwork.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy works;
verses.second_half_tle: and I will rejoice in giving praise for the operations of thy hands.

verses.first_half: O LORD, how glorious are your works;
verses.second_half: your thoughts are very deep.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, how glorious are thy works!
verses.second_half_tle: thy thoughts are very deep.

verses.first_half: The dull of heart does not consider this,
verses.second_half: and a fool does not understand it:
verses.first_half_tle: An unwise man doth not well consider this,
verses.second_half_tle: and a fool doth not understand it.

verses.first_half: Though the ungodly are as green as the grass, and though all the workers of wickedness flourish,
verses.second_half: they shall be destroyed for ever; but you, LORD, are the Most High for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: When the ungodly are green as the grass, and when all the workers of wickedness do flourish,
verses.second_half_tle: then shall they be destroyed for ever; but thou, LORD, art the Most Highest for evermore.

verses.first_half: For lo, your enemies, O LORD, lo, your enemies shall perish,
verses.second_half: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, thine enemies, O LORD, lo, thine enemies shall perish;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

verses.first_half: But my horn shall be exalted like the horns of wild bulls;
verses.second_half: for I am anointed with fresh oil.
verses.first_half_tle: But my horn shall be exalted like the horn of an unicorn;
verses.second_half_tle: for I am anointed with fresh oil.

verses.first_half: My eye also shall see its desire upon my enemies,
verses.second_half: and my ear shall hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eye also shall see his lust of mine enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and mine ear shall hear his desire of the wicked that arise up against me.

verses.first_half: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree,
verses.second_half: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Lebanon.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Lebanon.

verses.first_half: Those who are planted in the house of the LORD
verses.second_half: shall flourish in the courts of our God.
verses.first_half_tle: Such as are planted in the house of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: shall flourish in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.first_half: They also shall bring forth fruit in their old age,
verses.second_half: and shall be green and full of sap,
verses.first_half_tle: They also shall bring forth more fruit in their age,
verses.second_half_tle: and shall be fat and well-liking;

verses.first_half: That they may show how upright the LORD is,
verses.second_half: my rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: That they may show how true the LORD my strength is,
verses.second_half_tle: and that there is no unrighteousness in him.

verses.first_half: The LORD is King and has put on glorious apparel;
verses.second_half: the LORD has put on his apparel and girded himself with strength.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is King, and hath put on glorious apparel;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD hath put on his apparel, and girded himself with strength.

verses.first_half: He has made the round world so sure
verses.second_half: that it cannot be moved.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath made the round world so sure,
verses.second_half_tle: that it cannot be moved.

verses.first_half: Ever since the world began, your throne has been established;
verses.second_half: you are from everlasting.
verses.first_half_tle: Ever since the world began, hath thy seat been prepared:
verses.second_half_tle: thou art from everlasting.

verses.first_half: The floods have risen, O LORD; the floods have lifted up their voice;
verses.second_half: the floods have lifted up their waves.
verses.first_half_tle: The floods are risen, O LORD, the floods have lift up their voice;
verses.second_half_tle: the floods lift up their waves.

verses.first_half: Mightier than the sound of many waters, mightier than the waves of the sea,
verses.second_half: the LORD who dwells on high is mightier.
verses.first_half_tle: The waves of the sea are mighty, and rage horribly;
verses.second_half_tle: but yet the LORD, who dwelleth on high, is mightier.

verses.first_half: Your testimonies, O LORD, are very sure;
verses.second_half: holiness adorns your house for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy testimonies, O LORD, are very sure:
verses.second_half_tle: holiness becometh thine house for ever.

verses.first_half: O LORD God to whom vengeance belongs,
verses.second_half: O God to whom vengeance belongs, show yourself.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth,
verses.second_half_tle: thou God, to whom vengeance belongeth, show thyself.

verses.first_half: Arise, O Judge of the world,
verses.second_half: and reward the proud according to their deserving.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, thou Judge of the world,
verses.second_half_tle: and reward the proud after their deserving.

verses.first_half: O LORD, how long shall the ungodly,
verses.second_half: how long shall the ungodly triumph?
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, how long shall the ungodly,
verses.second_half_tle: how long shall the ungodly triumph?

verses.first_half: How long shall all evildoers speak so disdainfully
verses.second_half: and make such proud boasting?
verses.first_half_tle: How long shall all wicked doers speak so disdainfully,
verses.second_half_tle: and make such proud boasting?

verses.first_half: They smite down your people, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and trouble your heritage.
verses.first_half_tle: They smite down thy people, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and trouble thine heritage.

verses.first_half: They murder the widow and the stranger,
verses.second_half: and put the fatherless to death.
verses.first_half_tle: They murder the widow and the stranger,
verses.second_half_tle: and put the fatherless to death.

verses.first_half: And yet they say, “The LORD shall not see,
verses.second_half: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.”
verses.first_half_tle: And yet they say, Tush, the LORD shall not see,
verses.second_half_tle: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

verses.first_half: Take heed, you unwise among the people;
verses.second_half: O you fools, when will you understand?
verses.first_half_tle: Take heed, ye unwise among the people:
verses.second_half_tle: O ye fools, when will ye understand?

verses.first_half: He who planted the ear, shall he not hear?
verses.second_half: Or he who made the eye, shall he not see?
verses.first_half_tle: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?
verses.second_half_tle: or he that made the eye, shall he not see?

verses.first_half: Or he who nurtures the nations,
verses.second_half: he who teaches humanity knowledge, shall he not punish?
verses.first_half_tle: Or he that instructeth the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: it is he that teacheth man knowledge; shall not he punish?

verses.first_half: The LORD knows the thoughts of man,
verses.second_half: that they are but vain.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man,
verses.second_half_tle: that they are but vain.

verses.first_half: Blessed is the one whom you chasten, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and whom you teach your law,
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and teachest him in thy law;

verses.first_half: That you may give him patience in time of adversity,
verses.second_half: until a pit is dug for the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: That thou mayest give him patience in time of adversity,
verses.second_half_tle: until the pit be digged up for the ungodly.

verses.first_half: For the LORD will not fail his people,
verses.second_half: neither will he forsake his inheritance,
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD will not fail his people;
verses.second_half_tle: neither will he forsake his inheritance;

verses.first_half: But righteousness shall return to the place of judgment,
verses.second_half: and all those who are true of heart shall follow it.
verses.first_half_tle: Until righteousness turn again unto judgment:
verses.second_half_tle: all such as are true in heart shall follow it.

verses.first_half: Who will rise up with me against the wicked,
verses.second_half: or who will take my part against the evildoers?
verses.first_half_tle: Who will rise up with me against the wicked?
verses.second_half_tle: or who will take my part against the evil doers?

verses.first_half: If the LORD had not helped me,
verses.second_half: my soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.
verses.first_half_tle: If the LORD had not helped me,
verses.second_half_tle: it had not failed, but my soul had been put to silence.

verses.first_half: But when I said, “My foot has slipped,”
verses.second_half: your mercy, O LORD, held me up.
verses.first_half_tle: But when I said, My foot hath slipt;
verses.second_half_tle: thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.

verses.first_half: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart,
verses.second_half: your comforts refreshed my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart,
verses.second_half_tle: thy comforts have refreshed my soul.

verses.first_half: Will you have anything to do with the council of wickedness,
verses.second_half: which turns evil into law?
verses.first_half_tle: Wilt thou have any thing to do with the throne of wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: which imagineth mischief as a law?

verses.first_half: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous
verses.second_half: and condemn the innocent to death.
verses.first_half_tle: They gather them together against the soul of the righteous,
verses.second_half_tle: and condemn the innocent blood.

verses.first_half: But the LORD is my refuge,
verses.second_half: and my God is the rock of my confidence.
verses.first_half_tle: But the LORD is my refuge,
verses.second_half_tle: and my God is the strength of my confidence.

verses.first_half: He shall recompense them for their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice;
verses.second_half: indeed, the LORD our God shall destroy them.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall recompense them their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the LORD our God shall destroy them.

verses.first_half: O come, let us sing unto the LORD;
verses.second_half: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: O come, let us sing unto the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

verses.first_half: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving
verses.second_half: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.
verses.first_half_tle: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
verses.second_half_tle: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

verses.first_half: For the LORD is a great God
verses.second_half: and a great King above all gods.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD is a great God;
verses.second_half_tle: and a great King above all gods.

verses.first_half: In his hand are all the depths of the earth,
verses.second_half: and the heights of the hills are his also.
verses.first_half_tle: In his hand are all the corners of the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: and the strength of the hills is his also.

verses.first_half: The sea is his, for he made it,
verses.second_half: and his hands prepared the dry land.
verses.first_half_tle: The sea is his, and he made it;
verses.second_half_tle: and his hands prepared the dry land.

verses.first_half: O come, let us worship and fall down,
verses.second_half: and kneel before the LORD our Maker.
verses.first_half_tle: O come, let us worship and fall down,
verses.second_half_tle: and kneel before the LORD our Maker.

verses.first_half: For he is our God,
verses.second_half: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.
verses.first_half_tle: For he is the Lord our God;
verses.second_half_tle: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

verses.first_half: Today, if you will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
verses.second_half: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness,
verses.first_half_tle: Today if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
verses.second_half_tle: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness;

verses.first_half: When your fathers tested me,
verses.second_half: and put me to the proof, though they had seen my works.
verses.first_half_tle: When your fathers tempted me,
verses.second_half_tle: proved me, and saw my works.

verses.first_half: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation and said,
verses.second_half: “It is a people that err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways,”
verses.first_half_tle: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said,
verses.second_half_tle: It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways:

verses.first_half: Of whom I swore in my wrath
verses.second_half: that they should not enter into my rest.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto whom I sware in my wrath,
verses.second_half_tle: that they should not enter into my rest.

verses.first_half: O sing unto the LORD a new song;
verses.second_half: sing unto the LORD, all the whole earth.
verses.first_half_tle: O sing unto the LORD a new song;
verses.second_half_tle: sing unto the LORD, all the whole earth.

verses.first_half: Sing unto the LORD and praise his Name;
verses.second_half: tell of his salvation from day to day.
verses.first_half_tle: Sing unto the LORD, and praise his Name;
verses.second_half_tle: be telling of his salvation from day to day.

verses.first_half: Declare his honor to the nations,
verses.second_half: and his wonders to all peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: Declare his honor unto the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: and his wonders unto all peoples.

verses.first_half: For the LORD is great, and highly to be praised;
verses.second_half: he is more to be feared than all gods.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD is great, and cannot worthily be praised;
verses.second_half_tle: he is more to be feared than all gods.

verses.first_half: As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols;
verses.second_half: but it is the LORD who made the heavens.
verses.first_half_tle: As for all the gods of the heathen, they are but idols;
verses.second_half_tle: but it is the LORD that made the heavens.

verses.first_half: Glory and majesty are before him;
verses.second_half: power and honor are in his sanctuary.
verses.first_half_tle: Glory and worship are before him;
verses.second_half_tle: power and honor are in his sanctuary.

verses.first_half: Ascribe unto the LORD, O you families of the peoples,
verses.second_half: ascribe unto the LORD worship and power.
verses.first_half_tle: Ascribe unto the LORD, O ye kindreds of the peoples,
verses.second_half_tle: ascribe unto the LORD worship and power.

verses.first_half: Ascribe unto the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.second_half: bring offerings and come into his courts.
verses.first_half_tle: Ascribe unto the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.second_half_tle: bring presents, and come into his courts.

verses.first_half: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness;
verses.second_half: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.
verses.first_half_tle: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness;
verses.second_half_tle: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

verses.first_half: Tell it out among the nations, “The LORD is King;
verses.second_half: it is he who has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he shall judge the peoples righteously.”
verses.first_half_tle: Tell it out among the heathen, that the LORD is King, and that it is he who hath made the round world so fast that it cannot be moved;
verses.second_half_tle: and how that he shall judge the peoples righteously.

verses.first_half: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
verses.second_half: let the sea make a noise, and all that is therein.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
verses.second_half_tle: let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is.

verses.first_half: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
verses.second_half: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
verses.second_half_tle: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the LORD.

verses.first_half: For he comes, for he comes to judge the earth,
verses.second_half: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the peoples with his truth.
verses.first_half_tle: For he cometh, for he cometh to judge the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the peoples with his truth.

verses.first_half: The LORD is King; let the earth be glad.
verses.second_half: Indeed, let the multitude of the isles be glad.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is King, the earth may be glad thereof;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, the multitude of the isles may be glad thereof.

verses.first_half: Clouds and darkness are round about him;
verses.second_half: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.
verses.first_half_tle: Clouds and darkness are round about him:
verses.second_half_tle: righteousness and judgment are the habitation of his seat.

verses.first_half: There goes a fire before him
verses.second_half: and burns up his enemies on every side.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall go a fire before him,
verses.second_half_tle: and burn up his enemies on every side.

verses.first_half: His lightnings gave light to the world;
verses.second_half: the earth saw it and was afraid.
verses.first_half_tle: His lightnings gave shine unto the world:
verses.second_half_tle: the earth saw it, and was afraid.

verses.first_half: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD,
verses.second_half: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
verses.first_half_tle: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

verses.first_half: The heavens have declared his righteousness,
verses.second_half: and all the people have seen his glory.
verses.first_half_tle: The heavens have declared his righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: and all the peoples have seen his glory.

verses.first_half: Confounded be all those who worship carved images, and who delight in false gods;
verses.second_half: worship him, all you gods.
verses.first_half_tle: Confounded be all they that worship carved images, and that delight in vain gods:
verses.second_half_tle: worship him, all ye gods.

verses.first_half: Zion heard of it and rejoiced,
verses.second_half: and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of your judgments, O LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Zion heard of it, and rejoiced; and the daughters of Judah were glad,
verses.second_half_tle: because of thy judgments, O LORD.

verses.first_half: For you, LORD, are most high over all the earth;
verses.second_half: you are exalted far above all gods.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou, LORD, art higher than all that are in the earth:
verses.second_half_tle: thou art exalted far above all gods.

verses.first_half: O you who love the LORD, see that you hate the thing which is evil;
verses.second_half: the LORD preserves the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: O ye that love the LORD, see that ye hate the thing which is evil:
verses.second_half_tle: the Lord preserveth the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.first_half: A light has sprung up for the righteous,
verses.second_half: and joyful gladness for those who are truehearted.
verses.first_half_tle: There is sprung up a light for the righteous,
verses.second_half_tle: and joyful gladness for such as are true-hearted.

verses.first_half: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous,
verses.second_half: and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.
verses.first_half_tle: Rejoice in the LORD, ye righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: and give thanks for a remembrance of his holiness.

verses.first_half: O sing unto the LORD a new song,
verses.second_half: for he has done marvelous things.
verses.first_half_tle: O sing unto the LORD a new song;
verses.second_half_tle: for he hath done marvelous things.

verses.first_half: With his own right hand and with his holy arm,
verses.second_half: he has won for himself the victory.
verses.first_half_tle: With his own right hand, and with his holy arm,
verses.second_half_tle: hath he gotten himself the victory.

verses.first_half: The LORD declared his salvation;
verses.second_half: his righteousness has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD declared his salvation;
verses.second_half_tle: his righteousness hath he openly showed in the sight of the heathen.

verses.first_half: He has remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel,
verses.second_half: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.first_half: Show yourselves joyful in the LORD, all you lands;
verses.second_half: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.
verses.first_half_tle: Show yourselves joyful unto the LORD, all ye lands;
verses.second_half_tle: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD with the harp;
verses.second_half: sing with the harp a psalm of thanksgiving.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD upon the harp;
verses.second_half_tle: sing to the harp with a psalm of thanksgiving.

verses.first_half: With trumpets also and horns,
verses.second_half: O show yourselves joyful before the LORD, the King.
verses.first_half_tle: With trumpets also and shawms,
verses.second_half_tle: O show yourselves joyful before the LORD, the King.

verses.first_half: Let the sea make a noise, and all that is in it,
verses.second_half: the round world, and those who dwell therein.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is;
verses.second_half_tle: the round world, and they that dwell therein.

verses.first_half: Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the LORD,
verses.second_half: for he has come to judge the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for he is come to judge the earth.

verses.first_half: With righteousness shall he judge the world,
verses.second_half: and the peoples with equity.
verses.first_half_tle: With righteousness shall he judge the world,
verses.second_half_tle: and the peoples with equity.

verses.first_half: The LORD is King; let the peoples tremble;
verses.second_half: he sits between the cherubim; let the earth shake.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is King, be the people never so impatient;
verses.second_half_tle: he sitteth between the Cherubim, be the earth never so unquiet.

verses.first_half: The LORD is great in Zion
verses.second_half: and high above all peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is great in Zion
verses.second_half_tle: and high above all people.

verses.first_half: They shall give thanks unto his Name, which is great and wonderful;
verses.second_half: holy is he and mighty, a King who loves justice.
verses.first_half_tle: They shall give thanks unto thy Name,
verses.second_half_tle: which is great, wonderful, and holy.

verses.first_half: You have established equity;
verses.second_half: you have executed judgment and righteousness in Jacob.
verses.first_half_tle: The King’s power loveth judgment; thou hast prepared equity,
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast executed judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.first_half: O magnify the LORD our God,
verses.second_half: and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.
verses.first_half_tle: O magnify the LORD our God, and fall down before his footstool;
verses.second_half_tle: for he is holy.

verses.first_half: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his Name,
verses.second_half: they called upon the LORD, and he heard them.
verses.first_half_tle: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among such as call upon his Name:
verses.second_half_tle: these called upon the LORD, and he heard them.

verses.first_half: He spoke to them out of the cloudy pillar,
verses.second_half: for they kept his testimonies and the law that he gave them.
verses.first_half_tle: He spake unto them out of the cloudy pillar;
verses.second_half_tle: for they kept his testimonies, and the law that he gave them.

verses.first_half: You heard them, O LORD our God;
verses.second_half: you forgave them, O God, yet punished their evildoings.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou heardest them, O LORD our God;
verses.second_half_tle: thou forgavest them, O God, though thou didst punish their wicked doings.

verses.first_half: O magnify the LORD our God, and worship him upon his holy hill,
verses.second_half: for the LORD our God is holy.
verses.first_half_tle: O magnify the LORD our God, and worship him upon his holy hill;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD our God is holy.

verses.first_half: O be joyful in the LORD, all you lands;
verses.second_half: serve the LORD with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.
verses.first_half_tle: O be joyful in the LORD, all ye lands;
verses.second_half_tle: serve the LORD with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

verses.first_half: Be assured that the LORD, he is God;
verses.second_half: it is he that has made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
verses.first_half_tle: Be ye sure that the LORD he is God; it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves;
verses.second_half_tle: we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.first_half: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise;
verses.second_half: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.
verses.first_half_tle: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise;
verses.second_half_tle: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

verses.first_half: For the LORD is gracious, his mercy is everlasting,
verses.second_half: and his truth endures from generation to generation.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD is gracious, his mercy is everlasting;
verses.second_half_tle: and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

verses.first_half: My song shall be of mercy and judgment;
verses.second_half: unto you, O LORD, will I sing.
verses.first_half_tle: My song shall be of mercy and judgment;
verses.second_half_tle: unto thee, O LORD, will I sing.

verses.first_half: O let me have understanding
verses.second_half: in the way of godliness.
verses.first_half_tle: O let me have understanding
verses.second_half_tle: in the way of godliness!

verses.first_half: When will you come to me?
verses.second_half: I will walk in my house with integrity of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: When wilt thou come unto me?
verses.second_half_tle: I will walk in my house with a perfect heart.

verses.first_half: I will set no wicked thing before my eyes;
verses.second_half: I hate the sins of unfaithfulness; no such thing shall cleave to me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will take no wicked thing in hand; I hate the sins of unfaithfulness;
verses.second_half_tle: there shall no such cleave unto me.

verses.first_half: A crooked heart shall depart from me;
verses.second_half: I will not know a wicked person.
verses.first_half_tle: A froward heart shall depart from me;
verses.second_half_tle: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.first_half: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor,
verses.second_half: him will I destroy.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso privily slandereth his neighbor,
verses.second_half_tle: him will I destroy.

verses.first_half: Whoever has a proud look and an arrogant heart,
verses.second_half: I will not suffer him.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso hath also a haughty look and a proud heart,
verses.second_half_tle: I will not suffer him.

verses.first_half: My eyes shall look with favor upon the faithful in the land,
verses.second_half: that they may dwell with me.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes look upon such as are faithful in the land,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may dwell with me.

verses.first_half: Whoever leads a godly life,
verses.second_half: he shall be my servant.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso leadeth a godly life,
verses.second_half_tle: he shall be my servant.

verses.first_half: No deceitful person shall dwell in my house;
verses.second_half: the one who tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall no deceitful person dwell in my house;
verses.second_half_tle: he that telleth lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verses.first_half: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly who are in the land,
verses.second_half: that I may root out all evildoers from the city of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly that are in the land;
verses.second_half_tle: that I may root out all wicked doers from the city of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Hear my prayer, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and let my cry come unto you.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my prayer, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and let my crying come unto thee.

verses.first_half: Hide not your face from me in the time of my trouble;
verses.second_half: incline your ear to me when I call; O hear me, and very soon.
verses.first_half_tle: Hide not thy face from me in the time of my trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: incline thine ear unto me when I call; O hear me, and that right soon.

verses.first_half: For my days are consumed like smoke,
verses.second_half: and my bones are burnt up as in a furnace.
verses.first_half_tle: For my days are consumed away like smoke,
verses.second_half_tle: and my bones are burnt up as it were a firebrand.

verses.first_half: My heart is smitten and withered like grass,
verses.second_half: so that I forget to eat my bread.
verses.first_half_tle: My heart is smitten down, and withered like grass;
verses.second_half_tle: so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.first_half: Because of the voice of my groaning,
verses.second_half: my bones will scarcely cleave to my flesh.
verses.first_half_tle: For the voice of my groaning,
verses.second_half_tle: my bones will scarce cleave to my flesh.

verses.first_half: I have become like an owl in the wilderness
verses.second_half: and like a screech-owl among the ruins.
verses.first_half_tle: I am become like a pelican in the wilderness,
verses.second_half_tle: and like an owl that is in the desert.

verses.first_half: I am solitary, and lie sleepless because of my groaning;
verses.second_half: I am like a sparrow that sits alone upon the housetop.
verses.first_half_tle: I have watched, and am even as it were a sparrow,
verses.second_half_tle: that sitteth alone upon the housetop.

verses.first_half: My enemies revile me all day long,
verses.second_half: and those who are enraged against me conspire to do me hurt.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine enemies revile me all the day long;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that are mad upon me are sworn together against me.

verses.first_half: For I have eaten ashes as if they were bread
verses.second_half: and mingled my drink with weeping,
verses.first_half_tle: For I have eaten ashes as it were bread,
verses.second_half_tle: and mingled my drink with weeping;

verses.first_half: Because of your indignation and wrath,
verses.second_half: for you have taken me up and cast me down.
verses.first_half_tle: And that, because of thine indignation and wrath;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast taken me up, and cast me down.

verses.first_half: My days are gone like a shadow,
verses.second_half: and I am withered like grass.
verses.first_half_tle: My days are gone like a shadow,
verses.second_half_tle: and I am withered like grass.

verses.first_half: But you, O LORD, shall endure for ever,
verses.second_half: and your remembrance throughout all generations.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou, O LORD, shalt endure for ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy remembrance throughout all generations.

verses.first_half: You shall arise and have mercy upon Zion,
verses.second_half: for it is time for you to have mercy upon her; indeed, the time has come.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou shalt arise, and have mercy upon Zion;
verses.second_half_tle: for it is time that thou have mercy upon her, yea, the time is come.

verses.first_half: For your servants love her very stones,
verses.second_half: and are moved to pity to see her in the dust.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? thy servants think upon her stones,
verses.second_half_tle: and it pitieth them to see her in the dust.

verses.first_half: The nations shall fear your Name, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and all the kings of the earth your majesty,
verses.first_half_tle: The nations shall fear thy Name, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the kings of the earth thy majesty;

verses.first_half: When the LORD shall build up Zion,
verses.second_half: and when his glory shall appear,
verses.first_half_tle: When the LORD shall build up Zion,
verses.second_half_tle: and when his glory shall appear;

verses.first_half: When he turns to the prayer of the destitute
verses.second_half: and despises not their plea.
verses.first_half_tle: When he turneth him unto the prayer of the poor destitute,
verses.second_half_tle: and despiseth not their desire.

verses.first_half: This shall be written for those that come after,
verses.second_half: and a people that shall yet be born shall praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: This shall be written for those that come after,
verses.second_half_tle: and the people which shall be born shall praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: For he has looked down from his sanctuary;
verses.second_half: from the heavens the LORD has beheld the earth,
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath looked down from his sanctuary;
verses.second_half_tle: out of the heaven did the LORD behold the earth;

verses.first_half: That he might hear the groanings of those who are in captivity,
verses.second_half: and deliver those who are condemned to die,
verses.first_half_tle: That he might hear the mournings of such as are in captivity,
verses.second_half_tle: and deliver them that are appointed unto death;

verses.first_half: That they may declare the Name of the LORD in Zion,
verses.second_half: and his praises in Jerusalem;
verses.first_half_tle: That they may declare the Name of the LORD in Zion,
verses.second_half_tle: and his worship at Jerusalem;

verses.first_half: When the peoples are gathered together,
verses.second_half: and the kingdoms also, to serve the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: When the peoples are gathered together,
verses.second_half_tle: and the kingdoms also, to serve the LORD.

verses.first_half: He brought down my strength before my time,
verses.second_half: and shortened my days.
verses.first_half_tle: He brought down my strength in my journey,
verses.second_half_tle: and shortened my days.

verses.first_half: But I said, “O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days;
verses.second_half: for your years endure throughout all generations.”
verses.first_half_tle: But I said, O my God, take me not away in the midst of mine age;
verses.second_half_tle: as for thy years, they endure throughout all generations.

verses.first_half: You, Lord, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth,
verses.second_half: and the heavens are the work of your hands.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and the heavens are the work of thy hands.

verses.first_half: They shall perish, but you shall endure;
verses.second_half: they all shall wear out, as does a garment;
verses.first_half_tle: They shall perish, but thou shalt endure:
verses.second_half_tle: they all shall wax old as doth a garment;

verses.first_half: And as a garment you shall change them, and they shall be changed;
verses.second_half: but you are the same, and your years shall not fail.
verses.first_half_tle: And as a vesture shalt thou change them, and they shall be changed;
verses.second_half_tle: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.

verses.first_half: The children of your servants shall continue,
verses.second_half: and their seed shall stand fast in your sight.
verses.first_half_tle: The children of thy servants shall continue,
verses.second_half_tle: and their seed shall stand fast in thy sight.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD, O my soul,
verses.second_half: and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, O my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD, O my soul,
verses.second_half: and forget not all his benefits:
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, O my soul,
verses.second_half_tle: and forget not all his benefits:

verses.first_half: Who forgives all your sin
verses.second_half: and heals all your infirmities,
verses.first_half_tle: Who forgiveth all thy sin,
verses.second_half_tle: and healeth all thine infirmities;

verses.first_half: Who saves your life from the pit
verses.second_half: and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness,
verses.first_half_tle: Who saveth thy life from destruction,
verses.second_half_tle: and crowneth thee with mercy and loving-kindness;

verses.first_half: Who satisfies you with good things,
verses.second_half: renewing your youth like an eagle’s.
verses.first_half_tle: Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things,
verses.second_half_tle: making thee young and lusty as an eagle.

verses.first_half: The LORD executes righteousness and judgment
verses.second_half: for all those who are oppressed with wrong.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD executeth righteousness and judgment
verses.second_half_tle: for all them that are oppressed with wrong.

verses.first_half: He showed his ways to Moses,
verses.second_half: his works to the children of Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: He showed his ways unto Moses,
verses.second_half_tle: his works unto the children of Israel.

verses.first_half: The LORD is full of compassion and mercy,
verses.second_half: long-suffering and of great goodness.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is full of compassion and mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: long-suffering, and of great goodness.

verses.first_half: He will not always chide us,
verses.second_half: neither will he keep his anger for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: He will not alway be chiding;
verses.second_half_tle: neither keepeth he his anger for ever.

verses.first_half: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
verses.second_half: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath not dealt with us after our sins;
verses.second_half_tle: nor rewarded us according to our wickednesses.

verses.first_half: For as the heavens are high above the earth,
verses.second_half: so great is his mercy also toward those who fear him.
verses.first_half_tle: For look how high the heaven is in comparison of the earth;
verses.second_half_tle: so great is his mercy also toward them that fear him.

verses.first_half: As far as the east is from the west,
verses.second_half: so far has he set our sins from us.
verses.first_half_tle: Look how wide also the east is from the west;
verses.second_half_tle: so far hath he set our sins from us.

verses.first_half: As a father pities his own children,
verses.second_half: so is the LORD merciful to those who fear him.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, like as a father pitieth his own children;
verses.second_half_tle: even so is the LORD merciful unto them that fear him.

verses.first_half: For he knows whereof we are made;
verses.second_half: he remembers that we are but dust.
verses.first_half_tle: For he knoweth whereof we are made;
verses.second_half_tle: he remembereth that we are but dust.

verses.first_half: The days of man are as grass;
verses.second_half: he flourishes as a flower of the field.
verses.first_half_tle: The days of man are but as grass;
verses.second_half_tle: for he flourisheth as a flower of the field.

verses.first_half: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone,
verses.second_half: and its place shall know it no more.
verses.first_half_tle: For as soon as the wind goeth over it, it is gone;
verses.second_half_tle: and the place thereof shall know it no more.

verses.first_half: But the merciful goodness of the LORD endures for ever and ever upon those who fear him,
verses.second_half: and his righteousness upon children’s children,
verses.first_half_tle: But the merciful goodness of the LORD endureth for ever and ever upon them that fear him;
verses.second_half_tle: and his righteousness upon children’s children;

verses.first_half: Even upon those who keep his covenant
verses.second_half: and think upon his commandments to do them.
verses.first_half_tle: Even upon such as keep his covenant,
verses.second_half_tle: and think upon his commandments to do them.

verses.first_half: The LORD has prepared his throne in heaven,
verses.second_half: and his kingdom rules over all.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hath prepared his seat in heaven,
verses.second_half_tle: and his kingdom ruleth over all.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD, you angels of his, you that excel in strength,
verses.second_half: you that fulfill his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, ye angels of his, ye that excel in strength;
verses.second_half_tle: ye that fulfil his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his word.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD, all you his hosts,
verses.second_half: you servants of his that do his pleasure.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, all ye his hosts;
verses.second_half_tle: ye servants of his that do his pleasure.

verses.first_half: O speak good of the LORD, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion;
verses.second_half: praise the LORD, O my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: O speak good of the LORD, all ye works of his, in all places of his dominion:
verses.second_half_tle: praise thou the LORD, O my soul.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD, O my soul.
verses.second_half: O LORD my God, you have become exceedingly glorious; you are clothed with majesty and honor.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, O my soul:
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD my God, thou art become exceeding glorious; thou art clothed with majesty and honor.

verses.first_half: You clothe yourself with light as with a garment,
verses.second_half: and spread out the heavens like a curtain.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou deckest thyself with light as it were with a garment,
verses.second_half_tle: and spreadest out the heavens like a curtain.

verses.first_half: You lay the beams of your chambers in the waters,
verses.second_half: and make the clouds your chariot, and walk upon the wings of the wind.
verses.first_half_tle: Who layeth the beams of his chambers in the waters,
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh the clouds his chariot, and walketh upon the wings of the wind.

verses.first_half: You make winds your messengers,
verses.second_half: and flames of fire your ministers.
verses.first_half_tle: He maketh his angels winds,
verses.second_half_tle: and his ministers a flaming fire.

verses.first_half: You laid the foundations of the earth,
verses.second_half: that it never should move at any time.
verses.first_half_tle: He laid the foundations of the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: that it never should move at any time.

verses.first_half: You cover it with the deep as with a garment;
verses.second_half: the waters stand above the hills.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou coveredst it with the deep like as with a garment;
verses.second_half_tle: the waters stand above the hills.

verses.first_half: At your rebuke they fled;
verses.second_half: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.
verses.first_half_tle: At thy rebuke they flee;
verses.second_half_tle: at the voice of thy thunder they haste away.

verses.first_half: They went up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath,
verses.second_half: even to the place you had appointed for them.
verses.first_half_tle: They go up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath;
verses.second_half_tle: even unto the place which thou hast appointed for them.

verses.first_half: You have set bounds for them which they shall not pass;
verses.second_half: neither shall they again cover the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast set them their bounds, which they shall not pass,
verses.second_half_tle: neither turn again to cover the earth.

verses.first_half: You send the springs into the rivers,
verses.second_half: which run among the hills.
verses.first_half_tle: He sendeth the springs into the rivers,
verses.second_half_tle: which run among the hills.

verses.first_half: All beasts of the field drink thereof,
verses.second_half: and the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
verses.first_half_tle: All beasts of the field drink thereof,
verses.second_half_tle: and the wild asses quench their thirst.

verses.first_half: Beside them shall the birds of the air have their habitation
verses.second_half: and sing among the branches.
verses.first_half_tle: Beside them shall the fowls of the air have their habitation,
verses.second_half_tle: and sing among the branches.

verses.first_half: You water the hills from above;
verses.second_half: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.
verses.first_half_tle: He watereth the hills from above;
verses.second_half_tle: the earth is filled with the fruit of thy works.

verses.first_half: You bring forth grass for the cattle,
verses.second_half: and plants for the service of mankind,
verses.first_half_tle: He bringeth forth grass for the cattle,
verses.second_half_tle: and green herb for the service of men;

verses.first_half: That they may bring food out of the earth, and wine that makes glad the heart,
verses.second_half: and oil to make a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen the heart.
verses.first_half_tle: That he may bring food out of the earth, and wine that maketh glad the heart of man;
verses.second_half_tle: and oil to make him a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen man’s heart.

verses.first_half: The trees of the LORD also are full of sap,
verses.second_half: even the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,
verses.first_half_tle: The trees of the LORD also are full of sap;
verses.second_half_tle: even the cedars of Lebanon which he hath planted;

verses.first_half: Wherein the birds make their nests,
verses.second_half: and the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.
verses.first_half_tle: Wherein the birds make their nests;
verses.second_half_tle: and the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

verses.first_half: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats,
verses.second_half: and so are the stony cliffs for the rock badgers.
verses.first_half_tle: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats;
verses.second_half_tle: and so are the stony rocks for the conies.

verses.first_half: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons,
verses.second_half: and the sun knows its going down.
verses.first_half_tle: He appointed the moon for certain seasons,
verses.second_half_tle: and the sun knoweth his going down.

verses.first_half: You make darkness that it may be night,
verses.second_half: in which all the beasts of the forest move.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou makest darkness that it may be night;
verses.second_half_tle: wherein all the beasts of the forest do move.

verses.first_half: The lions, roaring after their prey,
verses.second_half: seek their meat from God.
verses.first_half_tle: The lions, roaring after their prey,
verses.second_half_tle: do seek their meat from God.

verses.first_half: The sun arises, and they go away together,
verses.second_half: and lay themselves down in their dens.
verses.first_half_tle: The sun ariseth, and they get them away together,
verses.second_half_tle: and lay them down in their dens.

verses.first_half: Man goes forth to his work,
verses.second_half: and to his labor until the evening.
verses.first_half_tle: Man goeth forth to his work, and to his labor,
verses.second_half_tle: until the evening.

verses.first_half: O LORD, how manifold are your works;
verses.second_half: in wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, how manifold are thy works!
verses.second_half_tle: in wisdom hast thou made them all; the earth is full of thy riches.

verses.first_half: So is the great and wide sea also,
verses.second_half: in which are things creeping innumerable, creatures both small and great.
verses.first_half_tle: So is the great and wide sea also;
verses.second_half_tle: wherein are things creeping innumerable, both small and great beasts.

verses.first_half: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan,
verses.second_half: whom you made to take its pleasure therein.
verses.first_half_tle: There go the ships, and there is that leviathan,
verses.second_half_tle: whom thou hast made to take his pastime therein.

verses.first_half: These all wait upon you,
verses.second_half: that you may give them food in due season.
verses.first_half_tle: These wait all upon thee,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou mayest give them meat in due season.

verses.first_half: When you give it to them, they gather it,
verses.second_half: and when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.
verses.first_half_tle: When thou givest it them, they gather it;
verses.second_half_tle: and when thou openest thy hand, they are filled with good.

verses.first_half: When you hide your face, they are troubled;
verses.second_half: when you take away their breath, they die, and are turned again to their dust.
verses.first_half_tle: When thou hidest thy face, they are troubled:
verses.second_half_tle: when thou takest away their breath, they die, and are turned again to their dust.

verses.first_half: When you let your breath go forth, they shall be made,
verses.second_half: and you shall renew the face of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: When thou lettest thy breath go forth, they shall be made;
verses.second_half_tle: and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.

verses.first_half: The glorious majesty of the LORD shall endure for ever;
verses.second_half: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.
verses.first_half_tle: The glorious majesty of the LORD shall endure for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.

verses.first_half: He looks at the earth and it trembles;
verses.second_half: if he even touches the hills, they shall smoke.
verses.first_half_tle: The earth shall tremble at the look of him;
verses.second_half_tle: if he do but touch the hills, they shall smoke.

verses.first_half: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live;
verses.second_half: I will praise my God while I have my being,
verses.first_half_tle: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live;
verses.second_half_tle: I will praise my God while I have my being.

verses.first_half: And so shall my words please him;
verses.second_half: my joy shall be in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: And so shall my words please him:
verses.second_half_tle: my joy shall be in the LORD.

verses.first_half: As for sinners, they shall perish from the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end.
verses.second_half: Praise the LORD, O my soul. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: As for sinners, they shall be consumed out of the earth,
verses.second_half_tle: and the ungodly shall come to an end.

verses.first_half_tle: Praise thou the LORD, O my soul.
verses.second_half_tle: Praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: Give thanks unto the LORD and call upon his Name;
verses.second_half: tell the peoples what things he has done.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD, and call upon his Name;
verses.second_half_tle: tell the people what things he hath done.

verses.first_half: O let your songs be of him, and praise him,
verses.second_half: and let your speech be of all his wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: O let your songs be of him, and praise him;
verses.second_half_tle: and let your talking be of all his wondrous works.

verses.first_half: Rejoice in his holy Name;
verses.second_half: let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Rejoice in his holy Name;
verses.second_half_tle: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

verses.first_half: Seek the LORD and his strength;
verses.second_half: seek his face evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: Seek the LORD and his strength;
verses.second_half_tle: seek his face evermore.

verses.first_half: Remember the marvelous works that he has done,
verses.second_half: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,
verses.first_half_tle: Remember the marvellous works that he hath done;
verses.second_half_tle: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

verses.first_half: O seed of Abraham his servant,
verses.second_half: O children of Jacob his chosen.
verses.first_half_tle: O ye seed of Abraham his servant,
verses.second_half_tle: ye children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.first_half: He is the LORD our God;
verses.second_half: his judgments are in all the world.
verses.first_half_tle: He is the LORD our God;
verses.second_half_tle: his judgments are in all the world.

verses.first_half: He has always been mindful of his covenant,
verses.second_half: and the promise that he made to a thousand generations,
verses.first_half_tle: He hath been alway mindful of his covenant and promise,
verses.second_half_tle: that he made to a thousand generations;

verses.first_half: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham,
verses.second_half: and the oath that he swore to Isaac,
verses.first_half_tle: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham;
verses.second_half_tle: and the oath that he sware unto Isaac;

verses.first_half: Which he appointed to Jacob for a law,
verses.second_half: and to Israel for an everlasting testament,
verses.first_half_tle: And appointed the same unto Jacob for a law,
verses.second_half_tle: and to Israel for an everlasting testament;

verses.first_half: Saying, “To you will I give the land of Canaan
verses.second_half: to be the portion of your inheritance.”
verses.first_half_tle: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan,
verses.second_half_tle: the lot of your inheritance:

verses.first_half: When there were yet but a few of them,
verses.second_half: and they were strangers in the land,
verses.first_half_tle: When there were yet but a few of them,
verses.second_half_tle: and they strangers in the land;

verses.first_half: And they wandered from nation to nation,
verses.second_half: and from one kingdom to another,
verses.first_half_tle: What time as they went from one nation to another,
verses.second_half_tle: from one kingdom to another people;

verses.first_half: He allowed no one to do them wrong,
verses.second_half: but reproved even kings for their sakes:
verses.first_half_tle: He suffered no man to do them wrong,
verses.second_half_tle: but reproved even kings for their sakes;

verses.first_half: “Do not touch my Anointed,
verses.second_half: and do my prophets no harm.”
verses.first_half_tle: Touch not mine anointed,
verses.second_half_tle: and do my prophets no harm.

verses.first_half: Moreover, he called for a famine in the land
verses.second_half: and destroyed all the provision of bread.
verses.first_half_tle: Moreover, he called for a dearth upon the land,
verses.second_half_tle: and destroyed all the provision of bread.

verses.first_half: But he had sent a man before them:
verses.second_half: Joseph, who was sold to be a bondservant,
verses.first_half_tle: But he had sent a man before them,
verses.second_half_tle: even Joseph, who was sold to be a bond-servant;

verses.first_half: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks;
verses.second_half: they put an iron collar around his neck.
verses.first_half_tle: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks;
verses.second_half_tle: the iron entered into his soul;

verses.first_half: Until the time came that his sayings were fulfilled,
verses.second_half: the word of the LORD tried him.
verses.first_half_tle: Until the time came that his cause was known:
verses.second_half_tle: the word of the LORD tried him.

verses.first_half: The king sent and delivered him;
verses.second_half: the ruler of the people let him go free.
verses.first_half_tle: The king sent and delivered him;
verses.second_half_tle: the prince of the people let him go free.

verses.first_half: He made him lord over his house,
