verses.second_half: and ruler of all his possessions,
verses.first_half_tle: He made him lord also of his house,
verses.second_half_tle: and ruler of all his substance;

verses.first_half: That he might instruct his princes according to his will
verses.second_half: and teach his elders wisdom.
verses.first_half_tle: That he might inform his princes after his will,
verses.second_half_tle: and teach his senators wisdom.

verses.first_half: Israel also came into Egypt,
verses.second_half: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.
verses.first_half_tle: Israel also came into Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

verses.first_half: And he increased his people exceedingly,
verses.second_half: and made them stronger than their enemies,
verses.first_half_tle: And he increased his people exceedingly,
verses.second_half_tle: and made them stronger than their enemies;

verses.first_half: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people,
verses.second_half: and dealt deceitfully with his servants.
verses.first_half_tle: Whose heart turned so, that they hated his people,
verses.second_half_tle: and dealt untruly with his servants.

verses.first_half: Then he sent Moses his servant,
verses.second_half: and Aaron whom he had chosen,
verses.first_half_tle: Then sent he Moses his servant,
verses.second_half_tle: and Aaron whom he had chosen.

verses.first_half: And they worked his signs among them,
verses.second_half: and wonders in the land of Ham.
verses.first_half_tle: And these showed his tokens among them,
verses.second_half_tle: and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.first_half: He sent darkness, and it was dark;
verses.second_half: but they were not obedient to his word.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent darkness, and it was dark;
verses.second_half_tle: and they were not obedient unto his word.

verses.first_half: He turned their waters into blood
verses.second_half: and caused their fish to die.
verses.first_half_tle: He turned their waters into blood
verses.second_half_tle: and slew their fish.

verses.first_half: Their land brought forth frogs,
verses.second_half: even in their kings’ chambers.
verses.first_half_tle: Their land brought forth frogs;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, even in their kings’ chambers.

verses.first_half: He spoke the word, and there came all manner of flies,
verses.second_half: and gnats in all their borders.
verses.first_half_tle: He spake the word, and there came all manner of flies,
verses.second_half_tle: and lice in all their quarters.

verses.first_half: He gave them hailstones for rain,
verses.second_half: and flames of fire in their land.
verses.first_half_tle: He gave them hailstones for rain;
verses.second_half_tle: and flames of fire in their land.

verses.first_half: He smote their vines also, and their fig trees,
verses.second_half: and destroyed the trees that were in their borders.
verses.first_half_tle: He smote their vines also and fig-trees;
verses.second_half_tle: and destroyed the trees that were in their coasts.

verses.first_half: He spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came, and locusts innumerable,
verses.second_half: which ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.
verses.first_half_tle: He spake the word, and the grasshoppers came, and caterpillars innumerable,
verses.second_half_tle: and did eat up all the grass in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.first_half: He smote all the firstborn in their land,
verses.second_half: even the firstfruits of all their strength.
verses.first_half_tle: He smote all the firstborn in their land,
verses.second_half_tle: even the chief of all their strength.

verses.first_half: He brought forth Israel with silver and gold;
verses.second_half: in all their tribes there was not one who stumbled.
verses.first_half_tle: He brought them forth also with silver and gold;
verses.second_half_tle: there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

verses.first_half: Egypt was glad at their departing,
verses.second_half: for they were afraid of them.
verses.first_half_tle: Egypt was glad at their departing;
verses.second_half_tle: for they were afraid of them.

verses.first_half: He spread out a cloud to be a covering,
verses.second_half: and fire to give light in the night season.
verses.first_half_tle: He spread out a cloud to be a covering,
verses.second_half_tle: and fire to give light in the night season.

verses.first_half: At their desire he brought quail,
verses.second_half: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: At their desire he brought quails;
verses.second_half_tle: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

verses.first_half: He opened the rock, and the waters flowed out,
verses.second_half: so that rivers ran in the dry places.
verses.first_half_tle: He opened the rock of stone, and the waters flowed out,
verses.second_half_tle: so that rivers ran in the dry places.

verses.first_half: For he remembered his holy promise
verses.second_half: and Abraham his servant.
verses.first_half_tle: For why? he remembered his holy promise;
verses.second_half_tle: and Abraham his servant.

verses.first_half: And he brought forth his people with joy,
verses.second_half: and his chosen ones with gladness,
verses.first_half_tle: And he brought forth his people with joy,
verses.second_half_tle: and his chosen with gladness;

verses.first_half: And gave them the lands of the nations,
verses.second_half: and they took the labors of the peoples in possession,
verses.first_half_tle: And gave them the lands of the heathen;
verses.second_half_tle: and they took the labors of the people in possession;

verses.first_half: That they might keep his statutes
verses.second_half: and observe his laws. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: That they might keep his statutes,
verses.second_half_tle: and observe his laws.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.second_half: and his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is gracious,
verses.second_half_tle: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who can express the mighty acts of the LORD,
verses.second_half: or show forth all his praise?
verses.first_half_tle: Who can express the noble acts of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: or show forth all his praise?

verses.first_half: Blessed are those who act with justice,
verses.second_half: and who always do righteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are they that alway keep judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: and do righteousness.

verses.first_half: Remember me, O LORD, according to the favor that you show to your people;
verses.second_half: O visit me with your salvation,
verses.first_half_tle: Remember me, O LORD, according to the favor that thou bearest unto thy people;
verses.second_half_tle: O visit me with thy salvation;

verses.first_half: That I may see the felicity of your chosen,
verses.second_half: and rejoice in the gladness of your people, and give thanks with your inheritance.
verses.first_half_tle: That I may see the felicity of thy chosen,
verses.second_half_tle: and rejoice in the gladness of thy people, and give thanks with thine inheritance.

verses.first_half: We have sinned like our fathers;
verses.second_half: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.
verses.first_half_tle: We have sinned with our fathers;
verses.second_half_tle: we have done amiss, and dealt wickedly.

verses.first_half: Our fathers regarded not your wonders in Egypt, neither did they keep your great goodness in remembrance,
verses.second_half: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
verses.first_half_tle: Our fathers regarded not thy wonders in Egypt, neither kept they thy great goodness in remembrance;
verses.second_half_tle: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, he saved them for his Name’s sake,
verses.second_half: that he might make his power known.
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, he helped them for his Name’s sake,
verses.second_half_tle: that he might make his power to be known.

verses.first_half: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up;
verses.second_half: so he led them through the deep as through a wilderness.
verses.first_half_tle: He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up;
verses.second_half_tle: so he led them through the deep, as through a wilderness.

verses.first_half: And he saved them from the adversary’s hand,
verses.second_half: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.
verses.first_half_tle: And he saved them from the adversary’s hand,
verses.second_half_tle: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.first_half: As for those who troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;
verses.second_half: there was not one of them left.
verses.first_half_tle: As for those that troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;
verses.second_half_tle: there was not one of them left.

verses.first_half: Then they believed his words
verses.second_half: and sang praises unto him.
verses.first_half_tle: Then believed they his words,
verses.second_half_tle: and sang praise unto him.

verses.first_half: But soon they forgot his works
verses.second_half: and would not wait for his counsel.
verses.first_half_tle: But within a while they forgat his works,
verses.second_half_tle: and would not abide his counsel.

verses.first_half: A craving came upon them in the wilderness,
verses.second_half: and they tempted God in the desert.
verses.first_half_tle: But lust came upon them in the wilderness,
verses.second_half_tle: and they tempted God in the desert.

verses.first_half: So he gave them their desire,
verses.second_half: and sent leanness into their soul.
verses.first_half_tle: And he gave them their desire,
verses.second_half_tle: and sent leanness withal into their soul.

verses.first_half: They were envious of Moses also in the camp,
verses.second_half: and of Aaron the holy one of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: They angered Moses also in the tents,
verses.second_half_tle: and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

verses.first_half: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
verses.second_half: and covered the company of Abiram,
verses.first_half_tle: So the earth opened, and swallowed up Dathan,
verses.second_half_tle: and covered the congregation of Abiram.

verses.first_half: And fire was kindled in their company;
verses.second_half: the flame burnt up the ungodly.
verses.first_half_tle: And the fire was kindled in their company;
verses.second_half_tle: the flame burnt up the ungodly.

verses.first_half: They made a calf in Horeb
verses.second_half: and worshiped a molten image.
verses.first_half_tle: They made a calf in Horeb
verses.second_half_tle: and worshiped the molten image.

verses.first_half: Thus they exchanged their glory
verses.second_half: for the image of a calf that feeds on hay.
verses.first_half_tle: Thus they turned their glory
verses.second_half_tle: into the similitude of a calf that eateth hay.

verses.first_half: And they forgot God their Savior,
verses.second_half: who had done great things in Egypt,
verses.first_half_tle: And they forgat God their Savior,
verses.second_half_tle: who had done so great things in Egypt;

verses.first_half: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
verses.second_half: and fearful things by the Red Sea.
verses.first_half_tle: Wondrous works in the land of Ham;
verses.second_half_tle: and fearful things by the Red Sea.

verses.first_half: So he said he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap
verses.second_half: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.
verses.first_half_tle: So he said he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap,
verses.second_half_tle: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

verses.first_half: Then they scorned that pleasant land
verses.second_half: and gave no credence to his word,
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, they thought scorn of that pleasant land,
verses.second_half_tle: and gave no credence unto his word;

verses.first_half: But murmured in their tents
verses.second_half: and did not hearken to the voice of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: But murmured in their tents,
verses.second_half_tle: and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Then he lifted up his hand against them
verses.second_half: to overthrow them in the wilderness,
verses.first_half_tle: Then lift he up his hand against them,
verses.second_half_tle: to overthrow them in the wilderness;

verses.first_half: To cast out their seed among the nations,
verses.second_half: and to scatter them in all the lands.
verses.first_half_tle: To cast out their seed among the nations,
verses.second_half_tle: and to scatter them in the lands.

verses.first_half: They joined themselves to Baal-Peor
verses.second_half: and ate the offerings to the dead.
verses.first_half_tle: They joined themselves unto Baal-peor,
verses.second_half_tle: and ate the offerings of the dead.

verses.first_half: Thus they provoked him to anger with their wanton deeds,
verses.second_half: and the plague broke out among them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thus they provoked him to anger with their own inventions;
verses.second_half_tle: and the plague was great among them.

verses.first_half: Then Phineas stood up and interceded,
verses.second_half: and so the plague was ended;
verses.first_half_tle: Then stood up Phineas, and interposed;
verses.second_half_tle: and so the plague ceased.

verses.first_half: And that was counted to him as righteousness
verses.second_half: among all generations for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: And that was counted unto him for righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: among all posterities for evermore.

verses.first_half: They angered him also at the waters of strife,
verses.second_half: so that he punished Moses for their misdeeds;
verses.first_half_tle: They angered him also at the waters of strife,
verses.second_half_tle: so that he punished Moses for their sakes;

verses.first_half: For they provoked him to anger,
verses.second_half: so that he spoke rashly with his lips.
verses.first_half_tle: Because they provoked his spirit,
verses.second_half_tle: so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

verses.first_half: Neither did they destroy the peoples
verses.second_half: as the LORD commanded them,
verses.first_half_tle: Neither destroyed they the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: as the LORD commanded them;

verses.first_half: But intermingled among the nations
verses.second_half: and learned their heathen ways,
verses.first_half_tle: But were mingled among the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: and learned their works.

verses.first_half: So that they worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them;
verses.second_half: they offered their sons and their daughters to demons,
verses.first_half_tle: Insomuch that they worshipped their idols, which became a snare unto them;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, they offered their sons and their daughters unto devils;

verses.first_half: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
verses.second_half: whom they offered to the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.
verses.first_half_tle: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
verses.second_half_tle: whom they offered unto the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

verses.first_half: Thus were they defiled by their own works
verses.second_half: and went whoring with their own deeds.
verses.first_half_tle: Thus were they stained with their own works,
verses.second_half_tle: and went a whoring with their own inventions.

verses.first_half: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people,
verses.second_half: and he abhorred his own inheritance,
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people,
verses.second_half_tle: insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

verses.first_half: And he gave them over into the hands of the nations,
verses.second_half: and those who hated them were lords over them.
verses.first_half_tle: And he gave them over into the hand of the heathen;
verses.second_half_tle: and they that hated them were lords over them.

verses.first_half: Their enemies oppressed them
verses.second_half: and held them in subjection.
verses.first_half_tle: Their enemies oppressed them,
verses.second_half_tle: and had them in subjection.

verses.first_half: Many a time did he deliver them,
verses.second_half: but they rebelled against him through their own devices, and were brought down in their wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: Many a time did he deliver them;
verses.second_half_tle: but they rebelled against him with their own inventions, and were brought down in their wickedness.

verses.first_half: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity,
verses.second_half: when he heard their lamentation,
verses.first_half_tle: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity,
verses.second_half_tle: he heard their complaint.

verses.first_half: He remembered his covenant and pitied them, according to the multitude of his mercies;
verses.second_half: he made all those who led them away captive to pity them.
verses.first_half_tle: He thought upon his covenant, and pitied them, according unto the multitude of his mercies;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, he made all those that led them away captive to pity them.

verses.first_half: Deliver us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the nations,
verses.second_half: that we may give thanks to your holy Name and make our boast of your praise.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen;
verses.second_half_tle: that we may give thanks unto thy holy Name, and make our boast of thy praise.

verses.first_half: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting and world without end,
verses.second_half: and let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, from everlasting, and world without end;
verses.second_half_tle: And let all the people say, Amen.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.second_half: and his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.second_half_tle: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Let those whom the LORD has redeemed give thanks,
verses.second_half: whom he has delivered from the hand of the enemy,
verses.first_half_tle: Let them give thanks whom the LORD hath redeemed,
verses.second_half_tle: and delivered from the hand of the enemy;

verses.first_half: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west,
verses.second_half: from the north and from the south.
verses.first_half_tle: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west;
verses.second_half_tle: from the north, and from the south.

verses.first_half: They went astray in the wilderness, even in the desert,
verses.second_half: and found no city to dwell in;
verses.first_half_tle: They went astray in the wilderness out of the way,
verses.second_half_tle: and found no city to dwell in.

verses.first_half: They were hungry and thirsty,
verses.second_half: and their soul fainted within them.
verses.first_half_tle: Hungry and thirsty,
verses.second_half_tle: their soul fainted in them.

verses.first_half: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half: and he delivered them from their distress.
verses.first_half_tle: So they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: and he delivered them from their distress.

verses.first_half: He led them forth by a straight path
verses.second_half: until they came to a city where they might dwell.
verses.first_half_tle: He led them forth by the right way,
verses.second_half_tle: that they might go to the city where they dwelt.

verses.first_half: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.second_half: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!
verses.first_half_tle: O that men would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.first_half: For he satisfies the empty soul
verses.second_half: and fills the hungry soul with goodness.
verses.first_half_tle: For he satisfieth the empty soul,
verses.second_half_tle: and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

verses.first_half: Some sat in darkness, and in the shadow of death,
verses.second_half: being bound fast in misery and iron,
verses.first_half_tle: Such as sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death,
verses.second_half_tle: being fast bound in misery and iron;

verses.first_half: Because they rebelled against the words of God
verses.second_half: and lightly regarded the counsel of the Most High.
verses.first_half_tle: Because they rebelled against the words of the Lord,
verses.second_half_tle: and lightly regarded the counsel of the Most Highest;

verses.first_half: He also brought down their heart with heaviness;
verses.second_half: they fell down, and there was none to help them.
verses.first_half_tle: He also brought down their heart through heaviness:
verses.second_half_tle: they fell down, and there was none to help them.

verses.first_half: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half: and he delivered them out of their distress.
verses.first_half_tle: So when they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.first_half: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death,
verses.second_half: and broke their bonds asunder.
verses.first_half_tle: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death,
verses.second_half_tle: and brake their bonds in sunder.

verses.first_half: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.second_half: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!
verses.first_half_tle: O that men would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.first_half: For he has broken the gates of brass
verses.second_half: and shattered the bars of iron asunder.
verses.first_half_tle: For he hath broken the gates of brass,
verses.second_half_tle: and smitten the bars of iron in sunder.

verses.first_half: The foolish were plagued for their offense
verses.second_half: and because of their wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: Foolish men are plagued for their offense,
verses.second_half_tle: and because of their wickedness.

verses.first_half: Their soul abhorred all manner of food,
verses.second_half: and they were even close to death’s door.
verses.first_half_tle: Their soul abhorred all manner of meat,
verses.second_half_tle: and they were even hard at death’s door.

verses.first_half: So when they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half: he delivered them out of their distress.
verses.first_half_tle: So when they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.first_half: He sent his word and healed them,
verses.second_half: and they were saved from destruction.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent his word, and healed them;
verses.second_half_tle: and they were saved from their destruction.

verses.first_half: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.second_half: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!
verses.first_half_tle: O that men would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.first_half: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.second_half: and tell of his works with gladness!
verses.first_half_tle: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
verses.second_half_tle: and tell out his works with gladness!

verses.first_half: Those who go down to the sea in ships,
verses.second_half: who carry out their business in great waters,
verses.first_half_tle: They that go down to the sea in ships,
verses.second_half_tle: and occupy their business in great waters;

verses.first_half: They behold the works of the LORD
verses.second_half: and his wonders in the deep.
verses.first_half_tle: These men see the works of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and his wonders in the deep.

verses.first_half: For at his word the stormy wind arises,
verses.second_half: which lifts up the waves.
verses.first_half_tle: For at his word the stormy wind ariseth,
verses.second_half_tle: which lifteth up the waves thereof.

verses.first_half: They are carried up to heaven and down again to the deep;
verses.second_half: their soul melts away because of the trouble.
verses.first_half_tle: They are carried up to the heaven, and down again to the deep;
verses.second_half_tle: their soul melteth away because of the trouble.

verses.first_half: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
verses.second_half: and are at their wits’ end.
verses.first_half_tle: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
verses.second_half_tle: and are at their wit’s end.

verses.first_half: So when they cry unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half: he delivers them out of their distress.
verses.first_half_tle: So when they cry unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.second_half_tle: he delivereth them out of their distress.

verses.first_half: For he makes the storm to cease,
verses.second_half: so that the waves are still.
verses.first_half_tle: For he maketh the storm to cease,
verses.second_half_tle: so that the waves thereof are still.

verses.first_half: Then they are glad, because they are at rest,
verses.second_half: and so he brings them into the haven where they desire to be.
verses.first_half_tle: Then are they glad, because they are at rest;
verses.second_half_tle: and so he bringeth them unto the haven where they would be.

verses.first_half: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.second_half: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!
verses.first_half_tle: O that men would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness;
verses.second_half_tle: and declare the wonders that he doeth for the children of men!

verses.first_half: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people
verses.second_half: and praise him in the seat of the elders!
verses.first_half_tle: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people,
verses.second_half_tle: and praise him in the seat of the elders!

verses.first_half: He turns rivers into a wilderness
verses.second_half: and water-springs into thirsty ground,
verses.first_half_tle: He turneth the floods into a wilderness,
verses.second_half_tle: and drieth up the water springs.

verses.first_half: A fruitful land he makes barren,
verses.second_half: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.
verses.first_half_tle: A fruitful land maketh he barren,
verses.second_half_tle: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

verses.first_half: Again, he makes the wilderness into pools of water
verses.second_half: and dry ground into water-springs;
verses.first_half_tle: Again, he maketh the wilderness a standing water,
verses.second_half_tle: and water springs of a dry ground.

verses.first_half: And there he sets the hungry
verses.second_half: that they may build a city to dwell in,
verses.first_half_tle: And there he setteth the hungry,
verses.second_half_tle: that they may build them a city to dwell in;

verses.first_half: That they may sow their land and plant vineyards
verses.second_half: to yield the fruits of increase.
verses.first_half_tle: That they may sow their land, and plant vineyards,
verses.second_half_tle: to yield them fruits of increase.

verses.first_half: He blesses them, so that they multiply exceedingly,
verses.second_half: and does not allow their cattle to decrease.
verses.first_half_tle: He blesseth them, so that they multiply exceedingly;
verses.second_half_tle: and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

verses.first_half: And again, when they are diminished and brought low,
verses.second_half: through oppression, through any plague or trouble,
verses.first_half_tle: And again, when they are minished and brought low
verses.second_half_tle: through oppression, through any plague or trouble;

verses.first_half: Though he pours contempt on princes
verses.second_half: and lets them wander in the pathless wilderness,
verses.first_half_tle: Though he suffer them to be evil entreated through tyrants,
verses.second_half_tle: and let them wander out of the way in the wilderness;

verses.first_half: Yet he helps the poor out of misery
verses.second_half: and increases their households like a flock of sheep.
verses.first_half_tle: Yet helpeth he the poor out of misery,
verses.second_half_tle: and maketh him households like a flock of sheep.

verses.first_half: The righteous will consider this and rejoice,
verses.second_half: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.
verses.first_half_tle: The righteous will consider this, and rejoice;
verses.second_half_tle: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

verses.first_half: Whoever is wise will ponder these things,
verses.second_half: and shall understand the loving-kindness of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Whoso is wise, will ponder these things;
verses.second_half_tle: and they shall understand the loving-kindness of the LORD.

verses.first_half: O God, my heart is fixed, my heart is firmly fixed;
verses.second_half: I will sing and give praise with the best that I have.
verses.first_half_tle: O God, my heart is ready, my heart is ready;
verses.second_half_tle: I will sing, and give praise with the best member that I have.

verses.first_half: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
verses.second_half: I myself will awaken the dawn.
verses.first_half_tle: Awake, thou lute and harp;
verses.second_half_tle: I myself will awake right early.

verses.first_half: I will give thanks unto you, O LORD, among the peoples,
verses.second_half: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations,
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the peoples;
verses.second_half_tle: I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

verses.first_half: For the greatness of your mercy reaches to the heavens,
verses.second_half: and your faithfulness to the clouds.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy mercy is greater than the heavens,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

verses.first_half: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.second_half: let your glory be over all the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Set up thyself, O God, above the heavens,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy glory above all the earth;

verses.first_half: That your beloved may be delivered,
verses.second_half: save me by your right hand, and answer me.
verses.first_half_tle: That thy beloved may be delivered:
verses.second_half_tle: let thy right hand save them, and hear thou me.

verses.first_half: God has spoken in his holiness:
verses.second_half: “I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.
verses.first_half_tle: God hath spoken in his holiness;
verses.second_half_tle: I will rejoice therefore, and divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

verses.first_half: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.second_half: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.
verses.first_half_tle: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.second_half_tle: Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver;

verses.first_half: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast my shoe;
verses.second_half: over Philistia will I triumph.”
verses.first_half_tle: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe;
verses.second_half_tle: upon Philistia will I triumph.

verses.first_half: Who will lead me into the strong city,
verses.second_half: and who will bring me into Edom?
verses.first_half_tle: Who will lead me into the strong city?
verses.second_half_tle: and who will bring me into Edom?

verses.first_half: Have you not forsaken us, O God?
verses.second_half: And will you not, O God, go forth with our hosts?
verses.first_half_tle: Hast thou not forsaken us, O God?
verses.second_half_tle: and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

verses.first_half: O help us against the enemy,
verses.second_half: for vain is the help of man.
verses.first_half_tle: O help us against the enemy,
verses.second_half_tle: for vain is the help of man.

verses.first_half: Through God we shall do great acts,
verses.second_half: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: Through God we shall do great acts,
verses.second_half_tle: and it is he that shall tread down our enemies.

verses.first_half: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise,
verses.second_half: for the mouth of the ungodly, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: Hold not thy tongue, O God of my praise;
verses.second_half_tle: for the mouth of the ungodly, yea, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

verses.first_half: They have spoken against me with false tongues;
verses.second_half: they encompassed me with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.
verses.first_half_tle: And they have spoken against me with false tongues;
verses.second_half_tle: they compassed me about also with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

verses.first_half: In return for the love that I had for them, they have become my adversaries;
verses.second_half: but I give myself to prayer.
verses.first_half_tle: For the love that I had unto them, lo, they take now my contrary part;
verses.second_half_tle: but I give myself unto prayer.

verses.first_half: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good,
verses.second_half: and hatred for my love.
verses.first_half_tle: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good,
verses.second_half_tle: and hatred for my good will.

verses.first_half: Set an ungodly man to be ruler over him,
verses.second_half: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.
verses.first_half_tle: Set thou an ungodly man to be ruler over him,
verses.second_half_tle: and let an adversary stand at his right hand.

verses.first_half: When judgment is given, let him be condemned,
verses.second_half: and let sentence be passed on him for guilt.
verses.first_half_tle: When sentence is given upon him, let him be condemned;
verses.second_half_tle: and let his prayer be turned into sin.

verses.first_half: Let his days be few,
verses.second_half: and let another take his office.
verses.first_half_tle: Let his days be few;
verses.second_half_tle: and let another take his office.

verses.first_half: Let his children be fatherless
verses.second_half: and his wife a widow.
verses.first_half_tle: Let his children be fatherless,
verses.second_half_tle: and his wife a widow.

verses.first_half: Let his children be vagabonds and beg their bread;
verses.second_half: let them be driven out, even from desolate places.
verses.first_half_tle: Let his children be vagabonds, and beg their bread;
verses.second_half_tle: let them seek it also out of desolate places.

verses.first_half: Let the creditor consume all that he has,
verses.second_half: and let strangers take his labor for spoil.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the extortioner consume all that he hath;
verses.second_half_tle: and let the stranger spoil his labor.

verses.first_half: Let there be no one to pity him,
verses.second_half: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.
verses.first_half_tle: Let there be no man to pity him,
verses.second_half_tle: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

verses.first_half: Let his posterity be destroyed,
verses.second_half: and in the next generation let his name be blotted out.
verses.first_half_tle: Let his posterity be destroyed;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the next generation let his name be clean put out.

verses.first_half: Let the wickedness of his fathers be held in remembrance in the sight of the LORD,
verses.second_half: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the wickedness of his fathers be had in remembrance in the sight of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and let not the sin of his mother be done away.

verses.first_half: Let them be always before the LORD,
verses.second_half: that he may root out the memorial of them from the earth,
verses.first_half_tle: Let them alway be before the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: that he may root out the memorial of them from off the earth;

verses.first_half: Because he was not minded to do good,
verses.second_half: but persecuted to death the poor and needy, and those who were brokenhearted.
verses.first_half_tle: And that, because his mind was not to do good;
verses.second_half_tle: but persecuted the poor helpless man, that he might slay him that was vexed at the heart.

verses.first_half: His delight was in cursing; let curses come upon him;
verses.second_half: he loved not blessing; therefore let it be far from him.
verses.first_half_tle: His delight was in cursing, and it shall happen unto him;
verses.second_half_tle: he loved not blessing, therefore shall it be far from him.

verses.first_half: He clothed himself with cursing as with a garment,
verses.second_half: so let it soak into his body like water, and like oil into his bones.
verses.first_half_tle: He clothed himself with cursing like as with a raiment,
verses.second_half_tle: and it shall come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.first_half: Let it be to him as the cloak that he has on
verses.second_half: and as the belt that he always wears.
verses.first_half_tle: Let it be unto him as the cloak that he hath upon him,
verses.second_half_tle: and as the girdle that he is alway girded withal.

verses.first_half: Let this be the recompense from the LORD to my enemies,
verses.second_half: and to those who speak evil against my soul.
verses.first_half_tle: Let it thus happen from the LORD unto mine enemies,
verses.second_half_tle: and to those that speak evil against my soul.

verses.first_half: But deal with me, O LORD God, according to your Name;
verses.second_half: for sweet is your mercy.
verses.first_half_tle: But deal thou with me, O LORD God, according unto thy Name;
verses.second_half_tle: for sweet is thy mercy.

verses.first_half: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor,
verses.second_half: and my heart is wounded within me.
verses.first_half_tle: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor,
verses.second_half_tle: and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.first_half: I disappear like the shadow that lengthens,
verses.second_half: and am shaken off like a grasshopper.
verses.first_half_tle: I go hence like the shadow that departeth,
verses.second_half_tle: and am driven away as the grasshopper.

verses.first_half: My knees are weak through fasting;
verses.second_half: my flesh is grown lean for want of nourishment.
verses.first_half_tle: My knees are weak through fasting;
verses.second_half_tle: my flesh is dried up for want of fatness.

verses.first_half: I have become a reproach to them;
verses.second_half: when they look on me, they shake their heads.
verses.first_half_tle: I am become also a reproach unto them:
verses.second_half_tle: they that look upon me shake their heads.

verses.first_half: Help me, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half: save me according to your mercy;
verses.first_half_tle: Help me, O LORD my God;
verses.second_half_tle: O save me according to thy mercy;

verses.first_half: And they shall know that this is your hand,
verses.second_half: and that you, O LORD, have done it.
verses.first_half_tle: And they shall know how that this is thy hand,
verses.second_half_tle: and that thou, LORD, hast done it.

verses.first_half: Though they curse, yet you bless;
verses.second_half: let them be confounded who rise up against me, but let your servant rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Though they curse, yet bless thou;
verses.second_half_tle: and let them be confounded that rise up against me; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.first_half: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame,
verses.second_half: and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a cloak.
verses.first_half_tle: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame;
verses.second_half_tle: and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a cloak.

verses.first_half: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth,
verses.second_half: and praise him among the multitude,
verses.first_half_tle: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth,
verses.second_half_tle: and praise him among the multitude;

verses.first_half: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,
verses.second_half: to save their souls from the unrighteous judges.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: to save his soul from unrighteous judges.

verses.first_half: The LORD said unto my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
verses.second_half: until I make your enemies your footstool.”
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD said unto my Lord,
verses.second_half_tle: Sit thou on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall send the scepter of your power out of Zion:
verses.second_half: “Rule in the midst of your enemies.”
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall send the rod of thy power out of Zion:
verses.second_half_tle: be thou ruler, even in the midst among thine enemies.

verses.first_half: In the day of your power the people, in holy raiment, shall offer you freewill offerings;
verses.second_half: from the womb of the morning, the dew of your youth belongs to you.
verses.first_half_tle: In the day of thy power shall thy people offer themselves willingly with an holy worship:
verses.second_half_tle: thy young men come to thee as dew from the womb of the morning.

verses.first_half: The LORD has sworn and will not recant:
verses.second_half: “You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD sware, and will not repent,
verses.second_half_tle: Thou art a Priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

verses.first_half: The Lord at your right hand
verses.second_half: shall smite kings in the day of his wrath.
verses.first_half_tle: The Lord upon thy right hand
verses.second_half_tle: shall wound even kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.first_half: He shall judge the nations;
verses.second_half: he shall fill the lands with dead bodies, and strike down heads over many countries.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall judge among the heathen;
verses.second_half_tle: he shall fill the places with the dead bodies, and smite in sunder the heads over divers countries.

verses.first_half: He shall drink from the brook by the way;
verses.second_half: therefore shall he lift up his head.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall drink of the brook in the way;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore shall he lift up his head.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD. I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart,
verses.second_half: in the company of the upright, and among the congregation.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart,
verses.second_half_tle: secretly among the faithful, and in the congregation.

verses.first_half: The works of the LORD are great,
verses.second_half: sought out by all who have pleasure in them.
verses.first_half_tle: The works of the LORD are great,
verses.second_half_tle: sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.

verses.first_half: His work is worthy to be praised and held in honor,
verses.second_half: and his righteousness endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: His work is worthy to be praised and had in honour,
verses.second_half_tle: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: He has made his marvelous works to be had in remembrance;
verses.second_half: The LORD is gracious and merciful.
verses.first_half_tle: The merciful and gracious LORD hath so done his marvellous works,
verses.second_half_tle: that they ought to be had in remembrance.

verses.first_half: He has given food to those who fear him;
verses.second_half: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath given meat unto them that fear him;
verses.second_half_tle: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

verses.first_half: He has shown his people the power of his works,
verses.second_half: that he may give them the heritage of the nations.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath showed his people the power of his works,
verses.second_half_tle: that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.

verses.first_half: The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice;
verses.second_half: all his commandments are true.
verses.first_half_tle: The works of his hands are verity and judgment;
verses.second_half_tle: all his commandments are true.

verses.first_half: They stand fast for ever and ever,
verses.second_half: and are done in truth and equity.
verses.first_half_tle: They stand fast for ever and ever,
verses.second_half_tle: and are done in truth and equity.

verses.first_half: He sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant for ever;
verses.second_half: holy and awesome is his Name.
verses.first_half_tle: He sent redemption unto his people;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath commanded his covenant for ever; holy and reverend is his Name.

verses.first_half: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom;
verses.second_half: a good understanding have all those who live accordingly; his praise endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom;
verses.second_half_tle: a good understanding have all they that do thereafter; his praise endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD! Blessed is the one who fears the LORD,
verses.second_half: who has great delight in his commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed is the man that feareth the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath great delight in his commandments.

verses.first_half: His seed shall be mighty in the land;
verses.second_half: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.
verses.first_half_tle: His seed shall be mighty upon earth;
verses.second_half_tle: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

verses.first_half: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house,
verses.second_half: and his righteousness shall endure for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house;
verses.second_half_tle: and his righteousness endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: For the upright, there rises light in the darkness;
verses.second_half: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto the godly there ariseth up light in the darkness;
verses.second_half_tle: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

verses.first_half: It is good for him to be generous in lending
verses.second_half: and to guide his words with discretion.
verses.first_half_tle: A good man is merciful, and lendeth;
verses.second_half_tle: and will guide his words with discretion.

verses.first_half: For he shall never be moved,
verses.second_half: and the righteous shall be kept in everlasting remembrance.
verses.first_half_tle: For he shall never be moved:
verses.second_half_tle: and the righteous shall be had in everlasting remembrance.

verses.first_half: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings,
verses.second_half: for his heart is steadfast and trusts in the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings;
verses.second_half_tle: for his heart standeth fast, and believeth in the LORD.

verses.first_half: His heart is established, and will not fear;
verses.second_half: at the last he shall see his desire upon his enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: His heart is stablished, and will not shrink,
verses.second_half_tle: until he see his desire upon his enemies.

verses.first_half: He has given freely to the poor,
verses.second_half: and his righteousness endures for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath dispersed abroad, and given to the poor,
verses.second_half_tle: and his righteousness remaineth for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.

verses.first_half: The ungodly shall see it, and shall be angry;
verses.second_half: he shall gnash his teeth, and waste away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly shall see it, and it shall grieve him;
verses.second_half_tle: he shall gnash with his teeth, and consume away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD. Sing praises, you servants of the LORD;
verses.second_half: O praise the Name of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, ye servants;
verses.second_half_tle: O praise the Name of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Blessed be the Name of the LORD,
verses.second_half: from this time forth for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed be the Name of the LORD
verses.second_half_tle: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.first_half: The LORD’s Name be praised
verses.second_half: from the rising up of the sun to the going down of the same.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD’s Name is praised
verses.second_half_tle: from the rising up of the sun unto the going down of the same.

verses.first_half: The LORD is high above all nations,
verses.second_half: and his glory above the heavens.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is high above all nations,
verses.second_half_tle: and his glory above the heavens.

verses.first_half: Who is like the LORD our God, who has his dwelling so high,
verses.second_half: and yet humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?
verses.first_half_tle: Who is like unto the LORD our God, that hath his dwelling so high,
verses.second_half_tle: and yet humbleth himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth!

verses.first_half: He takes up the lowly out of the dust,
verses.second_half: and lifts the poor out of the ashes,
verses.first_half_tle: He taketh up the simple out of the dust,
verses.second_half_tle: and lifteth the poor out of the mire;

verses.first_half: That he may set them with the princes,
verses.second_half: even with the princes of his people.
verses.first_half_tle: That he may set him with the princes,
verses.second_half_tle: even with the princes of his people.

verses.first_half: He gives the barren woman a home to dwell in,
verses.second_half: and makes her to be a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: He maketh the barren woman to keep house,
verses.second_half_tle: and to be a joyful mother of children.

verses.first_half: When Israel came out of Egypt,
verses.second_half: and the house of Jacob from among a people of a foreign tongue,
verses.first_half_tle: When Israel came out of Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: and the house of Jacob from among the strange people,

verses.first_half: Judah was God’s sanctuary,
verses.second_half: and Israel his dominion.
verses.first_half_tle: Judah was his sanctuary,
verses.second_half_tle: and Israel his dominion.

verses.first_half: The sea beheld it and fled;
verses.second_half: Jordan was driven back.
verses.first_half_tle: The sea saw that, and fled;
verses.second_half_tle: Jordan was driven back.

verses.first_half: The mountains skipped like rams,
verses.second_half: and the little hills like young sheep.
verses.first_half_tle: The mountains skipped like rams,
verses.second_half_tle: and the little hills like young sheep.

verses.first_half: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled?
verses.second_half: O Jordan, that you were driven back?
verses.first_half_tle: What aileth thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest?
verses.second_half_tle: and thou Jordan, that thou wast driven back?

verses.first_half: You mountains, that you skipped like rams,
verses.second_half: and you little hills like young sheep?
verses.first_half_tle: Ye mountains, that ye skipped like rams?
verses.second_half_tle: and ye little hills, like young sheep?

verses.first_half: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
verses.second_half: at the presence of the God of Jacob,
verses.first_half_tle: Tremble, thou earth, at the presence of the Lord:
verses.second_half_tle: at the presence of the God of Jacob;

verses.first_half: Who turned the hard rock into a pool of water,
verses.second_half: and the flint stone into a springing well.
verses.first_half_tle: Who turned the hard rock into a standing water,
verses.second_half_tle: and the flint-stone into a springing well.

verses.first_half: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto your Name give the praise,
verses.second_half: for your loving mercy and for your truth’s sake.
verses.first_half_tle: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto thy Name give the praise;
verses.second_half_tle: for thy loving mercy, and for thy truth’s sake.

verses.first_half: Why shall the nations say,
verses.second_half: “Where now is their God?”
verses.first_half_tle: Wherefore shall the heathen say,
verses.second_half_tle: Where is now their God?

verses.first_half: As for our God, he is in heaven;
verses.second_half: he has done whatsoever pleased him.
verses.first_half_tle: As for our God, he is in heaven:
verses.second_half_tle: he hath done whatsoever pleased him.

verses.first_half: Their idols are silver and gold,
verses.second_half: even the work of human hands.
verses.first_half_tle: Their idols are silver and gold,
verses.second_half_tle: even the work of men’s hands.

verses.first_half: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.second_half: eyes have they, but they see not.
verses.first_half_tle: They have mouths, and speak not;
verses.second_half_tle: eyes have they, and see not.

verses.first_half: They have ears, but they hear not;
verses.second_half: noses have they, but they smell not.
verses.first_half_tle: They have ears, and hear not;
verses.second_half_tle: noses have they, and smell not.

verses.first_half: They have hands, but they feel not; feet have they, but they walk not;
verses.second_half: neither is there any sound in their throat.
verses.first_half_tle: They have hands, and handle not; feet have they, and walk not;
verses.second_half_tle: neither speak they through their throat.

verses.first_half: Those who make them are like them,
verses.second_half: and so are all who put their trust in them.
verses.first_half_tle: They that make them are like unto them;
verses.second_half_tle: and so are all such as put their trust in them.

verses.first_half: But you, O house of Israel, trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half: he is their helper and defender.
verses.first_half_tle: But thou, house of Israel, trust thou in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: he is their helper and defender.

verses.first_half: You house of Aaron, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half: he is their helper and defender.
verses.first_half_tle: Ye house of Aaron, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: he is their helper and defender.

verses.first_half: You who fear the LORD, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half: he is their helper and defender.
verses.first_half_tle: Ye that fear the LORD, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: he is their helper and defender.

verses.first_half: The LORD has been mindful of us, and he shall bless us;
verses.second_half: he shall bless the house of Israel; he shall bless the house of Aaron;
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hath been mindful of us, and he shall bless us;
verses.second_half_tle: even he shall bless the house of Israel, he shall bless the house of Aaron.

verses.first_half: He shall bless those who fear the LORD,
verses.second_half: both small and great together.
verses.first_half_tle: He shall bless them that fear the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: both small and great.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall increase you more and more,
verses.second_half: you and your children after you.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall increase you more and more,
verses.second_half_tle: you and your children.

verses.first_half: You are the blessed of the LORD,
verses.second_half: who has made heaven and earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Ye are the blessed of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: who made heaven and earth.

verses.first_half: The heavens are the LORD’s;
verses.second_half: the earth has he given to the children of men.
verses.first_half_tle: All the whole heavens are the LORD’s;
verses.second_half_tle: the earth hath he given to the children of men.

verses.first_half: The dead praise you not, O LORD,
verses.second_half: neither all those who go down into silence.
verses.first_half_tle: The dead praise not thee, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: neither all they that go down into silence.

verses.first_half: But we will praise the LORD,
verses.second_half: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: But we will praise the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: I love the LORD,
verses.second_half: because he heard the voice of my prayer,
verses.first_half_tle: My delight is in the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: because he hath heard the voice of my prayer;

verses.first_half: Because he inclined his ear to me;
verses.second_half: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.
verses.first_half_tle: Because he hath inclined his ear unto me;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

verses.first_half: The snares of death encompassed me, and the pains of the Grave laid hold of me;
verses.second_half: I suffered trouble and sorrow.
verses.first_half_tle: The snares of death compassed me round about,
verses.second_half_tle: and the pains of hell gat hold upon me.

verses.first_half: Then I called upon the Name of the LORD:
verses.second_half: “O LORD, I beseech you, deliver my soul.”
verses.first_half_tle: I found trouble and heaviness; then called I upon the Name of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.

verses.first_half: Gracious is the LORD and righteous;
verses.second_half: indeed, our God is full of compassion.
verses.first_half_tle: Gracious is the LORD, and righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, our God is merciful.

verses.first_half: The Lord preserves the simple;
verses.second_half: I was in misery, and he helped me.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD preserveth the simple:
verses.second_half_tle: I was in misery, and he helped me.

verses.first_half: Turn again to your rest, O my soul,
verses.second_half: for the LORD has rewarded you.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn again then unto thy rest, O my soul;
verses.second_half_tle: for the LORD hath rewarded thee.

verses.first_half: You have delivered my soul from death,
verses.second_half: my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.
verses.first_half_tle: And why? thou hast delivered my soul from death,
verses.second_half_tle: mine eyes from tears, and my feet from falling.

verses.first_half: I will walk before the LORD
verses.second_half: in the land of the living.
verses.first_half_tle: I will walk before the LORD
verses.second_half_tle: in the land of the living.

verses.first_half: I believed, and therefore will I speak: “I am greatly troubled.”
verses.second_half: I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”
verses.first_half_tle: I believed, and therefore will I speak; but I was sore troubled:
verses.second_half_tle: I said in my haste, All men are liars.

verses.first_half: What shall I give unto the LORD
verses.second_half: for all the benefits that he has done unto me?
verses.first_half_tle: What reward shall I give unto the LORD
verses.second_half_tle: for all the benefits that he hath done unto me?

verses.first_half: I will lift up the cup of salvation
verses.second_half: and call upon the Name of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I will receive the cup of salvation,
verses.second_half_tle: and call upon the Name of the LORD.

verses.first_half: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the presence of all his people;
verses.second_half: dear in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.
verses.first_half_tle: I will pay my vows now in the presence of all his people:
verses.second_half_tle: right dear in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

verses.first_half: O LORD, I am your servant;
verses.second_half: I am your servant, and the child of your handmaid; you have broken my bonds asunder.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, O LORD, how that I am thy servant;
verses.second_half_tle: I am thy servant, and the son of thine handmaid; thou hast broken my bonds in sunder.

verses.first_half: I will offer you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.second_half: and will call upon the Name of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving,
verses.second_half_tle: and will call upon the Name of the LORD.

verses.first_half: I will pay my vows unto the LORD in the sight of all his people,
verses.second_half: in the courts of the LORD’s house, even in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I will pay my vows unto the LORD, in the sight of all his people,
verses.second_half_tle: in the courts of the LORD’s house; even in the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD, all you nations;
verses.second_half: praise him, all you peoples.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, all ye nations;
verses.second_half_tle: praise him, all ye peoples.

verses.first_half: For great is his loving-kindness towards us,
verses.second_half: and the faithfulness of the LORD endures for ever. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: For his merciful kindness is ever more and more toward us;
verses.second_half_tle: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: Give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious;
verses.second_half: his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious;
verses.second_half_tle: because his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious,
verses.second_half: that his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious,
verses.second_half_tle: and that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Let the house of Aaron now confess
verses.second_half: that his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the house of Aaron now confess,
verses.second_half_tle: that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Indeed, let those who fear the LORD confess
verses.second_half: that his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, let them now that fear the LORD confess,
verses.second_half_tle: that his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: I called upon the LORD in trouble,
verses.second_half: and the LORD heard me and set me free.
verses.first_half_tle: I called upon the LORD in trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: and the LORD heard me at large.

verses.first_half: The LORD is on my side;
verses.second_half: I will not fear what man can do to me.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is on my side;
verses.second_half_tle: I will not fear what man doeth unto me.

verses.first_half: The LORD takes my side with those who help me;
verses.second_half: therefore shall I look in triumph on my enemies.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD taketh my part with them that help me;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore shall I see my desire upon mine enemies.

verses.first_half: It is better to trust in the LORD
verses.second_half: than to put any confidence in man.
verses.first_half_tle: It is better to trust in the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: than to put any confidence in man.

verses.first_half: It is better to trust in the LORD
verses.second_half: than to put any confidence in princes.
verses.first_half_tle: It is better to trust in the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: than to put any confidence in princes.

verses.first_half: All the nations encompass me,
verses.second_half: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.
verses.first_half_tle: All nations compassed me round about;
verses.second_half_tle: but in the Name of the LORD will I destroy them.

verses.first_half: They hem me in on every side; indeed, they hem me in on every side,
verses.second_half: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.
verses.first_half_tle: They kept me in on every side, they kept me in, I say, on every side;
verses.second_half_tle: but in the Name of the LORD will I destroy them.

verses.first_half: They come about me like bees, and blaze like fire among the thorns,
verses.second_half: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.
verses.first_half_tle: They came about me like bees, and are extinct even as the fire among the thorns;
verses.second_half_tle: for in the Name of the LORD I will destroy them.

verses.first_half: I was thrust aside so that I almost fell,
verses.second_half: but the LORD was my help.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast thrust sore at me, that I might fall;
verses.second_half_tle: but the LORD was my help.

verses.first_half: The LORD is my strength and my song,
verses.second_half: and has become my salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD is my strength and my song;
verses.second_half_tle: and is become my salvation.

verses.first_half: The voice of joy and deliverance is in the dwellings of the righteous;
verses.second_half: the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.
verses.first_half_tle: The voice of joy and health is in the dwellings of the righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: the right hand of the LORD bringeth mighty things to pass.

verses.first_half: The right hand of the LORD is exalted;
verses.second_half: the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.
verses.first_half_tle: The right hand of the LORD hath the preeminence;
verses.second_half_tle: the right hand of the LORD bringeth mighty things to pass.

verses.first_half: I shall not die, but live,
verses.second_half: and declare the works of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: I shall not die, but live,
verses.second_half_tle: and declare the works of the LORD.

verses.first_half: The LORD has chastened and corrected me,
verses.second_half: but he has not given me over to death.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hath chastened and corrected me;
verses.second_half_tle: but he hath not given me over unto death.

verses.first_half: Open unto me the gates of righteousness,
verses.second_half: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Open me the gates of righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the LORD.

verses.first_half: This is the gate of the LORD;
verses.second_half: the righteous shall enter into it.
verses.first_half_tle: This is the gate of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: the righteous shall enter into it.

verses.first_half: I will thank you, for you have heard me,
verses.second_half: and have become my salvation.
verses.first_half_tle: I will thank thee; for thou hast heard me,
verses.second_half_tle: and art become my salvation.

verses.first_half: The same stone which the builders refused
verses.second_half: has become the chief cornerstone.
verses.first_half_tle: The same stone which the builders refused,
verses.second_half_tle: is become the head-stone in the corner.

verses.first_half: This is the LORD’s doing,
verses.second_half: and it is marvelous in our eyes.
verses.first_half_tle: This is the LORD’s doing,
verses.second_half_tle: and it is marvelous in our eyes.

verses.first_half: This is the day that the LORD has made;
verses.second_half: we will rejoice and be glad in it.
verses.first_half_tle: This is the day which the LORD hath made;
verses.second_half_tle: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.first_half: Help me now, O LORD;
verses.second_half: O LORD, send us now prosperity.
verses.first_half_tle: Help me now, O LORD:
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, send us now prosperity.

verses.first_half: Blessed is he who comes in the Name of the LORD;
verses.second_half: we bless you from the house of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed be he that cometh in the Name of the LORD:
verses.second_half_tle: we have wished you good luck, we that are of the house of the LORD.

verses.first_half: God is the LORD, who has shown us light;
verses.second_half: bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.
verses.first_half_tle: God is the LORD, who hath showed us light:
verses.second_half_tle: bind the sacrifice with cords, yea, even unto the horns of the altar.

verses.first_half: You are my God, and I will thank you;
verses.second_half: you are my God, and I will exalt you.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my God, and I will thank thee;
verses.second_half_tle: thou art my God, and I will praise thee.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious;
verses.second_half: his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is gracious,
verses.second_half_tle: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Blessed are those who are undefiled in their ways,
verses.second_half: and walk in the law of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are those that are undefiled in the way,
verses.second_half_tle: and walk in the law of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies
verses.second_half: and seek him with their whole heart,
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies,
verses.second_half_tle: and seek him with their whole heart;

verses.first_half: Even those who do no wickedness
verses.second_half: and perfectly walk in his ways.
verses.first_half_tle: Even they who do no wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: and walk in his ways.

verses.first_half: You have ordered your precepts
verses.second_half: that we should diligently keep them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast charged
verses.second_half_tle: that we shall diligently keep thy commandments.

verses.first_half: O that my ways were made so direct
verses.second_half: that I might keep your statutes!
verses.first_half_tle: O that my ways were made so direct,
verses.second_half_tle: that I might keep thy statutes!

verses.first_half: Then would I not be put to shame
verses.second_half: while I give heed unto all your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: So shall I not be confounded,
verses.second_half_tle: while I have respect unto all thy commandments.

verses.first_half: I will thank you with an upright heart,
verses.second_half: when I have learned your righteous judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: I will thank thee with an unfeigned heart,
verses.second_half_tle: when I shall have learned the judgments of thy righteousness.

verses.first_half: I will keep your statutes;
verses.second_half: O do not forsake me utterly. Beth
verses.first_half_tle: I will keep thy statutes;
verses.second_half_tle: O forsake me not utterly. Beth

verses.first_half: How shall a young man cleanse his way?
verses.second_half: By ruling himself according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Wherewithal shall a young man cleanse his way?
verses.second_half_tle: even by ruling himself after thy word.

verses.first_half: With my whole heart I have sought you;
verses.second_half: O let me not go astray from your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: With my whole heart have I sought thee;
verses.second_half_tle: O let me not go wrong out of thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Your words have I hidden within my heart,
verses.second_half: that I may not sin against you.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy word have I hid within my heart,
verses.second_half_tle: that I should not sin against thee.

verses.first_half: Blessed are you, O LORD;
verses.second_half: teach me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed art thou, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: With my lips have I been telling
verses.second_half: of all the judgments of your mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: With my lips have I been telling
verses.second_half_tle: of all the judgements of thy mouth.

verses.first_half: I have had greater delight in the way of your testimonies
verses.second_half: than in all manner of riches.
verses.first_half_tle: I have had as great delight in the way of thy testimonies,
verses.second_half_tle: as in all manner of riches.

verses.first_half: I will meditate on your commandments
verses.second_half: and have respect for all your ways.
verses.first_half_tle: I will talk of thy commandments,
verses.second_half_tle: and have respect unto thy ways.

verses.first_half: My delight will be in your statutes,
verses.second_half: and I will not forget your word. Gimel
verses.first_half_tle: My delight shall be in thy statutes,
verses.second_half_tle: and I will not forget thy word. Gimel

verses.first_half: O do well unto your servant,
verses.second_half: that I may live, and keep your word.
verses.first_half_tle: O do well unto thy servant;
verses.second_half_tle: that I may live, and keep thy word.

verses.first_half: Open my eyes that I may see
verses.second_half: the wondrous things of your law.
verses.first_half_tle: Open thou mine eyes;
verses.second_half_tle: that I may see the wondrous things of thy law.

verses.first_half: I am a sojourner on earth;
verses.second_half: O hide not your commandments from me.
verses.first_half_tle: I am a stranger upon earth;
verses.second_half_tle: O hide not thy commandments from me.

verses.first_half: My soul is consumed with the fervent desire
verses.second_half: that it always has for your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul breaketh out for the very fervent desire
verses.second_half_tle: that it hath alway unto thy judgements.

verses.first_half: You have rebuked the proud,
verses.second_half: and cursed are those who stray from your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast rebuked the proud;
verses.second_half_tle: and cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.

verses.first_half: O turn from me shame and contempt,
verses.second_half: for I have kept your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: O turn from me shame and rebuke;
verses.second_half_tle: for I have kept thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: Though princes sit and speak against me,
verses.second_half: yet will your servant meditate on your statutes;
verses.first_half_tle: Princes also did sit and speak against me;
verses.second_half_tle: but thy servant is occupied in thy statutes.

verses.first_half: For your testimonies are my delight,
verses.second_half: and they are my counselors. Daleth
verses.first_half_tle: For thy testimonies are my delight,
verses.second_half_tle: and my counselors. Daleth

verses.first_half: My soul cleaves to the dust;
verses.second_half: O revive me, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul cleaveth to the dust;
verses.second_half_tle: O quicken thou me, according to thy word.

verses.first_half: I have acknowledged my ways, and you heard me;
verses.second_half: O teach me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: I have acknowledged my ways, and thou heardest me:
verses.second_half_tle: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: Make me to understand the way of your commandments,
verses.second_half: and so shall I meditate on your wondrous works.
verses.first_half_tle: Make me to understand the way of thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: and so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.

verses.first_half: My soul melts away for heaviness;
verses.second_half: comfort me according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul melteth away for very heaviness;
verses.second_half_tle: comfort thou me according unto thy word.

verses.first_half: Take from me the way of lying,
verses.second_half: and graciously teach me your law.
verses.first_half_tle: Take from me the way of lying,
verses.second_half_tle: and cause thou me to make much of thy law.

verses.first_half: I have chosen the way of truth,
verses.second_half: and your judgments have I set before me.
verses.first_half_tle: I have chosen the way of truth,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy judgments have I laid before me.

verses.first_half: I hold fast to your testimonies;
verses.second_half: O LORD, let me not be put to shame.
verses.first_half_tle: I have stuck unto thy testimonies;
verses.second_half_tle: O LORD, confound me not.

verses.first_half: I will run the way of your commandments
verses.second_half: when you enlarge my heart with understanding. He
verses.first_half_tle: I will run the way of thy commandments,
verses.second_half_tle: when thou hast set my heart at liberty. He

verses.first_half: Teach me, O LORD, the way of your statutes,
verses.second_half: and I shall keep it to the end.
verses.first_half_tle: Teach me, O LORD, the way of thy statutes,
verses.second_half_tle: and I shall keep it unto the end.

verses.first_half: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law;
verses.second_half: indeed, I shall keep it with my whole heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Give me understanding, and I shall keep thy law;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

verses.first_half: Make me go in the path of your commandments,
verses.second_half: for therein is my desire.
verses.first_half_tle: Make me to go in the path of thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: for therein is my desire.

verses.first_half: Incline my heart to your testimonies,
verses.second_half: and not to covetous desires.
verses.first_half_tle: Incline my heart unto thy testimonies,
verses.second_half_tle: and not to covetousness.

verses.first_half: O turn away my eyes, lest they behold vanity,
verses.second_half: and revive me in your ways.
verses.first_half_tle: O turn away mine eyes, lest they behold vanity;
verses.second_half_tle: and quicken thou me in thy way.

verses.first_half: Confirm your word to your servant,
verses.second_half: and to all those who fear you.
verses.first_half_tle: O stablish thy word in thy servant,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may fear thee.

verses.first_half: Take away the reproach that I am afraid of,
verses.second_half: for your judgments are good.
verses.first_half_tle: Take away the rebuke that I am afraid of;
verses.second_half_tle: for thy judgments are good.

verses.first_half: Behold, my delight is in your precepts;
verses.second_half: O revive me in your righteousness. Waw
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, my delight is in thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: O quicken me in thy righteousness. Waw

verses.first_half: Let your loving mercy come to me, O LORD,
verses.second_half: even your salvation, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Let thy loving mercy come also unto me, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: even thy salvation, according unto thy word.

verses.first_half: So shall I answer those who taunt me,
verses.second_half: for my trust is in your word.
verses.first_half_tle: So shall I make answer unto my blasphemers;
verses.second_half_tle: for my trust is in thy word.

verses.first_half: O do not take the word of your truth utterly out of my mouth,
verses.second_half: for my hope is in your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: O take not the word of thy truth utterly out of my mouth;
verses.second_half_tle: for my hope is in thy judgments.
