verses.first_half: So shall I always keep your law,
verses.second_half: even for ever and ever;
verses.first_half_tle: So shall I alway keep thy law;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, for ever and ever.

verses.first_half: And I will walk at liberty,
verses.second_half: for I seek your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: And I will walk at liberty;
verses.second_half_tle: for I seek thy commandments.

verses.first_half: I will speak of your testimonies also, even before kings,
verses.second_half: and will not be ashamed;
verses.first_half_tle: I will speak of thy testimonies also, even before kings,
verses.second_half_tle: and will not be ashamed.

verses.first_half: And my delight shall be in your commandments,
verses.second_half: which I have loved exceedingly.
verses.first_half_tle: And my delight shall be in thy commandments,
verses.second_half_tle: which I have loved.

verses.first_half: My hands also will I lift up to your commandments,
verses.second_half: and I will meditate on your statutes. Zayin
verses.first_half_tle: My hands also will I lift up unto thy commandments, which I have loved;
verses.second_half_tle: and my study shall be in thy statutes. Zayin

verses.first_half: O remember your word to your servant,
verses.second_half: in which you have caused me to put my trust.
verses.first_half_tle: O think upon thy servant, as concerning thy word,
verses.second_half_tle: wherein thou hast caused me to put my trust.

verses.first_half: This is my comfort in my trouble,
verses.second_half: for your word has given me life.
verses.first_half_tle: The same is my comfort in my trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: for thy word hath quickened me.

verses.first_half: The proud have held me exceedingly in derision,
verses.second_half: yet I have not turned aside from your law.
verses.first_half_tle: The proud have had me exceedingly in derision;
verses.second_half_tle: yet have I not shrinked from thy law.

verses.first_half: For I have remembered, O LORD, your judgments from of old,
verses.second_half: and by them I have received comfort.
verses.first_half_tle: For I remembered thine everlasting judgments, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and received comfort.

verses.first_half: I am filled with indignation,
verses.second_half: because of the ungodly who forsake your law.
verses.first_half_tle: I am horribly afraid,
verses.second_half_tle: for the ungodly that forsake thy law.

verses.first_half: Your statutes have been my songs
verses.second_half: in the house of my pilgrimage.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy statutes have been my songs,
verses.second_half_tle: in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.first_half: I have thought upon your Name, O LORD, in the night season,
verses.second_half: and I have kept your law.
verses.first_half_tle: I have thought upon thy Name, O LORD, in the night season,
verses.second_half_tle: and have kept thy law.

verses.first_half: This has been my reward,
verses.second_half: because I have kept your commandments. Heth
verses.first_half_tle: This I had,
verses.second_half_tle: because I kept thy commandments. Heth

verses.first_half: You are my portion, O LORD;
verses.second_half: I have promised to keep your law.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my portion, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: I have promised to keep thy law.

verses.first_half: I made my humble petition in your presence with my whole heart;
verses.second_half: O be merciful to me, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: I made my humble petition in thy presence with my whole heart;
verses.second_half_tle: O be merciful unto me, according to thy word.

verses.first_half: I have called my ways to remembrance
verses.second_half: and turned my feet to your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: I called mine own ways to remembrance,
verses.second_half_tle: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: I made haste and did not delay
verses.second_half: to keep your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I made haste, and prolonged not the time,
verses.second_half_tle: to keep thy commandments.

verses.first_half: The cords of the ungodly have encircled me,
verses.second_half: but I have not forgotten your law.
verses.first_half_tle: The snares of the ungodly have compassed me about;
verses.second_half_tle: but I have not forgotten thy law.

verses.first_half: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,
verses.second_half: because of your righteous judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: At midnight I will rise to give thanks unto thee,
verses.second_half_tle: because of thy righteous judgments.

verses.first_half: I am a companion of all those who fear you
verses.second_half: and keep your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I am a companion of all them that fear thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and keep thy commandments.

verses.first_half: The earth, O LORD, is full of your mercy;
verses.second_half: O teach me your statutes. Teth
verses.first_half_tle: The earth, O LORD, is full of thy mercy:
verses.second_half_tle: O teach me thy statutes. Teth

verses.first_half: O LORD, you have dealt graciously with your servant,
verses.second_half: according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, thou hast dealt graciously with thy servant,
verses.second_half_tle: according unto thy word.

verses.first_half: O teach me true understanding and knowledge,
verses.second_half: for I have believed your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: O teach me true understanding and knowledge;
verses.second_half_tle: for I have believed thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Before I was afflicted I went astray,
verses.second_half: but now I keep your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Before I was troubled, I went wrong;
verses.second_half_tle: but now have I kept thy word.

verses.first_half: You are good and gracious;
verses.second_half: O teach me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art good and gracious;
verses.second_half_tle: O teach me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: The proud have slandered me with lies,
verses.second_half: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.
verses.first_half_tle: The proud have imagined a lie against me;
verses.second_half_tle: but I will keep thy commandments with my whole heart.

verses.first_half: Their heart has become gross with fatness,
verses.second_half: but my delight is in your law.
verses.first_half_tle: Their heart is as fat as brawn;
verses.second_half_tle: but my delight hath been in thy law.

verses.first_half: It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
verses.second_half: that I may learn your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: It is good for me that I have been in trouble;
verses.second_half_tle: that I may learn thy statutes.

verses.first_half: The law of your mouth is dearer to me
verses.second_half: than thousands in gold and silver. Yodh
verses.first_half_tle: The law of thy mouth is dearer unto me
verses.second_half_tle: than thousands of gold and silver. Yodh

verses.first_half: Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
verses.second_half: O give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy hands have made me and fashioned me:
verses.second_half_tle: O give me understanding, that I may learn thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me,
verses.second_half: because I have put my trust in your word.
verses.first_half_tle: They that fear thee will be glad when they see me;
verses.second_half_tle: because I have put my trust in thy word.

verses.first_half: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right,
verses.second_half: and that in your faithfulness you have caused me to be afflicted.
verses.first_half_tle: I know, O LORD, that thy judgments are right,
verses.second_half_tle: and that thou of very faithfulness hast caused me to be troubled.

verses.first_half: O let your merciful kindness be my comfort,
verses.second_half: according to your word to your servant.
verses.first_half_tle: O let thy merciful kindness be my comfort,
verses.second_half_tle: according to thy word unto thy servant.

verses.first_half: O let your loving mercies come to me, that I may live,
verses.second_half: for your law is my delight.
verses.first_half_tle: O let thy loving mercies come unto me, that I may live;
verses.second_half_tle: for thy law is my delight.

verses.first_half: Let the proud be put to shame, for they go about wickedly to destroy me;
verses.second_half: but I will meditate on your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the proud be confounded, for they go wickedly about to destroy me;
verses.second_half_tle: but I will be occupied in thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Let those who fear you turn to me,
verses.second_half: even those who know your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: Let such as fear thee, and have known thy testimonies,
verses.second_half_tle: be turned unto me.

verses.first_half: O let my heart be sound in your statutes,
verses.second_half: that I may never be put to shame. Kaph
verses.first_half_tle: O let my heart be sound in thy statutes,
verses.second_half_tle: that I be not ashamed. Kaph

verses.first_half: My soul has longed for your salvation,
verses.second_half: and I have a good hope because of your word.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul hath longed for thy salvation,
verses.second_half_tle: and I have a good hope because of thy word.

verses.first_half: My eyes long sorely for your word,
verses.second_half: saying, “O when will you comfort me?”
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes long sore for thy word;
verses.second_half_tle: saying, O when wilt thou comfort me?

verses.first_half: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
verses.second_half: yet I do not forget your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: For I am become like a bottle in the smoke;
verses.second_half_tle: yet do I not forget thy statutes.

verses.first_half: How many are the days of your servant?
verses.second_half: When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?
verses.first_half_tle: How many are the days of thy servant?
verses.second_half_tle: when wilt thou be avenged of them that persecute me?

verses.first_half: The proud have dug pits for me;
verses.second_half: they do not walk after your law.
verses.first_half_tle: The proud have digged pits for me,
verses.second_half_tle: which are not after thy law.

verses.first_half: All your commandments are true.
verses.second_half: They persecute me falsely; O Lord, be my help.
verses.first_half_tle: All thy commandments are true:
verses.second_half_tle: they persecute me falsely; O be thou my help.

verses.first_half: They had almost made an end of me on earth,
verses.second_half: but I have not forsaken your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: They had almost made an end of me upon earth;
verses.second_half_tle: but I forsook not thy commandments.

verses.first_half: O revive me with your loving-kindness,
verses.second_half: and so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth. Lamedh
verses.first_half_tle: O quicken me after thy loving-kindness;
verses.second_half_tle: and so shall I keep the testimonies of thy mouth. Lamedh

verses.first_half: O LORD, your word endures for ever;
verses.second_half: it stands fast in heaven.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, thy word
verses.second_half_tle: endureth for ever in heaven.

verses.first_half: Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another;
verses.second_half: you have laid the foundation of the earth, and it abides.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy truth also remaineth from one generation to another;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.

verses.first_half: Surely your ordinances stand firm this day,
verses.second_half: for all things are your servants.
verses.first_half_tle: They continue this day according to thine ordinance;
verses.second_half_tle: for all things serve thee.

verses.first_half: If my delight had not been in your law,
verses.second_half: I should have perished in my affliction.
verses.first_half_tle: If my delight had not been in thy law,
verses.second_half_tle: I should have perished in my trouble.

verses.first_half: I will never forget your commandments,
verses.second_half: for with them you have enlivened me.
verses.first_half_tle: I will never forget thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: for with them thou hast quickened me.

verses.first_half: I am yours; O save me!
verses.second_half: For I have sought your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I am thine: O save me,
verses.second_half_tle: for I have sought thy commandments.

verses.first_half: The ungodly lie in wait for me to destroy me,
verses.second_half: but I will consider your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly laid wait for me, to destroy me;
verses.second_half_tle: but I will consider thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: I see that all things come to an end,
verses.second_half: but your commandment has no bounds. Mem
verses.first_half_tle: I see that all things come to an end;
verses.second_half_tle: but thy commandment is exceeding broad. Mem

verses.first_half: Lord, what love I have for your law;
verses.second_half: all the day long I meditate on it.
verses.first_half_tle: Lord, what love have I unto thy law!
verses.second_half_tle: all the day long is my study in it.

verses.first_half: You, through your commandment, have made me wiser than my enemies,
verses.second_half: for it is always with me.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou, through thy commandments, hast made me wiser than mine enemies;
verses.second_half_tle: for they are ever with me.

verses.first_half: I have more understanding than my teachers,
verses.second_half: for your testimonies are my study.
verses.first_half_tle: I have more understanding than my teachers;
verses.second_half_tle: for thy testimonies are my study.

verses.first_half: I am wiser than the agéd,
verses.second_half: because I keep your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I am wiser than the aged;
verses.second_half_tle: because I keep thy commandments.

verses.first_half: I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
verses.second_half: that I may keep your word.
verses.first_half_tle: I have refrained my feet from every evil way,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may keep thy word.

verses.first_half: I have not turned aside from your judgments,
verses.second_half: for you yourself have taught me.
verses.first_half_tle: I have not shrunk from thy judgments;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou teachest me.

verses.first_half: Oh how sweet are your words to my taste;
verses.second_half: indeed, sweeter than honey to my mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: O how sweet are thy words unto my throat;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, sweeter than honey unto my mouth!

verses.first_half: Through your commandments I get understanding;
verses.second_half: therefore I hate all evil ways. Nun
verses.first_half_tle: Through thy commandments I get understanding:
verses.second_half_tle: therefore I hate all evil ways. Nun

verses.first_half: Your word is a lantern to my feet
verses.second_half: and a light upon my path.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy word is a lantern unto my feet,
verses.second_half_tle: and a light unto my paths.

verses.first_half: I have sworn and am steadfastly purposed
verses.second_half: to keep your righteous judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: I have sworn, and am steadfastly purposed,
verses.second_half_tle: to keep thy righteous judgments.

verses.first_half: I am troubled above measure;
verses.second_half: revive me, O LORD, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: I am troubled above measure:
verses.second_half_tle: quicken me, O LORD, according to thy word.

verses.first_half: Let the freewill offerings of my mouth please you, O LORD;
verses.second_half: and teach me your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Let the free-will offerings of my mouth please thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and teach me thy judgments.

verses.first_half: My life is always in my hand,
verses.second_half: yet I do not forget your law.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul is alway in my hand;
verses.second_half_tle: yet do I not forget thy law.

verses.first_half: The ungodly have laid a snare for me,
verses.second_half: yet I have not strayed from your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: The ungodly have laid a snare for me;
verses.second_half_tle: but yet I swerved not from thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Your testimonies have I claimed as my heritage for ever,
verses.second_half: and why? They are the very joy of my heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy testimonies have I claimed as mine heritage for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: and why? they are the very joy of my heart.

verses.first_half: I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes always,
verses.second_half: even unto the end. Samekh
verses.first_half_tle: I have applied my heart to fulfil thy statutes alway,
verses.second_half_tle: even unto the end. Samekh

verses.first_half: I hate those who are double-minded,
verses.second_half: but your law do I love.
verses.first_half_tle: I hate them that imagine evil things;
verses.second_half_tle: but thy law do I love.

verses.first_half: You are my defense and shield,
verses.second_half: and my trust is in your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art my defense and shield;
verses.second_half_tle: and my trust is in thy word.

verses.first_half: Away from me, you wicked.
verses.second_half: I will keep the commandments of my God.
verses.first_half_tle: Away from me, ye wicked;
verses.second_half_tle: I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.first_half: Establish me according to your word, that I may live,
verses.second_half: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.
verses.first_half_tle: O stablish me according to thy word, that I may live;
verses.second_half_tle: and let me not be disappointed of my hope.

verses.first_half: Hold me up, and I shall be safe;
verses.second_half: indeed, my delight shall be ever in your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: Hold thou me up, and I shall be safe;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, my delight shall be ever in thy statutes.

verses.first_half: You have trodden down all those who depart from your statutes,
verses.second_half: for they only imagine deceit.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes;
verses.second_half_tle: for they imagine but deceit.

verses.first_half: You put away all the ungodly of the earth like dross;
verses.second_half: therefore I love your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou puttest away all the ungodly of the earth like dross;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore I love thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: My flesh trembles for fear of you,
verses.second_half: and I am afraid of your judgments. Ayin
verses.first_half_tle: My flesh trembleth for fear of thee,
verses.second_half_tle: and I am afraid of thy judgments. Ayin

verses.first_half: I have done that which is lawful and right;
verses.second_half: O give me not over to my oppressors.
verses.first_half_tle: I deal with the thing that is lawful and right;
verses.second_half_tle: O give me not over unto mine oppressors.

verses.first_half: Be surety for your servant’s good;
verses.second_half: O let not the arrogant oppress me.
verses.first_half_tle: Make thou thy servant to delight in that which is good,
verses.second_half_tle: that the proud do me no wrong.

verses.first_half: My eyes have wasted away with looking for your salvation,
verses.second_half: and for the word of your righteousness.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes are wasted away with looking for thy health,
verses.second_half_tle: and for the word of thy righteousness.

verses.first_half: O deal with your servant according to your loving mercy,
verses.second_half: and teach me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: O deal with thy servant according unto thy loving mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: and teach me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: I am your servant; O grant me understanding,
verses.second_half: that I may know your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: I am thy servant; O grant me understanding,
verses.second_half_tle: that I may know thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: It is time for you, O LORD, to act,
verses.second_half: for they have broken your law.
verses.first_half_tle: It is time for thee, LORD, to lay to thine hand;
verses.second_half_tle: for they have destroyed thy law.

verses.first_half: For I love your commandments above all things,
verses.second_half: more than gold and precious stones.
verses.first_half_tle: For I love thy commandments
verses.second_half_tle: above gold and precious stones.

verses.first_half: Therefore I hold all your commandments to be right,
verses.second_half: and all false ways I utterly abhor. Pe
verses.first_half_tle: Therefore hold I straight all thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: and all false ways I utterly abhor. Pe

verses.first_half: Your testimonies are wonderful;
verses.second_half: therefore does my soul keep them.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy testimonies are wonderful;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore doth my soul keep them.

verses.first_half: When your word goes forth it gives light
verses.second_half: and understanding to the simple.
verses.first_half_tle: When thy word goeth forth,
verses.second_half_tle: it giveth light and understanding unto the simple.

verses.first_half: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath,
verses.second_half: for my delight was in your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath;
verses.second_half_tle: for my delight was in thy commandments.

verses.first_half: O look upon me, and be merciful unto me,
verses.second_half: as you always do for those who love your Name.
verses.first_half_tle: O look thou upon me, and be merciful unto me,
verses.second_half_tle: as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.

verses.first_half: Order my steps according to your word,
verses.second_half: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.
verses.first_half_tle: Order my steps in thy word;
verses.second_half_tle: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

verses.first_half: O deliver me from those who deal wrongfully,
verses.second_half: and so shall I keep your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: O deliver me from the wrongful dealings of men;
verses.second_half_tle: and so shall I keep thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Show the light of your countenance upon your servant,
verses.second_half: and teach me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: Show the light of thy countenance upon thy servant,
verses.second_half_tle: and teach me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: My eyes gush out water
verses.second_half: because of those who do not keep your law. Sadhe
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes gush out with water,
verses.second_half_tle: because men keep not thy law. Sadhe

verses.first_half: Righteous are you, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and true are your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Righteous art thou, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and true are thy judgments.

verses.first_half: The testimonies that you have commanded
verses.second_half: are exceedingly righteous and true.
verses.first_half_tle: The testimonies that thou hast commanded
verses.second_half_tle: are exceeding righteous and true.

verses.first_half: My zeal has even consumed me,
verses.second_half: because my enemies have forgotten your words.
verses.first_half_tle: My zeal hath even consumed me;
verses.second_half_tle: because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.

verses.first_half: Your word is tested to the uttermost,
verses.second_half: and therefore your servant loves it.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy word is tried to the uttermost,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy servant loveth it.

verses.first_half: I am small, and of no reputation,
verses.second_half: yet I do not forget your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I am small and of no reputation;
verses.second_half_tle: yet do I not forget thy commandments.

verses.first_half: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
verses.second_half: and your law is the truth.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy law is the truth.

verses.first_half: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold of me,
verses.second_half: yet my delight is in your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold upon me;
verses.second_half_tle: yet is my delight in thy commandments.

verses.first_half: The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting;
verses.second_half: O grant me understanding, and I shall live. Qoph
verses.first_half_tle: The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting:
verses.second_half_tle: O grant me understanding, and I shall live. Qoph

verses.first_half: I call with my whole heart.
verses.second_half: Hear me, O LORD; I will keep your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: I call with my whole heart;
verses.second_half_tle: hear me, O LORD; I will keep thy statutes.

verses.first_half: Even unto you do I call;
verses.second_half: help me, and I shall keep your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, even unto thee do I call;
verses.second_half_tle: help me, and I shall keep thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: Early in the morning do I cry unto you,
verses.second_half: for in your word is my trust.
verses.first_half_tle: Early in the morning do I cry unto thee;
verses.second_half_tle: for in thy word is my trust.

verses.first_half: My eyes open before the night watches,
verses.second_half: that I may meditate on your words.
verses.first_half_tle: Mine eyes prevent the night watches;
verses.second_half_tle: that I might be occupied in thy word.

verses.first_half: Hear my voice, O LORD, according to your loving-kindness;
verses.second_half: give me life according to your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Hear my voice, O LORD, according unto thy loving-kindness;
verses.second_half_tle: quicken me, according to thy judgments.

verses.first_half: They draw nigh who in malice persecute me,
verses.second_half: and are far from your law.
verses.first_half_tle: They draw nigh that of malice persecute me,
verses.second_half_tle: and are far from thy law.

verses.first_half: Be near at hand, O LORD,
verses.second_half: for all your commandments are true.
verses.first_half_tle: Be thou nigh at hand, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for all thy commandments are true.

verses.first_half: Concerning your testimonies, I have known long ago
verses.second_half: that you have founded them for ever. Resh
verses.first_half_tle: As concerning thy testimonies, I have known long since,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou hast grounded them for ever. Resh

verses.first_half: O consider my adversity and deliver me,
verses.second_half: for I do not forget your law.
verses.first_half_tle: O consider mine adversity, and deliver me,
verses.second_half_tle: for I do not forget thy law.

verses.first_half: Plead my cause and deliver me;
verses.second_half: give me life according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Avenge thou my cause, and deliver me;
verses.second_half_tle: quicken me according to thy word.

verses.first_half: Salvation is far from the ungodly,
verses.second_half: for they do not regard your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: Health is far from the ungodly;
verses.second_half_tle: for they regard not thy statutes.

verses.first_half: Great is your mercy, O LORD;
verses.second_half: give me life according to your judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Great is thy mercy, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: quicken me, as thou art wont.

verses.first_half: Many there are who trouble me and persecute me,
verses.second_half: yet I do not swerve from your testimonies.
verses.first_half_tle: Many there are that trouble me, and persecute me;
verses.second_half_tle: yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.

verses.first_half: It grieves me when I see the transgressors,
verses.second_half: because they do not keep your law.
verses.first_half_tle: It grieveth me when I see the transgressors;
verses.second_half_tle: because they keep not thy law.

verses.first_half: Consider, O LORD, how I love your commandments;
verses.second_half: O give me life according to your loving-kindness.
verses.first_half_tle: Consider, O LORD, how I love thy commandments;
verses.second_half_tle: O quicken me, according to thy loving-kindness.

verses.first_half: Your word is true from everlasting;
verses.second_half: all the judgments of your righteousness endure for evermore. Shin
verses.first_half_tle: Thy word is true from everlasting;
verses.second_half_tle: all the judgments of thy righteousness endure for evermore. Shin

verses.first_half: Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
verses.second_half: but my heart stands in awe of your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Princes have persecuted me without a cause;
verses.second_half_tle: but my heart standeth in awe of thy word.

verses.first_half: I am as glad of your word
verses.second_half: as one who finds great spoils.
verses.first_half_tle: I am as glad of thy word,
verses.second_half_tle: as one that findeth great spoils.

verses.first_half: As for lies, I hate and abhor them,
verses.second_half: but your law do I love.
verses.first_half_tle: As for lies, I hate and abhor them;
verses.second_half_tle: but thy law do I love.

verses.first_half: Seven times a day do I praise you,
verses.second_half: because of your righteous judgments.
verses.first_half_tle: Seven times a day do I praise thee;
verses.second_half_tle: because of thy righteous judgments.

verses.first_half: Great is the peace they have who love your law
verses.second_half: and find in it no stumbling block.
verses.first_half_tle: Great is the peace that they have who love thy law;
verses.second_half_tle: and they have none occasion of stumbling.

verses.first_half: LORD, I have looked for your saving health
verses.second_half: and have done your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, I have looked for thy saving health,
verses.second_half_tle: and done after thy commandments.

verses.first_half: My soul has kept your testimonies,
verses.second_half: and I have loved them exceedingly.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul hath kept thy testimonies,
verses.second_half_tle: and loved them exceedingly.

verses.first_half: I have kept your commandments and testimonies,
verses.second_half: for all my ways are before you. Taw
verses.first_half_tle: I have kept thy commandments and testimonies;
verses.second_half_tle: for all my ways are before thee. Taw

verses.first_half: Let my complaint come before you, O LORD;
verses.second_half: give me understanding, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Let my complaint come before thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: give me understanding according to thy word.

verses.first_half: Let my supplication come before you;
verses.second_half: deliver me, according to your word.
verses.first_half_tle: Let my supplication come before thee;
verses.second_half_tle: deliver me according to thy word.

verses.first_half: My lips shall pour forth your praise,
verses.second_half: when you have taught me your statutes.
verses.first_half_tle: My lips shall speak of thy praise,
verses.second_half_tle: when thou hast taught me thy statutes.

verses.first_half: Surely my tongue shall sing of your word,
verses.second_half: for all your commandments are righteous.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, my tongue shall sing of thy word;
verses.second_half_tle: for all thy commandments are righteous.

verses.first_half: Let your hand be strong to help me,
verses.second_half: for I have chosen your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: Let thine hand help me;
verses.second_half_tle: for I have chosen thy commandments.

verses.first_half: I have longed for your saving health, O LORD,
verses.second_half: and in your law is my delight.
verses.first_half_tle: I have longed for thy saving health, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: and in thy law is my delight.

verses.first_half: O let my soul live, and it shall praise you;
verses.second_half: and let your judgments help me.
verses.first_half_tle: O let my soul live, and it shall praise thee;
verses.second_half_tle: and thy judgments shall help me.

verses.first_half: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost;
verses.second_half: O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.
verses.first_half_tle: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost;
verses.second_half_tle: O seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.

verses.first_half: When I was in trouble I called upon the LORD,
verses.second_half: and he hearkened to my calling.
verses.first_half_tle: When I was in trouble, I called upon the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and he heard me.

verses.first_half: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips
verses.second_half: and from a deceitful tongue.
verses.first_half_tle: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips,
verses.second_half_tle: and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.first_half: What reward shall be given or done unto you, O false tongue?
verses.second_half: Even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.
verses.first_half_tle: What reward shall be given or done unto thee, thou false tongue?
verses.second_half_tle: even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

verses.first_half: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell in Meshech,
verses.second_half: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.
verses.first_half_tle: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell with Meshech,
verses.second_half_tle: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar!

verses.first_half: My soul has long dwelt among those
verses.second_half: who are enemies of peace.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul hath long dwelt among them
verses.second_half_tle: that are enemies unto peace.

verses.first_half: I labor for peace, but when I speak to them of it,
verses.second_half: they make themselves ready for battle.
verses.first_half_tle: I labor for peace; but when I speak unto them thereof,
verses.second_half_tle: they make them ready to battle.

verses.first_half: I will lift up my eyes unto the hills;
verses.second_half: from whence comes my help?
verses.first_half_tle: I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills;
verses.second_half_tle: from whence cometh my help?

verses.first_half: My help comes from the LORD,
verses.second_half: who has made heaven and earth.
verses.first_half_tle: My help cometh even from the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: who hath made heaven and earth.

verses.first_half: He will not let your foot be moved,
verses.second_half: and he who keeps you will not sleep.
verses.first_half_tle: He will not suffer thy foot to be moved;
verses.second_half_tle: and he that keepeth thee will not sleep.

verses.first_half: Behold, he who keeps Israel
verses.second_half: shall neither slumber nor sleep.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, he that keepeth Israel
verses.second_half_tle: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.first_half: The LORD himself is your keeper;
verses.second_half: the LORD is your defense upon your right hand,
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD himself is thy keeper;
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD is thy defense upon thy right hand;

verses.first_half: So that the sun shall not burn you by day,
verses.second_half: neither the moon by night.
verses.first_half_tle: So that the sun shall not burn thee by day,
verses.second_half_tle: neither the moon by night.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall preserve you from all evil;
verses.second_half: indeed, it is he who shall keep your soul.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall preserve thee from all evil;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, it is even he that shall keep thy soul.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall preserve your going out and your coming in,
verses.second_half: from this time forth for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall preserve thy going out, and thy coming in,
verses.second_half_tle: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.first_half: I was glad when they said unto me,
verses.second_half: “We will go into the house of the LORD.”
verses.first_half_tle: I was glad when they said unto me,
verses.second_half_tle: We will go into the house of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Now our feet are standing
verses.second_half: within your gates, O Jerusalem.
verses.first_half_tle: Our feet shall stand in thy gates,
verses.second_half_tle: O Jerusalem.

verses.first_half: Jerusalem is built as a city
verses.second_half: that is at unity in itself.
verses.first_half_tle: Jerusalem is built as a city
verses.second_half_tle: that is at unity in itself.

verses.first_half: For there the tribes go up, even the tribes of the LORD,
verses.second_half: as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: For thither the tribes go up, even the tribes of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: to testify unto Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the LORD.

verses.first_half: For there is the throne of judgment,
verses.second_half: even the throne of the house of David.
verses.first_half_tle: For there is the seat of judgment,
verses.second_half_tle: even the seat of the house of David.

verses.first_half: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem;
verses.second_half: they shall prosper that love you.
verses.first_half_tle: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem;
verses.second_half_tle: they shall prosper that love thee.

verses.first_half: Peace be within your walls
verses.second_half: and plenteousness within your palaces.
verses.first_half_tle: Peace be within thy walls,
verses.second_half_tle: and plenteousness within thy palaces.

verses.first_half: For my brethren and companions’ sakes,
verses.second_half: I will wish you prosperity.
verses.first_half_tle: For my brethren and companions’ sakes,
verses.second_half_tle: I will wish thee prosperity.

verses.first_half: Indeed, because of the house of the LORD our God,
verses.second_half: I will seek to do you good.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, because of the house of the LORD our God,
verses.second_half_tle: I will seek to do thee good.

verses.first_half: Unto you I lift up my eyes,
verses.second_half: you who are enthroned in the heavens.
verses.first_half_tle: Unto thee lift I up mine eyes,
verses.second_half_tle: O thou that dwellest in the heavens.

verses.first_half: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters,
verses.second_half: and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress,
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, even as the eyes of servants look unto the hand of their masters, and as the eyes of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress,
verses.second_half_tle: even so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God, until he have mercy upon us.

verses.first_half: Even so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God,
verses.second_half: until he show us his favor.
verses.first_half_tle: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us;
verses.second_half_tle: for we are utterly despised.

verses.first_half: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us,
verses.second_half: for we have suffered more than enough contempt.
verses.first_half_tle: Our soul is filled with the scornful reproof of the wealthy,
verses.second_half_tle: and with the despitefulness of the proud.

verses.first_half: Long has our soul suffered the scorn of the wealthy
verses.second_half: and the spitefulness of the proud.

verses.first_half: If the LORD himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say:
verses.second_half: if the LORD himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us,
verses.first_half_tle: If the LORD himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say;
verses.second_half_tle: if the LORD himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us;

verses.first_half: Then would they have swallowed us up alive,
verses.second_half: when they were so wrathfully displeased with us;
verses.first_half_tle: They had swallowed us up alive;
verses.second_half_tle: when they were so wrathfully displeased at us.

verses.first_half: Then the waters would have drowned us, and the torrent gone over us;
verses.second_half: then the raging waters would have gone clean over us.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, the waters had drowned us,
verses.second_half_tle: and the stream had gone over our soul.

verses.first_half: But praised be the LORD,
verses.second_half: who has not given us over to be prey for their teeth.
verses.first_half_tle: The deep waters of the proud
verses.second_half_tle: had gone even over our soul.

verses.first_half: We escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowler;
verses.second_half: the snare is broken, and we have been delivered.
verses.first_half_tle: But praised be the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: who hath not given us over for a prey unto their teeth.

verses.first_half: Our help is in the Name of the LORD,
verses.second_half: the maker of heaven and earth.
verses.first_half_tle: Our soul is escaped even as a bird out of the snare of the fowler;
verses.second_half_tle: the snare is broken, and we are delivered.

verses.first_half_tle: Our help standeth in the Name of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: who hath made heaven and earth.

verses.first_half: Those who put their trust in the LORD shall be like Mount Zion,
verses.second_half: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: They that put their trust in the LORD shall be even as the mount Zion,
verses.second_half_tle: which may not be removed, but standeth fast for ever.

verses.first_half: The hills stand about Jerusalem
verses.second_half: even as the LORD stands round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: The hills stand about Jerusalem;
verses.second_half_tle: even so standeth the LORD round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

verses.first_half: For the scepter of the ungodly shall not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous,
verses.second_half: lest the righteous put forth their hand to do wickedness.
verses.first_half_tle: For the sceptre of the ungodly shall not abide upon the lot of the righteous;
verses.second_half_tle: lest the righteous put their hand unto wickedness.

verses.first_half: Do good, O LORD, unto those who are good,
verses.second_half: unto those who are good and true of heart.
verses.first_half_tle: Do well, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: unto those that are good and true of heart.

verses.first_half: As for those who turn aside to their own wicked ways, the LORD shall lead them away with the evildoers;
verses.second_half: but peace shall be upon Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: As for such as turn back unto their own wickedness,
verses.second_half_tle: the LORD shall lead them forth with the evil doers; but peace shall be upon Israel.

verses.first_half: When the LORD overturned the captivity of Zion,
verses.second_half: then were we like those who dream.
verses.first_half_tle: When the LORD turned again the captivity of Zion,
verses.second_half_tle: then were we like unto them that dream.

verses.first_half: Then was our mouth filled with laughter
verses.second_half: and our tongue with shouts of joy.
verses.first_half_tle: Then was our mouth filled with laughter,
verses.second_half_tle: and our tongue with joy.

verses.first_half: Then they said among the nations,
verses.second_half: “The LORD has done great things for them.”
verses.first_half_tle: Then said they among the heathen,
verses.second_half_tle: The LORD hath done great things for them.

verses.first_half: Indeed, the LORD has done great things for us already,
verses.second_half: whereof we rejoice.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, the LORD hath done great things for us already;
verses.second_half_tle: whereof we rejoice.

verses.first_half: Overturn our captivity, O LORD,
verses.second_half: as when streams refresh the deserts of the south.
verses.first_half_tle: Turn our captivity, O LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: as the rivers in the south.

verses.first_half: Those who sow in tears
verses.second_half: shall reap with songs of joy.
verses.first_half_tle: They that sow in tears
verses.second_half_tle: shall reap in joy.

verses.first_half: He who goes on his way weeping and bears good seed
verses.second_half: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.
verses.first_half_tle: He that now goeth on his way weeping, and beareth forth good seed,
verses.second_half_tle: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

verses.first_half: Unless the LORD builds the house,
verses.second_half: their labor is in vain who build it.
verses.first_half_tle: Except the LORD build the house,
verses.second_half_tle: their labour is but lost that build it.

verses.first_half: Unless the LORD keeps the city,
verses.second_half: the watchman keeps vigil in vain.
verses.first_half_tle: Except the LORD keep the city,
verses.second_half_tle: the watchman waketh but in vain.

verses.first_half: It is in vain that you rise up early, and take rest so late, and eat the bread of toil,
verses.second_half: for he gives to his beloved sleep.
verses.first_half_tle: It is but lost labour that ye haste to rise up early, and so late take rest, and eat the bread of carefulness;
verses.second_half_tle: for so he giveth his beloved sleep.

verses.first_half: Behold, children are a heritage from the LORD,
verses.second_half: and the fruit of the womb is a gift that comes from him.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, children, and the fruit of the womb,
verses.second_half_tle: are an heritage and gift that cometh of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
verses.second_half: so are the children of one’s youth.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the arrows in the hand of the giant,
verses.second_half_tle: even so are the young children.

verses.first_half: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them;
verses.second_half: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.
verses.first_half_tle: Happy is the man that hath his quiver full of them;
verses.second_half_tle: they shall not be ashamed when they speak with their enemies in the gate.

verses.first_half: Blessed are all those who fear the LORD
verses.second_half: and walk in his ways.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed are all they that fear the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and walk in his ways.

verses.first_half: For you shall eat of the labors of your hands;
verses.second_half: it shall be well with you, and happy you shall be.
verses.first_half_tle: For thou shalt eat the labors of thine hands:
verses.second_half_tle: O well is thee, and happy shalt thou be.

verses.first_half: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine
verses.second_half: upon the walls of your house,
verses.first_half_tle: Thy wife shall be as the fruitful vine
verses.second_half_tle: upon the walls of thine house;

verses.first_half: Your children like the olive branches
verses.second_half: round about your table.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy children like the olive branches
verses.second_half_tle: round about thy table.

verses.first_half: Indeed, thus shall the man be blessed
verses.second_half: who fears the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, thus shall the man be blessed
verses.second_half_tle: that feareth the LORD.

verses.first_half: May the LORD bless you out of Zion;
verses.second_half: may you see Jerusalem in prosperity all your life long.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD from out of Zion shall so bless thee,
verses.second_half_tle: that thou shalt see Jerusalem in prosperity all thy life long;

verses.first_half: May you see your children’s children,
verses.second_half: and may there be peace upon Israel.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, that thou shalt see thy children’s children,
verses.second_half_tle: and peace upon Israel.

verses.first_half: “Many a time have they fought against me from my youth on,”
verses.second_half: may Israel now say;
verses.first_half_tle: Many a time have they fought against me from my youth up,
verses.second_half_tle: may Israel now say;

verses.first_half: “Indeed, many a time have they afflicted me from my youth on,
verses.second_half: but they have not prevailed against me.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, many a time have they vexed me from my youth up;
verses.second_half_tle: but they have not prevailed against me.

verses.first_half: The plowers plowed upon my back,
verses.second_half: and made long furrows.
verses.first_half_tle: The plowers plowed upon my back,
verses.second_half_tle: and made long furrows.

verses.first_half: But the righteous LORD
verses.second_half: has hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.”
verses.first_half_tle: But the righteous LORD
verses.second_half_tle: hath hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.

verses.first_half: Let them be ashamed and turned backward,
verses.second_half: as many as hate Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be confounded and turned backward,
verses.second_half_tle: as many as have evil will at Zion.

verses.first_half: Let them be as the grass growing upon the housetops,
verses.second_half: which withers before it grows up,
verses.first_half_tle: Let them be even as the grass upon the housetops,
verses.second_half_tle: which withereth afore it be grown up,

verses.first_half: Which does not fill the hand of the reaper,
verses.second_half: neither the bosom of him who binds up the sheaves,
verses.first_half_tle: Whereof the mower filleth not his hand,
verses.second_half_tle: neither he that bindeth up the sheaves his bosom.

verses.first_half: So that those who go by say not so much as, “The LORD prosper you.
verses.second_half: We bless you in the Name of the LORD.”
verses.first_half_tle: So that they who go by say not so much as, The LORD prosper you;
verses.second_half_tle: we wish you good luck in the Name of the LORD.

verses.first_half: Out of the deep have I called unto you, O LORD;
verses.second_half: Lord, hear my voice.
verses.first_half_tle: Out of the deep have I called unto thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.first_half: O let your ears consider well
verses.second_half: the voice of my supplications.
verses.first_half_tle: O let thine ears consider well
verses.second_half_tle: the voice of my complaint.

verses.first_half: If you, LORD, were to mark what is done amiss,
verses.second_half: O Lord, who could abide it?
verses.first_half_tle: If thou, LORD, wilt be extreme to mark what is done amiss,
verses.second_half_tle: O Lord, who may abide it?

verses.first_half: For there is mercy with you;
verses.second_half: therefore you shall be feared.
verses.first_half_tle: For there is mercy with thee;
verses.second_half_tle: therefore shalt thou be feared.

verses.first_half: I wait for the LORD; my soul waits for him;
verses.second_half: in his word is my trust.
verses.first_half_tle: I look for the LORD; my soul doth wait for him;
verses.second_half_tle: in his word is my trust.

verses.first_half: My soul waits for the Lord,
verses.second_half: more than watchmen for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.
verses.first_half_tle: My soul fleeth unto the Lord before the morning watch;
verses.second_half_tle: I say, before the morning watch.

verses.first_half: O Israel, trust in the LORD, for with the LORD there is mercy,
verses.second_half: and with him is plenteous redemption;
verses.first_half_tle: O Israel, trust in the LORD; for with the LORD there is mercy,
verses.second_half_tle: and with him is plenteous redemption.

verses.first_half: And he shall redeem Israel
verses.second_half: from all their sins.
verses.first_half_tle: And he shall redeem Israel
verses.second_half_tle: from all his sins.

verses.first_half: O LORD, I am not haughty;
verses.second_half: I have no proud looks.
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, I am not high-minded;
verses.second_half_tle: I have no proud looks.

verses.first_half: I do not occupy myself with great matters,
verses.second_half: or with things that are too high for me.
verses.first_half_tle: I do not exercise myself in great matters
verses.second_half_tle: which are too high for me.

verses.first_half: But I have stilled and quieted my soul, like a weaned child upon his mother’s breast;
verses.second_half: so is my soul quieted within me.
verses.first_half_tle: But I refrain my soul, and keep it low, like as a child that is weaned from his mother:
verses.second_half_tle: yea, my soul is even as a weaned child.

verses.first_half: O Israel, trust in the LORD
verses.second_half: from this time forth for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: O Israel, trust in the LORD
verses.second_half_tle: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.first_half: LORD, remember David,
verses.second_half: and all his tribulations,
verses.first_half_tle: LORD, remember David,
verses.second_half_tle: and all his trouble:

verses.first_half: How he swore unto the LORD,
verses.second_half: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob:
verses.first_half_tle: How he sware unto the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob:

verses.first_half: “I will not come within the tabernacle of my house,
verses.second_half: nor climb up into my bed,
verses.first_half_tle: I will not come within the tabernacle of mine house,
verses.second_half_tle: nor climb up into my bed;

verses.first_half: I will not allow my eyes to sleep, nor my eyelids to slumber,
verses.second_half: neither the temples of my head to take any rest,
verses.first_half_tle: I will not suffer mine eyes to sleep, nor mine eyelids to slumber;
verses.second_half_tle: neither the temples of my head to take any rest;

verses.first_half: Until I find a place for the temple of the LORD,
verses.second_half: a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.”
verses.first_half_tle: Until I find out a place for the temple of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: an habitation for the Mighty God of Jacob.

verses.first_half: Lo, we heard of the ark at Ephrathah
verses.second_half: and found it in the wood.
verses.first_half_tle: Lo, we heard of the same at Ephratah,
verses.second_half_tle: and found it in the wood.

verses.first_half: We will go into his tabernacle,
verses.second_half: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.
verses.first_half_tle: We will go into his tabernacle,
verses.second_half_tle: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

verses.first_half: Arise, O LORD, into your resting-place,
verses.second_half: you and the ark of your strength.
verses.first_half_tle: Arise, O LORD, into thy resting-place;
verses.second_half_tle: thou, and the ark of thy strength.

verses.first_half: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,
verses.second_half: and let your saints sing with joy.
verses.first_half_tle: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness;
verses.second_half_tle: and let thy saints sing with joyfulness.

verses.first_half: For your servant David’s sake,
verses.second_half: turn not away the presence of your Anointed.
verses.first_half_tle: For thy servant David’s sake,
verses.second_half_tle: turn not away the face of thine anointed.

verses.first_half: The LORD has made a faithful oath unto David,
verses.second_half: and he shall not shrink from it:
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD hath made a faithful oath unto David,
verses.second_half_tle: and he shall not shrink from it:

verses.first_half: “Of the fruit of your body
verses.second_half: shall I set upon your throne.
verses.first_half_tle: Of the fruit of thy body
verses.second_half_tle: shall I set upon thy throne.

verses.first_half: If your children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall teach them,
verses.second_half: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.”
verses.first_half_tle: If thy children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall teach them;
verses.second_half_tle: their children also shall sit upon thy throne for evermore.

verses.first_half: For the LORD has chosen Zion for himself;
verses.second_half: he has longed for her to be his habitation:
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD hath chosen Zion to be an habitation for himself;
verses.second_half_tle: he hath longed for her.

verses.first_half: “This shall be my rest for ever;
verses.second_half: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.
verses.first_half_tle: This shall be my rest for ever:
verses.second_half_tle: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

verses.first_half: I will bless her provisions with increase,
verses.second_half: and will satisfy her poor with bread.
verses.first_half_tle: I will bless her victuals with increase,
verses.second_half_tle: and will satisfy her poor with bread.

verses.first_half: I will clothe her priests with salvation,
verses.second_half: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.
verses.first_half_tle: I will deck her priests with health,
verses.second_half_tle: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

verses.first_half: There shall I make the horn of David flourish;
verses.second_half: I have prepared a lantern for my Anointed.
verses.first_half_tle: There shall I make the horn of David to flourish:
verses.second_half_tle: I have ordained a lantern for mine anointed.

verses.first_half: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame;
verses.second_half: but upon his head shall his crown flourish.”
verses.first_half_tle: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame;
verses.second_half_tle: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.

verses.first_half: Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is
verses.second_half: when brethren dwell together in unity.
verses.first_half_tle: Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is,
verses.second_half_tle: for brethren to dwell together in unity!

verses.first_half: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard,
verses.second_half: even Aaron’s beard, and went down to the edges of his clothing,
verses.first_half_tle: It is like the precious oil upon the head, that ran down unto the beard,
verses.second_half_tle: even unto Aaron’s beard, and went down to the skirts of his clothing.

verses.first_half: Like the dew of Hermon,
verses.second_half: which falls upon the hills of Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: Like as the dew of Hermon,
verses.second_half_tle: which fell upon the hill of Zion.

verses.first_half: For there the LORD promised his blessing,
verses.second_half: even life for evermore.
verses.first_half_tle: For there the LORD promised his blessing,
verses.second_half_tle: and life for evermore.

verses.first_half: Behold now, praise the LORD,
verses.second_half: all you servants of the LORD,
verses.first_half_tle: Behold now, praise the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: all ye servants of the LORD;

verses.first_half: You that stand by night in the house of the LORD,
verses.second_half: even in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.first_half_tle: Ye that by night stand in the house of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: even in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.first_half: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
verses.second_half: and sing praises unto the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary,
verses.second_half_tle: and praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: The LORD who made heaven and earth
verses.second_half: give you blessing out of Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD that made heaven and earth
verses.second_half_tle: give thee blessing out of Zion.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD. Praise the Name of the LORD;
verses.second_half: offer praise, you servants of the LORD,
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, laud ye the Name of the LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: praise it, O ye servants of the LORD;

verses.first_half: You who stand in the house of the LORD,
verses.second_half: in the courts of the house of our God.
verses.first_half_tle: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.first_half: O praise the LORD, for the LORD is good;
verses.second_half: sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.
verses.first_half_tle: O praise the LORD, for the LORD is gracious;
verses.second_half_tle: O sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

verses.first_half: For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself
verses.second_half: and Israel for his own possession.
verses.first_half_tle: For why? the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto himself,
verses.second_half_tle: and Israel for his own possession.

verses.first_half: For I know that the LORD is great,
verses.second_half: and that our Lord is above all gods.
verses.first_half_tle: For I know that the LORD is great,
verses.second_half_tle: and that our Lord is above all gods.

verses.first_half: Whatsoever the LORD pleases he does, in heaven and on earth,
verses.second_half: in the seas and in all the deep places.
verses.first_half_tle: Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth;
verses.second_half_tle: and in the sea, and in all deep places.

verses.first_half: He brings forth clouds from the ends of the earth
verses.second_half: and sends forth lightning with the rain, bringing the wind out of his treasuries.
verses.first_half_tle: He bringeth forth the clouds from the ends of the world,
verses.second_half_tle: and sendeth forth lightnings with the rain, bringing the winds out of his treasuries.

verses.first_half: It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.second_half: both of man and beast.
verses.first_half_tle: He smote the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.second_half_tle: both of man and beast.

verses.first_half: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O land of Egypt,
verses.second_half: against Pharaoh and all his servants.
verses.first_half_tle: He hath sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O thou land of Egypt;
verses.second_half_tle: upon Pharaoh, and all his servants.

verses.first_half: He smote many nations,
verses.second_half: and slew mighty kings:
verses.first_half_tle: He smote divers nations,
verses.second_half_tle: and slew mighty kings:

verses.first_half: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan,
verses.second_half: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
verses.first_half_tle: Sihon, king of the Amorites; and Og, the king of Bashan;
verses.second_half_tle: and all the kingdoms of Canaan;

verses.first_half: And he gave their land to be an inheritance,
verses.second_half: an inheritance for Israel his people.
verses.first_half_tle: And gave their land to be an heritage,
verses.second_half_tle: even an heritage unto Israel his people.

verses.first_half: Your Name, O LORD, endures for ever;
verses.second_half: so does your renown, O LORD, from one generation to another.
verses.first_half_tle: Thy Name, O LORD, endureth for ever;
verses.second_half_tle: so doth thy memorial, O LORD, from one generation to another.

verses.first_half: For the LORD will avenge his people
verses.second_half: and have compassion upon his servants.
verses.first_half_tle: For the LORD will avenge his people,
verses.second_half_tle: and be gracious unto his servants.

verses.first_half: As for the idols of the nations, they are but silver and gold,
verses.second_half: the work of human hands.
verses.first_half_tle: As for the images of the heathen, they are but silver and gold;
verses.second_half_tle: the work of men’s hands.

verses.first_half: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.second_half: eyes have they, but they see not;
verses.first_half_tle: They have mouths, and speak not;
verses.second_half_tle: eyes have they, but they see not.

verses.first_half: They have ears, and yet they hear not,
verses.second_half: neither is there any breath in their mouths.
verses.first_half_tle: They have ears, and yet they hear not;
verses.second_half_tle: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.first_half: Those who make them are like them,
verses.second_half: and so are all who put their trust in them.
verses.first_half_tle: They that make them are like unto them;
verses.second_half_tle: and so are all they that put their trust in them.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD, O house of Israel;
verses.second_half: praise the LORD, O house of Aaron.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, ye house of Israel;
verses.second_half_tle: praise the LORD, ye house of Aaron.

verses.first_half: Praise the LORD, O house of Levi;
verses.second_half: you who fear the LORD, praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Praise the LORD, ye house of Levi;
verses.second_half_tle: ye that fear the LORD, praise the LORD.

verses.first_half: Praised be the LORD from Zion,
verses.second_half: who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Praised be the LORD out of Zion,
verses.second_half_tle: who dwelleth at Jerusalem.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious:
verses.second_half_tle: and his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the God of all gods,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the God of all gods:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the Lord of all lords,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O thank the LORD of all lords:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who alone does great wonders,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Who only doeth great wonders:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who laid out the earth above the waters,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Who laid out the earth above the waters:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who made the great lights,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Who hath made great lights:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.first_half: The sun to rule the day,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: The sun to rule the day:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: The moon and the stars to govern the night,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: The moon and the stars to govern the night:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Who smote Egypt, with their firstborn:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And brought out Israel from among them,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: And brought out Israel from among them:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: With a mighty hand and an outstretched arm,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: With a mighty hand and stretched-out arm:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who divided the Red Sea in two parts,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Who divided the Red Sea in two parts:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: And made Israel to go through the midst of it:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who led his people through the wilderness,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Who led his people through the wilderness:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who smote great kings,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Who smote great kings:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And slew mighty kings,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, and slew mighty kings:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever:

verses.first_half: Sihon king of the Amorites,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Sihon, king of the Amorites:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And Og the king of Bashan,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: And Og, the king of Bashan:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And gave away their land for an inheritance,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: And gave away their land for an heritage:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: Even for an inheritance for Israel his servant,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Even for an heritage unto Israel his servant:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who remembered us when we were in trouble,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever;
verses.first_half_tle: Who remembered us when we were in trouble:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever;

verses.first_half: And delivered us from our enemies,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: And hath delivered us from our enemies:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: Who gives food to all flesh,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: Who giveth food to all flesh:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the God of heaven,
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the God of heaven:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords
verses.second_half: for his mercy endures for ever.
verses.first_half_tle: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords:
verses.second_half_tle: for his mercy endureth for ever.

verses.first_half: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,
verses.second_half: when we remembered you, O Zion.
verses.first_half_tle: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,
verses.second_half_tle: when we remembered thee, O Zion.

verses.first_half: As for our harps, we hung them up
verses.second_half: upon the trees that are therein.
verses.first_half_tle: As for our harps, we hanged them up
verses.second_half_tle: upon the trees that are therein.

verses.first_half: For those who led us away captive required of us a song and melody in our heaviness:
verses.second_half: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
verses.first_half_tle: For they that led us away captive, required of us then a song, and melody in our heaviness:
verses.second_half_tle: Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

verses.first_half: How shall we sing the LORD’s song
verses.second_half: in the land of our captivity?
verses.first_half_tle: How shall we sing the LORD’s song
verses.second_half_tle: in a strange land?

verses.first_half: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
verses.second_half: let my right hand forget its skill.
verses.first_half_tle: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem,
verses.second_half_tle: let my right hand forget her cunning.

verses.first_half: If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
verses.second_half: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my dearest joy.
verses.first_half_tle: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

verses.first_half: Remember the children of Edom, O LORD, in the day of Jerusalem,
verses.second_half: how they said, “Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.”
verses.first_half_tle: Remember the children of Edom, O LORD, in the day of Jerusalem;
verses.second_half_tle: how they said, Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.

verses.first_half: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery,
verses.second_half: happy shall be the one who rewards you as you have done to us.
verses.first_half_tle: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, happy shall he be that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

verses.first_half: Blessed shall he be who takes your children
verses.second_half: and throws them against the stones.
verses.first_half_tle: Blessed shall he be that taketh thy children,
verses.second_half_tle: and throweth them against the stones.

verses.first_half: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart;
verses.second_half: even before the gods will I sing praises to you.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, with my whole heart;
verses.second_half_tle: even before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

verses.first_half: I will worship toward your holy temple and praise your Name, because of your loving-kindness and truth,
verses.second_half: for you have magnified your Name and your word above all things.
verses.first_half_tle: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy Name, because of thy loving-kindness and truth;
verses.second_half_tle: for thou hast magnified thy Name, and thy word, above all things.

verses.first_half: When I called upon you, you heard me
verses.second_half: and gave me increase of strength.
verses.first_half_tle: When I called upon thee, thou heardest me;
verses.second_half_tle: and enduedst my soul with much strength.

verses.first_half: All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O LORD,
verses.second_half: for they have heard the words of your mouth.
verses.first_half_tle: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD;
verses.second_half_tle: for they have heard the words of thy mouth.

verses.first_half: They shall sing of the ways of the LORD,
verses.second_half: that great is the glory of the LORD.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, they shall sing of the ways of the LORD,
verses.second_half_tle: that great is the glory of the LORD.

verses.first_half: For though the LORD be high, yet he has respect for the lowly;
verses.second_half: as for the proud, he beholds them from afar.
verses.first_half_tle: For though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly;
verses.second_half_tle: as for the proud, he beholdeth them afar off.

verses.first_half: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shall you refresh me;
verses.second_half: you shall stretch forth your hand upon the furiousness of my enemies, and your right hand shall save me.
verses.first_half_tle: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shalt thou refresh me;
verses.second_half_tle: thou shalt stretch forth thy hand upon the furiousness of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

verses.first_half: The LORD shall make good his loving-kindness toward me;
verses.second_half: your mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; despise not the works of your own hands.
verses.first_half_tle: The LORD shall make good his loving-kindness toward me;
verses.second_half_tle: yea, thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever; despise not then the works of thine own hands.

verses.first_half: O LORD, you have searched me out and known me;
verses.second_half: you know my sitting down and my rising up; you understand my thoughts from afar.
verses.first_half_tle: O LORD, thou hast searched me out, and known me.
verses.second_half_tle: Thou knowest my down-sitting, and mine up-rising; thou understandest my thoughts long before.

verses.first_half: You examine my path and my places of rest,
verses.second_half: and are acquainted with all my ways.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou art about my path, and about my bed;
verses.second_half_tle: and art acquainted with all my ways.

verses.first_half: Indeed, there is not a word on my tongue,
verses.second_half: but you, O LORD, know it altogether.
verses.first_half_tle: For lo, there is not a word in my tongue,
verses.second_half_tle: but thou, O LORD, knowest it altogether.

verses.first_half: You have enclosed me behind and before,
verses.second_half: and have laid your hand upon me.
verses.first_half_tle: Thou hast beset me behind and before,
verses.second_half_tle: and laid thine hand upon me.

verses.first_half: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
verses.second_half: so excellent I cannot attain to it.
verses.first_half_tle: Such knowledge is too wonderful and excellent for me;
verses.second_half_tle: I cannot attain unto it.

verses.first_half: Where shall I go then from your Spirit,
verses.second_half: or where shall I flee from your presence?
verses.first_half_tle: Whither shall I go then from thy Spirit?
verses.second_half_tle: or whither shall I go then from thy presence?

verses.first_half: If I climb up to heaven, you are there;
verses.second_half: if I make my bed in the Grave, you are there also.
verses.first_half_tle: If I climb up into heaven, thou art there;
verses.second_half_tle: if I go down to hell, thou art there also.

verses.first_half: If I take the wings of the morning
verses.second_half: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
verses.first_half_tle: If I take the wings of the morning,
verses.second_half_tle: and remain in the uttermost parts of the sea;

verses.first_half: Even there shall your hand lead me,
verses.second_half: and your right hand shall hold me.
verses.first_half_tle: Even there also shall thy hand lead me,
verses.second_half_tle: and thy right hand shall hold me.

verses.first_half: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,”
verses.second_half: then shall my night be turned to day.
verses.first_half_tle: If I say, Peradventure the darkness shall cover me;
verses.second_half_tle: then shall my night be turned to day.

verses.first_half: Even the darkness is not dark to you, and the night is as clear as the day;
verses.second_half: the darkness and the light to you are both alike.
verses.first_half_tle: Yea, the darkness is no darkness with thee, but the night is as clear as the day;
verses.second_half_tle: the darkness and light to thee are both alike.

verses.first_half: For you yourself made my inmost parts;
verses.second_half: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.
verses.first_half_tle: For my reins are thine;
verses.second_half_tle: thou hast covered me in my mother’s womb.

verses.first_half: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;
verses.second_half: marvelous are your works, and my soul knows it very well.
verses.first_half_tle: I will give thanks unto thee, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made:
verses.second_half_tle: marvellous are thy works, and that my soul knoweth right well.

verses.first_half: My bones were not hidden from you
verses.second_half: when I was made in secret and fashioned in the depths of the earth.
verses.first_half_tle: My bones are not hid from thee,
verses.second_half_tle: though I be made secretly, and fashioned beneath in the earth.

verses.first_half: Your eyes beheld my substance, while I was yet unformed;
verses.second_half: and in your book were all my members written,
